Lead Character Artist in Scopely

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Boundless Entertainment, Scopely’s world-class game development studio, is in search of a Lead Character Artist to join our development team on MARVEL STRIKE FORCE. We need a strong creative leader with an exceptional understanding of shape, form and human and creature anatomy. Your passion for games and the Marvel Universe helps you bring to life your favorite heroes and villains, and contribute to one of the most visually ambitious mobile experiences ever. Studio Team Overview Boundless Entertainment is on a never-ending mission to create unforgettable games. Our studio was built by passionate game makers dedicated to crafting playful, smart, addictively fun experiences. We care about accessibility, depth, innovation, and production values, but most of all we care about our community of players. We don’t just make games, we play and love them too, making player empathy a core value for all of us. If you’re thinking about joining our close-knit team you should love games, be world-class at making them, and understand fundamentally that great business results come from great games and loyal players. At Boundless Entertainment, you’ll be working with some of the best developers in the world from hit games and franchises including Marvel Strike Force, Command & Conquer, Battle for Middle-earth, God of War, and Diablo. Day to Day Direct and manage a team of talented Character Artists Demonstrate a thorough understanding of anatomy in all of the work you oversee or create Oversee the creation of endearing, memorable models that reflect the personalities of Marvel Characters within the game - by internal and external teams Create exceptional, life-like PBR materials Collaborate with tech art and animation team on rig iteration for believable character movements Consistently strive to exceed the highest quality standards of the studio Required Experience and Skills 6+ years character art experience in a video game production environment. Extensive portfolio displaying diverse artistic skills. Thorough understanding of anatomy. Extensive knowledge of Zbrush, Maya, Substance Designer/Painter and Unity. Superior communication, organizational, time management and interpersonal skills. Extensive knowledge of team management and artist development. Desirable Experience and Skills: Experience with mobile development, live F2P games in particular Experience with fighting/combat system development Experience with character rigging and skinning Company Overview About Scopely: Scopely is a leading mobile games company home to many top-grossing, award-winning franchises including Scrabble® GO, MARVEL Strike Force, Star Trek™ Fleet Command, Looney Tunes™ World of Mayhem, WWE Champions, The Walking Dead: Road To Survival™, YAHTZEE® With Buddies and Wheel of Fortune®: Free Play, among others. Scopely creates rewarding, immersive games that empower a directed-by-consumer experience. Founded in 2011, Scopely is fueled by a world-class team and a proprietary technology platform that personalizes gameplay at scale across one of the most diversified portfolios in the west. Recognized in Fast Company’s ‘World’s Most Innovative Companies’ and #2 on Deloitte’s ‘Technology Fast 500’ as one of the fastest-growing companies in North America, Scopely has achieved more than $1 billion in lifetime revenue by creating game experiences that are an important part of people’s lives. Scopely has global operations in Los Angeles, Barcelona, Boulder, Dublin (DIGIT game studio), London and Tokyo, with additional studios in seven countries across four continents. For more information, visit scopely.com. Scopely is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, family or parental status, gender identity, veteran, or disability status, or other protected status. Candidate information will be treated in accordance with our candidate privacy notice which can be found here: https://scopely.com/scopely-candidate-privacy-notice/

Senior Environment Artist in Playable Worlds

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

About Playable Worlds Playable Worlds is a team of talented and creative game industry professionals working together on a sandbox MMO built for the cloud. Led by Raph Koster (Ultima Online; Star Wars Galaxies) Playable Worlds offers a collaborative and diverse work environment, competitive pay and benefits, and an opportunity to create new kinds of gameplay and experiences in online worlds that feel real and engaging. All positions at Playable Worlds are currently remote. Summary The Senior Environment Artist helps build worlds for our exciting new MMO game. In this role, you’ll work with the Lead Environment Artist creating structural and environmental worlds, from concept to in-game completion for modeling, textures, and lighting. You will help strategize techniques to guide procedural environment creation and facilitate solutions to multiple environments through experiments to reveal necessary toolsets. Working with the design team and tool teams, the Lead Environment Artist will develop production pipelines for a growing team of artists and help set a visual bar for the game. Applicants must be able to provide examples of their work and an art test may be required. The salary range for this position is $85,000 to $120,000 annually. Essential Job Functions Create 3D models in line with our game stylization. Create detailed textures with Substance Designer, Painter, Photoshop or equivalent level software. Assemble scenes and design models for game environments. Review and provide feedback on assets provided by outsourcing partners. Prototype and create game assets. Communicate with the Lead Environment Artist regularly to ensure a balance between performance and visual quality, while keeping artistic styles consistent with planned direction of the game. Assist with troubleshooting errors and evaluating performance concerns. Knowledge/Skill/Ability Requirements Experience level: 5+ years of experience in game development creating AAA titles for console or PC. Must have experience with Unreal, Unity, or an equivalent proprietary engine. Education level: College degree in Illustration, Fine Art, or similar preferred, but not required. Ability to collaborate and help mentor other employees. Experience with world design and production software, world building content creation tools and modular techniques common in level design. Advanced knowledge of traditional production techniques in addition to working knowledge of large, scalable multiplayer games. Highly motivated with good communication skills, positive attitude, and an ability to work with designers and engineers. Ability to explore a range of ideas, work towards creative solutions and inspire a team. Experience with procedural world generation and terrain building. Working knowledge of complex physics-based mesh systems. Ability to prioritize a variety of tasks in a manner that enables timely completion. Bonus Points for Any of These A passion for video games. Experience with multiplayer online games. Experience with Unity. Location Playable Worlds is headquartered in San Marcos, California. All positions are currently remote. Job descriptions are not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that may be required of the employee. Playable Worlds Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all employees and applicants. We are also committed to providing employees with a work environment free of illegal discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications. No applicant or employee will be discriminated against because of their age; ancestry; citizenship; color; marital or parental status; registered domestic partner status; national origin; pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical condition; race (including hair textures and styles); height; weight; religion; religious dress practice; religious grooming practice; sex; sexual orientation; genetic information; genetic characteristics; gender identity; gender expression; transgender status; military and veterans’ status; HIV/AIDS status; physical or mental disability or medical condition unrelated to the person’s ability to perform the job; or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state or local laws, or the perception that anyone has any of those characteristics or is associated with a person who has or is perceived as having any of those characteristics. See more details on your right to work here: https://www.e-verify.gov/sites/default/files/everify/posters/IER_RighttoWorkPoster.pdf. This employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. See more details here: https://e-verify.uscis.gov/web/media/resourcesContents/E-Verify_Participation_Poster_ES.pdf.

Lead Technical Artist in Insomniac Games

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Why PlayStation? PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, PlayStation™Now, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more. PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team. The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation. The Technical Artist team at Insomniac Games is growing and we're looking for a Lead Technical Artist to join our team. As the Lead Technical Artist, you will leads a small team of technical artists to design, develop, and maintain software systems and tools that empower content creators to produce best-in-class game assets. Works within and around commercial content creation software, with a heavy focus on real-time performance and efficient production. Educates production teams on how to best use internal tools and pipelines. Ensures that direct reports are positioned to maximize excellence and well-being. If this sounds interesting, please keep reading below. Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Leads a small team of technical artists to design, develop and maintain software systems and tools within an area of concentration (eg photogrammetry/photometrics, procedural generation, shader and material design, technical animation, animation dynamics and simulation) Provides coaching, performance evaluations, and career development support for team members. Promotes studio cultural values and foster a positive work environment Ensures that all complaints and concerns related to inappropriate or unprofessional conduct in the workplace, are address immediately to foster a safe work environment Maintains a team schedule that meets project goals and deadlines while maintaining a sustainable team workload Participates in the hiring and onboarding of new employees Educates production teams on technology and engine functionality, including ensuring sufficient documentation and presenting new functionality to users Researches and prototypes forward-looking strategic technical opportunities outside of existing project priorities Supports team members with individual technical contributions not critical to project schedules, as necessary Continuously expands knowledge of technological developments in the game industry Independently recognizes opportunities to improve games, tools, production content or general workflow, and seek to make these changes, either individually or via team direction Ensures that all complaints and concerns related to inappropriate or unprofessional conduct in the workplace, are address immediately to foster a safe work environment Other duties may be assigned Supervisory Responsibilities: Directly supervises a small (4 or fewer) team. Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include interviewing and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; resolving problems together with Core leadership. Education and/or Experience: Eight plus of related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience One year of team/area leadership experience Strong understand of commercial content creation software like Maya, Houdini, and Substance Expertise in programming languages like Python or HLSL as needed Substantial experience working with game engines like Unreal, Unity, and various in-house engines Knowledge of file formats and pipeline components like Alembic, FBX, and Collada Knowledge of common workplace software like Microsoft Office products Other Skills: Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference, and fundamentals of plane and solid geometry, trigonometry and linear algebra Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables Equal Opportunity Statement: Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category. We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond.

Outsource Artist in Insomniac Games

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Insomniac Games is looking for an Outsourcing Artist to join our team! This individual is responsible for reviewing/managing art assets from external vendors who will create assets to be used by the art team. This includes supplying clear and actionable feedback on the art creation process during development. Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following: Creates comprehensive Outsourcing (OS) packages to send to external art vendors, with guidance from the OS Lead, and OS Manager. Provides clear and actionable feedback and optimizations to vendors at key stages of asset creation: high/low poly, material/textures, and final delivery phases. Helps direct vendors work on multiple asset types including but not limited to hard surface, vehicles, weapons, and materials, under guidance and direction from the OS Lead, OS Manager, Art Director, and Lead Artists. Works closely with artists to ensure block-out models and reference images are provided for all OS work with external partners. Creates game ready assets that align to the art style of specific game. Has intricate knowledge of art tools and best practices for building assets for the following programs: Maya/Max, Substance Painter/Designer, Zbrush, Photoshop. Able to maintain consistent style under the direction of the Art Director and Lead Artists. Other duties may be assigned. Education and/or Experience: Five plus years related experience and/or training; and/or combination of education and experience. Technical Skills: Strong skills in modeling, baking and UV layout in Maya, Max, or equivalent. Strong skills in texture and material creation with Photoshop, Substance Painter, Substance Designer. Experience with ZBrush. Other Skills: Has the ability to create models and shaders for a range of art directions, from photorealistic to stylized. Ability to meet deadlines under tight schedules. Has a strong ability to multitask and self-prioritizing to-do lists. Willingness to receive direction and work closely with a team. Prior experience working with external vendors is required. Does this sound like you? Please submit your resume and portfolio for consideration. We look forward to reviewing your submission!

VFX Artist in PlayStation

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Why PlayStation? PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more. PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team. The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation. VFX Artist (Contract) Remote, Canada This is a long-term contracted position through our third party staffing agency Eastridge. Sony PlayStation Studios Visual Arts (PSSVA) team on our San Diego campus provides world-class content, development and services to PlayStation Studios such as Insomniac Games, Naughty Dog, Santa Monica Studio, Bend Studio, Guerilla Games, Sucker Punch Productions and more! Our team is always at the cutting edge of technology and partners with the industry’s best minds and companies. We are looking for an FX Artist to come aboard and help us build the highest quality game FX possible. Become a part of the Visual Arts Group, and work with a multi-award winning team responsible for the cinematic performances in outstanding Sony PlayStation franchises like Uncharted, The Last of Us, Killzone, and other iconic series. Responsibilities: Content creation of visual FX across all areas of the game ranging from in-game assets to Cinematics on the PlayStation 5 platform. You will work with our VFX Supervisor to ensure a consistent style and quality level across all the various types of game FX assets. You will partner with our render engineers to develop new, or improve upon existing technologies for pushing the bar of game FX, both visually and technically. Document, communicate requirements, and provide feedback to internal artists and outsourcing partners. Actively develop and improve skill set and abilities by keeping aware of industry trends and techniques, evaluating competitive products, and learning new software packages and traditional art methods. Qualifications: 2+ years’ experience as a professional FX artist in AAA games. Bachelor of art degree or equivalent industry experience and training Portfolio of realistic, high quality real-time FX work. Proficiency of standard art packages such as Maya and Photoshop. Good understanding of shader techniques as applied to visual effects. Working knowledge of dynamics and simulations packages. Good communication, organizational, time management and interpersonal skills Experience working with a game engine and implementing 3D work into engine. Pluses: Python scripting experience. C++ programming experience. Premiere/After Effects experience. Side-FX Houdini experience. At least 1 shipped AAA title as an FX artist. Equal Opportunity Statement: Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category. We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond. PlayStation is a Fair Chance employer and qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for employment.

PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team. The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation. VFX Artist (Contract) Remote, USA This is a long-term contracted position through our third party staffing agency DZConneX. Sony PlayStation Studios Visual Arts (PSSVA) team on our San Diego campus provides world-class content, development and services to PlayStation Studios such as Insomniac Games, Naughty Dog, Santa Monica Studio, Bend Studio, Guerilla Games, Sucker Punch Productions and more! Our team is always at the cutting edge of technology and partners with the industry’s best minds and companies. We are looking for an FX Artist to come aboard and help us build the highest quality game FX possible. Become a part of the Visual Arts Group, and work with a multi-award winning team responsible for the cinematic performances in outstanding Sony PlayStation franchises like Uncharted, The Last of Us, Killzone, and other iconic series. Responsibilities: Content creation of visual FX across all areas of the game ranging from in-game assets to Cinematics on the PlayStation 5 platform. You will work with our VFX Supervisor to ensure a consistent style and quality level across all the various types of game FX assets. You will partner with our render engineers to develop new, or improve upon existing technologies for pushing the bar of game FX, both visually and technically. Document, communicate requirements, and provide feedback to internal artists and outsourcing partners. Actively develop and improve skill set and abilities by keeping aware of industry trends and techniques, evaluating competitive products, and learning new software packages and traditional art methods. Qualifications: 2+ years’ experience as a professional FX artist in AAA games. Bachelor of art degree or equivalent industry experience and training Portfolio of realistic, high quality real-time FX work. Proficiency of standard art packages such as Maya and Photoshop. Good understanding of shader techniques as applied to visual effects. Working knowledge of dynamics and simulations packages. Good communication, organizational, time management and interpersonal skills Experience working with a game engine and implementing 3D work into engine. Pluses: Python scripting experience. C++ programming experience. Premiere/After Effects experience. Side-FX Houdini experience. At least 1 shipped AAA title as an FX artist. Technical Artist in PlayStation

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Why PlayStation? PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more. PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team. The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation. Technical Artist (Contract) This is a 12-month contracted position through our staffing partner DZConneX with a high likelihood of extension. Remote, United States PlayStation Studios Visual Arts provides world-class content, development and services to Worldwide Studios. We offer a full-service production studio with an emphasis in art and animation, as well as previsualization, cinematics, character creation, motion capture, software development, and face/body scanning, tracking and solving. We are looking for a Technical Artist to join our San Diego, California development team where you will be responsible for setting up and maintaining the technical pipeline on all projects, writing tools for artists for a variety of software package, solve technical issues that arise, and ensure quality of the final product. You will work with both our art and engineering teams to provide communication and cohesion between the groups. If you have the experience and understanding of visual effects pipelines, Autodesk Maya software, and python programming skills we want to hear from you! Responsibilities: Understanding and maintaining project workflows, primarily Maya art and animation, and game engine integration pipelines. Learning and supporting varying client working environments, assets, and tools. Writing, maintaining and customizing internal tools for production team. Solving problems in pipeline and for individuals on as-needed basis. Building and maintaining technical documentation. Desired Experience: BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Graphic Art, or a related field, or equivalent experience. At least 3+ years in a branch of visual effects (film, game dev, tv, etc). Excellent knowledge of Maya and experience developing Maya tools in Python. Excellent troubleshooting skills and the ability to creatively problem solve. PyQt/PySide experience. Knowledge of or experience with game engines such as Unreal, Unity, or proprietary engines. Nice to Have: General knowledge of Maya rigging. Experience with programming languages, especially C++. Experience developing or maintaining system environments. Experiencing developing or maintaining project pipeline tools. Experience with perforce and/or git. Experience with project management and tracking software (such as Shotgun and Jira). Equal Opportunity Statement: Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category. We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond. PlayStation is a Fair Chance employer and qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for employment.

Destiny VFX Artist in Bungie

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

We’re seeking a driven artist to help expand the Destiny universe through spectacular visual effects! The ideal candidate brings a passion to learn advanced technical and artistic skills. The candidate understands how to work with a team and will be expected to learn the challenges of modern AAA game development to produce stunning in-game visual effects that support gameplay, cinematics, and environments. During these uncertain times and rapidly changing environment surrounding COVID-19, all positions at Bungie are subject to onboarding and working virtually/remotely. RESPONSIBILITIES Work closely with the VFX Lead to author effect assets that enhance gameplay and storytelling Use proprietary tools, Photoshop and 3D Studio Max to create effects that balance the visual goals of the project with the performance demands of the game engine Help develop Destiny’s visual language through the craft of visual effects Build productive working relationships with your team REQUIRED SKILLS Be able to break down a visual effect into component content-types (particle FX, shader FX, mesh FX, post-process, animation, decal, lighting, etc.) and choose the right tools for the job Programming or scripting experience in any language (C++ / Python / HLSL) Animation background Experience with Houdini, Fume FX, Maya fluids tools, or Substance Designer Most Bungie full-time employees will adopt a digital first approach allowing remote work in Bungie approved locations (outside of positions identified as 100% onsite in Bellevue/Seattle, or individuals preferring a hybrid/flex environment). Prospective full-time employees located outside of CA, CO, DC, FL, GA, IL, MA, MD, MN, NC, NJ, NY, OR, TX, UT, VA, WA, or WI will need to establish residency in one of the states we are compliant in within 45 days of a start date. Contractors will follow a digital first approach adhering to the location guidelines agreed upon by our third-party employer/vendor and Bungie. Bungie’s remote policy is subject to change at the company’s discretion.

Destiny Lighting Artist (Mid to Senior) in Bungie

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Bungie is looking for a Senior Lighting Artist to join us in our fight against the Darkness. When you walk into a corridor, does the mood and tone speak to you? Do you find yourself fascinated by the navigational guidance and points of interest provided by lighting? Are you excited to immerse players in a captivating world? Whether it is natural or artificial light sources, color grading or visual effects - we know how important a role Lighting plays in the game’s experience. As a Senior Lighting Artist on Destiny, you will work to ensure that Art Direction’s vision for lighting and atmosphere is realized. You will collaborate with your fellow lighters and other disciplines to refine our best practices and elevate our content. Utilizing proprietary tools, you’ll embellish Destiny’s worlds, characters, and narrative content - supporting the team’s goals with reviews for both pipeline and creative endeavors. Most importantly, you will create a breathtaking experience to delight players around the world. If this is the experience you’re looking for, we are right there with you! It's what drives us every day. Come be a part of our team and let's create bold, new worlds together! RESPONSIBILITIES Collaborate with Art Direction and cross-discipline team members to maintain lighting’s aesthetic and technical standards Partner with graphics engineers, tech art, and tools teams to develop lighting processes and technology Own lighting for game worlds, dynamic/scripted lighting, character and hard surface object light rigs, and in-game narrative content from start to finish Work with Design stakeholders to ensure gameplay needs are met Stay informed on new developments in rendering, particularly about lighting, atmosphere, and surfaces Provide constructive feedback to production artists who are working on lighting-related tasks REQUIRED SKILLS Strong understanding and sense in lighting, shadow, and color to create a visually engaging piece Ability to follow and adapt to a wide range of design references to achieve lighting expectations Experience in lighting characters and environments, interior & exterior, different times of day, etc. With various lighting techniques and tools Understanding of composition and the ability to enhance mood through lighting Experience with materials/shaders and an understanding of their relationship with light Competent 3d modeling / texturing skills (ie. light fixtures / practical support for light sources) Wide understanding of lighting/rendering technologies Strong organizational and communication skills Comfortable working autonomously and in a collaborative environment in taking direction from Art Director/Leads and working with others on problem-solving NICE-TO-HAVE-SKILLS Experience with Unreal Engine 4, 5, Unity3D or other modern development toolsets Experience with and passion for games Most Bungie full-time employees will adopt a digital first approach allowing remote work in Bungie approved locations (outside of positions identified as 100% onsite in Bellevue/Seattle, or individuals preferring a hybrid/flex environment). Prospective full-time employees located outside of CA, CO, DC, FL, GA, IL, MA, MD, MN, NC, NJ, NY, OR, TX, UT, VA, WA, or WI will need to establish residency in one of the states we are compliant in within 45 days of a start date. Contractors will follow a digital first approach adhering to the location guidelines agreed upon by our third-party employer/vendor and Bungie. Bungie’s remote policy is subject to change at the company’s discretion.

Destiny Technical Artist – Rigging (Mid to Senior) in Bungie

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Bungie is looking for a talented Rigging Tech Artist to join our team. You will collaborate with an equally passionate team of content creators to build out 3D and animation content and pipelines. When you use 3D animation software, do you find yourself gravitating toward the script editor to automate and extend the functionality? Are you passionate about building great body and facial rigging systems, believable skin deformation and efficient workflows? If so, you might be just who we’re looking for! RESPONSIBILITIES Acquire a deep understanding of our engine and related tools Operation of Bungie’s proprietary rigging system and DCC tools and technology Collaboration with Character 3D Art, Hard-Surface 3D Art, Animation, Design and Engineering Creation of technical content for various assets meeting Bungie’s shipping quality bar (Skeletons, Rigs, Skin Weighting, Cloth, and more) Quality assurance for 3D art and animation content Provide desk side support for Artists, Animators and Designers Contribute to and maintain our Maya Python tools codebase Develop and maintain tools pipelines, supporting artists working efficiently Documenting processes required to educate artists on new tools or workflows REQUIRED SKILLS Professional or personal experience working with real-time game engines Proficiency at Rigging in Autodesk Maya or equivalent software Scripting or Programming experience in Python, C#, C++ or equivalent Comfortable with prototyping and fast iterative development cycles Problem solving skills, good collaboration and a keen eye for detail are critical for success in this role Strong communication skills Motivation for creating great games Passion for supporting and enabling others NICE-TO-HAVE SKILLS 3D Modeling Animation Motion Capture experience Knowledge of anatomy Face rigging User interface design Leadership and management experience Most Bungie full-time employees will adopt a digital first approach allowing remote work in Bungie approved locations (outside of positions identified as 100% onsite in Bellevue/Seattle, or individuals preferring a hybrid/flex environment). Prospective full-time employees located outside of CA, CO, DC, FL, GA, IL, MA, MD, MN, NC, NJ, NY, OR, TX, UT, VA, WA, or WI will need to establish residency in one of the states we are compliant in within 45 days of a start date. Destiny Environment Artist - Senior to Staff in Bungie

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

If you are an artist that imagines undiscovered horizons wrought from pixels and code, the opportunity to build amazing worlds awaits. Bungie is looking for experienced talent eager to join an incredible team of artists. As an environment artist you will be responsible for developing style, visual storytelling and refined, well-crafted gameplay spaces to our Destiny releases. RESPONSIBILITIES Translate approved concept art into 3D elements of gameplay and cinematic spaces Work closely with activity and narrative designs to build world geometry from rough massouts to highly polished, engaging gameplay spaces Engage with the larger environment art team to provide gameplay and visual feedback Contribute ideas on how to engage and delight our players through how they experience the worlds and environments of Destiny. Assemble spaces using a combination of pre-existing modular kit pieces and bespoke, custom set pieces (including associated modeling, uv and shader work, technical setup, etc). Work closely with our lighting artists to build environments and lighting that support the intended player experience. Polish gameplay environments with tasteful creation and deployment placement of set dressing, decals, devices and dynamic objects, etc. REQUIRED SKILLS Efficient communication and strong collaboration skills Robust understanding of light, value, composition, color, staging and detail in environmental design Strong sense of scale and spatial awareness Understanding of how the environment affects game play High level of proficiency in contemporary game dev software (Photoshop, Maya, Max, Zbrush, Substance Designer, and other 2D/3D applications) Professional experience working with current generation game engine / pipelines Experience in a collaborative game development environment crafting playable space Responsible time management skills A strong interest for games and creating gaming environments Most Bungie full-time employees will adopt a digital first approach allowing remote work in Bungie approved locations (outside of positions identified as 100% onsite in Bellevue/Seattle, or individuals preferring a hybrid/flex environment). Prospective full-time employees located outside of CA, CO, DC, FL, GA, IL, MA, MD, MN, NC, NJ, NY, OR, TX, UT, VA, WA, or WI will need to establish residency in one of the states we are compliant in within 45 days of a start date. Contractors will follow a digital first approach adhering to the location guidelines agreed upon by our third-party employer/vendor and Bungie. Bungie’s remote policy is subject to change at the company’s discretion.

Apply Now

Destiny Animation Engineer Intern in Bungie

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

As an Animation Engineer Intern on the Narrative Systems and Workflow team, you'll focus on empowering our content creators to tell inspiring stories within our proprietary engine. At the intersection of story and technology, you'll work with NPC designers and animators to optimize, update, and expand the relevant runtime systems and pipelines that enable narrative performances that tell stories in our game. Most importantly, you will work with a fun and creative team helping make exciting player experiences in Destiny. RESPONSIBILITIES Empower our NPC designers and animators to create higher fidelity animations. Collaborate with experienced colleagues to optimize the workflow and improve the capabilities of our storytelling narrative performances pipeline. Build your confidence with the engine that drives our proprietary visual scripting system. REQUIRED SKILLS Proficient in C/C++ and has an understanding of multi-threading, algorithm design, and common data structures (binary search trees, queues, stacks, hash tables, spatial partitioning). Strong relevant math background (trigonometry, linear algebra, calculus, numerical analysis). Demonstrable knowledge of mathematical concepts used in animation (quaternions, splines, forward and inverse kinematics). Can write clear, concise, and accurate technical documentation, summarize complex topics, and achieve alignment with customers of different technical and non-technical backgrounds. NICE-TO-HAVE SKILLS Personal or academic experience developing and debugging animation asset pipelines (FBX, FaceFX, etc.). An academic or practical understanding of how animation game engine sub-systems interact with game logic. Personal or academic experience working with physically based animation modelling (spring systems, flocking, particle simulations, fluid dynamics). The ability to understand and apply concepts from a research paper into a practical solution. So you don't meet every requirement listed in this job description? Do you think your experience level is not where it needs to be? Studies show that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they believe they meet every single qualification. Bungie is focused on building a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace. If you're interested in this position but your past experience doesn't line up perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we want you to apply anyway. The right role for you may be right around the corner! Most Bungie full-time employees will adopt a digital first approach allowing remote work in Bungie approved locations (outside of positions identified as 100% onsite in Bellevue/Seattle, or individuals preferring a hybrid/flex environment). Prospective full-time employees located outside of CA, CO, DC, FL, GA, IL, MA, MD, MN, NC, NJ, NY, OR, TN, TX, UT, VA, WA, or WI will need to establish residency in one of the states we are compliant in within 45 days of a start date. Contractors will follow a digital first approach adhering to the location guidelines agreed upon by our third-party employer/vendor and Bungie. Bungie’s remote policy is subject to change at the company’s discretion.

Senior Technical Artist in PlayStation

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Why PlayStation? PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more. PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team. The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation. Senior Technical Artist Remote, United States PlayStation Studios Visual Arts provides the highest quality artistic support to first-party Sony game teams as well as other teams developing titles for the PS5. We offer dozens of services including asset scanning, actor scanning, body motion capture, facial motion capture, motion edit, animation, facial tracking and solving, and lighting. As a service group we have the privilege of working with multiple game developers on a variety of titles. The Technical Art team works directly with clients to replicate and maintain their work environments in the studio and guarantee the quality of the final delivery. We are looking for a Senior Technical Artist to join our San Diego, California development team. The role requires experience and understanding of visual effects pipelines, experience with Autodesk Maya software, and python programming skills. Technical artists are responsible for setting up and maintaining the technical pipeline on all projects, writing tools for artists for a variety of software packages and needs, troubleshooting all technical issues that arise, and ensuring the quality of the final product. Technical artist work with both our art teams and our engineering team and help provide communication and cohesion between these two groups. Responsibilities: Understanding and maintaining project workflows, primarily Maya art and animation, and game engine integration pipelines. Learning and supporting varying client working environments, assets, and tools. Writing, maintaining and customizing internal tools for production team. Troubleshooting problems in pipeline and for individuals on as-needed basis. Creating and maintaining technical documentation. Desired Experience: BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Graphic Art, or a related field, or equivalent experience. At least 5+ years in some branch of visual effects (film, game dev, tv, etc). Excellent knowledge of Maya and Python and experience developing python tools for Maya. Excellent troubleshooting skills and the ability to problem solve creatively. PyQt/PySide experience. Ability to work in a team and communicate well. Ability to mentor junior technical artists. Experience with game engines such as Unreal, Unity, or proprietary engines. Nice to Have: General knowledge of Maya rigging. Experience with other programming languages, especially C++. Experience developing or maintaining system environments. Experiencing developing or maintaining project pipeline tools. Experience with perforce and/or git. Experience with project management and tracking software (such as Shotgun and Jira). Equal Opportunity Statement: Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category. We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond. PlayStation is a Fair Chance employer and qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for employment.

Senior VFX Artist in PlayStation

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Why PlayStation? PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more. PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team. The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation. Senior VFX Artist Remote, USA Sony PlayStation Studios Visual Arts (PSSVA) on our San Diego campus provides world-class content, development and services to PlayStation Studios such as Insomniac Games, Naughty Dog, Santa Monica Studio, Bend Studio, Guerilla Games, Sucker Punch Productions and more! Our team is always at the cutting edge of technology and partners with the industry’s best minds and companies. We are looking for a Senior FX Artist to come aboard and help us build the highest quality game FX possible. Become a part of the Visual Arts Group, and work with a multi-award winning team responsible for the cinematic performances in outstanding Sony PlayStation franchises like Uncharted, The Last of Us, Killzone, and other iconic series. Responsibilities: Content creation of visual FX across all areas of the game ranging from in-game assets to Cinematics on the PlayStation 5 platform. You will work with our VFX Supervisor to ensure a consistent style and quality level across all the various types of game FX assets. You will partner with our render engineers to develop new, or improve upon existing technologies for pushing the bar of game FX, both visually and technically. Document, communicate requirements, and provide feedback to internal artists and outsourcing partners. Actively develop and improve skill set and abilities by keeping aware of industry trends and techniques, evaluating competitive products, and learning new software packages and traditional art methods. Qualifications: 4+ years’ experience as a professional FX artist in AAA games. At least 1 shipped AAA title as an FX artist. Bachelor of art degree or equivalent industry experience and training Portfolio of realistic, high quality real-time FX work. Proficiency of standard art packages such as Maya and Photoshop. Good understanding of shader techniques as applied to visual effects. Working knowledge of dynamics and simulations packages. Good communication, organizational, time management and interpersonal skills Experience working with a game engine and implementing 3D work into engine. Pluses: Python scripting experience. C++ programming experience. Premiere/After Effects experience. Side-FX Houdini experience. Equal Opportunity Statement: Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category. Technical Artist, Shaders/Materials in Insomniac Games

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Do you have experience in game development and a particular interest in shader and material creation? Insomniac Games is looking for a Technical Artist to join its Core Technology department and focus on the development of new shader and material content with one of our technical art teams, in partnership with our rendering programmers. Candidates may be considered at higher seniority levels. This job is primarily individual contribution, with support, peer mentoring, and planning responsibilities as appropriate. You'll be developing ownership over an area of Insomniac's material pipeline, creating forward-looking and cutting-edge material features to support the needs of the production teams building games such as Marvel's Spider-Man and Ratchet & Clank. Others in this role have recently been involved in projects like re-crafting our material system for performance and flexibility, evolving our system for windowed building interiors, creating automated workflows in Substance, designing unique one-off Spider-Man suit effects, and more. The Core Technology department at Insomniac includes programmers and technical artists who are scheduled separately from game teams, offering an amount of independence and self-management to individuals on the team. They maintain close communication with the game production teams, ensuring that the engine team has a direct relationship with the people using their tools and tech to make our games. Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following: Design and develop improved material pipelines, processes, and workflows Develop specific shader and material effects for unique per-game situations Provide documentation and mentor the game teams to fully take advantage of our tools and technology Create sample content to prove out new workflows and demonstrate visual improvements Provide support to content creators for tools and pipelines owned by the department Respond to bug reports, feature requests, and questions related to our tools Maintain current knowledge of technological developments in the game industry Other duties may be assigned Qualifications: Strong verbal and written communication Strong knowledge of rendering basics and shader programming in HLSL Strong Python programming abilities Knowledge of the game engine landscape and modern engine feature sets, especially as it pertains to materials and shaders Knowledge of Substance Designer, Substance Painter, and other material content tools Experience with technical art, programming, or a related field Experience with C++ is a bonus

VFX Manager in Insomniac Games

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

We are searching for a VFX Manager! This role will supervise the VFX department and help maintain the quality and artistic consistency of the department by upholding high visual standards set by the Art Director. This role is also responsible for the career management, training, and well-being of our VFX team. Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following: Works closely with Art Director to maintain quality and style consistent across all visual effects. Provides direction to visual effects artists for aesthetic and technical considerations. Works closely with the design and gameplay teams to produce visual effects that support gameplay, accessibility, and the user experience. Works closely with the Tool and Engine team to develop new or improve upon old technologies to improve visual effect quality. Works closely with art and animation teams to produce spectacle cinematic moments and support game narrative. Works with Project Management to maintain a clear and consistent schedule. Works to develop the skills of other Visual Effects Artists. Participates in the planning for a project’s visual effects. Works with other departments to ensure that assets are delivered in a timely manner. Supervise bug distribution and verify bug fixes. Ensures that all complaints and concerns related to inappropriate or unprofessional conduct in the workplace, are addressed immediately to foster a safe work environment. Other duties may apply Supervisory Responsibilities: Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems. Education and/or Experience: 8+ years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Other Skills: Experience working with Maya and visual effects packages, proficient working with joints and locators, keyframing, rigid body simulations. Advanced understanding of complex node-based shader networks such as those used in Unreal Engine 4, Houdini, etc. Proficient in Photoshop for painting and editing textures. Knowledge of other visual effects software a plus. If this sounds like a good fit for you, please submit a resume, cover letter, and portfolio for consideration. We look forward to reviewing your submission!

You should also be excited about working in a developing proprietary engine and quick to pick up new software when the need arises. You need to be familiar with the full game development pipeline, and isn't afraid to problem solve and pick up tasks that might be out of your comfort zone. Having the ability to quickly create rough block-ins that focus on establishing gameplay feel and mood, then refine to a beautiful polished quality is a must. Our team doesn't work like most companies and we shift gears a lot throughout development, so you should be adaptable and flexible. Instead of official meetings, we tend to have organic discussions throughout the day (in-person and online), so you should have great communication skills. Be prepared to revise work as needed and quickly incorporate feedback. This position works closely with other Artists, the Art Lead, and the Designer, so being an excellent collaborator is a requirement. Our team is very small, and people have a lot of individual responsibility over our games, so you should be self-motivated, proactive, and ready to take initiative. We also ask that your working hours have at least a few hours of overlap time with the team.

Senior Animator in Thekla, Inc.

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

The game studio that made the critically-acclaimed game The Witness is looking for a highly experienced animator. You should be able to work quickly and fluently in Maya. We need someone who is familiar with the full game development pipeline, communicates and works with programmers fluidly to maintain the current animation workflow, and pushes to improve on it efficiently where possible. This person should be someone who isn't afraid to get into the trenches with designers and artists to solve problems. The ability to create quick, rough work, and iterate on it as needed is a must. You should be self-motivated and responsible, as you will own all of the existing animation tasks and any new ones that may arise, and be expected to find and tackle priorities proactively. You should take initiative to recognize problems, stay productive, and keep up with the team without being pushed too much. Our studio is a passionate, close-knit, small team who aims to produce the highest quality, most cohesive art we can. So you should be adaptable, flexible, able to catch on to our workflows quickly, and be consistent and hard-working, as we rely on everyone to do their part to make our game special. Thekla is currently fully remote and has few official meetings, instead, we tend to have organic discussions throughout the day on Slack and through email. With this in mind, you should have great communication skills and enjoy collaborating and keeping in touch with your teammates. You should proactively reach out for critique, give and receive feedback and be able to quickly incorporate it into your work. This position works closely with other Artists, the Art Director, and Designers, so being an excellent collaborator is necessary. The following are the requirements of this position: Animate humans in a naturalistic style Animations should have excellent grasp of weight and balance Animations should be smooth and natural Animations should support fluid gameplay and feel responsive and snappy while maintaining style and intention Create quick rough animations to try out ideas (and also to refine it into something highly nuanced, while also paying close attention to gameplay limitations) Work in our established pipeline from Maya to our custom game engine, and fill in the gaps that have not yet been established Make intelligent decisions relating to rigging, tools used, naming conventions, file/folder structure, etc Game development experience is a must Catch on to workflows and gameplay needs quickly; adapt to those workflows and needs; for example; create rough animations while problems are being solved Work closely with other game artists and art lead; needs to be a solid collaborator Needs to have initiative and be proactive Similar timezone, or have the availability to easily work together during some core hours during the day Being able to pick up work done by someone else and complete it to a high level of polish Location: While this role is remote, we expect you to join us for in-person in meetings in Denver, CO. for 1 week every 3 months. We also ask that your working hours have at least a few hours of overlap time with the team.

Our staff is composed of video game, music, and technology veterans redefining how indie and middle-market games are made and marketed. Current and past titles / collaborations include Ghostbusters: Spirits Unleashed, Arcadegeddon, Predator: Hunting Grounds, Friday the 13th: The Game, Dead Alliance, Star Citizen, Evolve, Armored Warfare, and Nexuiz. Responsibilities Lead team members in areas of expertise; instill best practices Working with Producers to estimate the duration of tech art tasks, and then enforcing deliverables and standards Propose solutions and optimize content for memory and performance concerns on PC and Consoles Develop and maintain art asset pipelines and collaborate with the art team to optimize workflows, authoring new tools as necessary Be proactive, develop and implement new ideas/solutions to problems as they arise Advise on emerging graphics technology while assessing its usefulness within current pipeline and schedules Assist in various areas of game art production to help assure the timely delivery of the product Requirements Portfolio of work demonstrating strong proficiency as a technical Artist Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Graphic Art or a related field or equivalent experience Must have a minimum of 6 years experience with at least 3 shipped titles (one or more shipped titles as a Lead) Solid understanding of artist workflows and toolsets Proficient in C++, along with Python / PySide and MEL with knowledge of 2d/3d art packages (in-game development support) Familiar with UE4 blueprints or equivalent visual scripting Ability to write clean, maintainable and extensible code with attention to reusability Optimizing Art Assets (Environment, Character, Props, VFX and Rigs) Ability to create simple and complex shader graphs, as well as the optimization of those shaders Tool support for animation tasks, animation rigging and skinning tasks Proactive and solution orientated Well-developed troubleshooting skills - must able to quickly identify and resolve art issues and demonstrate versatility Strong communication skills, both written and verbal A customer first mentality A passion for games Benefits & Compensation Flexible work location options including remote, hybrid or in office 100% employee paid medical, dental and vision coverage + 50% coverage for dependents 401k + 4% company match Competitive salary in the independent game developer market, with career progression and continued education encouraged and supported by management at all levels Royalty Bonus Plan paid out after each calendar quarter during the year Wellness Program that rewards work-life balance Unlimited PTO and almost 7 weeks of mandated time off of work annually including First Friday Wellness Days of each month, Summer Break the week of 4th of July, Winter Break the last two weeks of the year, and an additional 7 holidays during the year Moonlighting allowed for all non-competitive endeavors

Senior Technical Artist - Rigging / Pipeline in Elodie Games

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

At Elodie Games, we believe that games are better when you play them with friends. We build endlessly engaging experiences while striving to eliminate all barriers that get in the way of to playing together. Cross-play is etched into the DNA of everything we build so that no matter what platform you’re on, you’ll get a first-class experience. We’re a diverse team of industry professionals who love games and fuel each other's creativity. As an early member of the team, you’ll have the rare opportunity to explore broad areas of game development, learn new skills, and shape our first game. As a Senior Rigging/Pipeline Technical Artist, you will be responsible for rigging and skinning characters, and creating workflow tools that improve rigging and animation pipeline in both Maya and Unreal Engine. You will have direct responsibilities for improving Eolodies’ rigging solutions and integrate them with Unreal Engine character rigging solutions. You will also be able to investigate new solutions when required for certain aspects of the art pipelines. Responsibilities Develop, maintain and craft technical solutions for real time game art assets Work autonomously to assist artists with gameplay prototypes Rigging and skinning characters and creatures Setup physics and cloth for characters and creatures Develop, maintain character setup and animation solutions Character performance monitoring Create documentation for tools and workflows Consistently communicate with the team by giving and receiving feedback Partner with other artists, designers, and engineers to collaborate on creative solutions to solve complex art pipeline problems Required Qualifications: 5+ years of industry experience in a Technical Artist role Solid understanding of Python programming Deep understanding of rigging and deformation solutions Experience with physics and simulation setup Skill and a passion for authoring scalable and performant art solutions Deep understanding of game art pipelines and shared workflows Experience with a modern game engine Able to effectively collaborate with every department of a game development team Passion for games, particularly multiplayer games Desired Qualifications: Experience developing auto-rigging solutions and character tools Experience with Unreal Engine 4 Elodie Games has embraced a fully remote-first model. If you're someone who prefers a dedicated workspace, we've got you covered with our beautiful office in sunny Venice, CA. If you'd prefer to work from home some or all of the time, you can choose to do so. Elodie Games is proud to offer the following benefits: Competitive compensation including salary and equity Health, dental, and vision insurance Relocation assistance Holidays and an open PTO policy

Senior Concept Artist in People Can Fly

Jobs available in Remote Job

People Can Fly is one of the leading independent AAA games development studios with an international team of hundreds of talented individuals working from offices located in Poland, UK, US, and Canada, and from all over the world thanks to our remote work programs. Founded in 2002, we made our mark on the shooter genre with titles such as Painkiller, Bulletstorm, Gears of War: Judgment, and Outriders. We are one of the most experienced Unreal Engine studios in the industry and we are expanding it with in-house solutions called PCF Framework. Our creative teams are currently working on several exciting AAA projects with the top publishers in the industry: Project Gemini with Square Enix and Project Dagger with Take-Two (2K), in addition to a new IP to be self-published and two other games in a concept phase. One of our IPs is also being adapted for VR technology. With over 20 years of experience, PCF sets out to explore new horizons. We aim to combine our expertise with creativity of the best and most forward-thinking talents in the industry to work together on the new generation of action games for the global gaming community. If you decide to accompany us on this journey, you’ll have a chance to perfect your craft and expand your knowledge, working alongside leaders in the industry on bringing a brand-new unique experience to the players worldwide. If you feel yourself able to deliver as nobody else, take ownership of your projects, and are ready to leave a mark on a game you work on, apply now! Job Description *This position is 100% remote and candidates can be located in either Canada or the US* People Can Fly is looking for a passionate Senior Concept Artist. You will be responsible for creating cool environments, weapons and vehicles for our games and ensuring a consistent art style is maintained across the game. You need to have a creative mind, the ability to create scenes with a memorable “wow” factor, but with grounding details to make it believable and personal. Qualifications Strong understanding of color theory and how color affects mood & focal points Strong portfolio showcasing your concept art skills Solid traditional drawing skills and visual knowledge of human anatomy Good mechanical design skills Ability to show visual storytelling within an environment design Traditional art skills along with core graphic design competencies (composition and layout, typography, color and light) Strong Photoshop skills Ability to work with several development teams, while maintaining consistency of design Vector art creation (Flash, Illustrator) is a plus 3D software knowledge (Maya/Max/SketchUp) is a plus Additional Information What we offer: U.S. 100% group health insurance benefit premiums paid by PCF (Medical, Dental, Vision, Group Life, and Supplemental Live) and start on day 1 of employment. 401K with 100% match, up to 3% of employee salary, and vested immediately. Paid week off during Winter Holidays. 20 paid vacation days and 5 paid sick days. Free virtual health and mental wellbeing sessions included in the plan for members and their dependents. A competitive salary and performance-based annual bonuses. Personal development opportunities and ability to work in a global environment. Work in a creative team with people full of passion for what they do. Long term disability, short term disability, travel insurance, as well as other benefits provided. Canada Benefit package 100% paid by PCF. Insurance company reimburses 100% of claims (Up to $500 per service a year, as well as individual family coverage). Full Dental coverage, including major dental and orthodontics. 4% RRSP matching before tax deductions, 100% vested on day 1. Paid week off during Winter Holidays. 20 paid vacation days and 5 paid sick days. Free virtual health and mental wellbeing sessions included in the plan for members and their dependents. Character Concept Artist - External Development in Crytek

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

We are looking for a motivated and talented Regular Character Concept Artist with focus on External Development. The Character Concept Artist will be responsible for overseeing the deliveries created by external partners and ensuring the visual direction is carried through into the game to the highest quality. The successful candidate will be expected to provide feedback and manage art deliverables as well as drive the external development content creation of a wide variety organic and non-organic character elements. Candidates must be able to hit the internal standards of art, have good knowledge of Game Development and exceptional oral and written communication skills. *Sample pictures or a link to a webpage, which shows sample work, are required.* Relocation & Remote Work Although we believe living close to our studio helps foster team spirit and stronger bonds between team members, we understand that people have different needs and expectations for their place of residence. You have a choice of three location options, allowing you to work with Crytek from anywhere you wish: Come to our modern headquarters in Frankfurt and receive an attractive relocation package and have access to all of our benefits. If you are already living in a European Union member state, we are able to offer you a permanent work contract and allow you to work remotely as an employee from there. If you are interested in full-time remote work in any other country outside of the European Union, we can offer you a freelance contract arrangement. Responsibilities Collect and provide clear technical and aesthetic feedback to external teams. Understand and follow style guides to guarantee the consistency of the game. Iterate on ideas quickly through sketches and thumbnails Track external development on daily basis and incoming assets. Coordinate with other studio groups and production to achieve project objectives. Creating in-game Characters when needed, following art direction. Requirements 2+ years experience in game development Expert understanding of current game art processes, limitations and dependencies Excellent knowledge of 3D Software Packages and Photoshop High Quality portfolio of gamedev-relevant art Strong knowledge of understanding of anatomy. Ability to deliver and receive constructive feedback Good English communication and writing skills. Positive team-oriented attitude. Be proactive and self-motivated, complete tasks within given time constraint. Heavy focus on Character Art Keen eye on detail and realism Strong artistic skills (Shapes / colors / proportions) Ability to create new and refine existing designs Pluses Previous experience with external production and/or directing others through written communication. Experience with CRYENGINE Industrial design or Traditional Art background What you can expect from us A refreshing yet highly professional atmosphere in a diverse team Flexible work time Free public transportation ticket, which lets you use public transport free of charge 24/7 Supported German lessons for our employees Company language is English. Any additional language is a plus, but not a requirement Extensive assistance with getting visa, work permits and communication with local authorities Relocation support A company apartment for your first few months and help in finding a private apartment ...and much more!

Candidates must be able to hit the internal standards of art, have good knowledge of Game Development and exceptional oral and written communication skills. *Sample pictures or a link to a webpage, which shows sample work, are required.* Relocation & Remote Work Although we believe living close to our studio helps foster team spirit and stronger bonds between team members, we understand that people have different needs and expectations for their place of residence. You have a choice of three location options, allowing you to work with Crytek from anywhere you wish: Come to our modern headquarters in Frankfurt and receive an attractive relocation package and have access to all of our benefits. If you are already living in a European Union member state, we are able to offer you a permanent work contract and allow you to work remotely as an employee from there. We create rewarding opportunities across our entire family of brands, while championing a spirit of inclusion, innovation, self-development and support. Join WarnerMedia as we think big, live true and make the stories that move the world. TT Games was acquired by Warner Bros. in 2007 and went on to develop the hit LEGO games franchise. The company is proud to continue its mission to be the leading publisher of interactive entertainment for young gamers and their families. The Role TT Games Brighton are looking for a talented Senior Technical Artist to join the team at our Brighton studio. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work within our highly talented and creative team on an exciting AAA mobile game. Essential: Passion for tools and pipelines with a focus on future areas and trends. Positive and can-do attitude - being flexible with new ideas and most importantly open to direction and iteration. Ability to communicate and work with artists, coders & designers in a dynamic team environment. Willing to help others and ask for help where needed. Prepared to learn new tools during production. Proactive in sharing information and assets. A keen gamer and an appreciation of the visuals and user experience on all platforms from mobile to consoles. Experience: Excellent technical skills to manage assets that fit memory, design, and frame rate limitations. Expert knowledge in at least one of following areas: Modelling, Shaders / Materials, Animation and Vfx Excellent at both technical and creative problem-solving. Experience implementing efficient Rigs for Characters / Vehicles. Character skinning and physics simulation setup. Great working knowledge and proficiency in Autodesk Maya and Adobe Photoshop Experience at creating Custom Tools, Scripts and Shaders We make AAA quality games that have to be intuitive and slick. You would need to be hungry to make them even better! Advantageous: Knowledge of software like 3DSMax, ZBrush, Houdini, Modo, Substance Designer / Painter. Experience in MEL, Python, C# scripting. Knowledge of Unity or Unreal. About TT Odyssey Founded in 2017 by some of the leading talent in the mobile games industry, TT Odyssey is the Brighton based, mobile-focused arm of TT Games, part of Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment and the makers of best-selling LEGO titles including “LEGO Star Wars” and “LEGO Dimensions”. This is the first time that a LEGO video game has been designed from the ground-up as a free to play, mobile title. Quality and innovation is extremely important in this endeavour. We aim to be at the top of the charts and are looking for people to whom that goal is important. We are well funded, independent in spirit and working with the best Intellectual Properties in the world. Who wouldn’t want to be a part of that! Our culture and values place great emphasis upon open communication, autonomy and empowerment. We believe in encouraging people to be the best they can be and giving them the tools to achieve their goals. Our team is small, supportive and collaborative. We like everyone to be involved in the design process and value staff who can work independently. Our people are expected to organise their time and workload themselves so we can avoid excessive layers of management. This leads to a flat structure where everyone is respected and listened to. TT offers successful candidates a competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits package. Our work environment is inclusive, relaxed and friendly – one of the best things about working here is our fantastic people! We aim to support work-life balance, and some of the benefits we are most proud of include flexitime and other family-friendly benefits; discretionary bonus scheme; company pension scheme and life assurance. We also offer perks such as regular health and wellbeing activities, discounts on a wide range of company and partner products, free online training courses, complimentary fruit and a wide selection of drinks, social events and much more! We expect high levels of ambition and innovation from our colleagues and an ability to flourish within the dynamic entertainment industry in which the company operates.
