Senior Environment Outsource Review Artist This is a contracted position through our staffing partner DZConneX with a high likelihood of extension. Remote, United States PlayStation Studios Visual Arts (PSSVA) provides world-class content, development and services to PlayStation Studios. Our team is always at the cutting edge of technology and partners with the industry’s best minds and companies. This is your opportunity to work closely with game and film industry professionals from all over the world! We're looking for a Senior Environment Outsource Review Artist to join our team and build in-game next generation game & cinematic quality environments and a range of material props styles. The focus of this role will be on environmental art assets for AAA Assets for Sony First Party & External Client titles. If you have the ability to create props and environments from both detailed concepts and a single photograph, we want to speak to you! If you're able to take and provide direction from concepts or rough direction to the final model/texture, even better! Responsibilities: Be able to craft in-game art and in-game cinematic art assets to Visual Arts/client specifications. Oversee the creation of game assets with an external team. Take a game asset from grey box to final quality (end to end) including collision, LOD’s and baking texture maps, etc. Evaluate effort estimations to ensure staff days are in-line with current project schedules. Create and/or modify existing assets as necessary, may be required to create both hard-surface and soft bodied assets from scratch. Quality control art assets prior to delivery to client. Work with clients/supervisors to revise and respond based on feedback for both aesthetic and functional purposes. Qualifications: 5 years' experience as an Environment/Prop Artist, with at least 2 shipped AAA titles. Advanced understanding of in-game and in-game cinematic art asset creation (portfolio must contain examples of assets with wire-frame shading). Expert understanding of Maya, as well as ZBrush or Mudbox. Experience in training and mentoring a team of artists. Ability to use in-game technology to finalize assets. Understanding of in-game testing to test/optimize for game engine specs while balancing aesthetic needs. Experience with asset ingestion/integration within a game engine (Unreal, Crytek, or proprietary). Advanced understanding of in-game art asset creation including hard-surface props, soft rigid assets such as clothing items, vehicle, weapons, etc. Desired Qualifications: Experience working with external outsource vendors and/or working with a game engine and engine tools. Bonus: Experience as a concept artist / drawing skills / portfolio. Equal Opportunity Statement: Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category. Insomniac Games is looking for a Senior Art Manager to join our team! This individual will be responsible for logistical problem solving, planning, and execution of the Art department within a given project. The Senior Art Manager will supervise a team of managers and provide strategy and leadership to this group. This role will also look after the well-being of the art team. Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following: Manages Art leads and evaluates schedules and deliverables for a specific project Evangelizes tools and workflow improvements for project Evaluates leads’ objectives and goals, and ensures that department goals are being met Work with Department Head and other Senior Managers to determine best practices and guide leads in their implementation across all art groups within a given project Builds and maintains relationships with peers and other senior leaders to align project and departmental priorities Evaluates schedules in conjunction with project management, ensures that teams deliver against project goals and pillars Assists in pre-production planning through resource allocation and staffing Responsible for developing project budget in coordination with Department Head and Executives Plays game in development to ensure that operational goals are meeting or exceeding quality bar Ensures that all complaints and concerns related to inappropriate or unprofessional conduct in the workplace are addressed immediately to foster a safe work environment Other duties may be assigned Supervisory Responsibilities: Supervises a team of managers across multiple studio locations and is responsible for carrying out duties in accordance with the studio's policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include but are not limited to interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; addressing complaints and resolving problems. Qualifications: 12+ years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Technical Skills: Advanced Maya, 3D Studio Max, Photoshop, Perforce, and ZBrush (or equivalent) user, Microsoft Office 365. Ability to adapt to new tools quickly. Other Skills: Large team leadership, with experience navigating multiple simultaneous projects and reports. Creative collaboration and problem solving, with an understanding that often it is appropriate to defer to the expertise of specialists. Demonstrated high-level business, strategic and contemporary management skills and oriented both towards the big picture and operational detail. Effective time management, with the ability to delegate tasks and focus on larger issues while monitoring critical smaller details. A strong critical eye for detail and the ability to communicate effectively with the team to resolve issues. Communication with both large groups and individuals, with excellent written and oral communication skills. Deadline-oriented approach, with the ability to get results even in difficult situations. A leadership style that is marked by personal visibility, open communication, relationship building, collegiality, and teamwork. Well-developed interpersonal skills and the poise and the ability to relate effectively to others at all levels, state a point of view, and advocate for a position within a strong and assertive senior executive group. High level oral and written communication skills and a professional demeanor. Does this sound like you? Please submit your resume and cover letter for consideration. Insomniac Games is looking for a mid-level Visual Effects Artist to join our team! This individual will be responsible for creating realtime VFX that work across gameplay, environment, and cinematics of our games. Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following: Creates, designs, and implements real-time particle effects using both static and animating 2D/3D elements. Placing of visual FX across all areas of the game, including environmental and gameplay FX, and cinematics. Create FX textures (color, normal, specular, ambient occlusion, height, and incandescent maps.) Understands fundamentals of simulations in software packages like Houdini, Embergen or equivalent. Creates FX shaders with node-based shader networks. Creates simple geometry and UV sets. Optimizes FX for framerate and memory. Collaborates with other development departments to ensure that FX are implemented appropriately in the game engine. Understands and adds to the overall art style of game. Orchestrates FX events involving layering and timing of different FX to create a believable scene. Other duties may be assigned Education and/or Experience: Five plus years of professional experience or training, or an equivalent amount of education and experience. Technical Skills: Proficient in Maya, competent working with joints and locators, keyframing, rigid body simulations, hard surface modeling, and UV mapping. Proficient in Photoshop for painting and editing textures. Proficient with nodebased shader networks. Knowledge of other visual effects software is a plus. Other Skills: Strong team skills and collaborative attitude. Strong observation skills and ability to use reference materials. Ability to work independently. Proficient Animation and timing skills. Solid traditional arts background a plus. Does this sound like you? Submit your resume, cover letter, portfolio/reel to be considered. We look forward to reviewing your submission!

Create color studies and lighting keys to inform and inspire other environment artists. Be highly skilled at creating environments, including assembly, set dressing, and asset composition. Understand, inspire, and harmonize with the characters to achieve the goal that draws players into the game Collaborate and iterate on game assets with internal and external production artists via paint overs, studies, and group critiques Skilled at creating unexpected and awe-inspiring work that will help promote and enroll others in the unique artistic vision of the game. Assist with outsourced game art, reviewing submissions, checking quality, and upholding the integrity of the art style Coordinate with other art leads, design, and production to help accomplish team goals. Able to support the game’s artistic vision to both internal and external artists/teams. Providing feedback, maintaining documentation, and communicating daily. Work closely with the Art Director, and Concept Artists to create environments that work aesthetically and represent concept work and artistic vision. Demonstrate the ability to develop a comprehensive knowledge of the art production pipeline and all engine features, tools, and systems associated with the creation of art assets. Work with 3D artists and outsource supervisors to complete final modeling and render of concepts. Add final paint-over polish to 3D renders to enhance color, lighting, and details. Strong traditional fine art skills, training, and production experience (illustration, painting, organic forms, color theory, perspective, 2D & 3D design). A keen eye for design, form, shape, silhouette, structure, and composition with the ability to translate these ideas to real-time game environments. Deep understanding of organic material, textures, and forms and knowing how to stylize them. Proven ability to create compelling and memorable environments that help tell a story. Shipped a game as a senior artist and helped oversee the quality of the art, and implementation. A passion and excitement for collaboration. Creating exceptional entertaining game experiences is a team effort – you thrive when researching and conceptualizing ideas with like-minded teammates. Positive, proactive problem-solver. Lead by example and contribute to a positive, supportive, and inspiring studio culture. Familiarity with video game product development – workflow, tools, lighting, high and low poly modeling, texture painting, particle systems, UV layout, in-game animation, material setup, layout, VFX, and engine parameters/optimizations. Preferred Qualifications Has shipped an AAA console or PC title as an in-game senior environment artist. Mobile / Console / PC Games experience. Cinematic or television art production experience. A love for video games, movies, and animation. Skill in one or more related disciplines – illustration, lighting, staging, color, composition. *This position can be fully remote* People Can Fly is one of the leading independent AAA games development studios with an international team of hundreds of talented individuals working from offices located in Poland, UK, US, and Canada, and from all over the world thanks to our remote work programs. Founded in 2002, we made our mark on the shooter genre with titles such as Painkiller, Bulletstorm, Gears of War: Judgment, and Outriders. We are one of the most experienced Unreal Engine studios in the industry and we are expanding it with in-house solutions called PCF Framework. Our creative teams are currently working on several exciting AAA projects with the top publishers in the industry: Project Gemini with Square Enix and Project Dagger with Take-Two (2K), in addition to a new IP to be self-published and two other games in a concept phase. One of our IPs is also being adapted for VR technology. With over 20 years of experience, PCF sets out to explore new horizons. We aim to combine our expertise with creativity of the best and most forward-thinking talents in the industry to work together on the new generation of action games for the global gaming community. We are in the process of staffing up our development team with outstanding talent to build our first multi-platform, AAA game - a bold, new take on the GI JOE Universe starring the legendary character Snake Eyes! This is an excellent opportunity to not only build an outstanding AAA experience but to also help form the core foundations for the studio and team to build upon. We are proud to be part of Wizards of the Coast which is a division Hasbro. We are seeking a passionate, experienced, and team-oriented Senior Technical Animator to help us build an outstanding AAA, 3rd Person Action/Adventure game. You'll work on a variety of vehicles and characters and will be responsible for developing and maintaining animation systems, rigging, pipelines and processes used by the animation team. What You’ll Do: Develop technical animation / rigging pipelines and tools to help deliver high quality animations. Design, build and maintain character rigs and setups. Build automated animation setups and rigs. Collaborate with Concept, Design, Animation, and Art team to bring characters, creatures, and vehicles to life. Work closely with Artists to troubleshoot and fix problems arising in the course of production. Evaluate new technologies to improve existing pipelines and visual quality of rigged assets. Mentor and train junior tech animators and animators. What You’ll Bring: 5+ years of production experience in Games, Feature Film or VFX. Experience rigging/skinning complex characters, creatures and vehicles in Maya. Scripting / tool creation experience with Python / Mel. Strong understanding of character rigging / animation pipelines. Unreal Engine Experience in procedural animation systems (Animation Blueprints, Control Rig setups). Dedicated and internally driven, able to take initiative and work independently or collaborate effectively with artists, engineers, and designers. A passion for deep, compelling action adventure games. Why PlayStation? PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more. PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team. The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation. Senior Character Artist (Contract) This is a long-term contracted position through our staffing partner DZConneX with a high likelihood of extension. Remote, USA Are you an experienced Character Artist looking to join a team to create the highest quality characters possible? Then read on! You will work on a high visibility AAA projects within Sony PlayStation Studios Visual Arts (PSSVA), an award-winning, full-production studio that specializes in Animation, Motion Capture, Cinematics, Art and Scanning. For over two decades we have shared knowledge, support and ground breaking techniques with the very best developers in the industry: Naughty Dog, Kojima Productions, Guerrilla Games, Santa Monica Studios, Sucker Punch Productions, Bend Studio, Japan Studio, Insomniac Games and more. Responsibilities: Use modeling and texturing ability to create photorealistic living, breathing characters with personality. Create highly detailed and believable 3D character models and textures for use in-game. Ensure character assets are of the highest artistic quality and uphold the integrity of the games’ design and artistic vision. Follow the direction of art leads. Collaborate with other departments such as Concept Art, Animation, Rigging and Game Design to make sure artwork fits within the title’s vision. Serve as mentor for other artists. Work with production to follow and build schedules and to deliver assets on time. Work with outsourcing to help create and integrate art assets. Clearly communicate updates and voice concerns to the appropriate team members and manager(s) Contribute to the development of the artistic techniques and processes utilized to define and achieve a product's visual style or encourage artistic evolution within the studio Participate in research and development on latest tools tech and methodology. Capable of resolving a range of complex artistic development issues for both artists as well as other team members Actively improve skill set and abilities by keeping aware of industry trends and techniques, evaluating competitive products, learning new software packages and traditional art methods Qualifications 5+ years’ experience as a 3D character artist. Familiarity with video game product development including, but not limited to workflow, tools, lighting, high and low poly modeling, texture painting, material setup, character skinning, surface sampling, mapping techniques, UV layout, in-game animation, character rigging and engine parameters/optimizations desirable Portfolio of realistic, highly detailed, 3D character models, with highly realistic textures (skin, hair, worn fabric/accessories, etc.), accurate anatomy, detailed clothing, etc. Portfolio should show quality, taste, and ability to hit a photorealistic/believable look. Mastery of standard art packages such as Maya, Photoshop, Zbrush and Substance Designer. Strong understanding of scale, proportion, human anatomy and surface properties. Good communication, organizational, time management and interpersonal skills Possess strong time management and prioritization skills. Experience working with a game engine and implementing 3D work into engine. Previous console experience with a shipped title is desired. Desired Skills: Experience working on AAA titles as a character artist Marvelous Design,ari, Agisoft, Substance, Mudbox Equal Opportunity Statement: Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category. We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond. PlayStation is a Fair Chance employer and qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for employment.

Familiarity with video game product development including, but not limited to workflow, tools, lighting, high and low poly modeling, texture painting, material setup, character skinning, surface sampling, mapping techniques, UV layout, in-game animation, character rigging and engine parameters/optimizations desirable Portfolio of realistic, highly detailed, 3D character models, with highly realistic textures (skin, hair, worn fabric/accessories, etc.), accurate anatomy, detailed clothing, etc. Portfolio should show quality, taste, and ability to hit a photorealistic/believable look. Mastery of standard art packages such as Maya, Photoshop, Zbrush and Substance Designer. Strong understanding of scale, proportion, human anatomy and surface properties. Senior Materials Artist in PlayStation

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Why PlayStation? PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more. PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team. The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation. Senior Materials Artist Remote, USA PlayStation Studios Visual Arts (PSSVA) on our San Diego campus provides world-class content, development and services to PlayStation Studios such as Insomniac Games, Naughty Dog, Santa Monica Studio, Bend Studio Guerilla Games, and more! Our team is always at the cutting edge of technology and partners with the industry’s best minds and companies. You're a creative and passionate artist who lives for world building and crafting textures and materials that tell a story within the game environment. You're inspired to achieve only the highest of quality in your work and want to contribute to the artistic vision and development of the industry's most anticipated AAA games. We are looking for a highly talented and motivated Senior Materials Artist to work on an unannounced AAA project. Come work with our Art Lead and Studio Art Director to create both in-game and in-game cinematic quality materials within a range of styles. Your ability to build materials from both detailed concepts and a single photograph is required. Responsibilities: Create realistic game-ready physically based materials to project specifications. Build and maintain internal PBR material library. Assist with maintaining technical and quality standards. Collaborate with production artists on creating materials for in-game use. Create organized material workflows in Substance Designer and Painter. Problem solve production challenges with creative solutions. Ability to document production workflows and mentor production artists. Evaluate scope estimates to ensure material assets are in line with project schedules. Work with Environment Lead to revise and respond based on feedback for both aesthetic and functional purposes Requirements: At least 5 years' experience as an Environment Artist, with 2 shipped AAA titles Strong understanding of PBR materials and workflows. Expert knowledge of Substance Designer and Painter workflows. History of strong understanding of game development with a focus on materials. Proficient at sculpting surface details and controlling shader features that represent a wide variety of material types Ability to work in new game engines and add material assets to game engine. Expert knowledge of Adobe Photoshop and High Resolution Texture baking. Ability to unwrap UVs for texturing meshes and lightmaps in Autodesk Maya. Experience optimizing games for performance and memory. An advanced understanding of in-game and in-game cinematic art asset creation Pluses: Shader authoring a plus Photogrammetry experience a plus Experience working with external outsource vendors As a part of the PlayStation application process, candidates will be expected to provide a portfolio or demo reel of their work and may be asked to complete an art test, in addition to a phone screen. Equal Opportunity Statement: Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category. We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond. PlayStation is a Fair Chance employer and qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for employment.

3D Artist in PlaySide

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

We are looking for a 3D artist who is excited to use their diverse skill set to bring to life stunning visuals that delight our players. If you have a passion for game development and want to participate in the future of PlaySide, we would love to hear from you! Our team values creativity, collaboration, and a commitment to quality, and we are searching for like-minded developers to add to our team of talented game makers. Together we will learn, grow, and ultimately enjoy success as a team, overcoming new challenges together. Our ideal 3D artist can generate assets across various styles and is willing to tackle light FX and material creation tasks. You would use this diverse skill set to author new assets, problem-solve, and combine existing assets to create beautiful and performant games. Key Responsibilities To provide exceptional visual quality on your projects to create a fun and engaging experience. Identification and assistance in the creation of documentation in projects you are tasked to. Ability to work on a technical level with all members of staff in all areas of expertise. Working alongside the other Art team members in a professional manner. And providing thoughts on improvements to all projects studio-wide. Implement feedback from Lead Artist and Art Director. Liaise with Art Lead & producers within the scheduling phase of projects to ensure art implementation is within time/budget. Work with Art Lead & Director to reinforce art style and to resolve stylistic questions. Review progress of art team tasks and communicate potential issues to Art Lead and Producer. Improve workflow and efficiency by sharing experience and skill, both verbally and through presentations and/or documentation. To help in reinforcing great teamwork and amazing studio culture! What You Bring To The Role 3+ years of experience in video game production with multiple shipped titles in an artist role. Ability to contribute to a vision and help guide your projects to success. Experience providing mentorship and training to more junior members of the team. Exceptional level of understanding of software including Maya, Photoshop and Substance Painter. Advanced level of knowledge with either Unity or Unreal Engine. (Or both!) Create high-quality game-ready models and scenes with minimal direction and a high level of autonomy that work optimally within the engine and platform constraints. Review progress of art team tasks and communicate potential issues to Art Lead and Producer. Work with Art Lead to reinforce art style and to resolve stylistic questions. Excellent technical understanding of current asset workflows, shaders, and engine capabilities. Improve workflow and efficiency by sharing experience and skill, both verbally and through presentations and/or documentation. Excellent initiative, self-motivation, communication, organisational and problem-solving skills, as well as team working and the ability to accept and follow direction The ability to prioritise and work on multiple tasks simultaneously and manage competing priorities. Strong attention to detail and the ability to work independently to get the job done without day-to-day direction. Conduct strategy audits with your lead to identify further opportunities to improve the way we do things. Have a can-do with the ability to turn a negative into a positive, no problem is too great. Bonus Points! Strong 2D concept art skills to communicate vision and ideas. Good knowledge in shader/material development tools for Unity or Unreal.

You will need to excel at convincing character animation, strong grasp of the 12 principles and work as part of a team. Use a strong understanding of 2d animation to craft appealing character animation with dynamic body mechanics and high quality acting personality and appeal. Respond well to instruction, and feedback, take initiative in one's work and be willing to iterate multiple times. Brainstorm and ideate, strong, clear and fun narrative ideas and character pieces that can be executed to high quality, creating storyboards or thumbnails to communicate visual ideas and narrative Firm display of understanding over 2D animation workflows and pipelines from puppet/bone animated 2d Rigs to 2d hand-drawn vfx etc. Ability to create quality 2D assets and/OR rig 2D characters and animate them. Strong drawing ability with quality and appealing rendering quality Comprehension of 2d animation pipeline and workflows. What You Bring To The Role 3+ years of experience in 2d animation production with shipped titles in an Animation role. Excellent knowledge of animating using Spline or Adobe suite, with outstanding animation skills demonstrating knowledge and application of weight, timing, pace, poses and storytelling Excellent understanding of how animation must work in a pipeline structure and expectations Firm display of illustration and character design skills. Excellent initiative, self-motivation, communication, organisational and problem-solving skills, as well as team working and the ability to accept and follow direction Advanced level of knowledge with 2D animation asset creation and development. A genuine passion for animation, bringing characters to life with the highest appeal and strong visual storytelling. Ability to Create animation assets, rig and animate them through a full 2D production pipeline to end rendered result to a high quality and consistency. Experience with either Spine 2D or Adobe. (Or both!) The ability to prioritise and work on multiple tasks simultaneously and manage competing priorities. Strong attention to detail and the ability to work independently to get the job done without day-to-day direction. Understanding of 2D animation and production as an industry as a whole. Conduct strategy audits with your lead to identify further opportunities to improve the way we do things. Think on their feet and act quickly. Have a can-do with the ability to turn a negative into a positive, no problem is too great. Bonus Points! Familiarity in Rigging and Skinning with Spine 2D. StoryBoard skills and/or narrative writing. 2D hand-drawn animation skills; character or VFX.

Destiny 3D Hard Surface Artist in Bungie

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Do you think about what a receiver would have to work and look like if it were fed from the magazine with lightning bullets? What about if you were harnessing the power of the sun, charging, and channeling it inside a rifle? Do you find yourself thinking about how the starboard wing of a spaceship would attach to the main fuselage if it had to repeatedly endure the stresses of re-entry, warp space, and orbital ascension? How would you sit on a rocket with gravity repulsors, hit the throttle, and have the whole thing not only hold together, but look good doing it? These are the questions that we tackle daily, and then we make those dreams come true for us, and our millions of players. We are looking for artists to not only realize our imaginations with us, but who live and breathe it. You know who you are, you see vertices, high poly, baking, shaders, and that polished in game asset that makes everyone smile and get hyped as your bread and butter. You love talking with the team to bounce around ideas, help spin up new work, polish to that gleaming shine, and plays perfectly. We are right there with you, it is what drives us every day. Give us a shout, we want to hear from you. We are the makers of worlds, dreams, and amazing things, and we think you might fit in just fine. RESPONSIBILITIES Translate fully realized concepts and simple napkin sketches into amazing models of weapons and vehicles Author realistic, futuristic, and sometimes, fantastical textures for multiple shader functions such as albedo, normal, roughness, metal, and detail maps Meet the quality bar established by the Art Director and Art Lead Collaborate with the Art Lead, Concept, FX, Design, Engineering, and Animation on visuals, functions, style, limitations, etc. Incorporate technical, artistic, basic understanding of animation, and knowledge of industrial and mechanical design into asset creation REQUIRED SKILLS Experience working as a Hard Surface Artist on a shipped game title (AAA), or equivalent Hard Surface assets for feature films Well-rounded understanding of surface development, proportion, and mechanical functionality Proficient with 3D Max, Maya, Blender, Photoshop, Substance Painter, Zbrush and/or Mudbox Proficient with high to low poly pipelines Good communication skills and the ability to work well in a team environment Participate in constructive critiques Most Bungie full-time employees will adopt a digital first approach allowing remote work in Bungie approved locations (outside of positions identified as 100% onsite in Bellevue/Seattle, or individuals preferring a hybrid/flex environment). Prospective full-time employees located outside of CA, CO, DC, FL, GA, IL, MA, MD, MN, NC, NJ, NY, OR, TX, UT, VA, WA, or WI will need to establish residency in one of the states we are compliant in within 45 days of a start date. Contractors will follow a digital first approach adhering to the location guidelines agreed upon by our third-party employer/vendor and Bungie. Bungie’s remote policy is subject to change at the company’s discretion.

Generalist 3D Artist in Flaming Fowl Studios

Jobs available in Remote Job

Flaming Fowl Studios is an independent studio that rose from the ashes of the renowned Lionhead Studios. We create games that feature deep and interesting strategic experiences with fascinating twists and always include a healthy dose of humour. Our next project is a brand new and exciting AAA quality, strategic turn-based RPG for which we are looking for a talented Artist to join our ranks and help us create something awesome. Although the company is registered in the UK, we operate remotely so are looking for developers located all over the globe. Flaming Fowl is built on a foundation of respecting quality of life over everything else. We are a fully distributed team, working flexible hours and currently have team members from all over Europe. If you are fed up commuting, fed up being micromanaged and want to define your own hours then this is a great opportunity to become a core member of a growing studio but with all the flexibility of working from anywhere in the world. The Role: We are looking for a talented artist that is comfortable working in all areas of the art team and significant experience working in Unreal. Your duties will include: Produce new 3D environment and prop assets when required Integrate art assets from yourself and other team members into the game engine, ensuring that everything is working correctly Polishing existing levels and assets Creating and setting up additional variations of existing assets Integrate, set up and test character assets in-game Bug fixing, troubleshooting and optimisation, ensuring game is running efficiently Present, review and discuss work online Implement feedback from Lead Artist and Directors Requirements: A relevant degree and/or an outstanding portfolio/demo that showcases their ability 1 shipped title on consoles/ PC Expert general knowledge of Unreal production and art pipelines Excellent and efficient 3D modelling skills Expert knowledge of a current 3D modelling package, preferably Maya Strong Zbrush and Substance Painter skills Excellent 2D art skills with ability to follow an illustrative art style Excellent knowledge of Photoshop Good all-round technical art skills A good understanding of node-based material graphs (eg Amplify shader editor) Ability to R&D new techniques if required Excellent problem-solving abilities Understanding of performance limitations and ability to optimise without compromising on quality A true passion for video games and the desire to create high-quality experiences Highly motivated with a proactive attitude and the ability to work in a team Ability to manage time well and deliver high-quality assets on time and on budget Excellent verbal and written communication skills (English) Desirable: Understanding of simple rigging/skinning Good understanding of lighting techniques Initially, this will be on a long term contract with the possibility to convert to a permanent position.

Splitgate is a free to play, fast-paced sci-fi multiplayer shooter that combines the strategic elements of portals with the explosive gameplay of a first person shooter. We quickly became a top trending game on PlayStation, XBOX, and Steam. In our first 6 days, we passed 1M downloads, and hit 2M within the first two weeks. We’re now at 15M+ downloads and growing. After receiving $100M Series A funding with a valuation of $1.5B, we are actively looking to grow our team with the best talent out there to continue the journey of making Splitgate a game that we and the millions of players in our gaming community are proud of. What We're Looking For: A passionate art leader: You love to take on difficult, seemingly impossible problems and dig in to find creative ways to solve them A hard worker: You love to put in the extra effort, because you enjoy your work and know the impact of finishing the tasks at hand Passion for gaming: You can recognize what separates exceptional games from the average ones. You understand the mindset of gamers which enables you to create and implement features that will further benefit the game Responsibilities: Share a passion to innovate, especially in the design and development of open world games Keep up to date with the bleeding edge of animation trends within video game development and evangelize ideas that will innovate both the player experience and the creative development of the product Participate in the hiring of the animation discipline Responsible to help the mentorship of the animation discipline on the project Work side-by-side with all directors and leads to take a multi-discipline approach to creativity and problem solving Ensure that the animation direction of the game starts with a live product foundation, capable of regular updates and malleable to key changes if necessary Qualifications: A portfolio of visionary, inspiring, industry-leading gameplay animation that demonstrates your direction and capacity to execute on it within a game At least 8 years of professional AAA game development experience At least one product shipped during the current generation of games (PS4/XBOX ONE) Experience in gameplay animation systems (First and Third Person, ...) A team player who can evangelize the project and not just within art Experience creating animation in and shipping a game using Unreal Engine 4 Deep-rooted knowledge of animation software like Maya

This role focuses on 3DSMax tooling, environment features and their associated workflows to unlock our creative teams potential. You will hone your skills to tackle a diverse set of visual challenges with an eye on sustainable solutions. Join our team of technical artists if you are ready to take on the immense visual range Destiny has to offer. development of open world games Work with the team to develop and manage an animation vision and production plan capable of delivering upon the promise of the game Keep up to date with the bleeding edge of animation trends within video game development and evangelize ideas that will innovate both the player experience and the creative development of the product Participate in the hiring of the animation discipline Responsible for the career growth and mentorship of the animation discipline on the project Act as the key animation contact for the studio, representing the project and team to all external partners and stakeholders Develop an animation vision for gameplay that meets the ambitions of AAA quality game experiences Define and uphold animation principles to ensure the animation direction of the game is cohesive, inspiring, and represents the right balance between good looking motion and fluid player input Work side-by-side with all directors and leads to take a multi-discipline approach to creativity and problem solving Work closely with the Game Director and Creative Director to develop animation intentions that reinforce and celebrate the gameplay and player fantasy Ensure that the animation direction of the game starts with a live product foundation, capable of regular updates and malleable to key changes if necessary Qualifications: A portfolio of visionary, inspiring, industry-leading gameplay animation that demonstrates your direction and capacity to execute on it within a game At least 8 years of professional AAA game development experience At least two projects shipped in a leadership position At least one AAA action title shipped At least one product shipped during the current generation of games (PS4/XBOX ONE) Demonstrable, outstanding management and communication capabilities Proven ability to define and manage the animation direction and roadmap for large-scale projects Proven ability to to define and develop gameplay animation systems (3C, Combat, NPC, ...) A team player who knows how to get the best out of everyone on the project and not just within art Experience creating animation in and shipping a game using Unreal Engine 4 Deep-rooted knowledge of animation software like Motion Builder, 3DS Max, and Maya

Technical Artist in 1047 Games

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Splitgate is a free to play, fast-paced sci-fi multiplayer shooter that combines the strategic elements of portals with the explosive gameplay of a first person shooter. We quickly became a top trending game on PlayStation, XBOX, and Steam. In our first 6 days, we passed 1M downloads, and hit 2M within the first two weeks. We’re now at 15M+ downloads and growing. After receiving $100M Series A funding with a valuation of $1.5B, we are actively looking to grow our team with the best talent out there to continue the journey of making Splitgate a game that we and the millions of players in our gaming community are proud of. The Technical Artist (TA) acts as a bridge between the artists and engineers. They are considered part of the art team and work closely with artists, project managers, SEs and the Technical Art team. What We're Looking For: A passionate art leader: You love to take on difficult, seemingly impossible problems and dig in to find creative ways to solve them A hard worker: You love to put in the extra effort, because you enjoy your work and know the impact of finishing the tasks at hand Passion for gaming: You can recognize what separates exceptional games from the average ones. You understand the mindset of gamers which enables you to create and implement features that will further benefit the game Responsibilities: Improve and maintain art production workflows, pipelines, asset optimization/integration and shader development Collaborate and advise on tools, workflows and best practices Owner any technical issues that arise in art production and bring them to resolution Work closely with artists and engineers to pinpoint and fix game performance and memory usage issues Diagnose problems related to asset and level creation and support the art and design teams Lighting systems Shaders Art assets Qualifications: At least 5+ years of cinematic/games production experience. You have completed more than 3 AAA games/movies Experience in Unreal is a must A bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in a related field is desired Effective at communicating with different audiences: artists, engineers, managers Proficient scripting/programming in python and C#. (C++ is a bonus, but is not required) Expert knowledge of a 2D and 3D art packages: Maya/Photoshop needed. Houdini/Substance Designer a bonus A solutions-provider, particularly as it pertains to debugging technical issues Experience with asset optimization challenges/techniques A willingness to jump into the unknown and solve new problems; the ability to think creatively to resolve technical challenges and limitations A Passion for Games!

2D Artist (VR) in Nimble Giant Entertainment

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Nimble Giant is looking for a Full-time 2D Artist We are looking for a talented, dedicated, and passionate 2D Artist to join our team. As a member of our art team, your job will involve creating concept art, and producing and implementing 2D art and UI assets for our games, striving to achieve AAA quality. You will work closely with the rest of the team during the game development and in synchronicity with the art leads to ensure all assets in each project are top-notch and spectacular. If you are interested in growing as a 2D artist while working with a top-notch team of developers in cutting-edge VR games, don’t hesitate to apply! Responsibilities: Collaborate with the art team to define the look of our projects by working to establish a consistent visual and art direction. Design, create and implement concept art, UI and game ready art assets, adapting to the game style and art direction, to achieve a visually cohesive product. Deliver assets in time and with high quality. Help ensure that produced and integrated assets respect the artistic vision of the game and meet the art and quality standards. Provide visual contextualization support for gameplay design efforts at all stages of development. Provide and receive feedback professionally. Requirements: At least 1 year of experience as a 2D artist in games. Excellent and versatile artistic skills, with a strong sense of color, composition, shape, visual language, personality, and design. Professional knowledge of digital painting, using Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, or equivalent software. Good communication skills, both oral and written. Ability to communicate in English. Bonus: Knowledge of graphic design, including visual design skills including color, shape, layout and typography. Experience with Unreal, Unity or other 3D game engines. Experience working on Virtual Reality projects. Experience working with Agile methodologies (Scrum). Experience with project management tools like Jira, Confluence and others. WHAT WE OFFER Excellence Excellence is one of our core drivers. Not only in the products we deliver, but also in the way we do things. Continuous learning In order to be on top of the game, we always encourage our employees to keep updating and deepening their know how. Flexibility We aim to always work in a fun and relaxed environment. Working remotely is an option. Inclusion and Diversity We want a diverse talent team and would like to encourage ethnicities, gender, age, and disabilities communities with a strong interest in developing themselves in the videogame industry to join us. ABOUT US We are Nimble Giant, a game development studio founded in 2002 in Argentina. With offices in Perú, Chile and Uruguay, Nimble Giant Entertainment (Formerly NGD Studios) is one of the leading developers of PC and console games studios in Latin America. Our first major release, Champions of Regnum, was the first commercial MMORPG made in the region. We are the team behind the reimagining of the classic 4X strategy game Master of Orion and the multiplayer time travel shooter Quantum League. In 2020 we merged with Embracer Group. With its head office based in Karlstad, Sweden, Embracer Group has a global presence through its ten operative groups: THQ Nordic, Koch Media, Coffee Stain, Amplifier Game Invest, Saber Interactive, DECA Games, Gearbox Entertainment, Easybrain, Asmodee, and Dark Horse.We are certified as one of the best companies to work for by Great Place to Work®.

Technical Animator (VR) in Nimble Giant Entertainment

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Nimble Giant Entertainment is looking for a full-time Technical Animator. We are looking for a resourceful Technical Animator eager to work on upcoming AAA titles alongside a team of equally passionate top developers in the region. As a Technical Animator, you will be acting as a bridge between the technical and artistic aspects of game development, empowering both programming and art to achieve more than either could on their own. You will be supporting the Animation Lead and working closely with the development team to produce and implement game assets. You will collaborate with art leads to ensure content and features are integrated seamlessly into the game. The ideal candidate combines a strong technical background in animation or engineering with deep knowledge of the 3D art development pipeline. Capable of discussing various technical topics with engineers, such as performance, rendering, and gameplay issues, they should also be open to participate in creative discussions and provide constructive criticism in a collaborative environment. Responsibilities: Work with the animation team to define, create and maintain the animation pipeline. Work with modelers, animators and programmers to set up 3D art and bring it into the engine. Produce, implement and optimize stunning animations to bring life to our games. Work in collaboration with the Lead Tech Artist and the rest of the team to develop the 3D art and animation pipelines, tools, and standards for cutting edge games. Solve technical problems from an animator’s point of view. Review creative processes and proactively recommend improvements for existing pipelines and tools. Research and explore new software and techniques, including novel solutions. Requirements: At least 3 years of experience in animation for Video Games, Animation, or Cinema. Experience working with Unreal Engine. Basic knowledge of coding and/or scripting in C++, to be able to read and update game code and scripts. Expert in 3D art tools, Rigging/Skinning and Blend Shape implementation. Knowledge of the full 3D art pipeline (High and Low-poly Modeling, Skinning, Rigging, Exporting, etc.). Experience working with live physics rigs and physics systems for rigid/soft bodies, hair and cloth. Experience developing custom tools for 3D art pipelines (Maya/Max preferable). Experience with Unreal animation pipeline. Good communication and problem solving skills. Capacity to communicate in English. Preferred Skills: Experience working on Virtual Reality projects. WHAT WE OFFER Excellence Excellence is one of our core drivers. Not only in the products we deliver, but also in the way we do things. Continuous learning In order to be on top of the game, we always encourage our employees to keep updating and deepening their know how. Flexibility We aim to always work in a fun and relaxed environment. Working remotely is an option. Inclusion and Diversity We want a diverse talent team and would like to encourage ethnicities, gender, age, and disabilities communities with a strong interest in developing themselves in the videogame industry to join us. ABOUT US We are Nimble Giant, a game development studio founded in 2002 in Argentina. With offices in Perú, Chile and Uruguay, Nimble Giant Entertainment (Formerly NGD Studios) is one of the leading developers of PC and console games studios in Latin America. Our first major release, Champions of Regnum, was the first commercial MMORPG made in the region. We are the team behind the reimagining of the classic 4X strategy game Master of Orion and the multiplayer time travel shooter Quantum League. In 2020 we merged with Embracer Group. With its head office based in Karlstad, Sweden, Embracer Group has a global presence through its ten operative groups: THQ Nordic, Koch Media, Coffee Stain, Amplifier Game Invest, Saber Interactive, DECA Games, Gearbox Entertainment, Easybrain, Asmodee, and Dark Horse.We are certified as one of the best companies to work for by Great Place to Work®.

Lead Environment Artist in Jagex

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

A leader in creating deep and engaging experiences on PC and mobile, Jagex was founded in 2001 and is today one of the UK’s biggest and most respected video game developers and publishers. Famed for its flagship MMOs RuneScape and Old School RuneScape, Jagex has welcomed more than 260million player accounts to its world and created a $1bn lifetime franchise revenue. Today the RuneScape franchise exists beyond running games in live operations; our titles are living games that connect and inspire millions of players, with content and experiences both inside and outside of inexhaustible game worlds. Both RuneScape and Old School RuneScape, on PC and mobile, offer ever-evolving, highly-active worlds and our community-focussed development ethos empowers players to have a real say in how each game is shaped. Jagex is expanding and extending its portfolio with fresh franchise titles, new IP and, in 2018 launched Jagex Partners, delivering third-party publishing and operational services exclusively for the living games of the future. Jagex employs more than 400 people at its Cambridge headquarters and is on the hunt for talented people to work across the business to help the company to achieve yet another year of record growth and player satisfaction. Project Background: Jagex has begun exciting new projects that leverage our legendary RuneScape IP in creative ways. We are expanding a project team with expertise in the latest technologies, focused around Unreal Engine 5, to create a highly-skilled, player-focused development group that you could join. A core team based in Cambridge, augmented by members distributed globally, form a friendly, talented bunch keen to invite new members. Apply your passion for creating unforgettable online games and drive technology development to help us fulfil our vision for a deep, community-driven, connected, multi-platform Open World Survival Craft experience, set in the RuneScape universe. Job Purpose: We have an exciting opportunity for a Lead Environment Artist to join a growing team on a brand-new project! Working with Art Directors and Principals, you will be responsible for setting and maintaining a cohesive visual style within your specialism. You will visually own building rich, immersive worlds while holding the art vision for the area. Together with design you will deliver the best environmental player interaction and experience. As a lead, you will coordinate and collaborate with your team and hold their work to a common standard of quality. It is expected you split time effectively between leadership and task contribution. You will liaise with production and external development to ensure your area of ownership has a solid and timely work stream including hiring/ growth. You are responsible for creating a healthy environment to unleash potential in others and facilitates career progression within their area of ownership. You will be expected to set mechanisms to review, critique and guide quality ensuring alignment to the art direction in your given area of ownership. A Lead is a skilled contributor with the ability and ability to provide strong craft leadership within their discipline and effectively time manage themselves and others in their sub team to deliver the results expected by the games directors. Leads work closely with the directors to establish the art direction, documenting any guides, creative briefs, or pipelines in support of that goal. They will be expected to be hands-on and perform the duties of their specialty when needed while also taking on the lead-specific duties as outlined below. This role gives a rare opportunity for a lead to make a significant impact on a game from conception to completion c Collaborate closely with the Art Director to develop the products environment art style. Build, lead, mentor, and manage environment artists ensuring their continual levelling up. Balance team management with the delivery of artwork at the expected studio quality. Accountable for environment art quality. Plan, schedule, and structure tasks that feed into scheduling and planning. Contribute towards the art team hiring plan. Build a healthy environment to unleash the potential in others. Inspire and mentor the environment artists, sharing your craft expertise and best practices. Document and communicate technical specifications and visual guides to support the art direction to both internal and external artists. Run individual, group reviews and feedback sessions to set and maintain quality consistency. Work with design to construct effective, fun level layouts and designs. Collaborate with tech art and programming to ensure pipelines and tools are effective optimal and capable of delivery. Keep all updated with state-of-the-art craft software, pipelines, and processes knowledge. Hands on teaching expertise and specialist knowledge in products selected game engine. Supervise level optimisations, bug distribution, and verify bug fixes. Comfortable dealing with outsource vendors if required. Essential Skills: Previous experience leading, mentoring, or coaching others to success within craft. Portfolio showcasing outstanding ‘hands on’ high end environment art (not props). Exceptional knowledge of the art fundamentals and their digital application. Understanding of both realistic and stylized visual elements. Full end to end industry experience of a modern environment art production pipeline. Understanding of technical game constraints and how to resolve them within related craft. Comfortable with running individual, group review and critique sessions. Able to time manage, prioritise, and track both themselves and direct reports.  Ability to communicate clearly, and concisely to team, peers, and management.  Willingness to transition between asset production and line management. Able to level up junior to senior artists through teaching and mentoring.  Professional attitude and work ethic. Excellent soft skills and teamwork. Company Benefits: Flexible Working Bonus Scheme Private Health Care Gym Membership Generous Pension Contributions Life Insurance Free Cycle Repair Income Protection Dental Plan Free Fruit and Drinks Subsidised Canteen Feel like you fit this role, but don’t meet all the requirements? We strive for fresh perspectives, so as long as you can demonstrate how your attitude and other abilities might make up for any gaps we would welcome your application! Jagex are an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy or maternity, religion or belief.

Gameplay Animator - The Sims in Maxis Studios

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Locations: This is a fully remote position, available across most European locations. Welcome to Maxis, home to tinkerers, craftspeople, and storytellers. Our drive is to inspire everyone to make a better world through creative play. As the developer of The Sims, we create games and experiences for millions of people around the world and are always looking for new ways to inspire our players. Maxis is a place where you can do what you love and help others grow while doing it; a place where your unique voice can be heard and seen. We put creativity and inclusivity at the core of our work and don't settle for seeing the world only as it is, but strive to build a world as it could be. Read on to see how you can join our team and dream big. As an Animator, you will create high quality key-frame animations and collaborate with other disciplines to design and implement interaction state-flows in-engine. You will be creating animations that express a wide range of emotions and personality. You have a strong understanding of the latest keyframe animation workflows. You have extensive experience using Maya and implementing content in-engine. You will receive direction and feedback directly from Senior Animators and the Animation Director. Responsibilities: Work with Animation Lead and Director to create high-quality keyframe animation with heavy emphasis on full body character acting. Produce content under tight game development deadlines. With guidance from your Lead, collaborate with other essential contributors of the Production process to fulfill Design Goals. Essential contributions include: Work with different technical and art disciplines to solve implementation challenges. Estimate and provide scoping options for content. Design animation assets and state machines using our proprietary engine. Present implementation strategies alongside other contributors. Use both Maya and art tools to implement animated characters and objects in a proprietary engine. Use proprietary engine and pre-vis tools to technically verify animation content for self and others. Work with other essential disciplines to solve complex game bugs. Maintain and track animation assets related to your implementation designs. Create technical documentation of your implementations. Hold focused discussions concerning technical implementations you have contributed to, to spread knowledge across the animation team. Qualifications: 5+ years of experience as a Gameplay Animator working with and designing animation state machines in a game engine such as Unity, Unreal or similar. Exceptional skill creating keyframe animation with a primary emphasis on full body character acting. Proficient understanding of both game animation and in-engine state machine design. Excellent technical comprehension regarding game animation implementation. Excellent collaborator with a passion for working across diverse groups to find creative solutions. Passion for learning new workflows, processes, and technology. Bonus Experience: Experience in the Simulation genre of games Comfortable creating entertaining acting performances for reference for your animations or others. Experience working with motion capture processes Experience with Atlassian Confluence, Jira software, Shotgun or similar tools More About Maxis: Many team members have a tenure of over a decade. Here are some top reasons folks join our team and stay: Work life balance. We work diligently to ensure we make incredible products while prioritizing our team member’s wellbeing. We uphold a people first mentality. Commitment to diversity. We take immense pride in the diversity of our team members. We know unique perspectives and experiences are critical to our success as a team in order to produce the leading simulation game in the world. Creative autonomy. We firmly believe good ideas come from anywhere. Joining the team means contributing to the whole production process, from concept through final in game experience. Purpose. We provide meaningful content that impacts our player’s in game and real world experiences, motivating us to push the boundaries of what’s possible. Community. We thrive at Maxis because of our incredibly supportive and creative colleagues and players that bring fun and positivity into doing what we love. About EA We exist to inspire the world to play. Through innovative technology and immersive storytelling, we deliver new ways of experiencing worlds of interactive entertainment for our millions of players worldwide. Our strength lies in the diversity of our people, combining creativity, innovation and passion. We fully champion inclusive culture, and provide opportunities for growing, learning, and leading that allows for the most impactful and rewarding work of our teams’ careers. We put our people first, and we make sure they’re taken care of both in and out of the office. As we reflect on our learnings and successes from remote work, we aim to provide dynamic, collaborative and flexible work environments for our teams. Our employees connect through our Employee Resource Groups, which are actively involved in driving business decisions every step of the way. But our support doesn’t end at the workplace—we also encourage a balanced lifestyle with paid time off and new parent leave, free video games, fitness reimbursement and more. Our goal is to provide a safe, respectful and inspiring workplace for all of our employees. Through our diversity, equity, inclusion and social responsibility programs, we’re doing the work to give everyone the space to be their full selves while giving back to our community. We’re looking for problem-solvers, game-changers, innovators, dreamers, doers—people that are ready to move the needle and build on our success. As our industry accelerates, we aren’t just keeping up—we’re staying ahead of the game. Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Electronic Arts also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

3D Artist - The Sims in Maxis Studios

Locations: This is a fully remote position, available across most European locations. Welcome to Maxis, home to tinkerers, craftspeople, and storytellers. Our drive is to inspire everyone to make a better world through creative play. We put creativity and inclusivity at the core of our work and don't settle for seeing the world only as it is, but strive to build a world as it could be. Read on to see how you can join our team and dream big. As an Object Modeler, you have the visual and technical skill set with passion to hone the Player Experience. You autonomously and excel in a collaborative environment. Your skills include hard surface and organic models including machinery, household items, furniture, creatures, sculptures, vegetation, and more. You hand paint textures and optimize for best performance while maintaining a high standard of visual quality. Though your passion is creating visually compelling assets, you are also comfortable working in a technical environment that includes. You will report into our European Senior Development Director. Responsibilities: Model and texture hand painted, high quality assets following The Sims 4 art style Rig and skin deforming assets for Animation Apply various shaders and tune object lighting for desired effects Co-develops with non-art disciplines to prototype visual targets and to improve assets Debugs and writes occasional bugs Maintains technical and aesthetic coherence with the Sims brand Creates documentation and communicate requirements Provides estimates, delivers to quality and maintains desired schedules Skills and Experience: 4+ years professional experience in art game development At least one shipped title in the role of Modeling or equivalent on PC or major console Stylized art authoring similar to The Sims 4 Proficient in industry standard software like Maya, ZBrush, Substance Painter/Designer, Marmoset, and Photoshoo Strong understanding of scale, proportion, and material properties Experience rigging and skinning hard surface and organic models Efficient vert allocation and usage of UV/ texture space Excellent sense of form, weight (mass), and volume Good understanding of how light and shadow defines shape and form Proficiency in hand painted textures An understanding of optimization for game engines Excellent sense of quality and craftsmanship Traditional art skill in drawings or sketches You have a passion for making and playing games Additional Pluses You have product knowledge and familiarity with The Sims franchise An eye for industrial design, architectural design, and historical art periods Good understanding of general construction details and terminology Experience working with Unreal Engine and implementing 3D work into the pipeline More About Maxis: Many team members have a tenure of over a decade. Lead Animator in Jagex

Jobs available in Remote Job

A leader in creating deep and engaging experiences on PC and mobile, Jagex was founded in 2001 and is today one of the UK’s biggest and most respected video game developers and publishers. Famed for its flagship MMOs RuneScape and Old School RuneScape, Jagex has welcomed more than 260million player accounts to its world and created a $1bn lifetime franchise revenue. Today the RuneScape franchise exists beyond running games in live operations; our titles are living games that connect and inspire millions of players, with content and experiences both inside and outside of inexhaustible game worlds. Both RuneScape and Old School RuneScape, on PC and mobile, offer ever-evolving, highly-active worlds and our community-focussed development ethos empowers players to have a real say in how each game is shaped. Jagex is expanding and extending its portfolio with fresh franchise titles, new IP and, in 2018 launched Jagex Partners, delivering third-party publishing and operational services exclusively for the living games of the future. Jagex employs more than 400 people at its Cambridge headquarters and is on the hunt for talented people to work across the business to help the company to achieve yet another year of record growth and player satisfaction. Project Background: Jagex has begun exciting new projects that leverage our legendary RuneScape IP in creative ways. We are expanding a project team with expertise in the latest technologies, focused around Unreal Engine 5, to create a highly-skilled, player-focused development group that you could join. A core team based in Cambridge, augmented by members distributed globally, form a friendly, talented bunch keen to invite new members. Apply your passion for creating unforgettable online games and drive technology development to help us fulfil our vision for a deep, community-driven, connected, multi-platform Open World Survival Craft experience, set in the RuneScape universe. Job Purpose: We have an exciting opportunity for a Lead Animator to join a growing team on a brand-new project! As the lead animator you will be responsible for ensuring that animation direction is followed. In addition, you will also be responsible for building, mentoring, and training the animation team to hit the expected quantity and quality. This role gives a rare opportunity to make a significant impact on a game from conception to completion. A Lead is a skilled contributor with the ability to be able to effectively time manage themselves and others in their team to deliver the results expected by the games Art Director. Leads work closely with the Art Director to establish the vision and document any style guides or pipelines in support of that goal. They will be expected to be hands-on and perform the duties of their specialty when needed while also taking on the lead-specific duties as outlined below. Key Duties Include: Provide leadership, direction, and line management to the animation team. Responsible for the delivery of highest quality in game animation. Collaborate with Tech Art / Tech animation and engineering to ensure animation pipelines and tools are effective, optimal and capable of delivery. Review assets to maintain consistent animation quality and style, and provide feedback and critique where needed. Work with production and the AD to plan, schedule and structure discipline tasks that feed into the master schedule. Document and communicate technical specifications and visual benchmarks to support the games artistic vision to both internal and external artists. Organize, manage, and supervise motion capture sessions. Support, promote and build good team and studio morale in an open, creative environment. Together with AD contribute toward animation hiring plans and recruitment process. Manage outsource partners or freelancers as required. Company Benefits: Flexible Working Bonus Scheme Private Health Care Gym Membership Generous Pension Contributions Life Insurance Free Cycle Repair Income Protection Dental Plan Free Fruit and Drinks Subsidised Canteen Feel like you fit this role, but don’t meet all the requirements? We strive for fresh perspectives, so as long as you can demonstrate how your attitude and other abilities might make up for any gaps we would welcome your application! Jagex are an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy or maternity, religion or belief.

Deep Silver Volition has been creating wildly original and successful video games for over 25 years, including the fan-favorite Saints Row series. This is a remote-friendly role. We’re a hybrid work environment, headquartered in Champaign, IL but with employees working permanently remotely across the U.S. (We’re currently unable to hire in CA & NY, unfortunately.) What you’ll do as Senior Environment Concept Artist at Deep Silver Volition:  Inspire the team by exploring and defining the setting, tone and mood of the game through richly detailed and inspiring concept art. Curate references, develop mood-boards, and illustrate original concepts for hyper-realistic environments from visual and written briefs. Create concept art as exemplars that develop a vision and set the standard for future concepts by other artists. Provide timely & detailed feedback for the concept art team and outsourcing vendors. Help the Art Director develop and organize the environment art style guide. Proactively engage with leadership and peers across departments to align on high-level priorities and maintain strong lines of communication. Focus on the big picture: understand when details matter, and when broad strokes are more important.  What we’re looking for:  5+ years' experience in the game industry working in AAA game development as a Concept Artist. An outstanding portfolio that showcases your artistic ability and imagination Excellent foundational art skills with a strong grasp of composition, color theory, perspective, lighting, environment, architectural, and graphic design. Ability to iterate quickly via thumbnails/sketches/roughs, and to take a concept all the way to a rendered color final as needed. Extensive experience in 2D content creation tools Strong communication skills, with a thoughtful collaboration style. Ability to work with a library of assets to build visually interesting new Concepts from existing assets. A keen eye for developing a visual mood as it relates to storytelling. Researches new tools and techniques to create more efficient and visually appealing environments. Collaborates with art leadership and art teams to establish, organize and maintain our material library across all game content. Creates high quality physically based materials using software such as Substance Designer/Painter to establish visual targets and support art efforts across all game content. Maintains a consistent style under director of production designers, art directors and creative directors. Work closely with TD’s to ensure the pipeline is as efficient as possible. Research into new shader development techniques and apply to production. Experience with high poly sculpting and modeling software such as Z-Brush & Maya Experience with 2D image creation software such as Photoshop, Painter, 3D coat, etc. Strong experience with developing and compiling shaders within Unity and/or Unreal essential. Experience with subsurface shaders (skin) advantageous. Strong experience of lighting both from a technical and artistic perspective within Unity and/or Unreal. Good understanding of modeling, rigging, animation, UV mapping, texturing and rendering is advantageous. Experience with OpenGL GLSL/HLSL advantageous. Strong organizational and communications skills along with understanding production values, deadlines and priorities Experience with FX shader work advantageous. Must be eligible to work in United States Preference to Applicants With Experience developing in Unity Knowledge of scripting (Python, Mel, C# scripting in Unity, and/or Unreal Blueprint) useful. Experience with developing shaders in Shaderlab for Unity and/or ShaderFX for Maya essential. Relentless proactivity in finding problems and their solutions. Passion for problem-solving, particularly as it pertains to debugging technical issues Analyze and improve game performance.
