Environment Outsource Review Artist in PlayStation

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Why PlayStation? PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more. PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team. The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation. Environment Outsource Review Artist This is a contracted position through our staffing partner DZConneX with a high likelihood of extension. Remote, United States PlayStation Studios Visual Arts (PSSVA), a passionate team within the PlayStation family, provides world-class content, development, and services to PlayStation’s studios all over the world. Always at the cutting edge of technology, Visual Arts works with studios like Naughty Dog, Santa Monica Studios, Guerrilla Games, Insomniac Games, and more of our first-party partners. Our team is made up of game and film industry professionals working with some of the best minds and companies around! We're looking for an Environment Outsource Review Artist to join our team and build next generation game & cinematic quality environments and a range of material props styles. The focus of this role will be on environmental art assets for AAA Assets for Sony First Party & External Client titles. If you have the ability to build props and environments from both detailed concepts and a single photograph, we want to speak to you! If you're able to take and provide direction from concepts or rough direction to the final model/texture, even better! Responsibilities: Create in-game art and in-game cinematic art assets to Visual Arts/client specifications and oversee the creation of game assets with an external team. Take a game asset from grey box to final quality (end to end) including collision, LOD’s and baking texture maps, etc. Evaluate effort estimations to ensure staff days are in-line with current project schedules. Create and/or modify existing assets as necessary, may be required to create both hard-surface and soft bodied assets from scratch. Quality control art assets prior to delivery to client, and work with clients/supervisors to revise and respond based on feedback for both aesthetic and functional purposes. Qualifications: 4 years' experience as an Environment / Prop Artist, with at least 1 shipped AAA title. Strong understanding of in-game and in-game cinematic art asset creation (portfolio must contain examples of assets with wire-frame shading). A good understanding of Maya, as well as ZBrush or Mudbox. Ability to use in-game technology to finalize assets. Understanding of in-game testing to test/optimize for game engine specs while balancing aesthetic needs. Experience with asset ingestion/integration within a game engine (Unreal, Crytek, or proprietary). Advanced understanding of in-game art asset creation including hard-surface props, soft rigid assets such as clothing items, vehicle, weapons, etc. Desired Qualifications: Experience working with external outsource vendors. Equal Opportunity Statement: Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category. We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond. PlayStation is a Fair Chance employer and qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for employment.

Apply Now

Understanding of in-game testing to test/optimize for game engine specs while balancing aesthetic needs. Experience with asset ingestion/integration within a game engine (Unreal, Crytek, or proprietary). Senior Character TD in PlayStation

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Why PlayStation? PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more. PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team. The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation. Senior Character TD Remote, Canada PlayStation Studios Visual Arts (PSSVA) on our San Diego campus provides world-class content, development and services to PlayStation Studios. Our team is always at the cutting edge of technology and partners with the industry’s best minds and companies! We are looking for a Senior Technical Director who has experience with Maya rigging/scripting, along with a strong understanding of human anatomy and realistic deformation. You will work with our multi-award winning team while working with AAA PlayStation Studios like Naughty Dog, Santa Monica Studio, San Diego Studio, Guerrilla Games, and more! If you like to be hands-on and have the effective communication skills to ensure output from the rigging team is executed efficiently, timely, and meet our technical and animation requirements, we want to talk to you! Role responsibilities Set up and maintain character (humans and animals) rigs. Work with art team to generate models that meet deformation requirements. Work with animation team to create artist-friendly rigs that satisfy animation and gameplay needs. Set up character dynamics (i.e. cloth, hair). Create and support rigging/animation tools as needed. Provide and maintain technical documentation. Required Experience and Skills Minimum 6 years’ of production experience in game or film/vfx field, with strong understanding of Maya and Python scripting. Strong knowledge of Maya, with minimum of 4 years of production experience in game or film/vfx fields. Understanding of character/prop rigging techniques and principles. Familiarity with figure and facial anatomy. Experience in adopting production pipelines and following guidelines and system requirements. Strong troubleshooting skills and the ability to find pragmatic solutions. Python and Maya scripting proficiency. Proven ability to be self-sufficient and be proactive in preventing/solving production issues. Effective communication skills. Bonus Skills C++ experience (Maya API). Familiarity in runtime performance efficiency and optimization. Equal Opportunity Statement: Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category. Senior Environment Artist in PlayStation

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Why PlayStation? PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more. PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team. The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation. Senior Environment Artist Remote, Canada PlayStation Studios Visual Arts (PSSVA) on our San Diego campus provides world-class content, development and services to PlayStation Studios such as Insomniac Games, Naughty Dog, Santa Monica Studio, Bend Studio Guerilla Games, and more! Our team is always at the cutting edge of technology and partners with the industry’s best minds and companies. You're a creative and passionate artist who lives for world building and crafting environments that tell a story. You're inspired to achieve only the highest of quality in your work and want to contribute to the artistic vision and development of the industry's most anticipated AAA games. We are looking for a highly talented and motivated Senior Environment Artist to work on an unannounced AAA project. Come work with our Art Lead and Studio Art Director to create both in-game and in-game cinematic quality environments and props within a range of styles. Your ability to build environments from both detailed concepts and a single photograph is required. Responsibilities: Create models and assemble scenes for both architectural and organic environments. Troubleshoot levels and maintain them to stay in frame rate, memory and design spec. Requirements and Skills: 4+ years’ experience in games modeling environments using Maya, or related experience/software. High level understanding of form, shape, structure, and silhouette in regard to modeling. Strong experience and techniques in creating plants, shrubs and vines using cards/flats. Strong artistic ability to visualize entire levels and detail with minimal concept art and direction. Strong technical ability to manage assets to fit memory, design, and frame rate limits. Strong polygonal modeling skills- able to generate clean and efficient models at a very fast pace. Self-motivated- requires minimal direction, can carry on the vision for the level until completion. Good communication skills—able to help others and ask for help when needed. Being proactive in sharing info and assets. Team-player attitude—flexible and encouraged to add new insights, is open to direction and changes. Detail oriented—ability to manage and prioritize work, is flexible in times of change. Foundation in the traditional arts. As a part of the PlayStation application process, candidates will be expected to provide a portfolio or demo reel of their work and may be asked to complete an art test, in addition to a phone screen. Equal Opportunity Statement: Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category. We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond. PlayStation is a Fair Chance employer and qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for employment.

Apply Now

Senior Environment Outsource Review Artist in PlayStation

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Why PlayStation? PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more. PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team. The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation. Senior Environment Outsource Review Artist This is a contracted position through our staffing partner DZConneX with a high likelihood of extension. Remote, United States PlayStation Studios Visual Arts (PSSVA) provides world-class content, development and services to PlayStation Studios. Our team is always at the cutting edge of technology and partners with the industry’s best minds and companies. This is your opportunity to work closely with game and film industry professionals from all over the world! We're looking for a Senior Environment Outsource Review Artist to join our team and build in-game next generation game & cinematic quality environments and a range of material props styles. The focus of this role will be on environmental art assets for AAA Assets for Sony First Party & External Client titles. If you have the ability to create props and environments from both detailed concepts and a single photograph, we want to speak to you! If you're able to take and provide direction from concepts or rough direction to the final model/texture, even better! Responsibilities: Be able to craft in-game art and in-game cinematic art assets to Visual Arts/client specifications. Oversee the creation of game assets with an external team. Take a game asset from grey box to final quality (end to end) including collision, LOD’s and baking texture maps, etc. Evaluate effort estimations to ensure staff days are in-line with current project schedules. Create and/or modify existing assets as necessary, may be required to create both hard-surface and soft bodied assets from scratch. Quality control art assets prior to delivery to client. Work with clients/supervisors to revise and respond based on feedback for both aesthetic and functional purposes. Qualifications: 5 years' experience as an Environment/Prop Artist, with at least 2 shipped AAA titles. Advanced understanding of in-game and in-game cinematic art asset creation (portfolio must contain examples of assets with wire-frame shading). Expert understanding of Maya, as well as ZBrush or Mudbox. Experience in training and mentoring a team of artists. Ability to use in-game technology to finalize assets. Understanding of in-game testing to test/optimize for game engine specs while balancing aesthetic needs. Experience with asset ingestion/integration within a game engine (Unreal, Crytek, or proprietary). Advanced understanding of in-game art asset creation including hard-surface props, soft rigid assets such as clothing items, vehicle, weapons, etc. Desired Qualifications: Experience working with external outsource vendors and/or working with a game engine and engine tools. Bonus: Experience as a concept artist / drawing skills / portfolio. Equal Opportunity Statement: Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category. We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond. PlayStation is a Fair Chance employer and qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for employment.

Senior Environment Artist in PlayStation

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Why PlayStation? PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more. PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team. The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation. Senior Environment Artist Remote, USA PlayStation Studios Visual Arts (PSSVA) on our San Diego campus provides world-class content, development and services to PlayStation Studios such as Insomniac Games, Naughty Dog, Santa Monica Studio, Bend Studio Guerilla Games, and more! Our team is always at the cutting edge of technology and partners with the industry’s best minds and companies. You're a creative and passionate artist who lives for world building and crafting environments that tell a story. You're inspired to achieve only the highest of quality in your work and want to contribute to the artistic vision and development of the industry's most anticipated AAA games. We are looking for a highly talented and motivated Senior Environment Artist to work on an unannounced AAA project. Come work with our Art Lead and Studio Art Director to create both in-game and in-game cinematic quality environments and props within a range of styles. Your ability to build environments from both detailed concepts and a single photograph is required. Responsibilities: Create models and assemble scenes for both architectural and organic environments. Troubleshoot levels and maintain them to stay in frame rate, memory and design spec. Requirements and Skills: 4+ years’ experience in games modeling environments using Maya, or related experience/software. High level understanding of form, shape, structure, and silhouette in regard to modeling. Strong experience and techniques in creating plants, shrubs and vines using cards/flats. Strong artistic ability to visualize entire levels and detail with minimal concept art and direction. Strong technical ability to manage assets to fit memory, design, and frame rate limits. Strong polygonal modeling skills- able to generate clean and efficient models at a very fast pace. Self-motivated- requires minimal direction, can carry on the vision for the level until completion. Good communication skills—able to help others and ask for help when needed. Being proactive in sharing info and assets. Team-player attitude—flexible and encouraged to add new insights, is open to direction and changes. Detail oriented—ability to manage and prioritize work, is flexible in times of change. Foundation in the traditional arts. As a part of the PlayStation application process, candidates will be expected to provide a portfolio or demo reel of their work and may be asked to complete an art test, in addition to a phone screen. Senior Environment Outsource Review Artist This is a contracted position through our staffing partner Eastridge with a high likelihood of extension. Remote, Canada PlayStation Studios Visual Arts (PSSVA) provides world-class content, development and services to PlayStation Studios. Our team is always at the cutting edge of technology and partners with the industry’s best minds and companies. This is your opportunity to work closely with industry professionals from all over the world! If you're a Senior Outsource Review Artist who has crafted both in-game and in-game cinematic quality environments and props within a range of styles from hyper-real to stylized, we want to chat with you! This position will focus on environmental art pieces and set dressing for a AAA titles; however, specialized experience with characters, vehicles, weapons and organic structures a plus! We're looking for someone who has created art from both detailed concepts and a single photograph, with the ability to take and provide direction from concepts or rough direction to final model/texture. Responsibilities: Build in-game art assets to Visual Arts/client specifications. Work with external vendors and distributed production team to create and review assets. Work with department supervision and production, client to define project technical and aesthetic asset specifications; ability to work with internal and external production partners to review work product. Creating and/or supervising the creation of proxy mesh/gray box art assets to guide execution. Ability to elevate issues to production, supervision/lead and department management to optimize production. Evaluate effort estimations to ensure staff days are in-line with current project schedules in coordination with production. Create and/or modify existing assets as necessary, may be required to create both hard surface and soft bodied assets from scratch. Quality control art assets prior to delivery to client. Work with clients/supervisors to revise and respond based on feedback for both aesthetic and technical purposes to ensure the deliverables meet expectations. Test assets in-engine to assess aesthetics and performance specifications on DevKit hardware or PC builds. Qualifications: 4-5 years' experience as an Environment, Prop or Character Artist, with at least 2 shipped AAA titles. An advanced understanding of in-game art asset creation and workflows (portfolio must contain examples of assets with wire-frame shading). An advanced understanding of Maya, as well as ZBrush or Mudbox. Experience with working with vendors or distributed production partners on feedback. Ability to clearly and concise provide feedback to internal and external partners in written form, in live feedback video meetings, and with paint-over/draw-overs. Ability to use in-game technology to review and finalize assets. Understanding of in-game testing to test/optimize for frame rate while balancing aesthetic needs. Experience with set dressing within a game engine (Unreal or proprietary) An advanced understanding of in-game art asset creation including hardsurface props, soft rigid assets such as clothing items, vehicle, weapons, etc… Desired Qualifications: Experience working with external outsource vendors. Experience working on previous cinematic projects. Experience working with a game engine and engine tools. Equal Opportunity Statement: Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Senior Technical Artist, Accelerate Solutions in Unity

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

The opportunity Unity’s Accelerate Solutions team is growing, and we are looking for talented technical artists! Our professional services team works across multiple platforms and industries, incorporating cutting edge technologies like XR, ML, robotics and IoT. We use the Unity engine to build custom software solutions for a wide range of technically diverse fields, including architecture, automotive, retail, entertainment, and games! Your day-to-day work will apply your diverse technical art skillset on an application project team. As a senior technical artist, you’ll play a meaningful role in each phase of your projects, from concept and proposal, to planning and implementation, through client delivery. While your focus will be on building real-time 3D experiences, you’ll also work with our engineers and designers to ingest and visualize real world data. You’re an experienced technical artist that owns your work, helps guide others, and has an eagerness to learn and grow. You have confidence and skills to champion and drive outstanding interactive experiences for discerning clients. Our cross-disciplinary teams consist of world class application & cloud developers, technical artists, 3d artists, UX & UI designers. Our goal is to inspire customers and transform industries. We are committed to maintaining a diverse team, and we welcome and encourage applicants with diverse experiences and backgrounds. What you’ll be doing Designing and developing workflows, pipelines, and tools for a variety of projects and teams, from industrial to games Integrating assets provided by art & design, and implementing the features associated with them Developing solutions to incorporate real-world assets and data into real-time applications Research and experimenting with groundbreaking technologies, pioneering new techniques to match the constantly evolving demands of ours clients and the industry Collaborating in small teams to ship client projects on multiple platforms, including desktop, AR, and VR headsets, mobile, WebGL, and more. What we’re looking for Experience developing with Unity at a high level, or another game engine Solid understanding of one or more 3D creation suites (Maya, Blender, etc.) Experience and technical understanding of 3D model optimization and performance Experience with art production workflows such as modelling, texturing, rigging, animation, or lighting with HDRP/URP Intermediate skill with C# or another programming language You might also have Experience working with commercial/industrial data (CAD, BIM, GIS, LIDAR, point clouds, etc.) Production experience developing headset AR/VR applications Rendering performance & optimization techniques Life at Unity Unity (NYSE: U) is the world’s leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity is the foundation upon which the world’s most powerful digital content is created. Specifically, Unity’s platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices. In the fourth quarter of 2021, Unity had, on average, 3.9 billion monthly active end users who consumed content created or operated with its solutions. The applications developed by these creators were downloaded, on average, five billion times per month in 2021. For more information, please visit www.unity.com. Unity is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment and celebrate our employees across age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. Our differences are strengths that enable us to support the growing and evolving needs of our customers, partners, and collaborators. If there are preparations or accommodations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please fill out this form to let us know. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

Technical Environment Artist in PlayStation

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Why PlayStation? PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more. PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team. The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation. Technical Environment Artist PlayStation Studios Visual Arts provides the highest quality artistic support to first-party Sony game teams as well as other teams developing titles for the PS5. We offer dozens of services including asset scanning, actor scanning, body motion capture, facial motion capture, motion edit, animation, facial tracking and solving, and lighting. As a service group we have the privilege of working with multiple game developers on a variety of titles. The Technical Art team works directly with clients to replicate and maintain their work environments in the studio and guarantee the quality of the final delivery. We are looking for a Technical Environment Artist to join our San Diego, California development team. The role requires experience and understanding of visual effects pipelines, experience with Autodesk Maya software, and python programming skills. Technical artists at PSVA are responsible for setting up and maintaining the technical pipeline on all projects, writing tools for artists for a variety of software packages and needs, troubleshooting all technical issues that arise, and ensuring the quality of the final product. Technical artist work with both our art teams and our engineering team and help provide communication and cohesion between these two groups. Responsibilities: Understanding and maintaining project workflows, primarily Maya art and animation, and game engine integration pipelines. Learning and supporting varying client working environments, assets, and tools. Writing, maintaining, and customizing internal tools for production team. Troubleshooting problems in pipeline and for individuals on as-needed basis. Creating and maintaining technical documentation. Share work for feedback and offer productive opinions while assisting all team members. Keep communication steady with other leads on the project to provide consistency Lead by example and communicate with supervisors, management and overall teams. Audit game performance by analyzing GPU CPU and Memory metrics per frame-time goals Desired Experience: BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Graphic Art, or a related field, or equivalent experience. At least 8+ years in some branch of visual effects (film, game dev, tv, etc.). 1+ year in a leadership role. Strong leadership, mentoring and teaching abilities. Excellent knowledge of Maya and Python and experience developing python tools for Maya. Excellent troubleshooting skills and the ability to problem solve creatively. PyQt/PySide experience. Ability to work in a team and communicate well. Ability to mentor junior technical artists. Experience with game proprietary engines, or off the shelf engines such as Unreal, or Unity. Experience with environment art modeling and a strong understanding of topology Strong understanding of PBR material response using BRDF shading model Experience with material application process and UV mapping for consistent texel density Experience with runtime and baked lighting pipelines Experience navigating complex scene hierarchy and ability to identify locations of assets based on file paths and nested inheritance Nice to Have: General knowledge of Maya rigging. Experience with other programming languages, especially C++. Experience developing or maintaining system environments. Experiencing developing or maintaining project pipeline tools. Experience with perforce and/or git. Experience with project management and tracking software (such as Shotgun and Jira). Experience working with real-time particle systems, water rendering, and post processing. Knowledge of Houdini pipelines and their integration with other applications via Houdini Engine Experience with real-time dynamics and physics driven by Havok or similar physics engines Experience with Linux based operating systems Equal Opportunity Statement: Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Senior Character Concept Artist in Deep Silver Volition

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Deep Silver Volition has been creating wildly original and successful video games for over 25 years, including the fan-favorite Saints Row series. Our studio has prospered by making fun, innovative games no one else can make, while focusing on work-life balance and fostering a culture of collaboration, continuous growth, and learning.   We're looking for a talented and creative Senior Character Concept Artist to help define iconic, visually compelling characters for our future titles. Our games are well-known for pushing the limits of character customization, and the Character Concept Artists are critical to this mission. You'll help our team achieve the vision of our games by creating compelling and original character designs with a mind-blowing array of customization options, collaborating across Art, Design, and Programming to help the team achieve their aesthetic vision. This is a remote-friendly role. We’re a hybrid work environment, headquartered in Champaign, IL but with employees working permanently remotely across the U.S.  (We’re currently unable to hire in CA & NY, unfortunately.) What you’ll do as a Senior Character Concept Artist at Deep Silver Volition:  Inspire the team by exploring and defining the setting, tone and mood of the game through richly detailed and inspiring concept art. Curate references, develop mood-boards, and illustrate original concepts for hyper-realistic Character designs from visual and written briefs. Create concept art as exemplars that develop a vision and set the standard for future concepts by other artists. Use your knowledge of anatomy and fashion to build a library of compelling and unique character options Provide timely & detailed feedback for the concept art team and outsourcing vendors. Help the Art Director develop and organize the character art style guide. Proactively engage with leadership and peers across departments to align on high-level priorities and maintain strong lines of communication. Focus on the big picture: understand when details matter, and when broad strokes are more important.  What we’re looking for:  5+ years' experience in the game industry working in AAA game development as a Character Concept Artist. An outstanding portfolio that showcases your artistic ability and imagination. Excellent foundational art skills with a strong grasp of composition, color theory, perspective, character anatomy, gesture, style, and graphic design. Ability to iterate quickly via thumbnails/sketches/roughs, and to take a concept all the way to a rendered color final as needed. Extensive experience in 2D content creation tools. Strong communication skills, with a thoughtful collaboration style. Ability to work with a library of assets to build visually interesting new Concepts from existing assets. A keen eye for developing a visual mood as it relates to storytelling. Pluses:  Familiarity with procedural content authoring tools (Substance Designer, Zbrush, Marvelous designer).  Basic 3D art skills. Basic clothing design knowledge. Sample Work Required:  Candidates must submit an online portfolio to be considered. Some of our benefits: Subsidized medical/dental/vision insurance Company-paid life, short-term, & long-term disability insurance Generous paid time off (including parental leave and an annual company shutdown between Christmas & New Year's) 401k with company contribution Annual learning & development budget + access to GDC Vault + LinkedIn Learning Paid subscriptions to Headspace, Doordash, Sworkit, and other wellness apps At Deep Silver Volition we believe in fostering an open, collaborative, and diverse environment, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We will consider all qualified applicants without attention to race, color, national origin, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, genetic information, disability, age, veteran status, or military status.

Senior Technical Artist in Deep Silver Volition

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Deep Silver Volition has been creating wildly original and successful video games for over 25 years, including the fan-favorite Saints Row series. Our studio has prospered by making fun, innovative games no one else can make, while focusing on work-life balance and fostering a culture of collaboration, continuous growth, and learning. We're looking for a Senior Technical Artist who can help us continually push the limits of next-gen open world gaming. As a Senior Technical Artist, you'll bridge the creative and technical aspects of AAA game development, developing tools, pipelines, and innovative strategies for efficient creation and integration of visual game assets. This is a remote-friendly role. We are a hybrid work environment, headquartered in Champaign, IL but with employees working permanently remotely across the U.S. (We’re currently unable to hire in CA & NY, unfortunately.) What you’ll do as Senior Technical Artist at Deep Silver Volition: Design and assist in developing tools and workflows for Artists and Designers. Proactively seek out inefficiencies and problems in existing pipelines, identifying creative solutions. Improve and enhance tools and processes for real-time environments, vehicles, weapons, cinematics, characters, VFX, UI, and animation, throughout the project cycle. Collaborate with Programmers and Designers in researching and optimizing new tools for game features. Collaborate with other Technical Artists to ensure consistent technology, standards, and content creation. Prototype new techniques to facilitate more efficient content production. What we’re looking for: 5+ years of AAA Technical video game experience. Comfort with at least one common scripting language (e.g. Python). Fluent knowledge of at least one major 3D software package (3ds Max, Maya, Houdini, Blender). Demonstrated understanding of the open-world gaming experience. Positive, professional attitude. Disciplined and self-motivated with a strong work ethic. Being collaborative and having a team-oriented mindset is a requirement. Ability to identify complex problems and propose solutions while working within real-time technical restrictions. Proactive in seeking feedback and resolving issues. Excellent communication and organizational skills. Ability to multitask and be flexible about changing role requirements. Passion for games and ability to articulate the pursuit of that passion as a career clearly and analytically. A broad knowledge base of console games. Experience developing tools for real-time in two or more of the following art disciplines including environments, vehicle, weapons, cinematics, characters, VFX, UI, and animation, etc. Pluses: Code samples, or examples of tools/pipelines developed to overcome past challenges. Encouraged but not required: Art portfolio demonstrating proficiency and talent with both CG and traditional art skills. Some of our benefits: Subsidized medical/dental/vision insurance Company-paid life, short-term, & long-term disability insurance Generous paid time off (including parental leave and an annual company shutdown between Christmas & New Year's) 401k with company contribution Annual learning & development budget + access to LinkedIn Learning Paid subscriptions to Headspace, Doordash, Sworkit, and other wellness apps At Deep Silver Volition we believe in fostering an open, collaborative, and diverse environment, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Identify opportunities to improve our animation pipeline and provide solutions for technical animation problems. Give input and guidance to animators, designers, and programmers to achieve an excellent animation system that can support our games. Collaborate with other Technical Artists to ensure consistent technology, standards, and content creation.  What we’re looking for:   3+ years of production experience in games, feature films, or VFX. Experience animating assets on at least one AAA title from beginning to end, or have shipped AAA PC or console titles in an animator position. A strong understanding of rigging and deformation concepts. Experience with Unreal or other modern game engines. A passion for creating games. An ability to identify complex problems and propose solutions while working within real-time technical restrictions.   Pluses:   Experience in building face rigs for character animation. Experience retargeting motion capture data. Experience creating and maintaining animation state machines. Familiarity with C++. Required:   A portfolio or code samples demonstrating your technical and artistic abilities. We produce our industry-leading results by constantly staying at the forefront of modern technology and cutting-edge processes and practices. The best of Magic Media’s teams are known for their strong initiative, not just in taking care of their day-to-day responsibilities but in helping identify ways to build, grow, and improve. We are looking for a talented Senior Lighting Artist to join our team on a very ambitious project. The ideal candidate should have extensive full-time experience dealing with lighting setups, creating lighting adapted to a set of different contexts and locations, building the atmosphere and mood of a variety of spaces in Unreal Engine. Responsibilities As a Senior Lighting Artist you will be responsible for taking care of the visual coherence of lighting throughout the whole project, ensuring lighting is optimal and technically correct. You will be cooperating in the development of technology related to lighting in a big open world game. Taking part in creating ideas and solutions for a wide range of locations. Working with state-of-the-art lighting systems and techniques, shaders and post-processing effects in dynamic and extense environments. Requirements 5+ years of experience within the Lighting Art discipline with at least 2+ years of experience as a Lighting Artist in game development using Unreal Engine. Shipped at least 2 games in Lighting Art role; preferably full cycle on a ‘AAA’ console or PC title. Proven experience in creating lighting art for different kinds of locations. A solid understanding in game engines, lighting systems and techniques. Knowledge in Unreal Engine’s shaders and material development. Experience in lighting optimizations, from profiling to implementation. Outstanding artistic skills, with a good understanding of color and composition. Relentless proactivity in reference materials analysis from the real world and video games. Awesome communication skills -in English-, across all disciplines. A passion for video games. Establish direct and reflected lighting, shadows, and compositing for different moods. Design and implement lighting for video game environments. A great artistic eye for detail, composition and cinematography. Develop innovative strategies and techniques to maximize the visual lighting quality of our games whilst maintaining performance. Keep the artistic style consistent with a defined visual style in video games. Collaborate with the tech-art team to develop lighting related blueprints and other lighting effects, to create dynamic lighting gameplay elements. Assist in developing an efficient pipeline for lighting. Work with the leads and other art team members to ensure consistent visual quality. Knowledge of platform strengths and limitations. Excellent communication skills. Desirable pluses Experience in lighting big open-world games. Background in a wide variety of platforms like PC, VR and WebGL games. Working knowledge with RayTracing and Lumen for Unreal Engine. Skills in Technical Lighting Art (like light optimizations). Knowledge in Shader and Materials development. Benefits Permanently remote position An opportunity to hone and improve your skills by applying them to a diverse variety of engaging projects. Be part of an international Group with offices worldwide Career growth and development Working closely with a team of like-minded people in a fast-paced, multicultural environment Ongoing training and professional self-improvement opportunities Flexible working hours An inclusive culture and open communication At Magic Media, our passion lies in gaming. Our vision is to create and deliver engaging and interesting games for our clients. We can deliver this high-quality work on any platform, whether it be on console, PC, or mobile. We know that reputation and results go hand-in-hand. Therefore, we work hard to find experts and talented creators to deliver the best results.If you do not meet all the requirements, but believe you’d still be a great fit for the role, don’t worry! We’d still love to hear from you, please get in touch!

Senior Pipeline & Tools Technical Artist in Magic Media

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Magic Media is a pioneering media, entertainment, and tech group powered by creativity and innovation. We have a physical presence in 13 countries and expertise in the areas of art, animation, cybersecurity, game development, software development, VFX, and video production amongst others. We work with leading developers and publishers within the games and tech industry, providing support and solutions designed around individual needs and carried out by global experts. We produce our industry-leading results by constantly staying at the forefront of modern technology and cutting-edge processes and practices. The best of Magic Media’s teams are known for their strong initiative, not just in taking care of their day-to-day responsibilities but in helping identify ways to build, grow, and improve. We are looking for a talented Senior Pipeline & Tools Technical Artist to join and support our team on a very ambitious project. The ideal candidate should have extensive full-time experience in building bridges between artists and engineers and in doing so, maintain a close relationship with many disciplines to drive both existing and future tech and tools; especially in Unreal Engine. Responsibilities You will be responsible for maintaining and improving pipelines and workflows in order for the art teams to work effectively, efficiently and comfortably. Also, mentor other technical artists to support their growth, manage CI/CD pipeline for artists, and write technical documentation. In short, you will play an important role in the technical art field of a project. Hands-on scripting and technical tools pipeline development to refine and improve the team’s workflow. Optimizing pipelines between our artist publishing tools, asset databases, and our version control backend. Continually build and troubleshoot the artist data (e.g. assets, props, textures, materials, characters, etc.) and the pipeline that produces it. Connecting various DCCs/tools/systems into cohesive pipelines from content creation through to the game (mainly for Art and Animation teams). Contribute to the development of our core proprietary automation frameworks to allow for greater scalability as our project/pipeline needs continue to expand. Maintaining existing pipelines and automation processes for on-going development work on released projects. Creating user interfaces (Desktop and Web) to interact with and manage our Automation Systems. Evaluating and breaking down existing manual processes different teams have - work with them to streamline and automate these processes with minimal downtime. Designing, implementing and iterating on services to be consumed within and outside of Technical Art departments. Planning and rolling out improvements to our Technical Art development processes - introducing new patterns of working. Create tools/scripts to support production/tracking. Collaborate with a team of other technical artists, support art teams directly, and work closely with engineers. Design, develop and implement tools to manage art assets in the game engine, automate production software tracking and data, and ensure that assets are optimized. You will support artists and resolve technical issues as they arise during production, and guide on best practices to ensure consistency in process and data flow between departments and teams. Be part of a dedicated team of tech artists to build and enhance a core pipeline for Art and our Animation teams. Support Art and Animation throughout the production process and remove potential technical problems. Automate and optimize inefficient workflows and processes. Develop tools and systems across departments and serve as the liaison between art and engineering. Collaborate with engineers on technical design and workflow solutions Requirements At least 5+ years of experience as a technical artist on a shipped AAA title. Deep understanding of Unreal Engine. Experience in writing tools, scripts, and pipeline development, ideally for video games. Mastery with scripting languages like Python and a working knowledge of Maya and/or other 3d content creation applications. Overall knowledge of the 3d content creation process and pipeline. Strong coding/scripting skills with OOP knowledge. Experience using source control software (i.e. Perforce, Plastic, Git) and working on a code base collaboratively. Strong problem-solving skills and ability to think outside the box. Ability to design and execute long term work on complex pipelines and tools. Comfortable coding in modern IDEs and debugging. Understanding of using DCC packages for authoring game Art and/or Animation. Strong communication, self-management, and organizational skills. Professional experience working in a large team spread across multiple locations and timezones. Ability to work within a schedule and deliver effectively to deadlines. Knowledge of art creation pipelines, asset exporting, and process automation workflows Excellent communication skills and ability to translate between technical and artistic language Strong reporting and documentation skills Flexibility and ability to adapt to new technological changes as per project need Desirable pluses Experience in developing big open-world games and sandbox tools Background in a wide variety of platforms like PC, VR and WebGL games Working knowledge of Houdini, tool creation for artists and designers Scripting skills in Python, C++, C# and/or MaxScript Experience setting up CI/CD systems (GitLab, Jenkins or similar) Benefits Permanently remote position An opportunity to hone and improve your skills by applying them to a diverse variety of engaging projects. Be part of an international Group with offices worldwide. Career growth and development. Working closely with a team of like-minded people in a fast-paced, multicultural environment. Ongoing training and professional self-improvement opportunities. Flexible working hours An inclusive culture and open communication At Magic Media, our passion lies in gaming. Our vision is to create and deliver engaging and interesting games for our clients. We can deliver this high-quality work on any platform, whether it be on console, PC, or mobile. We know that reputation and results go hand-in-hand. Senior Concept Artist in Jagex

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

A leader in creating deep and engaging experiences on PC and mobile, Jagex was founded in 2001 and is today one of the UK’s biggest and most respected video game developers and publishers. Famed for its flagship MMOs RuneScape and Old School RuneScape, Jagex has welcomed more than 260million player accounts to its world and created a $1bn lifetime franchise revenue. Today the RuneScape franchise exists beyond running games in live operations; our titles are living games that connect and inspire millions of players, with content and experiences both inside and outside of inexhaustible game worlds. Both RuneScape and Old School RuneScape, on PC and mobile, offer ever-evolving, highly-active worlds and our community-focussed development ethos empowers players to have a real say in how each game is shaped. Jagex is expanding and extending its portfolio with fresh franchise titles, new IP and, in 2018 launched Jagex Partners, delivering third-party publishing and operational services exclusively for the living games of the future. Jagex employs more than 400 people at its Cambridge headquarters and is on the hunt for talented people to work across the business to help the company to achieve yet another year of record growth and player satisfaction. Job Overview: As a Concept artist you will be required to visually develop and illustrate any given combination of game assets, associated game development imagery and speculative ‘pitch’ materials to a high standard and on schedule under the art direction of a Lead or Director. Concept art is about communicating and developing ideas in a visually inspiring manner whilst successfully interpreting the visual direction and style. Being a Senior Concept Artist, it is expected you will design and create benchmark quality digital artwork meeting the art direction criteria. You set the quality bar and provide artistic, technical guidance, coaching and mentoring to others on how to achieve it. At a senior level, it is important to demonstrate an all-round ability to solve problems reliably and autonomously with great organisational, scheduling and mentorship skills. You must show an ability to look more broadly at product development and strategise accordingly within discipline. Overall, as a senior you are expected to take on a higher level of responsibility for the quality and timely delivery of complex tasks on a project. Key Duties: Work with the Art Director or Associate Art Director to visualise the games art direction Produce benchmark quality assets covering all aspects of concept design, key art, illustration, and storyboards adhering to the products art direction Develop a deep knowledge and understanding of your product enabling to you make the best visual decisions and appropriate artwork Collaborate with the art team and create inspiring artwork Be a major driver and voice in cross discipline visual development, brainstorms, and pitches Review internal and external artwork to maintain a consistent quality and provide effective feedback and critique Level up via mentoring, coaching and critique sessions those more junior in craft Support production guide creation, outlining detailed steps to reproduce artwork on style Encourage, promote, and build good team and studio morale in an open, creative environment  Feedback to outsource partners or freelancers as required Essential Skills: Portfolio demonstrating an ability to visually develop an idea and render to a high level of finish Experience of multiple full game development cycles or live product releases Profound knowledge and expertise of the fundamental art principles (color, composition, value/ lighting, anatomy, form, perspective) Ability to deconstruct, understand and adapt to various art styles replicating them successfully Full proficiency in illustration and 2D software such as Adobe CC Fluent in industry standard concept design development processes and pipelines (mood-board, thumbs, sketches, mockups) Iterative and agile approach to visual development A deep artistic toolbox with multiple approaches to visual development and problem solving Comfortable running critique sessions  Feedback to outsource partners or freelancers as required Excellent time management and prioritization skills Ability to communicate clearly, and concisely to team, peers, and management  Able to level up junior artists through coaching and mentoring  Happy to both give and receive constructive criticism Have a passion for games and understand game development processes Professional attitude and work ethic  Excellent soft skills and teamwork  Bonus Skills Comfortable using 3D modelling software Game engine experience (Unreal/ Unity) Traditional Sculpting Company Benefits: Flexible Working Bonus Scheme Private Health Care Gym Membership Generous Pension Contributions Life Insurance Free Cycle Repair Income Protection Dental Plan Free Fruit and Drinks Subsidised Canteen Feel like you fit this role, but don’t meet all the requirements? We strive for fresh perspectives, so as long as you can demonstrate how your attitude and other abilities might make up for any gaps we would welcome your application! Jagex are an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy or maternity, religion or belief.

Both RuneScape and Old School RuneScape, on PC and mobile, offer ever-evolving, highly-active worlds and our community-focussed development ethos empowers players to have a real say in how each game is shaped. That’s why we’ve made it our mission to build the next generation of technologies for online multi-user games and simulations. We’re motivated by the fulfillment of solving hard problems to achieve something profound and transformative. Your Mission We believe that the Metaverse experiences of today are far from what players and participants deserve. We believe we can create a better looking virtual world, filled with people, novel experiences and meaningful interactions by leveraging our AAA game development experiences. We have already started this journey by holding a ScavLab event with over 4,000 players crowding into a single map to battle, and a Meet and Greet with K-Pop star AleXa attended by over a thousand fans who all got on stage at the same time. You will be part of the team responsible for building our worlds and bringing them to life. Display a high degree of discipline in following the Character Art processes. Create high quality Character Art content within industry standard timelines. Own a discrete area of the game and execute on it with a high degree of quality, including: Character Heads, Hair, Clothing/worn equipment & Shaders (e.g. skin, hair, clothing types etc.) Generate high quality content for user acquisition and engagement, e.g.: marketing assets. We'd like to hear from you if you embody the following: Expert in a Character Art Role with shipped products that show an end-to-end understanding of the process. Demonstrable skills include: Excellent 3d character modeling skills and techniques (both high-resolution and game-ready) Excellent texturing skills and a strong understanding of shaders and their best uses. An excellent understanding of how to set character assets up in UE4, optimise them and strike a balance between performance and visual quality. Expert ability to identify and solve any issues which present themselves, either through their own work or with the help of others. Excellent understanding of form and anatomy and how they relate to in-game characters, help to define interesting silhouettes and convey character and personality. Demonstrates a desire to go out of their way to improve their understanding of their craft through personal projects, anatomy courses and the study of current trends within the industry. Excellent in self-managing workloads through Jira or another tracking methodology. Excellent in identifying issues and proposing solutions that improve Character Art processes or the discipline in general. Excellent skills in one or more common Character Art packages: Autodesk Maya, Zbrush, Substance Painter, Marvelous Designer, Photoshop, Unreal Engine (UE4) Able to create tutorials, guides, or other important documentation for more junior staff members. Responsibilities include but are not limited to interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; addressing complaints and resolving problems. Other Skills: Large team leadership, with experience navigating multiple simultaneous projects and reports. Effective time management, with the ability to delegate tasks and focus on larger issues while monitoring critical smaller details. A strong critical eye for detail and the ability to communicate effectively with the team to resolve issues. Communication with both large groups and individuals, with excellent written and oral communication skills. Deadline-oriented approach, with the ability to get results even in difficult situations. A leadership style that is marked by personal visibility, open communication, relationship building, collegiality, and teamwork. Well-developed interpersonal skills and the poise and the ability to relate effectively to others at all levels, state a point of view, and advocate for a position within a strong and assertive senior executive group. High level oral and written communication skills and a professional demeanor. Does this sound like you? Please submit your resume and cover letter for consideration. Title: Senior 3D Environment & Props Artist Level: Senior Type: Remote, Home-Working We are extensively growing our Global Art Team. Our 3D Artists mix keen technical skills with creative problem solving to create models and textures for our upcoming games. 1518 studios are now on the hunt for several talented and professional 3D Artists to join our global Art Team. You'll be a highly qualified and experienced 3D Artist with the skills to create hard-surface objects and work with the team on Props and Environment assets. This position entails a great deal of responsibility and opportunity to drive further the development of your artistic, technical, and creative expertise and will accept applications from 3D Artists that can work on a realistic style. We are ideally looking for Senior 3D Artists that have at least around 5+ years of commercial experience for games. Requirements Qualifications Have skills in hard-surface modelling (preferably knowledge of 3Ds Max). Can do accurate shading using weighted normals. A keen eye for spinning narrative and life into an environment. Understanding of real-time engines (Unreal Engine 4, Unity) and PBR pipeline. Can quickly adapt to new client software and plugins (according to guides). Able to switch quickly and fluidly to new requirements and processes when required. Able to create top shelf quality game assets for our current and upcoming stylized projects from start to implementation in Unity. Skilled at creating 3D models that are cleanly modelled, organised workflow & files. Consistently delivering well presented and defined materials from the initial block out through to final model & maps. Excellent design thinking skills, able to solve creative problems when adapting 2D concept, balancing form and function, always being aware of the whole pipeline and the requirements. Exceptional technical skills, solid knowledge of 3D software (Max, Maya, Blender, Zbrush, Substance and Marmoset). Solid skills while using Substance Painter and Photoshop texturin, targeting physically based rendering. Solid understanding of the art fundamentals. A strong grasp of proportion, scale, perspective, lighting, colour and volume is key. Familiarity with the entire game asset creation pipeline: high-poly sculpting, retopology, UV mapping, texture baking, texture painting, setting up and exporting to game. The ability to provide multiple creative options, then iterate upon them as projects progress. Good understanding of creative briefs, able to consider elements such as context, timescales and creative constraints when solving tasks. Excellent time management skills, able to meet deadlines and multitask. Excellent collaborative attitude. A receptive individual who's open to take feedback and working together with team-mates and clients. An eye-catching portfolio is a must, we want to see that passion for Hard-Surface Modelling. Nice to have Experience in game dev or outsource. Love of computer games, interest in the metaverses. An understanding and interest in real world mechanics would also be a benefit. Intermediate-Advanced English level and above. Benefits 8-hour working day. Competitive financial reward. A community of people who share a love for games and are always ready to share knowledge. Remote working form home. Dynamic and entrepreneurial global multicultural casual, fun environment. You get to work with the latest technologies. You will be working for one of the worlds leading providers of specialist services to the games industry. Who we are PTW is a video games services company which supports video game developers and publishers through outsourced production services. We started 25 years ago and since then, have grown exponentially year-on-year to where we are today. Our history is in gaming, and we are gamers at heart. In our time within the games industry, we have worked on over 1500 titles across all genres and all platforms, including 8 out of the past 10 Game-Of-The-Year-winning titles. We have grown rapidly over the past few years and now have 35 sites spanning the globe. The PTW umbrella of companies includes 1518, SIDE and Orange Rock. SIDE works at the cutting edge of interactive media as a provider of audio services for the global entertainment market. Orange Rock is our in-house game and product development studio. 1518 is our award- winning global Art studio service. Welcome to 1518

Who we are PTW is a video games services company which supports video game developers and publishers through outsourced production services. We started 25 years ago and since then, have grown exponentially year-on-year to where we are today. Our history is in gaming, and we are gamers at heart. In our time within the games industry, we have worked on over 1500 titles across all genres and all platforms, including 8 out of the past 10 Game-Of-The-Year-winning titles. We have grown rapidly over the past few years and now have 35 sites spanning the globe. The PTW umbrella of companies includes 1518 studios, SIDE and Orange Rock. SIDE works at the cutting edge of interactive media as a provider of audio services for the global entertainment market. Orange Rock is our in-house game and product development studio.1518 is our global award-winning art studio. Welcome to 1518

Senior Software Engineer (Effects) in Unity

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Unity/Weta is seeking a creative, dedicated Pipeline Engineer to join our Shots and Lookdev R&D team to build tools for our FX team. This role is based in Wellington, though candidates in compatible timezones may be able to join remotely. In this fast paced technical role, you will support and develop tools for artists at WetaFX in our industry-leading simulation and effects pipeline. This year we are striving to deliver more shots than ever, at a higher quality than ever, on movies such as Avatar 2 and the next slate of Marvels. As part of a team, you will be responsible for evolving and improving Weta's tools and software to facilitate effects workflows in water, fire, destruction, magic and others, alongside improving pipeline efficiency and asset management. Our tools are used by artists across the company and are crucial to the delivery of creative content. We work closely with the FX Artists to build these tools and workflows. What you’ll be doing Develop, deploy and support artist-facing tooling and applications Providing support and guidance for the workflow of FX artists and the creation of our effects data Working with artists to gather requirements, develop new workflows and techniques and test Contributing to broader backend pipeline improvement projects such as improved data flow, management of our compute resource, and rendering What we’re looking for Demonstrable professional experience developing software with python Familiarity with VFX production pipelines and an understanding of Houdini, Maya or equivalent. An excellent communicator who enjoys collaborating and problem solving with artists You might also have Direct experience coding for Houdini, UIs with Qt or other frameworks, C++, experience with USD Experience as an FX TD in a VFX pipeline Familiarity with another VFX pipeline technology - simulation technology, renderers, asset databases, render farm scheduling and so on Life at Unity Unity (NYSE: U) is the world’s leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity is the foundation upon which the world’s most powerful digital content is created. Specifically, Unity’s platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices. In the fourth quarter of 2021, Unity had, on average, 3.9 billion monthly active end users who consumed content created or operated with its solutions. The applications developed by these creators were downloaded, on average, five billion times per month in 2021. Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, disability, gender, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations or accommodations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

Lighting Artist in Crytek

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

The Crysis 4 (Working Title) team is looking for a creatively minded and driven Lighting Artist who can communicate well between programmers and artists to develop cutting edge, next generation lighting solutions for Games. *Sample pictures or a link to a webpage, which shows sample work, are required.* Relocation & Remote Work Although we believe living close to our studio helps foster team spirit and stronger bonds between team members, we understand that people have different needs and expectations for their place of residence. You have a choice of three location options, allowing you to work with Crytek from anywhere you wish: Come to our modern headquarters in Frankfurt and receive an attractive relocation package and have access to all of our benefits. If you are already living in a European Union member state, we are able to offer you a permanent work contract and allow you to work remotely as an employee from there. If you are interested in full-time remote work in any other country outside of the European Union, we can offer you a freelance contract arrangement. Responsibilities Working with Level Designers, Artists and Programmers to create real time and baked lighting moods and effects for static, dynamic and animated environments, cinematics, characters, etc. within the platform's limitations. Creation of skyboxes and other geometry based lighting assets (sun shafts, glows, flares, etc). Balancing and maintaining consistent light levels across a variety of physically based materials and surfaces. Finding, discussing and fixing material inconsistencies that might affect shading quality. Collaboration with other Lighting Artists on the team to ensure consistent quality across the game. Texture creation using available graphic applications. Population of light entities and cubemaps in game using the CRYENGINE Sandbox Editor and tools. Creating dramatic, unique, and interesting day/night setups using the CRYENGINE Sandbox Editor and tools. Solving technical issues that arise with new tools or game performance. Requirements 2+ years of professional experience lighting for next-gen games on PC and console hardware. Experience with and a good working knowledge of the limitations and expectations of next generation hardware. Excellent art sense (e.g. knowledge of composition, color, lighting, etc). Solid understanding of basic theory of light propagation and light-material interaction. Ability to work with multiple disciplines to meet project’s specific needs. Capable of working both as a member of a development team and individually with minimum supervision. Must have the ability to conceptualize, present, and execute ideas within a schedule, while actively participating in technical and artistic problem solving. Ability to quickly understand custom tool-sets and deliver assets within the confines of real time engine constraints and programming demands. Organized approach to problem solving and time-management. Good English communication and writing skills. Positive team-oriented attitude. Proactive and self-motivated, capable of working without direct supervision. Pluses Experience with CRYENGINE and Sandbox Editor. Strong understanding of real-time and pre-baked lighting systems. Experience creating and configuring geometry assets for in game lighting effects. Experience with real world lighting situations, including natural light and artificial “studio” type lighting, and/or photography. Experience with cinematic post-processing work (e.g. compositing, color correction). What you can expect from us A refreshing yet highly professional atmosphere in a diverse team. Flexible work time. FUN. Free public transportation ticket, which lets you use public transport free of charge 24/7. Free German lessons Company language is English. Any additional language is a plus, but not a requirement. Extensive assistance with getting visa, work permits and communication with local authorities. Relocation support. A company apartment for your first few months and help in finding a private apartment. ...and much more!

Junior Lighting Artist in Crytek

The Crysis 4 (Working Title) team is looking for a creatively minded and driven Junior Lighting Artist who can communicate well between programmers and artists to develop cutting edge, next generation lighting solutions for Games. *Sample pictures or a link to a webpage, which shows sample work, are required.* Relocation & Remote Work Although we believe living close to our studio helps foster team spirit and stronger bonds between team members, we understand that people have different needs and expectations for their place of residence. You have a choice of three location options, allowing you to work with Crytek from anywhere you wish: Come to our modern headquarters in Frankfurt and receive an attractive relocation package and have access to all of our benefits. If you are already living in a European Union member state, we are able to offer you a permanent work contract and allow you to work remotely as an employee from there. If you are interested in full-time remote work in any other country outside of the European Union, we can offer you a freelance contract arrangement. Responsibilities Working with Level Designers, Artists and Programmers to create real time and baked lighting moods and effects for static, dynamic and animated environments, cinematics, characters, etc. within the platforms limitations. Creation of skyboxes and other geometry based lighting assets (sun shafts, glows, flares, etc). Collaboration with other Lighting Artists on the team to ensure consistent quality across the game. Population of light entities and cubemaps in game using the CRYENGINE Sandbox Editor and tools. Requirements Good art sense (e.g. knowledge of composition, color, lighting, etc). Ability to work with multiple disciplines to meet project’s specific needs. Must have the ability to execute ideas within a schedule. Ability to understand custom tool-sets and deliver assets within the confines of real time engine constraints and programming demands. Good English communication and writing skills. Keep a positive team-oriented attitude. Be proactive and self-motivated. Pluses Experience with CRYENGINE and Sandbox Editor. Strong understanding of real-time and pre-baked lighting systems. Experience creating and configuring geometry assets for in game lighting effects. Experience with real world lighting situations, including natural light and artificial “studio” type lighting, and/or photography. Experience with cinematic post-processing work (e.g. compositing, color correction). Proficient in a diverse set of software including Photoshop, 3ds Max/Maya, etc. Professional experience lighting for next-gen games on PC and console hardware. What you can expect from us A refreshing yet highly professional atmosphere in a diverse team. Flexible work time. FUN. Free public transportation ticket, which lets you use public transport free of charge 24/7. Free German lessons Company language is English. Any additional language is a plus, but not a requirement.
