PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team. The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation. Senior VFX Artist Remote, Canada Sony PlayStation Studios Visual Arts (PSSVA) on our San Diego campus provides world-class content, development and services to PlayStation Studios such as Insomniac Games, Naughty Dog, Santa Monica Studio, Bend Studio, Guerilla Games, Sucker Punch Productions and more! Our team is always at the cutting edge of technology and partners with the industry’s best minds and companies. We are looking for a Senior FX Artist to come aboard and help us build the highest quality game FX possible. Become a part of the Visual Arts Group, and work with a multi-award winning team responsible for the cinematic performances in outstanding Sony PlayStation franchises like Uncharted, The Last of Us, Killzone, and other iconic series. Responsibilities: Content creation of visual FX across all areas of the game ranging from in-game assets to Cinematics on the PlayStation 5 platform. You will work with our VFX Supervisor to ensure a consistent style and quality level across all the various types of game FX assets. You will partner with our render engineers to develop new, or improve upon existing technologies for pushing the bar of game FX, both visually and technically. Document, communicate requirements, and provide feedback to internal artists and outsourcing partners. Actively develop and improve skill set and abilities by keeping aware of industry trends and techniques, evaluating competitive products, and learning new software packages and traditional art methods. Qualifications: 4+ years’ experience as a professional FX artist in AAA games. At least 1 shipped AAA title as an FX artist. Bachelor of art degree or equivalent industry experience and training Portfolio of realistic, high quality real-time FX work. Proficiency of standard art packages such as Maya and Photoshop. Good understanding of shader techniques as applied to visual effects. Working knowledge of dynamics and simulations packages. Good communication, organizational, time management and interpersonal skills Experience working with a game engine and implementing 3D work into engine. Pluses: Python scripting experience. C++ programming experience. Premiere/After Effects experience. Side-FX Houdini experience. Equal Opportunity Statement: Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Senior Technical Artist in PlayStation

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Why PlayStation? PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, PlayStation™Now, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more. PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team. The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation. Senior Technical Artist Remote, Canada PlayStation Studios Visual Arts provides the highest quality artistic support to first-party Sony game teams as well as other teams developing titles for the PS5. We offer dozens of services including asset scanning, actor scanning, body motion capture, facial motion capture, motion edit, animation, facial tracking and solving, and lighting. As a service group we have the privilege of working with multiple game developers on a variety of titles. The Technical Art team works directly with clients to replicate and maintain their work environments in the studio and guarantee the quality of the final delivery. We are looking for a Senior Technical Artist to join our San Diego, California development team. The role requires experience and understanding of visual effects pipelines, experience with Autodesk Maya software, and python programming skills. Technical artists are responsible for setting up and maintaining the technical pipeline on all projects, writing tools for artists for a variety of software packages and needs, troubleshooting all technical issues that arise, and ensuring the quality of the final product. Technical artist work with both our art teams and our engineering team and help provide communication and cohesion between these two groups. Responsibilities: Understanding and maintaining project workflows, primarily Maya art and animation, and game engine integration pipelines. Learning and supporting varying client working environments, assets, and tools. Writing, maintaining and customizing internal tools for production team. Troubleshooting problems in pipeline and for individuals on as-needed basis. Creating and maintaining technical documentation. Desired Experience: BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Graphic Art, or a related field, or equivalent experience. At least 5+ years in some branch of visual effects (film, game dev, tv, etc). Excellent knowledge of Maya and Python and experience developing python tools for Maya. Excellent troubleshooting skills and the ability to problem solve creatively. PyQt/PySide experience. Ability to work in a team and communicate well. Ability to mentor junior technical artists. Experience with game engines such as Unreal, Unity, or proprietary engines. Nice to Have: General knowledge of Maya rigging. Experience with other programming languages, especially C++. Experience developing or maintaining system environments. Experiencing developing or maintaining project pipeline tools. Experience with perforce and/or git. Experience with project management and tracking software (such as Shotgun and Jira). Equal Opportunity Statement: Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category. We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond.

Experience with Photoshop and 3d modeling applications. Experience with Zbrush. Experience with Unreal engine. AAA game development experience. Experience with 3D software packages a plus.

Jobs available in Remote Job

The Senior Concept Artist will create compelling concepts and polished in game art for our mobile game titles. You will work as part of the creative team responsible for crafting in-game assets for existing and new titles. You will work closely with both internal and external teams to create character art and environment art. Essential Functions/Responsibilities: Illustrate, and compose highly effective art assets following IP specific brand and in- game style guidelines. Create custom illustrated player facing key art that accomplishes the vision, mission, and high level goals of the product. Play a key role in defining the look and feel of the brand with a clear and distinctive visual identity that aligns with the goals of the product and tell a story. Ensure all campaigns and assets truly capture the marketability of the visual design of the games. Concept new and original ideas, and render 2d Illustrations. Generate story boards to communicate ideas and provide direction to the wider team. Illustrate concept art that can inform outsourcing for character and environment asset creation Illustrate iconography to support motion graphics efforts. Communicate and collaborate with various stakeholders on both the game product team and IP stakeholders to ensure that the visual identity of our brand is aligned. Lead by example, creating a strong sense of purpose and community, and promoting a culture of excellence. Exemplify reliability, accountability, and professionalism in all work-related interactions. Skills and Abilities: Highly proficient in Adobe Creative Suite, as well as Microsoft PowerPoint. Excellent ability to create high quality promotional assets in various styles. Expert in digital painting with ability to perform marketing and player facing polish. Able to manage multiple, competing tasks and be self-directed in a quickly evolving environment with little direction. Excellent communication, organization, and leadership skills. Collaborative team centric focus with an excellent ability to deliver and receive constructive feedback. Ability to mentor and inspire artists in the same discipline. Motion design knowledge in After Effects or Spine is a big plus. Education and Experience 10 years of experience with a mobile gaming company or related creative studio environment. Experience documenting processes. Great understanding of composition and color theory. Working knowledge of graphic/visual/stylistic trends in art, film, and games. Strong understanding of visual branding and IP in the context of marketing campaigns. Well versed in a wide range of marketing mediums such as web graphics, social media, ad creatives, photography, posters, and videos. Position Type/Expected Hours of Work: Our core hours are 10am to 6:00pm CST, which means you should be available for meetings etc. during this time. This also means you will be required to work longer hours on occasion, especially during periods when staff is working late to meet tight deadlines etc. Other Duties: Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. VFX Programmer in Bloober Team

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

If you’re searching for something more than just a workplace, if you want to be a co-creator rather than just another cog in the machine, if you want to go down in the history of the game industry working as a part of great productions – read this ad. Bloober Team S.A. is not only a leading horror producer, with strong financial ground beneath it, a clear strategy and perhaps most interestingly, a portfolio of pending productions. Most of all, it’s a place of business with a comfortable and open working atmosphere, and a great team working with passion soon to be found on the new generation of consoles. If you’re looking not only for a well-paid job, but also a great atmosphere and the opportunity to be remembered for your work – apply to this position: VFX Programmer Within this role you will be responsible for: creating and integrating various VFX systems inside UE4 engine (Cascade and Niagara), extending UE4 VFX systems to suit VFX Artists needs, working closely with Technical Animators/Gameplay Programmers on implementing various gameplay driven effects, implementing various state of the art VFX systems (fluid solvers, volumetric effects, compute shaders, etc.), creating C++ plugins to aid VFX Artists (content importing plugins from Houdini, etc.). Job requirements vast knowledge of UE4 VFX systems (Cascade/Niagara), vast knowledge of UE4 material system, excellent knowledge of C++ (in the context of VFX programming in UE4), excellent knowledge of HLSL, practical knowledge of current trends and solutions in VFX creation pipeline, great teamwork skills, English skills that allow you to communicate on an everyday basis. Nice to have: strong 3D vector and math skills, some experience with 3D software (Maya, Houdini), ability to complete complex tasks with minimal supervision, being a fan of horror genre (books, movies etc.). What do we have to offer: earnings fitting to your skills and experience, possibility of long-term cooperation on current and upcoming projects, work in a creative environment, in a committed team of game enthusiasts, work in a modern, comfortable office, flexible working hours, days off, private healthcare, and working with new technologies.

Lead Concept Artist in Fortis Games

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

WHO WE ARE At Fortis Games we aspire to make great games that bring people together while redefining how game companies work. We believe in building a sense of belonging through our games, their communities, and how we operate and treat each other. Through our game communities, we will create powerful connections and lasting memories. We will foster a culture of diversity, equity and belonging where together our diverse skills, experiences and background impact the games we make. We are an early but mighty organization with a leadership team of game industry veterans. There are many opportunities for you to have a big impact on the products we’ll be making as well as the overall direction of the company. If you’re passionate about tackling difficult problems with direct and thoughtful communication and team first mentality, we may be the right place for you. ABOUT THE ROLE (THE MISSION, WHY THIS ROLE EXISTS, THE THING YOU DO OVER AND OVER AGAIN) As a Lead Concept Artist, you will work closely with the Art Director and Creative Leadership to help conceptualize the visual style of our mobile games! You’ll bring your expertise as a visionary, designer, and storyteller to lead a global team of passionate artists to visually communicate and maintain a stylized art direction throughout the creation of world-class environments, characters, props, and key art marketing materials. Collaborate with the Game Director and Art Director to establish and execute the artistic vision of a game. Create designs for characters, creatures, props, and environments to elevate the gameplay and overall player experience. Gather and catalog references, conduct competitive analysis and formulate research strategies under the leadership of the Art Director. Understand and evangelize the visual style of the game, sharing knowledge with the team to be sure that the vision and directions are understandable. Collaborate with other leads and team members across various departments to problem-solve and help steer the conceptual direction into the final game experience Lead the Concept Art team, guiding other artists through both mentorship and constructive critique. Work closely with 3D Asset teams, Environment teams, and Character teams, joining their design processes and working out the visual problems that arise during production. WHAT YOU’LL ACHIEVE (OUTCOMES VS WHAT PEOPLE WILL DO) Benchmark quality assets covering all aspects of style guides, creative briefs, concept design, key art, illustration, and experiments adhering to the overall art direction A visual style that has broad appeal while being distinct and memorable. We aspire for our original IP to have the potential to cross over into multiple games, genres, and media. A well-led team of artists who feel informed, challenged, and supported to do their best work. An efficient and scalable art pipeline that can provide a foundation for future games shaped by constructive feedback and implemented solutions. WHAT YOU’LL NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL (COMPETENCIES) Outstanding proficiency in designing for the digital world with a deep understanding of the technology, technical constraints, and terminology. Solid 2D drawing skills and a good aesthetic sense with a solid understanding of how concepts translate into 3D game assets. Top-notch technique and thorough knowledge of anatomy, perspective, composition, color, and textures. Mastery of industry standard digital painting tools such as Photoshop and proficiency in ZBrush, Substance Painter and other 3D modeling software to quickly develop and express ideas. Ability to turn ideas into images, coupled with a desire to push the envelope. A portfolio showcasing a range of styles that leans heavily toward stylized work. Commitment to the project and a desire to find the best possible way of inspiring others. Ability to communicate your creative vision, process, decisions, and rationale to team members and cross-functional stakeholders in a way that inspires and motivates. Enthusiasm for directing, mentoring, and otherwise elevating the people around you to do their best work. A natural curiosity and eagerness to learn - we believe this is essential to our ability to stay ahead of the market and value this over years of experience. We expect our leaders to continue being students of their craft and the game spaces they’re working in. You should be educated on the latest trends and have a strong perspective on how they relate to our current and future projects. #LI-Remote WHY JOIN US There are many reasons to join us, but here are a few: We strongly believe we are changing how games studios operate and at the core of what we do is making great games that create a connected community Culture of diversity and inclusion and support to all team members Work with some of the industry's coolest people who have designed and launched the best games in the world Fortis is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

of video-based therapy and psychiatry services Membership to One Medical Rocket Lawyer online legal service membership Paid parental leave Paid time off to volunteer Pawternity – paid time off to bond with a newly adopted pet Sabbatical leave available after 5 years of employment Access to all of the latest Ubisoft games for PC Generous discount on new Ubisoft games All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guideline MORE ABOUT US Ubisoft is composed of over 20,000 talented people located in 55+ development studios and offices across the globe. With more than 80% of our teams dedicated to creation, Ubisoft is the biggest in-house creative force in the industry. Ubisoft’s worldwide network of video game development studios and business offices work hand-in-hand each day to deliver rich and innovative gaming experiences that reflect the creativity and diversity of their teams. This cross-studio collaboration model means every team member has the opportunity to participate in challenging projects based on iconic brands including Assassin's Creed®, Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six Siege®, Tom Clancy's The Division®, For Honor®, Rabbids®, Rayman®, Watch Dogs®, Far Cry®, The Crew®, Just Dance® and more. Ubisoft is a global leader in the video games and entertainment software industry. We are committed to enriching player’s lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. We create worlds where people can express themselves, explore and discover new possibilities. Are you looking to work with enthusiastic experts who are tackling game-changing challenges in entertainment and beyond? At Ubisoft, we offer an open environment where bright ideas are given a chance to shine, and everyone is eager to share knowledge. Skills and competencies show up in different forms and can be based on different experiences, that's why we strongly encourage you to apply even though you may not have all the requirements listed above. At Ubisoft, you can come as you are. We embrace diversity in all its forms. We’re committed to fostering a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences. Ubisoft is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that reflects the diversity of our player community. We are an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability status. Take entertainment to the next level. Join us and create the unknown. We do not accept any unsolicited resumes submitted by staffing or placement agencies or recruiters.

Lead Character Artist - XDefiant in Ubisoft

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

As Lead Character Artist you are responsible for managing the team to deliver AAA characters and character related assets in our art production teams, for trouble shooting character related issues and participating in the planning for the project characters in game. You will also develop your team through excellent communication skills and mentoring. WHAT YOU'LL DO Managing, developing and inspiring the character artist team Content creation of characters across all areas of the game as defined together with the Character Art Director, which sets the industry leading standard for the team and the project Work with and mentor character artists to provide clear direction and set expectations and character requirements Setting up, maintaining and documenting our character production pipelines Close collaboration with the Art Director to work within the visual style of the game Balance quality and efficiency of work to gain the best possible results within the given time frame and technical constraints Ability to skillfully optimize characters to game-ready quality Cooperation with other Ubisoft teams globally on a daily basis for optimal performance and qualified results QUALIFICATIONS WHAT YOU'LL BRING Senior level of experience as a character artist in game development, with at least one AAA title shipped, leadership experience is a plus Exceptional understanding of next gen asset creation workflows with the ability to improve them, then optimize as required for final product Excellent skills in ZBrush, Maya and Photoshop Strong sculpting, texturing and painting skills Ability to create highly realistic characters that meet AAA standards Good working knowledge with at least one AAA game engine Being used to working on tasks autonomously and to deliver results in time Great communication skills, a positive attitude, and team player ADDITIONAL INFORMATION All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guideline Ubisoft is composed of over 20,000 talented people located in 55+ development studios and offices across the globe. Technical Artist in Ubisoft

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Home to the North American Ubisoft headquarters since 1996, Ubisoft San Francisco opened its development studio in 2009 and since developed Rocksmith® and Rocksmith 2014, to teach millions of people how to play guitar and bass. With a song library of over 1,500 songs and 10 years of support the Rocksmith franchise helped millions of players around the world on their musical journey. In 2017, the studio released the critically acclaimed South Park™: The Fractured But Whole™, in collaboration with Trey Parker, Matt Stone, and South Park Digital Studios. The studio is currently working on innovative new titles with Rocksmith+ and XDefiant. JOB DESCRIPTION WHAT YOU'LL DO Establish quick, efficient, and clear pipelines in collaboration with team leads, accounting for the artist's needs as well as technical requirements or other limitations Constantly striving for top visual quality and performance Work with Art Leads, Technical Directors, and QA to ensure that all art content conforms to technical requirements Profiling and optimization Produce and maintain documentation on tools, methods, processes, and engine limits for consultation and future reference Collaborate with all production teams to answer questions and solve complex technical and art-related issues, identify, and communicate risks, share feedback and best practices while maintaining a balance between creative vision and technical constraints QUALIFICATIONS WHAT YOU'LL BRING Mid to senior level of experience and in working on Tech Art in a console or PC game development pipeline Scripting languages and programming concepts Industry standard DCC tools and workflows, both for 3D and 2D content Knowledge and experience working with Game editors and engines Knowledge and understanding of rendering pipelines Ability to profile, identify and address art production bottlenecks Strong organizational skills Ability to write clear and concise technical documentation for technical and non-technical audience Being creative (original and resourceful in finding solutions) Great communication skills, and a proactive and solution-oriented attitude Ability to communicate constructively with positivity and respect for others Ability to give and receive feedback and drive the iterative process ADDITIONAL INFORMATION All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines Ubisoft is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that reflects the diversity of our player community. We are an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability status. Animation Engineer - XDefiant in Ubisoft

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

You’ll be working to design, create, and extend the underlying animation systems which bring our games to life. Your contributions will empower the whole development team and help our games to shine. You will work on a small, collaboration-oriented team where you will have the opportunity to contribute in meaningful ways. You’ll also be part of the diverse Ubisoft San Francisco team. We embrace a variety of work situations based on what’s best for the team, and we welcome people working in our SF office, remotely from other locations, or some combination of the two. We put a priority on supporting our team members and what makes them happiest and most productive. WHAT YOU'LL DO Extend and improve the existing animation systems Optimize animation code and systems Work with the animation team to implement animation features and content Collaborate with Lead Core Engineer on technical design and feature roll out Work with animators and other engineers to identify systems in need of improvement Coordinate with other developers to ensure smooth roll out of new features Review the work of other engineers and provide mentorship Create and maintain technical design documents QUALIFICATIONS WHAT YOU'LL BRING C/C++ experience with understanding of multi-threaded programming techniques Experience with low-level animation systems in modern game engines Understanding of low-level optimizations and cross-platform development Experience building games as an engineer for PlayStation, Xbox, or PC Ability to be self-directed, focused, and detail-oriented Experience on the new generation of consoles (PS5, Xbox Series X) ADDITIONAL INFORMATION WHAT YOU'LL GET Medical, dental, and vision coverage Employer HSA contribution to fully cover your deductible (with enrollment in a HSA eligible medical plan) 401k match Paid vacation, holiday and wellness time Fitness, physical challenge, and eSports competition reimbursements Ginger emotional support app for you and your adult dependents with up to 10 sessions per year of video-based therapy and psychiatry services Membership to One Medical Rocket Lawyer online legal service membership Paid parental leave Paid time off to volunteer Pawternity – paid time off to bond with a newly adopted pet Sabbatical leave available after 5 years of employment Access to all of the latest Ubisoft games for PC Generous discount on new Ubisoft games All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guideline MORE ABOUT US Ubisoft is composed of over 20,000 talented people located in 55+ development studios and offices across the globe. Manager, Animation in PlayStation

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Why PlayStation? PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more. PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team. The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation. Our Animation Department is growing and we are looking for an Animation Manager to join our team. As an Animation Manager you will be responsible for ensuring project quality and the well-being of team members by managing a group of Animators and Leads across multiple projects. The role provides a critical component of the studio’s mission to create games that have a positive and lasting impact on people’s lives by helping foster an environment of craft excellence, collaboration, and positivity. Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following: Supervises direct reports on the Animation team, and participates in strategy and decision-making as a member of the department’s leadership group Meets regularly with team members to mentor and offer experienced guidance, provide constructive feedback, conduct performance reviews, and facilitate the team’s best work Manages the career growth and development of direct reports Evaluates team members’ goals and objectives and ensures that department goals are being met Evaluates schedules in conjunction with pod leads and project management, ensures that teams deliver against project goals and pillars Advocates studio cultural values and fosters an environment of craft excellence and collaboration Assists the Department Head with project staffing, hiring, and onboarding Works with Department Head and other Managers to determine best practices and guide Leads in their implementation across all animation groups across all projects Fosters a safe work environment by ensuring all complaints and concerns related to inappropriate or unprofessional conduct in the workplace are addressed immediately Develops training opportunities to support the development of team members at the group or individual level Builds and maintains relationships with peers and other senior leaders to align project and departmental priorities Regularly plays games in development and reviews scripts to provide feedback and help identify opportunities for craft development Other duties may be assigned Supervisory Responsibilities: Directly supervises a team of animators and animation leads on various projects. Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems. Education and/or Experience: Eight plus years related experience and/or training/education; or equivalent combination of education and experience Shipped a AAA game in an animator or manager role preferred Experience in a lead role preferred Other Skills: Expert knowledge of the principles of writing, performance, and design Strong written and verbal communication skills Must be able to present ideas clearly and work well within a large team environment Ability to make effective and persuasive speeches (scripts) and presentations on controversial or complex topics to top management, public groups, and/or boards of directors Proficient with the Microsoft Office Suite Proficient with Final Draft and/or other screenwriting software Photoshop and Illustrator a plus Equal Opportunity Statement: Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category. We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond. PlayStation is a Fair Chance employer and qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for employment.

Senior 3D Character Artist in PlayStation

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Why PlayStation? PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more. PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team. The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation. Bluepoint Games has begun the exciting work of original development and seeks passionate, industry-leading talent to join our pursuit in crafting Game-of-the-Year quality titles. Our studio is renowned for critically acclaimed titles that exceeded what the world expected of us, from the remaster of Uncharted: The Nathan Drake Collection, to the remake of Shadow of the Colossus, and most recently the PS5 launch title Demon's Souls. We are looking for a SENIOR 3D CHARACTER ARTIST to join our team on a full time basis. Help us create unique assets for AAA titles developed for current-generation home video game consoles. We are preferably looking for an individual with senior-level experience, but open to mid-level experience with exceptional talent and a true passion for creating cutting edge character art. Please note: This is not an entry-level or mid-level position. Responsibilities Create high-quality game ready character models Sculpt highly detailed geometry Retopologize sculpted geometry to game-ready models Create high-quality texture maps for use in a PBR workflow Transfer high-resolution model detail to texture maps Apply and modify cutting edge material techniques Layout efficient and quality UVs Maintain character functionality and animation ability throughout the model iteration process Develop and learn the latest art creation technologies Collaborate with fellow artists, Team Leads, and our Engineering and Design teams to produce the highest quality characters Requirements Expert level sculpting skills in ZBrush Strong knowledge of Maya modeling tools Expertise of Substance Painter and Photoshop for texturing Full understanding of game workflows and pipelines Desire to learn new techniques and technologies Excellent communication and organizational skills Drawing/painting skills to convey ideas At least 5 years of professional experience in the game development industry with at least one shipped title (excluding academic projects) A portfolio reflecting high-quality game art The ideal candidate shall also have Experience with Allegorithmic Substance Designer Understanding of character skeleton and skinning techniques Equal Opportunity Statement: Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category. We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond. PlayStation is a Fair Chance employer and qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for employment.

Character Art Intern in Insomniac Games

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

The Character Art internship here at Insomniac Games is an excellent opportunity to be part of game production. This intern will have the opportunity to take part in working in a diverse, innovative, collaborative, and creative environment. A successful intern will end the summer with a AAA game credit for their resume and will have the opportunity to be mentored by senior members of the team, through the Insomniac process for creating character art. Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following: Authoring and optimizing character assets to match both aesthetic and performance goals Using Maya, Marvelous Designer, ZBrush and Substance Painter Assisting with maintaining character systems throughout the project Working closely with Animators and Riggers to ensure models deform correctly and are functional Maintaining consistent style under the direction of the project Art Director Polishing character related assets Delivering milestones with the rest of the team Internship Qualifications: Six to twelve months related experience and/or training, or students enrolled at a college or university, working towards a B.F.A. in Computer Art, Illustration, Game Design, Product Design, or equivalent. Master's candidates may apply for this internship. We will also consider recent graduates – within 12 months of graduation, when the internship begins Possess strong foundational art skills, and 3D asset production skills Be proficient in Maya, ZBrush and Substance Painter The ideal candidate will be energetic, self-motivated, communicative, creative, and responsible, and also have a genuine interest in video games and art. Internship Details: This is a paid, full-time internship. The student must be available to intern 5 days per week for approximately 40 hours a week. The duration of internship is flexible, but we expect at least an 8-week commitment from our interns. This role is based in Burbank, California, Durham, North Carolina, or remote.

Senior U.I. Artist in Climax Studios

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Climax Studios was established nearly 30 years ago, we have an extensive history in developing all kinds of digital experiences across all formats, and we have won multiple awards along the way. We have a state of the art studio located in the heart of the beautiful Gunwharf Quays in Portsmouth overlooking the Harbour. You take your creativity seriously and games should be what get you fired up and passionate. At Climax we embrace those who see things in a different way and aren’t afraid to try-out new things and push themselves out of their comfort zones. For this stand out opportunity, we are looking for a talented and versatile fully remote UI Artist, we require a highly organised individual to help create and implement a complicated user interfaces. Requirements Responsible for creating game UI compliant with the game design, both technically and aesthetically Designing, creating and exporting 2D textures and icons using Illustrator and Photoshop. Creating, animating and exporting working interface files for use in game. Work with the art teams to ensure consistency between vision and implementation of interface designs Contributing original ideas towards all aspects of the UI design. The artist will also produce in game graphic design related assets, such as advertising and fonts to tie the in-game environments to the Front-end and HUD. QUALIFICATIONS A degree in Graphic Design/ Art or related degree (3D Graphics/Fine Art) Minimum of 3 years experience as a UI Artist in the games industry with a published game in your folio. Experience of working within a team. SKILLS Strong experience creating game front-end systems design and functionality. Experience with Adobe XD and/or Figma, and After Effects for motion concepts The successful candidate will need to demonstrate a core understanding of good graphics, iconography and typography. Able to demonstrate comprehensive understanding of good UX and Good UI, Experience creating UI in an Unreal project is essential. You should have a strong background in Graphic Design, with excellent Photoshop and Illustrator skills. Video editing skills useful for making trailers and gameplay footage. Knowledge of 3D construction using Maya or Max would be a bonus. Benefits Regular social events Cycle To Work Scheme Pension Fresh fruit and snacks A friendly, focused, ambitious and relaxed working environment Ongoing training and development, with career progression Discount card for all the shopping centre stores Great seafront location, a short walk from the rail station, bars, restaurants, coffee shops Group Private Medical Insurance provided by BUPA Group Life Insurance Employee Assistance Programme Private Dental Insurance Group Income Protection Company Pension Scheme Cycle To Work Scheme Eye-Care Vouchers Perks Bring your doggo to work! We're a dog friendly studio, bring your pooch in to meet us. Bean to cup coffee machine in the studio. Fresh fruit and healthy snacks provided daily, breakfast and some not so healthy snacks. In-house clubs and socials. From board games, tennis, football to D&D nights, there are lots of opportunities to socialise. Regular Socials including Project Wrap Parties, team and studio events, Christmas and annual Summer parties and soem great charity fundraising events.

Jobs available in Remote Job

Disruptive Games is a veteran development studio specializing in multiplayer and online experiences. We are an independently owned studio working on a AAA, fully-funded title with original IP! We’re expanding our fully-remote team with people who share our passion for collaborative, multiplayer gameplay. We're looking for a Principal Animator to support our team in animating an incredible game. What You'll Do Mentor a small team of animators, setting animation standards and receiving/providing feedback to ensure the highest quality work Create prototyping animations and other benchmarking assets Produce high quality keyframe animations with a focus on style Collaborate with design to define things like expression, timing, and animation styles for core systems from the ground up, iterating on animations from initial blocking to shippable quality Collaborate effectively with other art functions, production, design, and engineering teams Advocate for and drive improvements to our animation pipeline, helping our team to push the style of our animations forward Implement and maintain animations in Unreal Engine Identify and advocate for solutions to potential areas of risk Support the Art Team in interviewing, hiring, and training new team members Partner closely with Principal Technical Animator on workflow pipelines and asset creation What You'll Bring 5+ years of game industry animation experience, with 2+ years at the senior level Animation portfolio demonstrating process and quality Expert in first person animation, implementation, and debugging Solid stylistic eye for body mechanics and timing of gameplay moments Comfortable with industry standard software and engines (Maya and Unreal Engine strongly preferred) Excellent ability to give and receive feedback, with a specific emphasis on mentoring more junior animators Experience in partnering with outsourcing teams A passion for games! Bonus Points Experience in the implementation of animation blueprints in Unreal Engine Experience in first-person and third-person character animation Disruptive Games is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Senior Technical Animator (Games) in TLM Partners

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Are you looking to change the gaming industry? We are! TLM Partners is a world-class digital entertainment company dedicated to breaking down barriers in the video game industry. We publish captivating and original indie games that bring people together through our best-in-class cross-play technology, while our professional services arm and cloud-based, fully-remote studio ensure that talent and expertise are always where they are needed most. TLM is at the forefront of making games and game development more accessible than ever. Gaming together. Anytime. Anywhere. Any device.™ Position Summary: Senior Technical Animator (Gameplay) Must have 5+ years of game development experience as a Technical Animator, or 2+ years as a Senior Technical Animator in AAA UE4 game development, with a minimum of 1 game shipped for PC and 8th/9th Gen Console as a Senior Technical Animator. Portfolio/Reel demonstrating your knowledge and talent is required, along with the willingness to take a test, if asked. As a Senior Technical Animator you will join a team of technical animators and animators to support the creation, integration, and optimization of animation content. Fulltime, 100% Remote position. We are an Unreal studio. Best-in-class benefits & work flexibility. Reports to: Animation Director Responsibilities Collaborate with other Animators and Directors to create, test, and maintain animation rigs and systems. Be responsible for creating, optimizing, and maintaining gameplay animation graphs. Work closely with the Animation Leads to ensure quality of milestone deliverables that are both visually impactful and data efficient. Assist the Lead Technical Animator establish and refine Tech Animation workflows and asset conventions while also helping to maintain a database of technical documentations. Function as an integral member of a cross-disciplinary group of Artists, Animators, and Designers that innovate and elevate capabilities and capacities of our company. Continuously vet and test our internal tools, assets, and systems for appropriateness and robustness. Coordinate with our Art Outsource Managers in reviewing and integrating assets created by external vendors and partners. Learning is one of our core values, as such, mentor others within your team and/or across departments Required Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Animation, Science, or Engineering. 5+ years experience in technical animation for games with at least 1 successful AAA, UE4 games shipped on PC and 8th/9th Gen Console as a Senior Technical Animator in the last 3 years. Portfolio that demonstrates your impressive skills and understanding of animation principles, and the tools that enable animators to create and iterate quickly. Great communication and organizational skills in working with others throughout the entire game development process. Expertise with MotionBuilder and Maya or 3DS Max. Expertise with creating, optimizing, and owning gameplay animation graphs. Excellent knowledge of Python, MEL and/or other scripting languages. Working knowledge of C, C++, or C# preferred. Demonstrated experience with MOCAP and keyframe integration and optimization for UE4. Excellent understanding of UE4 animation systems and Blueprints. Ability to create and maintain technical documentation as needed. Proficiency with tools used for feedback, tracking, and integration. Shotgun, JIRA, and Perforce experience is preferred. Desired Qualifications Experience with creating cloth and hair physics systems. Strong math skills: 3D math, dot arithmetic, and working knowledge of analytic geometry. Working knowledge of OpenSource tools such as Blender. Experience developing games on PS5, XBX, and XB1.

Apply Now

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

We’re looking for a Pixel Artist contractor to work on our in-development magic school RPG Witchbrook! We are an independent and self-funded indie studio and publisher, with three in-house titles: Starbound, Wargroove and Witchbrook. We have also published: Eastward, Stardew Valley, Risk of Rain, and many more. We are passionate about what we do, and are looking for someone who shares this passion. Our team is very friendly and we take pride in having a no-crunch policy, 4-day work week, and full creative independence. Successful applicants will be joining us to help develop Witchbrook on a contract basis. We are open to applicants from all over the world so long as you can match our in-house hours. To apply please fill in the form below with your CV, portfolio, availability, and day rate. Requirements: Excellent pixel art skills and general 2D art skills Confident character and environment animation (pixel art) Self-motivated and proactive attitude towards work Ability to adapt to different art styles Able to explore and experiment – sketches, mockups etc. based on rough briefs Great communication skills – sharing and receiving feedback and keeping the team up to date with their work Able to match our in-house hours (between 9-to-5 and 10-to-6) Please feel free to let us know if we need to accommodate disability-related requests

Responsibilities Create new 3D assets as needed for a Unity-based strategy game, including mesh creation and materials. Modify, repurpose, and optimize existing assets as necessary. Import and set up assets in the Unity engine, then test them out in VR. Work with an eye toward performance, keeping assets within budget, and meeting other technical specs. Collaborate with the team to profile problem areas and rework assets to consistently hit our target frame rate. Work independently to solve problems and get your work done, but know when to collaborate to complete tasks more efficiently. Correctly scope work and provide time estimates that you are able to hit to deliver key milestones. Collaborate with our virtual team including other artists and the art lead from your home office on the equipment we provide. Work core hours in the North American Central time zone with the rest of our team. You'll play a critical role in shaping our game's look and how our artists work. We are open to a wide range of seniority levels with a focus on environments and lighting, asset pipelines and implementation, materials, shaders, and procedural generation. Tell us about your past experiences and tech art areas of expertise and interest! Responsibilities Discover and innovate creative solutions for procedurally generated environmental assets and lighting solutions. Develop the tools and pipelines to allow our design and art teams to ship amazing game content at scale Educate and support environmental artists and design teams on asset development and level design best practices Ensure game art content is technically correct, functional, and within budget. Collaboratively review art assets developed by in-house team members and outsourced teams, helping to ensure that everything we create is achieving our established quality and style standards. Tactfully communicate ideas and feedback on how to improve artwork, processes, game design, and company culture. Embrace and uphold our Core Values. Listening to and empowering the stories of others, while contributing your own story to Lightforge’s development. Requirements Experience in the following areas of technical art: Lighting Shaders Modular Environment Pipelines Materials Procedural Generation Tools & Pipeline Development Performance Asset Implementation Fundamental knowledge of color, light, shape design, composition, and movement Ability to communicate feedback in a concise and constructive way - including to resources external to the studio Self-motivated and proactive, with ability to fully embrace a remote work culture. Pluses Working knowledge of Houdini Python knowledge Experience with multi-platform games and art requirements, particularly with Unreal Character pipeline shader creation experience If this sounds like a job you might be suited for, but maybe you think you're not quite ready, we’d love to hear from you anyway! We are looking for someone with both technical and artistic skills to support us making both player and environmental VFX. Our game is moderately stylized. Someone who is excited by both sci-fi and fantasy VFX should feel empowered to make exciting effects. Unity experience is a must. A strong portfolio / demo reel is required. Lunchbox Entertainment is fully remote and is looking for developers who are adept at using Discord, and Google Meet to stay connected and interact with one another in a collaborative manner. Main office hours are between 10am - 6pm EST. Responsibilities Create real-time particle systems and effects in the Unity Engine Work with the art director and design team to build gameplay driving VFX Collaborate with the concept art team on building out the visual look of each effect Integrate VFX into the game in Unity Respond to feedback from visual and gameplay perspectives Qualifications 2+ Years of experience in the Games Industry Shipped Content (Title, DLC, Itch.IO, Mods, etc) High standards of visual art execution Knowledge of 3D modeling packages & other resources to build supplemental materials (Substance, After Effects, Photoshop, etc.) Knowledge of shader graph Ability to work within highly technical pipelines Experience creating custom VFX Expert understanding of Unity Particles Solid understanding of Unity Shaders Technical art expertise, or experience working with a technical artist Able to generate VFX content (meshes, sprites, etc) Nice to Have: Knowledge of MOBAs or other strategy type games Understanding of scripting or programming concepts Animation and other technical skills Please apply with reel, portfolio and resume

Technical Animator in Cloud Imperium Games

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

As a Technical Animator, you will be part of an industry leading team of veterans focused on delivering the pinnacle of animation pipelines and technologies to our company. We are always looking to the future to inspire us here and now, and endeavour to bring to life the best in new inspiring technologies in our field. This is a broad mandate and covers a great deal of technology that our company relies upon, including next gen facial animation rigs, human and creature body animation rigs, industry leading Maya animation pipeline, Cross platform deformation plugin technologies, source control file management and curation, external pipeline integration, animation implementation. The list is extensive, but the philosophy is simple - to make highly technical pipelines and procedures accessible and usable for the rest of the company. Founded in 2012, Cloud Imperium Games creates cutting-edge videogames that defy expectations. We’re currently developing Star Citizen, a record-breaking multiplayer online space sim, and Squadron 42, a cinematic single-player adventure set in the same universe. Join us as we break boundaries and make videogame history. What do our Technical Animators do? Collaborate with various cross-functional teams to bring characters and vehicles to life. Create, maintain, and support technical animation pipelines and tools to deliver cutting-edge animations and workflows. Support multiple animation teams in developing their own pipeline requirements and ideas, with a view to benefiting the team as a whole. Implement how characters within the project will interact, transition, and function from concept to final implementation in CryEngine. What do we expect from our Technical Animators? Experience with Maya animation and rigging systems. Familiarity with coding languages, such as Python and/or C++. Ability to effectively understand and communicate technical animation requirements across a range of disciplines. A proactive hands-on approach, with a drive to get animation in game and working well for the players. Ability to work well in a cooperative, cross-functional agile team environment. Diversity Statement CIG is a global company, staunchly committed to cultivating a culture and workplace that celebrates all backgrounds, lifestyles, and perspectives. Together, we are creating a space where authentic recognition, appreciation, and understanding of the importance of diversity is fostered by everyone. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we strive to build a team that represents all walks of life, and we want every employee to bring all the things that make them unique to the work environment. The universe is as vast and varied as the people in it, and it’s our differences that make it special. Fraud Statement We are aware of people receiving job offers that fraudulently allege to be from CIG. These types of fraud can be carried out through false websites, fake email addresses claiming to be from our company, or social media. We do not ask for your personal info like bank account numbers, identification numbers, etc through social media or chat-based apps, nor do we request or send money for the purchase of business equipment. If you suspect fraud, please report it to your local authorities, as well as reaching out to us at info[@]cloudimperiumgames.com with any information you may have.

Lead Games Artist (Casual Games) in Kwalee

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Kwalee is one of the world’s leading multiplatform game publishers and developers, with well over 750 million downloads worldwide for mobile hits such as Draw It, Teacher Simulator, Let’s Be Cops 3D, Traffic Cop 3D and Makeover Studio 3D. Alongside this, we also have a growing PC and Console team of incredible pedigree that is on the hunt for great new titles to join TENS!, Eternal Hope and Die by the Blade. With a team of talented people collaborating daily between our studios in Leamington Spa, Bangalore and Beijing, or on a remote basis from Turkey, Brazil, the Philippines and many more places, we have a truly global team making games for a global audience. And it’s paying off: Kwalee games have been downloaded in every country on earth! If you think you’re a good fit for one of our remote vacancies, we want to hear from you wherever you are based. Founded in 2011 by David Darling CBE, a key architect of the UK games industry who previously co-founded and led Codemasters for many years, our team also includes legends such as Andrew Graham (creator of Micro Machines series) and Jason Falcus (programmer of classics including NBA Jam) alongside a growing and diverse team of global gaming experts. Everyone contributes creatively to Kwalee’s success, with all employees eligible to pitch their own game ideas on Creative Wednesdays, and we’re proud to have built our success on this inclusive principle. Could your idea be the next global hit? What’s the job? As our Lead Games Artist you’ll be part of the Casual Games team creating eye-catching art for our mobile games, both leading the team and creating art yourself. What you will really be doing Being responsible for art on multiple casual game projects. Leading, mentoring, and developing a small art team; ensuring they deliver a successful project on time Working closely with the Art Director to establish visual identity, adding to and maintaining style guides. Creating and maintaining workflows and pipelines that help improve efficiency. Getting hands on and helping out with content creation, integration and quality control Helping carry out key department responsibilities including hiring, training and issue res How you will be doing this You’ll be part of an agile, multidisciplinary and creative team and work closely with them to ensure the best results. You'll think creatively and be motivated by challenges and constantly striving for the best. You’ll work with cutting edge technology, if you need software or hardware to get the job done efficiently, you will get it. We even have a robot! Team Our talented team is our signature. We have a highly creative atmosphere with more than 200 staff where you’ll have the opportunity to contribute daily to important decisions. You’ll work within an extremely experienced, passionate and diverse team, including David Darling and the creator of the Micro Machines video games. Skills and requirements At least 5 years of experience as an artist in the game industry, with at least one shipped title in the casual mobile game space Excellent communication and problem solving skills as a leader, collaborator and mentor. Excellent time management skills, able to meet deadlines and multitask A professional, pro-active & collaborative work attitude. Extensive knowledge of Unity (and/or other game engines), pipelines and processes High level of proficiency in 2D and 3D. The ability to work in a variety of styles and genres A portfolio demonstrating the development of brands/IPs for casual mobile games A passion for mobile gaming, casual games in particular We offer We want everyone involved in our games to share our success, that’s why we have a generous team profit sharing scheme from day 1 of employment Creative Wednesdays! (Design and make your own games every Wednesday) Great work-life balance with flexible working hours Quarterly team building days - work hard, play hard! Monthly employee awards Our philosophy We firmly believe in creativity and innovation and that a fundamental requirement for a successful and happy company is having the right mix of individuals. With the right people in the right environment anything and everything is possible. Kwalee makes games to bring people, their stories, and their interests together. As an employer, we’re dedicated to making sure that everyone can thrive within our team by welcoming and supporting people of all ages, races, colours, beliefs, sexual orientations, genders and circumstances. With the inclusion of diverse voices in our teams, we bring plenty to the table that’s fresh, fun and exciting; it makes for a better environment and helps us to create better games for everyone! This is how we move forward as a company – because these voices are the difference that make all the difference. WHO WE ARE At Fortis Games we aspire to make great games that bring people together while redefining how game companies work. We believe in building a sense of belonging through our games, their communities, and how we operate and treat each other. Through our game communities, we will create powerful connections and lasting memories. We will foster a culture of diversity, equity and belonging where together our diverse skills, experiences and background impact the games we make. We are an early but mighty organization with a leadership team of game industry veterans. There are many opportunities for you to have a big impact on the products we’ll be making as well as the overall direction of the company. If you’re passionate about tackling difficult problems with direct and thoughtful communication and team first mentality, we may be the right place for you. ABOUT THE ROLE (THE MISSION, WHY THIS ROLE EXISTS, THE THING YOU DO OVER AND OVER AGAIN) Work with product and marketing teams to develop a visual style and world setting that maximizes the commercial success of our original IP games. Define and uphold the quality bar of our aesthetics - visual targets, style guides, reviews, etc. Help build, lead, and nurture the growth of a team of talented artists. WHAT YOU’LL ACHIEVE (OUTCOMES VS WHAT PEOPLE WILL DO) A visual style that has broad appeal while being distinct and memorable. We aspire for our original IP to have the potential to cross over into multiple games, genres, and media. A set of processes that effectively uphold the quality bar and onramp new team members or vendors. An efficient and scalable art pipeline that can provide a foundation for future games. A highly effective and engaged team of talented artists who push themselves and one another to their fullest potential. WHAT YOU’LL NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL (COMPETENCIES) Ability to communicate your creative vision, process, decisions, and rationale to team members and cross-functional stakeholders in a way that inspires and motivates. Ability to direct a team across a wide range of visual styles in both 2D & 3D. Proven artistic talent and a firm understanding of traditional art and design principles. A strong understanding of the practical implications that different visual styles have on not just art, but also product, design, marketing, and engineering. Enthusiasm for directing, mentoring, and otherwise elevating the people around you to do their best work. A natural curiosity and eagerness to learn - we believe this is essential to our ability to stay ahead of the market and value this over years of experience. We expect our leaders to continue being students of their craft and the game spaces they’re working in. You should be educated on the latest trends and have a strong perspective on how they relate to our current and future projects. #LI-Remote **PLEASE SEND ALL RESUMES AND PORTFOLIOS IN ENGLISH.** WHY JOIN US There are many reasons to join us, but here are a few: We strongly believe we are changing how games studios operate and at the core of what we do is making great games that create a connected community Culture of diversity and inclusion and support to all team members Work with some of the industry's coolest people who have designed and launched the best games in the world Fortis is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Lead VFX Artist | Unity | Video Games in 1518 Studios

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Title: Lead VFX Artist Location: Anywhere in N & S America, Europe The ideal candidate in this role is an experienced VFX Artist in games, with a balance of technical problem solving and artistic skill and a passion for all manner of VFX, from gameplay and combat driven systems, to environmental atmospherics and destruction. With a highly collaborative development culture at PTW/1518, experience at effectively working and communicating alongside a diverse team, across all departments and specialization, to solve ambitious visual, gameplay, and technical problems together, is extremely important for success in this role In This Role You will design and implement high-quality AAA VFX to support gameplay and art direction. Create and optimize VFX to run within performance limitations. Work closely with art, animation, design, and programming team to anticipate and solve challenges within given constraints and visual requirements. Translate references, concept art, game design briefs, and verbal directions into prototypes and implement real-time VFX in-game. We are looking for Mid to senior level of professional VFX experience in the game industry and you must have a strong reel/portfolio showing executed real-time FX work with a minimum of one shipped AAA game. What you’ll be doing Creating amazing looking real time FX with Unity. Collaborate with the Art, Gameplay, Design, and Animation teams to develop in-game FX elements, from early look development and prototyping to final polished implementation. Use our engine authoring toolset, Maya, Houdini, Substance, and various other supplemental FX authoring packages to create stunning VFX particles, systems, textures, and simulations. Directly implement VFX content, including in-world placement and scripting of systemic/gameplay driven behaviours Contribute to the development and enhancement of our proprietary engine VFX systems, including particle effect authoring and scripting and sequencing tools and pipelines. Placing and triggering FX within the world. Working with the Art, Design and Engineering teams to find solutions to artistic challenges. Develop a deep understanding of the art direction and create effects to support the vision. Create effects to realistic performance budgets and take ownership of the memory and performance costs of your effects. Requirements What we’re looking for Experience of creating Realtime particle effects in Unity Experience of using industry-standard content creation software (e.g. Maya, 3ds Max, Photoshop, Substance) to create assets to use in-engine. Experience as a VFX artist in games, using a real-time authoring toolset (Unity) Experience with various supplemental 3D and VFX authoring packages (Maya, Houdini, Substance, etc.) Portfolio that demonstrates a breadth of both technical and artistic execution of real-time VFX Interest for games and the future of Virtual Reality Experience with shaders. Strong Unity skills and experience with other appropriate features: Knowledge of game production pipeline and life cycle. A critical eye for the timing, animation, and motion of real-world objects and visual FX Ability to create all art needed for the FX from prototype to final FX Desire and knowledge of how to push our effects, editing tools, and pipeline further Experience with scripting in Blueprint, Python, etc is a plus Abilities in secondary areas such as modelling, skinning, animation, or lighting Experience working with multiple platforms memory limitations Experience with real-time networked multiplayer games Passionate about games and art in games. Benefits What we offer Attractive Remuneration You will be working for the pre-eminent global provider of specialist services to the games industry and provided with full training and the opportunity to work on some of the biggest games titles in the world. Competitive remuneration, holidays, regular team competitions with great prizes; and inclusion into an extensive social calendar. Collaborative team-work with people from all around the world, different nationalities and languages. A supportive community inclusive of LGBTQ+, and any age, ethnicity, religion, or disability. We care about the wellbeing of our employees and have a dedicated employee wellbeing programme. Who we are 35+ Studios &vert; 26+ Years of Experience &vert;1,000+ Products &vert; 60+ Awards for Clients &vert; 8,500+ Employees PTW is a video games services company that supports video game developers and publishers through outsourced production services. We started 25 years ago and since then, have grown exponentially year on year to where we are today. Our history is in gaming, and we are gamers at heart. In our time within the games industry, we have worked on over 1500 titles across all genres and all platforms, including 8 out of the past 10 Game-Of-The-Year-winning titles. We have grown rapidly over the past few years and now have 35 sites spanning the globe. The PTW Family of Brands includes SIDE, 1518, and Orange Rock. SIDE works at the cutting edge of interactive media as a provider of audio services for the global entertainment market. Orange Rock is our in-house game and product development studio. 1518 is our award-winning global art studio providing art-related services at every stage of the game or app development process. 1518 Our in-house art team offers the highest-quality assets: from 2D concept design to 3D animation, in-game to package art, smartphone to VR, we make everything look amazing. 1518 Ranged across time zones and countries, we’re a diverse group of tech wizards, engineers, and strategists, with over 25 years combined on-the-job experience. Alongside our internationally-acclaimed art directors, artists, and animators, we’re building immersive game worlds through Art and Co-Dev. Our client list includes Electronic Arts, Google, Jam City, Disney, Warner Bros, and Uber. No detail is too small or insignificant, and no vision is too big or ambitious. Let’s make beautiful worlds together! Our Values Pole To Win's core values are imbued across our global organization: Reinforced by our actions and our attitudes. Echoed throughout our approach to our operations and our clients. Exemplified by our culture, and most of all, our people. We build people and their careers. We actively turn to team mates for counsel, inspiration, and diverse perspectives. Relationships are built on mutual respect. Personal and professional integrity is our guiding principle. We are honest, authentic, transparent, and ethically sound. Our primary goal is to advance our clients' businesses and their customers' satisfaction. We set the bar for generating imaginative and effective solutions for the most challenging problems. We move with speed and agility. We love what we do. We have unwavering loyalty to our DNA, our culture, our values, and ourselves. Welcome to PTW, Family of Brands 1518 STUDIOS

Lead Environment Artist in Midwinter Entertainment

Requires Skils: NA

Jobs available in Remote Job

Midwinter is looking for a full-time Environment Artist to join our talented development team! We are based in Seattle, but currently operating remotely throughout the West Coast. This is a lead level position that requires technical knowledge and shipped game experience in Unreal Engine 4. We are a small team of artists, designers and engineers working on something awesome. If you are passionate about beautiful environments, have a great looking portfolio and often find yourself getting under the hood in UE4, we'd love to hear from you! As a Lead Environment Artist, you will partner directly with designers, artists and engineers to develop and optimize the beautiful frozen wasteland in Scavengers. You will be working directly in Unreal Engine 4 editor with special attention on the Material Editor, Foliage Tools, Landscape Materials and in Blueprint. RESPONSIBILITIES Generate benchmark quality, highly performant realtime Assets and Materials in UE4. Review and optimize environment art for high performance on a wide array of GPU's. Plan outsourcing assignments, review and approve incoming work from Outsource Partners for consistency and quality. Work closely with many disciplines on a small, nimble and highly experienced team. Help establish World Art workflow and pipelines and create inhouse tools with Unreal Engine Blueprints. Organize, track, and scope the work for yourself and the world art team members. Lead an environment team, which includes regular check-ins with team members, providing direction, and mentoring other team members. Help create a positive and creative work environment for yourself and your peers. QUALIFICATIONS Familiarity with modular level construction. Ability to reuse existing assets in interesting and creative ways. Solid understanding of performance and GPU rendering for creating optimized realtime content in large, streamed worlds. Deep knowledge of Unreal Engine 4, with attention towards Landscapes, Foliage, Collision Systems, Material Editor, Node Based Shader Construction and Blueprint Design. Experience developing tools to support Procedurally Generated Content. Attention to detail and beauty as demonstrated in a world-class art portfolio. Outstanding communication and collaboration skills. Experience supporting environment art in a live, operating service is a plus. Ability to help develop and consistently execute an art directed visual style. Ability to scope and track major parts of the World Art content, and identify and communicate production risks. Experience using Houdini software is a plus. While we think the above experience could be important, we’re keen to hear from people who believe they have valuable experience to bring to the role. If you identify with the team and mission, but not all of our requirements, then please still apply!! COVID-19 Studio Guidelines The health, safety, and well being of our team members is of the utmost importance to our studio. As such, we have transitioned to remote work by default until a time at which we can safely return to the office. This means that all interviews, "onsite" interviews, office tours, and onboarding will be done over video conference (or phone). We also recognize the impact the pandemic is having on all of us personally, and work hard to create a culture where mental health and wellness are valued and supported. If you have any questions or concerns about our studio policy, please don't hesitate to raise them with your recruiter. JOIN US AND WE'LL KEEP WARM TOGETHER! Midwinter Entertainment, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.
