What we'll need from you: You’re stylistically diverse, organised and precise. You have a deep understanding of the roles and workflows of an UI art team, how an art team and the wider development team operates and integrates and supports with those workflows You’re a fantastic Graphic Designer with a good knowledge of art theory Expert knowledge of User Interface theory and practice - terminology and best practices Expert knowledge of typical UI and graphic design tools and a general knowledge of typical art tools and game engines Ability to create and present high level documentation, style guides, ideation, etc Ability to advise team members on UI production matters - solid experience with production tools like Jira Attention to detail with a strong ability to analyse and comprehend Visual Direction A good communicator with the ability to verbalise conceptual thoughts and the willingness to accept constructive critique What would help: Previous experience in a similar role is highly desirable Experience working on several projects concurrently Experience of direct communication with clients UI concept art and White Box Wire Framing experience

You will work on department level projects and operational efficiency projects. Responsibilities: You will work with Senior Engineers, creating test plans You will need an eye for test cases that would be good candidates for automation, and ability to write test steps in Gherkins or other automation frameworks You will need to understand and construct SQL statements Coordinate multiple work streams in task execution and task management Comfortable working with internal and external teams Comfortable working with different domain experts across different time zones Prioritize the player first, ensuring that feedback is delivered with the community in mind while still accounting for development constraints such as timelines and budgets Create test scenarios and scripts supporting requirements for both manual and automation testing Implement test cases, test plans and suites, defect tracking and regression tests Be a process advocate. Both for efficiencies on your team, and for behaviors that bring defects into the product upstream Be data minded individual to ingest Indicators and make informed decisions. Propose solutions to resolve trends that have negative impacts on product quality Create reports to multiple teams to communicate what quality is using data Identify and escalate risk that impacts project goals proposing potential solutions Work with Engineers to perform Root cause analysis on crash logs and crash trends using tools such as Backtrace, Crashlytics, or Big Query Mentor and cultivate junior members within their project team Qualifications: Intermediate knowledge of programming language preferred (Python, C#, C++, SQL, JSON, Unreal). 5 years of experience in a software development environment. 2+ years experience working directly with game engines preferred (Unity, Unreal Engine, Etc). You are comfortable working with Engineering teams and can think like an Engineer when communicating what good is for internal tool development. Experience shipping mobile software as QA professional. In depth knowledge of game production lifecycle and live services Experience applying data to tell a story Advocate for best in class quality principles. Bachelor's degree in related field: (Computer Science, Game Development, Business). Proficient with test case management software (Test Rail, TM4J, Zephyr, etc). Proficient with Jira, Grafana, Power BI, Data Dog Experience and hands-on with test automation About EA We exist to inspire the world to play. Through innovative technology and immersive storytelling, we deliver new ways of experiencing worlds of interactive entertainment for our millions of players worldwide. Our strength lies in the diversity of our people, combining creativity, innovation and passion. We fully champion inclusive culture, and provide opportunities for growing, learning, and leading that allows for the most impactful and rewarding work of our teams’ careers. We put our people first, and we make sure they’re taken care of both in and out of the office. As we reflect on our learnings and successes from remote work, we aim to provide dynamic, collaborative and flexible work environments for our teams. Our employees connect through our Employee Resource Groups, which are actively involved in driving business decisions every step of the way. But our support doesn’t end at the workplace—we also encourage a balanced lifestyle with paid time off and new parent leave, free video games, fitness reimbursement and more. Our goal is to provide a safe, respectful and inspiring workplace for all of our employees. Through our diversity, equity, inclusion and social responsibility programs, we’re doing the work to give everyone the space to be their full selves while giving back to our community. We’re looking for problem-solvers, game-changers, innovators, dreamers, doers—people that are ready to move the needle and build on our success. As our industry accelerates, we aren’t just keeping up—we’re staying ahead of the game. Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Electronic Arts also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

UI Artist in Hypixel Studios

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

We're looking for a UI Artist to join our team, which collaborates remotely from around the world. Our members range from industry newcomers to experts with 25+ years of experience. Team members come from a diverse set of backgrounds, but share a common passion for building polished player-focused, community-powered games. At Hypixel Studios we are looking for applicants that are demonstrably passionate about their hobbies, have the drive and commitment to deliver results with minimal supervision, have international-level professional competency in their skill sets, and can demonstrate involvement with other interesting projects throughout their lives. The ideal candidate for our UI/UX team will create amazing player experiences through their knowledge of interface design, color theory, visual hierarchy, and illustration. The candidate will be responsible for creating deliverables that captivate players through impeccable visual design, while seamlessly allowing them to achieve their goals in the game’s various interfaces. As a player first designer, you will be responsible for collaborating with other disciplines such as game design, UX, and audio to create a consistent and meaningful experience between the player and the game. Who you are: You are an artist who not only creates beautiful art, but puts the player at the heart of your work, solving problems which help them seamlessly interact with the game You have an exceptional eye for aesthetics and can help maintain, develop, and define consistent UI throughout the game experience You’re organized, and demonstrate this through attention to detail not only in your art but within the way your work is arranged and communicated You’re an excellent communicator and are passionate about working across disciplines to advocate for your craft You’re player focused; you have a track record of creating interfaces that focus on clarity and usability, in addition to visual design Some of your role: Collaborate with other artists to maintain and push the boundaries of our UI art style Create visually balanced and player focused mockups that demonstrate a solid understanding of readability, clarity, typography, and visual hierarchy Create, iterate, and define the iconography and UI style guide for Hytale Communicate with other disciplines, demonstrating and defining your work Work closely with UX to bring wireframes and prototypes to life through use of visual design principles Essential Traits: Exceptional talent in creating UI designs focused on 2D and/or 3D art Expert level ability to work with Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects or comparable industry tools Proven knowledge of UI design fundamentals such as layout, animation, and typography A player focused problem solver, and passionate about creating innovative solutions A personal passion for games and staying on top of the latest trends in the industry Bonus Traits: A proven track record of creating UI art in a shipped AAA title Experience with creating wireframes and prototypes demonstrating user needs Experience with implementing UI in a game engine A personal passion for open world, builder, or survival games A minimum of a BA/BS degree in a related field such as graphic design, visual design, interaction design, etc. We can offer: A chance to work on a new game project with an extremely motivated team Opportunities to learn and grow personally and professionally A stable and secure work environment The ability to work remotely and experience a healthy work-life balance We’re looking for applicants who are self-driven, put players first, and that have a history of making cool stuff. In return, we can offer an environment that values and supports individual creativity and passion and believes in fostering new talent. We recognize the value of diversity in every sense and actively encourage candidates from diverse backgrounds to apply.

Join a rapidly growing game studio as we scale up to support and deliver content for a game designed to be played for years to come. As a studio founded by the community, developing games that players will love is truly at the heart of what we do. At Omeda Studios, we believe that community feedback is integral to the development of games that players will not want to put down. Having recently closed a $20m Series A funding round, we've populated the studio with an exciting mix of industry veterans and community talent and we want you to be a part of shaping and executing our vision and the challenges that await us. We're keen to speak to all levels so do get in touch for an informal chat! In This Role You Will Driving prototyping and implementation of major creative UI screens and flows in Unreal Engine 5 Working with other disciplines to ensure that UI meets aesthetic and functional requirements Attending to every detail, especially with regard to compliance, layout, and design Architect and implement new UI systems Contributing ideas toward all aspects of the game’s production and development Writing robust, maintainable C++ and Blueprint logic What We're Looking For Comfortable communicating with other team members on a daily basis Strong understanding of object orientated programming in a modern language (C++, C# etc) Excel at problem-solving and troubleshooting Experience with multithreading, asynchronous, and event-driven programming Enthusiastic about UX and UI design Keen eye for improving the user experience Nice to Have Experience in building UI Widgets in UE5 (or equivalent) Online service integration experience Console Experience Experience writing code in a networked multiplayer context Benefits Global, remote team 33 days holiday inclusive of bank holidays EMI Stock Options Healthcare More to come!

Game Economy Designer in Kwalee

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

Kwalee is one of the world’s leading multiplatform game publishers and developers, with well over 750 million downloads worldwide for mobile hits such as Draw It, Teacher Simulator, Let’s Be Cops 3D, Airport Security and Makeover Studio 3D. Alongside this, we also have a growing PC and Console team of incredible pedigree that is on the hunt for great new titles to join TENS!, Eternal Hope, Die by the Blade and Scathe. We have a team of talented people collaborating daily between our studios in Leamington Spa, Bangalore and Beijing, or on a remote basis from Turkey, Brazil, the Philippines and many more places, and we’ve recently acquired our first external studio, TicTales which is based in France. We have a truly global team making games for a global audience. And it’s paying off: Kwalee has been recognised with the Best Large Studio and Best Leadership awards from TIGA (The Independent Game Developers’ Association) and our games have been downloaded in every country on earth! Founded in 2011 by David Darling CBE, a key architect of the UK games industry who previously co-founded and led Codemasters for many years, our team also includes legends such as Andrew Graham (creator of Micro Machines series) and Jason Falcus (programmer of classics including NBA Jam) alongside a growing and diverse team of global gaming experts. Everyone contributes creatively to Kwalee’s success, with all employees eligible to pitch their own game ideas on Creative Wednesdays, and we’re proud to have built our success on this inclusive principle. Could your idea be the next global hit? What’s the job? As a Game Economy Designer you will be responsible for finding the optimal balance in our games of them being Free to Play but Beneficial to Spend, helping to make sure our game economy is healthy and doesn’t get out of hand over time. What you tell your friends you do “I take the great ingredients from the game team and season them to perfection to make everything extra tasty” What you will really be doing Working closely with designers and the analytics team to develop the right inputs, and measurements for evaluating a games economic patterns. Creating models for various interpretations of the game economy and forecasting player behaviours to find the right global maxima approach. Collaborate with the Art Leads to find the right information hierarchy and UI conventions to get information across to the user in a tone and style appropriate to each game. Working with the analytics department to understand the results of your work and the impact it has on player behaviour. From paper to playable you will be able to visualise the desired UX, both in UX tools or in Unity. Providing feedback based on your expertise on a wide range of games. How you will be doing this You’ll be part of an agile, multidisciplinary and creative team and work closely with them to ensure the best results. You'll think creatively and be motivated by challenges and constantly striving for the best. You’ll work with cutting edge technology, if you need software or hardware to get the job done efficiently, you can get it. Team Our talented team is our signature. We have a highly creative atmosphere with more than 150 staff where you’ll have the opportunity to contribute daily to important decisions. You’ll work within an extremely experienced, passionate and diverse team, including David Darling and the creator of the Micro Machines video games. Skills and requirements A minimum of 3 years experience in an economy design or balancing role within gaming. Can create models in industry standard tools to model player behaviours and the resultant economy impacts of those. Can devise the parameters and measurements for effective AB testing of game economy variations. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Ability to work creatively in a demanding team environment. Absolute passion for playing and making video games, especially mobile games. Strong creative ideas and imagination, able to entertain players with challenges, humour, surprises and fun. Positive attitude, self driven and able to work alone or as part of a team. Desirable Economics Degree or similar academic background Coding / prototyping skills to be able to create a simulation of the game economy. Experience of mobile game live ops, A/B testing and telemetry. We offer We want everyone involved in our games to share our success, that’s why we have a generous team profit sharing scheme from day 1 of employment Creative Wednesdays! (Design and make your own games every Wednesday) Great work-life balance with flexible working hours Quarterly team building days - work hard, play hard! Monthly employee awards Our philosophy We firmly believe in creativity and innovation and that a fundamental requirement for a successful and happy company is having the right mix of individuals. With the right people in the right environment anything and everything is possible. Kwalee makes games to bring people, their stories, and their interests together. As an employer, we’re dedicated to making sure that everyone can thrive within our team by welcoming and supporting people of all ages, races, colours, beliefs, sexual orientations, genders and circumstances. With the inclusion of diverse voices in our teams, we bring plenty to the table that’s fresh, fun and exciting; it makes for a better environment and helps us to create better games for everyone! This is how we move forward as a company – because these voices are the difference that make all the difference.

Senior Game Designer - Hypercasual Mobile Games in Kwalee

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

A Little Bit about Kwalee…. Kwalee is one of the world’s leading multiplatform game developers and publishers, with well over 900 million downloads worldwide for mobile hits such as Draw It, Teacher Simulator, Let’s Be Cops 3D, Airport Security and Makeover Studio 3D. We also have a growing PC and Console team of incredible pedigree that is on the hunt for great new titles to join TENS!, Eternal Hope, Die by the Blade and Scathe. What’s In It For You? Profit sharing scheme - we win, you win Quarterly Team Building days Pitch and make your own games on Creative Wednesdays! Flexible working hours - we trust you to choose how and when you work best All the equipment that you need to be properly set up Are You Up To The Challenge? As a Senior Game Designer you have a talent to create fun, exciting game experiences for our players. You’ll be an expert in all things hypercasual and an impressive track record of designing successful hypercasual games. Your Team Mates Your team is a diverse and creative group of designers from all around the world. Some are based in one of our offices, while others are working remotely. Instead of just being small cogs in a big machine, designers are given a large degree of freedom and responsibility over every game we make. What Does The Job Actually Involve? Working as part of the design team, taking responsibility for multiple mobile game projects, from an initial pitch all the way to global launch. Keeping track of market trends and coming up with game ideas that will be well received by the ever-changing hypercasual gaming audience. Designing compelling game mechanics using modern mobile design principles. Creating, balancing and tuning game mechanics, game difficulty and UI flow. Creating levels and additional content using Unity, for new and existing games. Evolving and adapting game designs based on play testing, feedback and live metrics. Driving long term player engagement by understanding mobile players needs and motivations. Your Hard Skills A minimum of 2 years experience in a game design role with at least one published Hypercasual game Experience creating hypercasual mobile games. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Knowledge of mobile free-to-play game monetisation and advertising techniques. Ability to work creatively in a demanding team environment. Absolute passion for playing and making video games, especially mobile games. Strong creative ideas and imagination, able to entertain players with challenges, humour, surprises and fun. Positive attitude, self driven, able to work alone or as part of a team. Your Soft Skills Kwalee has grown fast in recent years but we’re very much a family of colleagues. We welcome people of all ages, races, colours, beliefs, sexual orientations, genders and circumstances, and all we ask is that you collaborate, work hard, ask questions and have fun with your team and colleagues. We don’t like egos or arrogance and we love playing games and celebrating success together. If that sounds like you, then please apply. A Little More About Kwalee Founded in 2011 by David Darling CBE, a key architect of the UK games industry who previously co-founded and led Codemasters, our team also includes legends such as Andrew Graham (creator of Micro Machines series) and Jason Falcus (programmer of classics including NBA Jam) alongside a growing and diverse team of global gaming experts. Everyone contributes creatively to Kwalee’s success, with all employees eligible to pitch their own game ideas on Creative Wednesdays, and we’re proud to have built our success on this inclusive principle. We have an amazing team of experts collaborating daily between our studios in Leamington Spa, Lisbon, Bangalore and Beijing, or on a remote basis from Turkey, Brazil, Cyprus, the Philippines and many more places around the world. We’ve recently acquired our first external studio, TicTales, which is based in France. We have a truly global team making games for a global audience, and it’s paying off: - Kwalee has been voted the Best Large Studio and Best Leadership Team at the TIGA Awards (Independent Game Developers’ Association) and our games have been downloaded in every country on earth - including Antarctica!

Adaptive Business Systems Analyst in Unity

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

The Opportunity Unity is seeking a Workday/Adaptive Planning Analyst to join our Workday team! This individual will work in partnership with business partners and internal teams to ensure maximum value out of the Workday product suite. The role is responsible for providing Workday support across Workday module(s), understanding business partners requirements, and configuring, designing and delivering solutions that best fit their needs. What you’ll be doing Design, configure, test, and implement business requirements in Workday/Adaptive Planning module while prioritizing conflicting demands on small to medium results/projects across multiple, concurrent projects without supervision. Conduct working sessions with partners to gather, understand, and analyze business requirements. Assess FP&A needs and propose recommendations and/or alternative solutions to meet their goals. Advise partners on best practices, recognize, and recommend process improvements, and implement system enhancements. Frequently discuss and communicate lessons learned from previous experience and Workday standard methodologies. Perform research on problems, identify the true cause, and present/implement corrective measures. Seek opinions and feedback on alternative solutions from team members to solve needs. Provide mentorship and coaching to team members in area(s) of expertise. What we're looking for 2+ years experience leading and deploying Workday/Adaptive implementations, supporting Workday Post Production, or as a client of Workday. Particularly in the following areas: Security, Custom Reports, Dashboards and Calculated Fields Bachelor degree in finance, accounting, economics, or similar - must understand and be able to read/talk to common financial reports (income statement, balance sheet, cash flow) Superb communication skills, both verbal and written. Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with colleagues in a global working environment. Ability to prioritize and coordinate work to ensure overall timeliness and quality standards with little supervision. Ability to effectively manage against timelines, deadlines, and goals within a remote/global setting. Proven experience demonstrating initiative and curiosity to build skills in other areas both within and outside of Workday. You might also have Modelling and/or integration experience within the Adaptive Planning tool Functional knowledge of Workday Financials and Workday HCM structures (Company, Cost Center, Supervisory Org, GL Accounts, Spend Categories, Revenue Categories, etc.) Basic coding skills (Excel/VBA, SQL, reading API's) Life at Unity Unity (NYSE: U) is the world’s leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity is the foundation upon which the world’s most powerful digital content is created. Specifically, Unity’s platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices. In the fourth quarter of 2021, Unity had, on average, 3.9 billion monthly active end users who consumed content created or operated with its solutions. The applications developed by these creators were downloaded, on average, five billion times per month in 2021. For more information, please visit www.unity.com. Unity is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment and celebrate our employees across age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. Our differences are strengths that enable us to support the growing and evolving needs of our customers, partners, and collaborators. If there are preparations or accommodations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please fill out this form to let us know. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a sign

Lead UI Engineer in Crystal Dynamics

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

Crystal Dynamics is constantly seeking the best gaming talent worldwide to add to our 30-plus year legacy of AAAA game development creating new and iconic franchises. We are committed to making great games with great people and having an awesome time living the dream while doing it. Benefits for our full-time positions include, but are not limited to, a competitive regional salary, 100% employer-paid medical, dental, and vision insurance options, professional development reimbursement perk, flexible hybrid on-site/off-site work opportunities, 12 company paid holidays, additional 10 paid days in December when the studio is closed for holiday break, and the ability to accrue weeks of personal paid time-off. Join us and shape the future of an amazing studio culture committed to creating award-winning franchises like Tomb Raider, Marvel's Avengers, the next Perfect Dark, and more! Position Summary Come be a part of the future of Tomb Raider! The Lead UI Engineer is responsible for collaborating with both internal and external partners like the UX/UI Director to ensure their deliveries meet the quality standards established. The Lead UI Engineer serves as a broad expert on a centralized internal team in multiple areas related to architecture, as well as UI tools and features for their projects. This will be achieved by both working individually and leading a team of UI engineers with clarity, accountability and excellence by taking full ownership for their projects. This is a hands-on role that will require the Lead to do (at times) significant coding. Essential Duties & Responsibilities Collaborate and Co-develop with Game, Art, QA, and Tech Directors to establish functional pipelines and best practices to build a world class UI/UX system Recommends adoption of relevant technical approaches or improvements to process based on experience Develop, modify, and debug UI software in script and C/C++ Evaluate, optimize and test UI software on console and PC platforms to ensure performance Participate in the scheduling, design, performance and code review process Motivate and manage a small team of fellow UI engineers Works with other leads, peers, and non-technical clients to define, prioritize, and organize team backlogs, sprints and roadmaps Adapt to changing requirements, and to predict possible development issues or roadblocks Essential Requirements 5+ years experience in the game industry or other relevant experience Development experience with C++ and XAML Experience using UI middleware (XAML, Coherent, Noesis, etc.) Experience with current gen platforms: Xbox, PlayStation, and PC Excellent verbal and written communication skills for both technical and non-technical audiences, including productive feedback and brainstorming, creation of/contribution to technical design documents, code documentation, and Wiki/Web based documents Experience as a game or central technology programmer on multiple game titles throughout their life cycle Extensive knowledge of game architecture and development tools Bonus Skills & Experience Highly proficient programming within Unreal Engine Knowledge of ActionScript Crystal Dynamics is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to identifying and implementing positive and persistent measures to ensure equal opportunity in the recruitment, hiring, development, training, promotion and compensation of a diverse team employee group. Enemy Designer in Crystal Dynamics

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

Crystal Dynamics is constantly seeking the best gaming talent worldwide to add to our 30-plus year legacy of AAAA game development creating new and iconic franchises. We are committed to making great games with great people and having an awesome time living the dream while doing it. Benefits for our full-time positions include, but are not limited to, a competitive regional salary, 100% employer-paid medical, dental, and vision insurance options, professional development reimbursement perk, flexible hybrid on-site/off-site work opportunities, 12 company paid holidays, additional 10 paid days in December when the studio is closed for holiday break, and the ability to accrue weeks of personal paid time-off. Join us and shape the future of an amazing studio culture committed to creating award-winning franchises like Tomb Raider, Marvel's Avengers, the next Perfect Dark, and more! Position Summary Crystal Dynamics is assembling a highly motivated, independent Incubation team. We are building an inclusive, diverse culture where every team member is valued for the perspectives and results we each bring to the table. We plan, act, and deliver as an indie team within the Crystal Dynamics group of studios. We are on the hunt for an experienced Enemy Designer. As an Enemy Designer you will be responsible for working with the team to plan, prototype and build enemies and bosses for a combat focused game. Design responsibilities include but are not limited to creating new enemies, enemy behaviors, giving direction and feedback to animators and artists regarding the enemies, and tuning the enemies. These responsibilities require a high degree of knowledge and experience between code and content, as well as showing demonstrable on-screen progress from concept to ship. Both theory and hands on work will be required. Essential Duties & Responsibilities Promote collaboration amongst combat designers and directors, objectively breakdown combat design principles and provide feedback when appropriate Work closely with AI Engineers to produce clear, concise and fun enemy behaviors and rules that support the combat systems that a wide variety of players can relate to Collaborate with the entire team to ensure all combat systems meet project needs and have consistent demonstrable onscreen progress through rapid prototypes and routine onscreen deliverables of all systems from paper to ship Coordinate closely with AI programmers and Combat Level Designers to communicate the goals and specific needs of various combat systems and provide regular updates to all related gameplay systems Under minimal supervision: design, adapt and scope features to the needs of production, the technical constraints of the project and the overall gameplay goals Evaluate and initiate processes and features needed to improve and streamline any combat related production Maintain, test, iterate combat system-based features from concept phase to final tuning Document game mechanics and features quickly, clearly and concisely Essential Requirements 3-5 years of game design experience preferred At least 1 AAA project shipped for current gen consoles in a combat systems design capacity, including primary responsibility developing enemies or bosses Visual scripting experience (Kismet, Blueprint, etc.) Experience spec-ing and tuning enemies or bosses Crystal Dynamics is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to identifying and implementing positive and persistent measures to ensure equal opportunity in the recruitment, hiring, development, training, promotion and compensation of a diverse team employee group. The ideal candidate is driven by the need for excellence and thrives in a multi-disciplinary team environment. Essential Duties & Responsibilities Design, document, and drive the development of all game systems focusing on ranged and melee combat mechanics, boss and enemy design, experience tuning, and related features Absolute necessity to be “in the tools”; developing and implementing the combat experience for proof of concept and prototype settings Prototype, build, and ultimately own the moment-to-moment combat melee and shooting experience Design, implement and extensively test combat systems for weapons, gear, traversal and player abilities Engage and respond with playtest feedback and data to iterate and improve the experience Coordinate with production and other departments to achieve results Anticipate, prioritize, and organize work to meet objectives Tune combat systems, such aim assists and controller response curves Design and document weapon systems, damage systems and combat tuning Essential Requirements 4-6 years’ experience as a Senior designer on a high-fidelity (preferably AAA) current-gen title focusing on player/combat design Professional contribution to a 3rd person action-adventure title Strong understanding, specifically in player/combat design Ability and willingness to be “in the tools” Positive attitude, strong work ethic and the ability to work in a highly collaborative team environment (both independently and cross-discipline, including in a remote environment) Strong passion and understanding of the combination of systems and tuning that make a game “feel” good Crystal Dynamics is an equal opportunity employer. Senior Camera Designer in Crystal Dynamics

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

Crystal Dynamics is constantly seeking the best gaming talent worldwide to add to our 30-plus year legacy of AAAA game development creating new and iconic franchises. We are committed to making great games with great people and having an awesome time living the dream while doing it. Benefits for our full-time positions include, but are not limited to, a competitive regional salary, 100% employer-paid medical, dental, and vision insurance options, professional development reimbursement perk, flexible hybrid on-site/off-site work opportunities, 12 company paid holidays, additional 10 paid days in December when the studio is closed for holiday break, and the ability to accrue weeks of personal paid time-off. Join us and shape the future of an amazing studio culture committed to creating award-winning franchises like Tomb Raider, Marvel's Avengers, the next Perfect Dark, and more! Position Summary Come be a part of the future of Tomb Raider! This Gameplay Camera Designer, working under the Lead Player Designer, will be responsible for designing, implementing, and fine-tuning the gameplay cameras and custom level camera and cinematic transitions to ensure a player's smooth and seamless journey through a rich and epic narrative experience. A successful Camera Designer will be able to collaborate with Engineers, Animators and other Designers to create tools and camera solutions that will positively impact the player experience and create exciting moments within our dynamic worlds. Essential Duties & Responsibilities Work with the lead player designer to understand the direction for gameplay and solve how to best present gameplay to the player Work with system designers to ensure coordination between gameplay systems and their on-screen representation Conceptualize, present, and execute ideas within a schedule, while actively participating in technical and design problem solving Coordinate directly with representatives of multiple departments to solve design challenges, create exceptional narrative storytelling, remove production bottlenecks and clearly communicate design needs Evaluate and initiate processes, tools, and camera features pertaining to title/franchise specific camera design Essential Requirements 5+ years of game design experience in a camera design role Able to set system requirements and drive implementation Contributed to camera design on 1+ AAA project (or equivalent) Demonstrated understanding of scripting and procedural systems A deep understanding of cinematography concepts and their application to games Crystal Dynamics is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to identifying and implementing positive and persistent measures to ensure equal opportunity in the recruitment, hiring, development, training, promotion and compensation of a diverse team employee group. This includes persons of different race, color, creed, religion, sex, gender identity or gender expression, pregnancy, breastfeeding or medical conditions related to breastfeeding, genetic characteristic, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, medical condition, political affiliation, age, veteran status, uniform service member status, marital status, physical or mental disability, or citizenship, as well as any other classifications protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.

Jobs available in Remote Job

Do you love RPG / ARPG systems? Are you looking for an opportunity to work on a new title with a team of highly respected game developers? Are you passionate about designing and balancing across a range of different systems including combat, itemization and character progression? Our team at Stoic, a 4-time BAFTA nominated independent video game company, is seeking a Mid-level or Senior Systems Designer. The person successful in this position will collaborate closely with the design, engineering and narrative teams to guide the development of features, systems and tools to help create content and features. While driving multiple systems and features which bring the world of the game to life they will also have an in-depth knowledge of the technical realities and constraints of the engine, so they can provide clear feedback in design discussions regarding how they will improve development. Your ability to communicate clearly and break down complex systems and designs into parsable chunks that non-Systems Designers can understand will be critical to your success. What You Will Do: Working with ARPG to define all the specific weapons, gear and aspects Loot and reward allocation Maintain and implement content and data for major gameplay systems using established tools Scaling enemy difficulty Understand metrics and react to them Participate in the game design process at all stages from inception to completion Provide feedback and input Establish a deep personal understanding and investment in the game Collaborate closely with other designers, artists and programmers Exhibit flexibility in a small team setting that sometimes requires people to work outside their assigned role Need to Have: Minimum of 4 years experience in the game industry Expert level proficiency in Excel or Google Sheets to build systems and models At least one shipped title as a Systems Designer Detail oriented and quality driven Passionate about learning MMO or ARPG game experience Dedication to high quality standards Nice to Have: Live game experience Worked on a game with a live monetization system Stoic has transitioned to a fully remote, forever remote workforce. We are uniquely positioned thanks to our broad and diverse games label catalogue, which plays host to an exciting mix of both internally and externally developed titles. We have our own multi-million selling IP, we’re always exploring interesting new concepts, and we love collaborating and supporting our development partners in bringing games to life. We are looking for a Lead UX Designer to join our growing team. This is a fantastic opportunity to get hands on, but also to help build and grow a dedicated UX Design team, here at Team17. You will work closely with our dedicated team of Game Designers, Programmers, Artists and User Researchers, advocating for the player throughout the development process. You will have the ability to directly influence the UX for all of our titles, as well as lead through defining processes and best practices. Some of the things you will do: Lead the way on defining processes for developing all UX related features of our internally developed titles, as well as how we support our third-party development partners on the games label from a UX point of view Help build a dedicated UX team through recruitment - and mentor, train and grow that team over time You will be providing feedback and suggesting improvements to game UX across a variety of development teams, aiming to improve the quality of our titles in all things related to UX Advocating for the player during development and collaborating with the User Research team to analyse research and find solutions to problems and challenges, coupled with advocating for accessibility in our games Ensure visual consistency and high quality in our User Interfaces, working with UI artists to create and design systems, whilst being hands-on alongside designers and programmers to help implement interfaces in our games using popular engines You will get hands on, designing directly through creating wireframes, user flows and other artefacts, and by defining features and providing solutions Some of the ways you will do it: Through your love of gaming and up to date latest knowledge of industry trends, tools techniques and technology, setting a high standard of work Through your experience of creating clear documentation, your ability to design iteratively and utilising your knowledge of to present and deliver solutions to a variety of audiences Using your experience of design and prototyping tools (e.g., Figma) to best support the games that you work on Call on your leadership skills to recruit, mentor, train and grow a dedicated UX Design team You will be a keen communicator and collaborator with a strong understanding of the digital landscape, especially when it comes to games! Jobs available in Remote Job

Team17 is establishing an ambitious and exciting new stand-alone virtual studio dedicated to the further development and on-going support of Hell Let Loose. Hell Let Loose is a WW2 platoon-based realistic multiplayer FPS videogame for PC and consoles set during the Second World War. With over 6 million players already, this is just the start for us! Team 17 is on the lookout for talented Game Designer who can bring their skills and creativity to this exciting and successful franchise. This is a highly collaborative role, where you will be operating proactively alongside a mixed team of coders, artists, and game designers. You have the technical and communication skills to communicate your ideas with your peers and the wider team. Things you will do… The communication and championing of Hell Let Loose’s game content, concept and vision to artists, programmers, producers, marketing staff and all others involved in the development process Assist in the implementation of that content, and the balancing of key systems to the high quality of that content Working proactively with the other members of the team, directors, and stakeholders, to ensure that the design-related goals of the project are met in a timely manner Help ensure a high quality of work on their assigned project, primarily from a game design point of view, but also sometimes including UI/UX work Presenting Hell Let Loose content to; press, or other development partners, either on Team17 premises, at the offices of platform holders, or at trade shows Forming new ideas to contribute to both titles that are in development, and as the basis for ideas for wholly new games and IP How you will do it… Utilise excellent communication skills and the ability to write clearly and concise documentation to demonstrate new ideas and concepts to the team. Engage concept ideation skills to hone and improve new features and concepts. Identify what is essential to the game's core experience. Employ their good interpersonal skills - the ability to work with people and accept feedback and criticism throughout development Demonstrate prioritisation and time management skills; being able to work to deadlines but remaining committed to delivering a high level of quality Utilise their strong practical knowledge of current game development practices and tools - including but not limited to game engines (for example Unity or Unreal), Adobe Photoshop and Microsoft Office, including experience of using scripting languages such as C# or Blueprint Your Benefits… Annual Bonus, Pension matched up to 8%, Share match Scheme, £1000 of free shares for all new colleagues. BUPA private medical insurance including cover for pre-existing conditions and BUPA Dental Work Anywhere. Whilst our studio is virtual you have access to utilise our three UK offices. Senior Level Designer (Hell Let Loose Studio) in Team17

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

Team17 is establishing an ambitious and exciting new stand-alone virtual studio dedicated to the further development and on-going support of Hell Let Loose. Hell Let Loose is a WW2 platoon-based realistic multiplayer FPS videogame for PC and consoles set during the Second World War. With over 6 million players already, this is just the start for us! Team 17 is on the lookout for highly talented Senior Level Designer who can bring their skills and creativity to this exciting and successful franchise. You will have a background in level design, working on both the ideation and construction of game worlds of at least one published title under your belt. You must have a keen grasp of what it takes to make a good level, and a full understanding of the theory that underpins the players’ journey through your level. This is a highly collaborative role, where you will be operating proactively alongside a mixed team of coders, artists, and game designers. You have the technical and communication skills to communicate your ideas with your peers and the wider team. The things you will do… Take ownership and accountability for the development of historic levels within Hell Let Loose and all their associated content, ensuring they adhering to the game's creative vision. Defining the level content either visually, verbally or in written form. Maintain a close relationship with the environmental art team to create a cohesive and believable levels. Understand the high-level vision of the game and be able to translate the vision into level design standards that can be utilised by others within the team. Establish and evangelise the level design best practices to the whole team. Regularly update the directors and stakeholders, collating feedback into tasks for your team. Identify and manage risks within the schedule. Help production schedule and resource work for your team throughout the project. Performing research and understanding real world WW2 battlefields. How will you do it… Previous professional experience in a level design role, with at least one published title. Experience in crafting gameplay experiences from concept to completion Experience with 3D modelling packages for white boxing Extensive experience of level editing tools, including a strong demonstratable knowledge of the Unreal Engine 4. Prior experience using node-based visual script logic and the creation of scripted events Experience with agile processes and project tracking software Experience with rapid prototyping. Your Benefits… Annual Bonus, Pension matched up to 8%, Share match Scheme, £1000 of free shares for all new colleagues. BUPA private medical insurance including cover for pre-existing conditions and BUPA Dental Work Anywhere. Whilst our studio is virtual you have access to utilise our three UK offices. Team17 is an equal opportunities employer with a commitment to building a diverse workforce, representative of the world we live and game in! Accessibility is at the heart of our games, and we reflect that in how we operate as a business. Lead Game Designer in Wizards of the Coast

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

At Wizards of the Coast, we connect people around the world through play and imagination. From our genre defining games like Magic: The Gathering® and Dungeons & Dragons® to our growing multiverse, we continue to innovate and build new ways to foster friendship and connection. That’s where you come in! Are you a game designer with a deep love for Dungeons & Dragons? We’re seeking an engaging, hardworking, and player-focused Lead Game Designer to join our team building the future of Dungeons & Dragons' digital play experience! In this role you will plan, detail, and supervise the creation of intelligent tools and digital content for all players, while also aligning with the business and design goals of the product. You will be an advocate for the player experience and the design ethos of the studio, collaborating in real-time with product managers, programmers, and UX designers to deliver the highest quality results. Applicants should be enthusiastic about solving unique problems, have a proven track record of leading diverse teams in a variety of game genres, and be ready to immerse themselves in the work of digitizing the world's greatest role-playing game. What You'll Do: Formulate Tactics: Collaborate with the Game Director on overall strategy and devise your own plans to achieve these goals. Lead the Way: Help the team understand how and why we are building specific features, own the process, and deliver results to the players. Explore Dungeons: Build up and maintain detailed documentation for new features with your team, leaving no pathway unexplored. Min-max the Game: Get the most out of features and systems with tools that empower both content designers and players. Fire up the Forge: Jump in and create content or prototype when needed, take control of your vision. Join the Party: Regularly play the game, filter feedback and suggestions from other members of the team. What You'll Bring: Proven experience as a game designer - minimum 6 years. At least 1 significant shipped project with lead design responsibilities. Deep knowledge of how to make games and how to "find the fun." Strong analytical skills and a love for efficient problem solving, understanding when to use data to help make decisions. Experience with Dungeons & Dragons / TTRPG design and a drive to keep updated with the latest trends in the industry. Positive, direct, collaborative communication to improve our shared vision. Flexible, adaptable approach with a constant appetite for new knowledge and experiences. Motivated and self-sufficient, able to mentor and lead a diverse team of developers, artists, and designers. Understanding of UX concepts and ability to build flow charts. Understanding of the modern web environment, including HTML, CSS, MySQL, JavaScript, React and Typescript. We are an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer The above is intended to describe the general content of and the requirements for satisfactory performance in this position. It is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of the duties, responsibilities, or requirements of the position. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Goodgame Studios is a leading free-to-play, online games development company. We operate across web and mobile platforms and cater to over 500 million registered users worldwide. With employees from more than 40 nations, we are among the largest German employers in the gaming software industry. Since 2018, Goodgame Studios has been part of Stillfront Group AB, which is a group of independent developers, publishers and distributors of digital games - with a vision to become the leading group of game developers and publishers. We are convinced that only the best people will create the best products and drive a company towards success. We believe that teamwork, expertise and bringing different perspectives together are the heart and soul of game development. Conquer the gaming world collectively with the greatest colleagues and the most exciting company around - become a part of our family! As an UI/UX Designer - Freelancer (all genders), you will have the opportunity to be responsible for the UI/UX design of our games. You will work together with the game design, art and development teams to create design systems and produce user interfaces for our games. Your good communication skills and your positive attitude help you to achieve success. Apply now and join us as a freelancer in this full-time project for approximately six months. YOUR MISSION Independently develop and apply methods to achieve great player experience in our games Take responsibility for the UI/UX design of a product in cooperation with the Game Design, Art and Development teams Create and develop wireframes, mock-ups, user flows, prototypes and produce UI for our games Support in creating and applying design systems to achieve consistency across the project Applying best practices in UI/UX for mobile devices Advocate for the users and promote the user-centric mindset across the team YOUR BACKSTORY Several years of professional experience in user experience design, concept development, interaction design, information architecture Completed degree in Media Psychology, Graphic Design, Game Design or similar qualification Extensive experience in Adobe CC suite (Adobe Illustrator and Adobe XD in particular) Experience in UI/UX design for mobile products A self-motivated individual with a passion for online and casual games Excellent analytical skills and a strong customer focus Well organized, solid communication skills and a positive team player attitude Familiar with industry standards and emerging trends in software Very good written and spoken English SOUNDS GREAT? MORE REASONS TO TAKE THIS MISSION Full flexibility: Work remotely or come and work from our modern office in Hamburg with roof terrace, cafeteria, common rooms, gaming and lounging etc. or take a lap in the swimming pool on our beautiful campus. Join a supportive team in a pragmatic, yet challenging environment, flat hierarchies and state of the art technologies. Work with multidisciplinary and experienced colleagues from the entire product lifecycle in a culture of continuous development and learning opportunities. Don't be hungry ever again: there are fresh fruits, snacks and drinks available at the office. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION Please provide us with a current UI/UX portfolio as a file or link with your application. The safety of our employees and everyone else is of utmost importance to us which is why you will experience a solely virtual recruiting process. We are happy to receive your application in English! #Stayhome #Stayhealthy Your contact person for this job offer is Simon Guenther. Goodgame Studios is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage and support diversity and welcome all qualified applications.

Senior Product Designer: RT3D in Unity

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

The Opportunity Unity is looking for a senior product designer to work on ground breaking rendering and authoring technologies, for the future of real time 3D content . This is an opportunity to bring outstanding innovation into the hands of artists across industries. Working directly with product management, engineering leaders, designers, and artists, this person will play a key role in enabling the next generation of artists to author visually outstanding content at the resolution they choose, and deliver an optimized experience across platforms. The right candidate will combine design ability with a natural curiosity for technology, knowledge of rendering pipelines and or games engines and a passion for empowering artists. You will collaborate with other designers to establish our product vision, whilst advocating for our users, bring alignment and consistency between products, and exemplify the highest standards of inclusive design, whilst delivering innovative solutions to artists worldwide. You will partner with engineers to delve into the technical capabilities of the system, and rationalize the tools into artist focused interfaces, enabling simple access to powerful rendering technologies. This is an opportunity to bring new levels of artistic control and visual fidelity into the hands of a global audience, working on a suite of authoring tools from the ground up. What you’ll be doing Employ design thinking to reason complex technology into intuitive, efficient and joyful artist tools, thereby enabling more creators to achieve their goals. Work with product management, product design, technical and production artists, UX research and engineering leads to develop and refine product strategy, establish clear design goals, and promote a culture of innovation, collaboration, and inclusivity. Create sketches, storyboards, wireframes, prototypes and high-fidelity comps to communicate product vision to internal and external partners. Engage with subject matter experts to research and validate product decisions. Conduct design reviews with senior leadership to ensure alignment with project goals, and collaborate with other designers to ensure consistency and coherence across Unity products. What we’re looking for A selective product design portfolio, showcasing project development from concept to shipping, creative thought, a user-centric approach, awareness of technology and design craftsmanship, and a desire to promote visual excellence. The ability to initiate design conversations within a team or group context, to reason through sophisticated problems and arrive at elegant solutions in a collaborative way. Knowledge of RT3D rendering pipelines, and technical proficiency in some aspects is required. Previous consumer or tooling product design in content authoring tools. Excellent collaborator with strong verbal, visual and written communication skills. You might also have Experience designing consumer or professional products for multiple platforms Hands on experience in Unity and/or other game engines Understanding of lighting, shaders, VFX authoring Life at Unity Unity (NYSE: U) is the world’s leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity is the foundation upon which the world’s most powerful digital content is created. Specifically, Unity’s platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices. In the fourth quarter of 2021, Unity had, on average, 3.9 billion monthly active end users who consumed content created or operated with its solutions. The applications developed by these creators were downloaded, on average, five billion times per month in 2021. For more information, please visit www.unity.com. Unity is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment and celebrate our employees across age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. Our differences are strengths that enable us to support the growing and evolving needs of our customers, partners, and collaborators. If there are preparations or accommodations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please fill out this form to let us know. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

Jobs available in Remote Job

The opportunity Unity’s Ultra Simple Creation (Ultra) team is building out new creative tools that will inspire and enable entirely new markets of makers! Your role will be to help design a collaborative web-first and mobile design product from the ground up. This team and product are extensions of Unity’s belief that the world is better with more creators in it. Specifically, Ultra is highly targeted at the extensive number of everyday, common creative tasks that ordinary people have to do. We make it easier than ever to make beautiful, high quality creations. This role is especially pivotal as an early employee in an internal zero-to-one ‘startup’. You will work alongside product & engineering, and specifically contribute to key workflows ranging from templates to interactivity, animation and 3D. If you are a product designer who has been disappointed or frustrated by the lack of accessible design tools for animation and 3D, this is your chance to make that product come to life! This is a rare opportunity to join a 0-1 product team inside a well-established, successful company, helping to expand Unity’s tool suite to an entirely new class of users. What you’ll be doing Working with the rest of the team to create prototypes and working products for the web. Creatively exploring how we can push the bounds on a wide range of sub-disciplines in the creation space: product design, UX, brand design & illustration, 3D design, animation, and video Coming up with novel, groundbreaking ways of combining templates and tools to unlock even the most unskilled creators What we’re looking for A skilled product designer who is at the cutting edge of UI and new interaction paradigms Background in web and mobile design, specifically creation tools Ability to innovate and play with the concept of creation—we are looking to make the best products, not parity You might also have Experience in 3D design, motion graphics, animation, or video The ability to prototype on the web or mobile Experience with typography or illustration Life at Unity Unity (NYSE: U) is the world’s leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity is the foundation upon which the world’s most powerful digital content is created. Specifically, Unity’s platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices. In the fourth quarter of 2021, Unity had, on average, 3.9 billion monthly active end users who consumed content created or operated with its solutions. The applications developed by these creators were downloaded, on average, five billion times per month in 2021. For more information, please visit www.unity.com. If there are preparations or accommodations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please fill out this form to let us know. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

Communications Designer in Unity

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

The opportunity We are Accelerate Solutions, an innovative team building custom software for a wide range of clients. Our professional services team works across multiple platforms building digital twin and metaverse solutions that incorporate ground breaking technologies like XR, robotics, machine learning and IoT. We work on a diverse range of business verticals including games, automotive, transportation, retail, manufacturing and entertainment. As a Communications Designer, you understand the power of storytelling and concise communication. Based on this understanding, you will bring clarity to complex problems through your ability to synthesize information, presenting it in an expertly crafted way. What you’ll be doing Be part of a growing and dynamic team, participating in the creation and production of proposal and presentation decks for extraordinary clients Collaborate with our business development team, design leads and storyboard artists to shape the stories we're trying to tell for global clients Continually improve on the efficiency of the presentation production process What we’re looking for Must have previous experience designing presentation and proposal decks in a fast-paced environment with a stunning portfolio to back it Exceptional layout and typographic skills please! Proficiency in Google Slides, Apple Keynote, or Microsoft PowerPoint and a solid understanding of Adobe InDesign, Illustrator, & Photoshop Expert-level written and verbal communication skills You are a fierce editor! — “do we really need that many bullet points?” You might also have The ability to generate supporting visuals for use within presentations Experience within the field of user experience design Understanding and curiosity about advanced technologies (AR/VR) and industry trends (did someone say metaverse?) Life at Unity Unity (NYSE: U) is the world’s leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity is the foundation upon which the world’s most powerful digital content is created. Specifically, Unity’s platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices. In the fourth quarter of 2021, Unity had, on average, 3.9 billion monthly active end users who consumed content created or operated with its solutions. The applications developed by these creators were downloaded, on average, five billion times per month in 2021. For more information, please visit www.unity.com. Unity is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment and celebrate our employees across age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. Our differences are strengths that enable us to support the growing and evolving needs of our customers, partners, and collaborators. Game UI/UX Artist (Mid-weight+) in SMG Studio

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

SMG Studio is looking for an experienced Game UI/UX Artist Mid-weight to join our expanding team. Our studio is based out of Sydney and we also have various team members across the globe however we’re mostly working from home so working within or close to the Sydney time zone would be ideal. We have multiple game titles across all platforms so the role will require you to have a broad knowledge of platform UI/UX requirements as well as the ability to create art and design work that can be used for marketing and social media (Twitter, TikTok, Apple Arcade etc) Our eclectic mix of games (Moving Out, SP!NG, No Way Home, RISK, Thumb Drift, Death Squared, OTTTD, One More Line and One More Dash) showcase how we don't like to rest on our laurels. This is a role where you will work closely with our current senior design team but you will also be required to work occasionally independently with a sense of ownership and pride for all design work created for SMG and our game titles with the support from the design leads. We enjoy making unique, mechanically driven titles that are fun for everyone to play and always with a sense of quirkiness that is unique to SMG. You are: Highly organized. Someone who works well within a team but can also work independently to solve challenges. Someone with a pixel-perfect eye for detail and a deep understanding of UI/UX best practices with the intent on making the best experience possible for our players. A good listener and can communicate ideas and visual languages in a clear and concise manner. A problem solver and strategic thinker. Someone who gets stuff done with limited oversight. Able to provide constructive feedback and insights during all stages of our games development cycle from initial conception to final launch. Comfortable handling critiques on your own work constructively, adapting to feedback from senior staff and playtesting sessions, and being flexible to adopting new art styles and direction along the way. Have an in-depth knowledge and passion for games: mobile games, console games, even board games. Someone who can manage multiple tasks with ease. Someone who makes themselves indispensable. Humble and level headed with a sense of humour. Able to remain cool under pressure and work to deadlines in fast-paced scenarios. Australian permanent resident or existing legal ability to work in Australia. (For this role we’re not considering sponsoring VISAs) You have: A great knowledge of the Adobe Cloud suite of applications (Photoshop, XD, Illustrator) Fluency across production tools (JIRA, Google suite, Slack etc) Bonus points for any of the following; Experience in animation (UI) and/or Visual FX (After Effects, Unity) Illustration skills, at both a conceptual sketch level to communicate interface, environment and game level ideas, but also at a final polished art level whether it be intricate vector icons for user interfaces or hand illustrated pieces of original art for marketing purposes. Prior employment at a large or small game developer or digital production agency. Worked on the development & deployment of a console title (Switch, Xbox, Playstation, PC) or mobile game (iOS, Android). A score of over 100 in One More Line. Experience coding, writing, 3D, photography or any creative field. An interest in board games Your duties will include, but not limited to: Design and create high-quality static and/or animated user interfaces (UI) and artwork for video games on both mobile or console platforms. Create wireframes, concept sketches, moodboards, design concepts, prototypes, icons and final art assets based on internal briefs and/or technical specifications. Contribute to UI/UX research and strategy that helps shape our vision on how our games will both look, behave and be experienced by players. Create UX flows diagrams and/or prototypes that deliver an intuitive experience for players Communicate these UX flows and present and collaborate with the game team members Prepare and deliver exported UI assets and artwork files that are ready to be bought into the game both during development and when launched with App/platform storefronts. Support the development of the game with any additional social or marketing art assets.

Overview Splitgate is a free to play, fast-paced sci-fi multiplayer shooter that combines the strategic elements of portals with the explosive gameplay of a first person shooter. We quickly became a top trending game on PlayStation, XBOX, and Steam. In our first 6 days, we passed 1M downloads, and hit 2M within the first two weeks. We’re now at 15M+ downloads and growing. After receiving $100M Series A funding with a valuation of $1.5B, we are actively looking to grow our team with the best talent out there to continue the journey of making Splitgate a game that we and the millions of players in our gaming community are proud of. What We’re Looking for: We are looking for a talented Senior UI Artist who has great attention to detail and a passion for crafting beautiful UI experiences. In this role you will be responsible for iterating on concepts, delivering high-fidelity comps, and bringing visual designs to life in Unreal Engine. As a senior member of the team, you will help inspire fellow team members, take point on major features and ensure our tools support our workflow needs. Responsibilities: Craft and iterate on high-fidelity visual comps, prototypes, and polished designs for game features and HUD Create artwork, iconography, and rasterized assets that are high-quality and optimized for the game Work with UX designers to visualize various interface solutions Work with art leadership to achieve desired visual direction and ensure consistency Work in unreal engine (UMG) to bring designs to implementation with the engineering team, and push for improvements to workflow Collaborate with a variety of disciplines including art, design, engineering, audio, and production Qualifications 3+ years of experience working in interactive media with a focus on user interface design Game industry experience on at least 1 commercially shipped title Strong sense of composition, color, and working knowledge of graphic design fundamentals High proficiency in Photoshop, Illustrator, Figma, or other industry-standard design tools Good communication, interpersonal, organizational, and time management capabilities Strong problem-solving, analytical, strategic, and troubleshooting skills. Passion for games Love for visual design and awareness of trends future, current, and dated Desired Qualifications Ability to create logos, symbols, illustrative emblems, and icons Technical proficiency in Unreal Engine (UMG) Motion graphics experience Technical proficiency in scripting materials (shaders) Familiarity with accessibility best practices and designing with them in mind Comfortable designing for immersive end to end user experiences Demonstrated history crafting style guides and/or component style libraries
