UI/UX Designer II in Pixelberry Studios

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

Pixelberry Studios is a top mobile games developer, creating fun and engaging games with heart for over nine years. We’re a division of Nexon, one of the Top 10 largest gaming companies in the world. Our studio is 3-for-3 launching games into the App Store's Top 25 Grossing chart. Our market-leading, award-winning mobile game, Choices: Stories You Play, broke into the Top 5 in the App Store. Our vision for success is based around innovative game design, diversity, and putting our players first! We've seen firsthand the positive impact that games can make. Because of that, we leverage our commercial success to make a real difference: we have partnered with numerous non-profits, saved actual lives with our games, and donated hundreds of thousands of dollars to charities. Players love our games’ focus on racial, gender, sexual, and identity diversity while holding us accountable when they expect more. Some of us at Pixelberry have worked together for over 10 years through multiple companies. As a result, we strive to create long-term relationships that help sustain our success. We continue to add new individuals who aren’t just searching for another stepping stone but a place to put down roots and actively make a difference. We love what we do and are looking for passionate, like-minded people who want to grow, learn, and make a difference together. SUMMARY OF POSITION At Pixelberry, we strive to expand the potential of narrative games. As we create new games and experiences in that pursuit, we are searching for a highly creative and detail-oriented UX/UI Designer to help refine existing products and build the next generation of narrative games. This role will work closely with the Product team to design UI/UX features from our ambitious roadmap, collaborate with other Designers to create a cohesive product, and pioneer design methods that scale. The ideal candidate has worked across multiple platforms and mediums, from web to app to games, and has experience working with creative and technical team members. We are looking for candidates who can showcase user-centered design solutions and understand their products and users. Our headquarters are in Mountain View, CA but we can accommodate a remote work environment for a candidate from the following states: California, Colorado, Florida, Indiana, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Nevada, New York, Oregon, Pennsylvania, South Dakota, Texas, and Washington. Currently, all Pixelberry staff work remotely with the option to work in-office, if desired. RESPONSIBILITIES Create deliverables such as wireframes, app flows, high and low fidelity UI layouts, interactive prototypes, icons and optimized game ready assets Clearly communicate your designs through use of sketches, feature documentation, mockups, and prototypes Collaborate with other designers, leading brainstorming sessions and providing feedback to ensure a strong holistic product Lead research efforts, providing analysis on competitor designs and overseeing user testing sessions Work closely with engineering, production, and QA to implement the working software Provide accurate design estimates and advocate for the highest quality designs, striving to find elegant design solutions to reduce impact on the rest of the team Contribute throughout the whole lifecycle of game development shipping fun, innovative features REQUIREMENTS Portfolio of sample projects that showcases a wide range of work across industries and mediums Bachelor’s Design degree or equivalent industry experience 5+ years of experience in UI/UX design Excellent UI design and visual design skills Shipped 2+ successful products or games Strong abilities in building out complex UX/UI interaction patterns, flows, wires, and animations Experience using Figma as both a Design and a communication tool Self sufficient and driven by a strong desire to learn new concepts and methodologies Quick to identify and solve edge case scenarios Strong communication skills and experience working with other Designers Good analytical, interpersonal, and problem solving skills PLUSSES Experience or passion for narrative or interactive fiction games Experience creating Game UI assets for different genres (Sci-Fi, Fantasy, Etc.) Experience with animation and building interactive prototypes Experience with responsive app design Experience with Unity BENEFITS & PERKS Competitive salary High level of autonomy and freedom Rich & flexible health, disability, and employee assistance offerings to meet the needs of a diverse workforce 401(K) with matching program Paid Year-End Break For local employees that elect to work in-studio, a relaxed office environment with free food and snacks Virtual escape rooms, video game nights, trivia parties, and other team-building activities throughout the year! HOW THIS JOB IS DIFFERENT Learn about the business side of mobile games. Our team is very good at what we do. Good work/life balance. We are family-friendly and look at things in the long term. That warm fuzzy feeling that you’re not just making a difference at a company, but in the lives of people all over the world. UA Creative Designer in Kwalee

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

Kwalee is one of the world’s leading multiplatform game publishers and developers, with well over 750 million downloads worldwide for mobile hits such as Draw It, Teacher Simulator, Let’s Be Cops 3D, Airport Security and Makeover Studio 3D. Alongside this, we also have a growing PC and Console team of incredible pedigree that is on the hunt for great new titles to join TENS!, Eternal Hope, Die by the Blade and Scathe. We have a team of talented people collaborating daily between our studios in Leamington Spa, Bangalore and Beijing, or on a remote basis from Turkey, Brazil, the Philippines and many more places, and we’ve recently acquired our first external studio, TicTales which is based in France. We have a truly global team making games for a global audience. And it’s paying off: Kwalee has been recognised with the Best Large Studio and Best Leadership awards from TIGA (The Independent Game Developers’ Association) and our games have been downloaded in every country on earth! Founded in 2011 by David Darling CBE, a key architect of the UK games industry who previously co-founded and led Codemasters for many years, our team also includes legends such as Andrew Graham (creator of Micro Machines series) and Jason Falcus (programmer of classics including NBA Jam) alongside a growing and diverse team of global gaming experts. Everyone contributes creatively to Kwalee’s success, with all employees eligible to pitch their own game ideas on Creative Wednesdays, and we’re proud to have built our success on this inclusive principle. Could your idea be the next global hit? What’s the job? As a UA Creative Designer, your day-to-day tasks will consist of ideating and designing visually engaging, innovative and functional mobile and social media adverts and promotional creatives. Your ability to bring your vision and concepts to life will not only be welcomed but celebrated. One of the key aspects of your role is a thorough understanding of the right balance between game and concepts - appealing to our users and serving the marketing purpose, missions and targets. What you tell your friends you do “I convince people to play our games by designing super-smart advertising creatives” What you will really be doing Working with the team, and independently to ideate and conceptualise new ideas for our user acquisition creative production. Evaluating trends, assessing new data, and keeping up-to-date with the latest marketing campaigns in the industry. Researching and documenting tailored marketing ideas based on individual project requirements. Running brainstorming meetings and creative sessions. Shaping and creating procedures to ensure consistency in ideation and contribution from the other team members. Generate clear ideas, concepts and designs of creative assets from beginning to end. Developing exceptional and well-crafted ideations docs and storyboards that meet a project's requirements. Translate marketing objectives into clear creative strategies Monitor results of creatives and propose actions and revisions for the same. Work closely with multidisciplinary project teams across a range of skill sets both within the marketing creative team and in other teams. How you will be doing this You’ll be part of an agile, multidisciplinary and creative team and work closely with them to ensure the best results. You'll think creatively and be motivated by challenges and constantly striving for the best. You’ll work with cutting edge technology, if you need software or hardware to get the job done efficiently, you will get it. We even have a robot! Team Our talented team is our signature. We have a highly creative atmosphere with more than 200 staff where you’ll have the opportunity to contribute daily to important decisions. You’ll work within an extremely experienced, passionate and diverse team, including David Darling and the creator of the Micro Machines video games. Skills and Requirement Digital experience, particularly with, but not limited to web and social A solid understanding of design, copy, and story telling. Brilliant interpersonal and communication skills. Have in-depth knowledge of advertising, and multichannel marketing models. Must be a creative and strategic thinker. Hands-on experience in creative process, marketing, graphic design and Advertising The ability to refine other people’s ideas as well and come up with new ones to create high performance creatives. Exemplary interpersonal and analytical abilities We offer We want everyone involved in our games to share our success, that’s why we have a generous team profit sharing scheme from day 1 of employment Creative Wednesdays! (Design and make your own games every Wednesday) Great work-life balance with flexible working hours Quarterly team building days - work hard, play hard! Monthly employee awards Our philosophy We firmly believe in creativity and innovation and that a fundamental requirement for a successful and happy company is having the right mix of individuals. With the right people in the right environment anything and everything is possible. Kwalee makes games to bring people, their stories, and their interests together. As an employer, we’re dedicated to making sure that everyone can thrive within our team by welcoming and supporting people of all ages, races, colours, beliefs, sexual orientations, genders and circumstances. With the inclusion of diverse voices in our teams, we bring plenty to the table that’s fresh, fun and exciting; it makes for a better environment and helps us to create better games for everyone! This is how we move forward as a company – because these voices are the difference that make all the difference.

Senior Game Systems Engineer in Jagex

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

A leader in creating deep and engaging experiences on PC and mobile, Jagex was founded in 2001 and is today one of the UK’s biggest and most respected video game developers and publishers. Famed for its flagship MMOs RuneScape and Old School RuneScape, Jagex has welcomed more than 260million player accounts to its world and created a $1bn lifetime franchise revenue. Today the RuneScape franchise exists beyond running games in live operations; our titles are living games that connect and inspire millions of players, with content and experiences both inside and outside of inexhaustible game worlds. Both RuneScape and Old School RuneScape, on PC and mobile, offer ever-evolving, highly-active worlds and our community-focussed development ethos empowers players to have a real say in how each game is shaped. Jagex is expanding and extending its portfolio with fresh franchise titles, new IP and, in 2018 launched Jagex Partners, delivering third-party publishing and operational services exclusively for the living games of the future. Jagex employs more than 400 people at its Cambridge headquarters and is on the hunt for talented people to work across the business to help the company to achieve yet another year of record growth and player satisfaction. Job Purpose: Working as part of a passionate and cross-disciplinary agile game team, you will be integral to the development and delivery of the Old School RuneScape product roadmap. You’ll be working closely with our game developers on the game roadmap and larger initiatives like graphical enhancements and bringing the game to new audiences. You will want to maintain what is working well while thinking ahead to enhance and improve our technology and game features. If you’re a senior level engine developer with a deep understanding of programming principles, we would love to hear from you. Key Duties: Programming using C++ (11/14), Java and other languages as required Leading, defining, and evolving the current client engine architecture powering Old School RuneScape Researching, innovating, and developing new game engine technology Contributing to overall project strategy, being willing to put forward ideas, and to positively critique those put forward by others Taking an active interest in mentoring and levelling up more junior developers on the team Assisting in the recruitment of other great team members Essential Requirements: Extremely proficient with C++ Games experience working on at least one launched title Experience working across a range of game engine systems Fluent in communicating and innovating solutions to complex problems in a legacy technology stack you enjoy optimizing for performance Knowledgeable and appreciative of old-school and modern development practices, with experience evaluating and recommending custom versus off-the-shelf solutions Ability to work well in a team and with others, good communication skills are essential Willingness to mentor and support other team members to achieve their best work Relevant qualification at degree level or equivalent experience Even Better if: Interest and experience in graphics programming Experience working on large-scale MMO games Comfortable working in other programming languages such as Java where it suits the situation Familiarity with CMake or similar build tools Experience developing games for multiple platforms, including PC, Mac OSX, Linux, iOS and Android Company Benefits: Flexible Working Bonus Scheme Private Health Care Gym Membership Generous Pension Contributions Life Insurance Free Cycle Repair Income Protection Dental Plan Free Fruit and Drinks Subsidised Canteen Feel like you fit this role, but don’t meet all the requirements? We strive for fresh perspectives, so as long as you can demonstrate how your attitude and other abilities might make up for any gaps we would welcome your application! Jagex are an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy or maternity, religion or belief.

ABOUT US Mountaintop is a new game studio creating multiplayer games for players that crave a challenge. We’re an independent, remote-first studio primarily located in the US and Canada. We’re creating the types of games that bring people together — and keep them together for “just one more round.” The types of games that inspired us as kids. The games that become our hobbies, and sometimes our obsessions. Games are a reflection of the teams that make them. So to make the best games, we’re building a studio that puts the team first — one that's collaborative, anti-crunch, diverse, and inclusive. We’d love for you to join us. THE ROLE We’re looking for a Senior Level Designer who’s passionate about building extraordinary new experiences that inspire others. You’ll play a crucial role in bringing our first title to life. YOU’LL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR Designing competitive multiplayer FPS levels that deliver amazing team-centric player experiences Developing compelling team combat areas through rapid graybox prototyping Collaborating with art, engineering, and production to convert rough block-outs into awe-inspiring environments Contributing to concept, direction, and gameplay designs for all Mountaintop projects Working collaboratively with other disciplines to bring out the best ideas, translating them into compelling prototypes Inventing, extending, and maintaining design processes, tools, and workflows Creating a team culture that prides itself on excellence, innovation, trust, and respect ABOUT YOU A love for playing and making amazing games A minimum of 4 years design experience, including at least one shipped title Experience creating maps for competitive multiplayer games Demonstrated ability to analyze and critique maps from a competitive shooter design perspective Familiarity with all aspects of FPS map creation in a production environment Self-motivated and eager to contribute in many different areas of development Excellent verbal and written communication skills PLUSES Experience working with Unreal Engine 4 Experience supporting a live service title Experience working on networked games BENEFITS Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life insurance (100% of premiums paid) 401k plan Flexible Spending Account (FSA) Unlimited PTO 8 weeks of paid maternity/paternity leave Remote-work Friendly

You will help determine the resource needs and coordinate various disciplines internally and externally. In This Role You Will Empower and support your team to deliver the highest audio quality possible by providing direction and leadership Help to set ambitious goals and improve by challenging ideas, form a positive relationship with the team to bring out the best results Collaborate with the leads from other areas to create a shared vision and roadmap for the game Participate in setting and ensuring performance metrics and quality bars Provide feedback to group audio reviews to make sure the team works meets the quality of standard required and is in line with the audio vision Build and encourage an open feedback culture ensuring a lean feedback cycle and strong ability to collaborate within the team. Don’t be afraid to get your hands dirty: record, edit, and design sound effects Build strong audio features, systems, and other areas using competitive industry techniques and tools What We're Looking For At least 2 years of experience in a leadership role working on an in-house project Worked on at least 2 AA+ PC/Console titles Expertise in the holistic game audio process (Sound Design, Voice Over, Music Implementation, Technology, Player Experience, etc.) Experience with sound design tools such as Pro Tools, Cubase, Reaper, Ableton, Waves plugins, etc, high level of implementation between exporting assets from DAW to the game engine Experience with voice over processing tools and techniques Experience with audio middleware Wwise, Fmod Experience within the Unreal Engine, creating blueprints or similar visual scripting Organisation skills, autonomous along with the ability to anticipate risks for the audio pipeline Nice To Haves Experience with MOBAs or shooter games Background in music theory or music production

Level Designer in Climax Studios

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

Climax Studios was established nearly 30 years ago, we have an extensive history in developing all kinds of digital experiences across all formats, and we have won multiple awards along the way. We have a state-of-the-art studio located in the heart of the beautiful Gunwharf Quays in Portsmouth overlooking the Harbour. You take your creativity seriously and games should be what get you fired up and passionate. At Climax we embrace those who see things in a different way and aren’t afraid to try-out new things and push themselves out of their comfort zones. We are seeking an experienced Level Designer, with proven level design skills & experience working on Console titles, to join our award-winning team. This is an exciting opportunity to work on a AAA IP where you will be responsible for creating and owning major immersive environments for the game within the Level Design Team from start to finish. This is a great opportunity to work with a team of passionate and experienced designers on a AAA project for a 1st party publisher. Requirements Experience working as a Level Designer on at least one published console title. A strong grasp of level flow, metrics & pacing. A good visual eye for scene setting, sight lines, vistas and areas of interest. Proven experience working within Unreal Engine 4 or 5, as well as with Blueprinting. Experience of grey boxing levels to a professional standard. Experience in scripting gameplay content in levels such as events, interactions and encounters. Experience with enemy placement/spawn points. Excellent communication skills to collaborate with a creative & multidisciplinary team. Level design experience for third person action games is a benefit. Enjoys a creative challenge with the passion and motivation to make great games. Responsibilities Design and build large, immersive levels that create memorable gameplay experiences. Keep to project vision for best practices, methodologies used and quality benchmark. As part of level reviews, able to accept critique and come up with solutions. Regularly play the game and provide suggestions and feedback in a clear and constructive manner. Able to understand and action the narrative and gameplay ambitions for the levels. Ability to self-motivate as-well-as work well as part of a team. Notes Applications for this role must include a portfolio/show reel link. Benefits Regular social events Cycle To Work Scheme Pension Fresh fruit and snacks A friendly, focused, ambitious and relaxed working environment Ongoing training and development, with career progression Discount card for all the shopping centre stores Great seafront location, a short walk from the rail station, bars, restaurants, coffee shops Group Private Medical Insurance provided by BUPA Group Life Insurance Employee Assistance Programme Private Dental Insurance Group Income Protection Company Pension Scheme Cycle To Work Scheme Eye-Care Vouchers Perks Bring your doggo to work! We're a dog friendly studio, bring your pooch in to meet us. Bean to cup coffee machine in the studio. Fresh fruit and healthy snacks provided daily, breakfast and some not so healthy snacks. In-house clubs and socials. From board games, tennis, football to D&D nights, there are lots of opportunities to socialise. Regular Socials including Project Wrap Parties, team and studio events, Christmas and annual Summer parties and soem great charity fundraising events.

Title: UI Artist Level: Mid-Weight to Senior Type: Remote, Home-Working Location: America We are extensively growing our Global Art Team We’re looking for an exceptionally talented Senior UI Artist to join our "Is It You?" game team – helping to enhancing our players experience while exposing the shady shrooms! This position entails a great deal of responsibility; as a UI Artist at 1518 Studios you will design and optimize player-facing user interfaces. - Building bridges and foster close collaboration with other teams to help shape all aspects of the player experience, and problem solve to create functional and efficient UI solutions. Requirements Job Responsibilities Development of UI design language, components and layouts. Getting into the bones of the UI, thinking about all scalability, accessibility, usability and player needs. Support in the creation and iteration of UI mock-ups, prototypes and polished designs for game that enhance player interactions and complement the user experience. Produce flows describing UI states and the resulting visual information fed back to the user. Support in the creation, maintenance and governance of UI design systems in Figma, and in-game. Identify when new components are needed, being aware of the downstream effects of UI design work on development and the overall game ecosystem. Create and maintain associated UI Design System documentation. Collaborate with UX Design and technical teams to identify needs, and challenges to solve within the design system, and assist with implementing UI solutions that ensure product consistency and effective use of components. Work closely with Visual Design teams, efficiently balancing the technical constraints while staying true to the look and feel of the UI design, and the overall art-direction of each game. Consistently benchmark the useability and accessibility of new and existing products, and leverage creative solutions to make iterative improvements to designs. Support in the wider production of design flows, pre-vis and prototypes as required. Produce related game-ready assets as required. Hands-on working in Unity. Working closely with the Lead Designer and the project team on creating an unforgettable player experience. Meet with key team members to ensure that everyone understands the goal and plan for a content design before its implementation Continuously look for ways to improve or expand on the game experience through creating ideas for new mechanics or features. Native level English Qualifications Minimum of 3 years' game industry experience in a Level/Content Designer role. Industry experience and at least 1 shipped title that featured a multiplayer component, worked on from beginning to end. Experience creating UI designs, screens, flows and documentation with a high level of craft and keen eye for detail. A solid understanding of UX/UI design fundamentals. Experience working in Unity. Experience of supporting other Level Designers with your technical level design experience – e.g. creating metric workflows that ensure gameplay consistency or exposing/creating blueprint functionality for other designers to use Analytical and methodical approach to working. Portfolio demonstrating applied UI design work and use of design systems. 3+ years’ experience of using modern design tools and workflows (Figma, FigJam, Adobe CC, etc). A creative, agile and player-centric mindset. The ability to work within constraints and to specific briefs. A deep passion and knowledge of the games industry. Can work independently and unsupervised to a high standard. Great communication and collaboration skills; the ability to work openly with their team and pivot through other disciplines. Benefits Competitive basic salary Excellent Holiday entitlement plus public holidays Dynamic and entrepreneurial culture You get to work with the latest technologies You will be working for one of the worlds leading providers of specialist services to the games industry. Who we are PTW is a video games services company which supports video game developers and publishers through outsourced production services. We started 25 years ago and since then, have grown exponentially year-on-year to where we are today. Our history is in gaming, and we are gamers at heart. In our time within the games industry, we have worked on over 1500 titles across all genres and all platforms, including 8 out of the past 10 Game-Of-The-Year-winning titles. We have grown rapidly over the past few years and now have 35 sites spanning the globe. The PTW umbrella of companies includes 1518 studios, SIDE and Orange Rock. Review code and mentor other engineers on the team. Write documentation on systems for designers, QA, and other engineers. Solid understanding of algorithms, performance, and debugging. Shipped products across multiple platforms with involvement in every stage of the development process. Experience using profiling tools to identify performance issues on client and server. Experience working across disciplines to implement optimizations to achieve performance goals. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Preferences Current generation console development experience. Experience with live service game development. Lead Combat Designer in Bungie

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

Bungie is seeking a highly technical, creative, and team-oriented Lead Combat Designer who is excited to build our next great game. Do you love the challenge of designing great gameplay? Are you excited to do the hard work of creating understanding across a large team to what you are trying to achieve, and take them along for the journey through development? Do you obsess over core game feel like camera FOV/shake changes, controller rumble values, and other behind the scenes tuning knobs? Are you a game designer looking to work on AAA games with talented and passionate people in a team environment? If so, we have the job for you! Bungie is looking for a passionate, creative and innovative Lead Combat Designer for a totally new third-Person action game! As a Lead Combat Designer, you will work closely with the Design Team to craft a robust sandbox of gameplay systems, abilities, combat synergies and content. You will collaborate with team members from other disciplines to drive a holistic gameplay experience. You will contribute to the design processes to ensure your work is the very best it can possibly be. Additionally, you will also work closely with other Leads to prepare creative plans and evaluations for our partners and guide our partners toward meeting the experiential needs of the players and markets. RESPONSIBILITIES Define and drive the player sandbox design principles to create a whole new combat space. Help set the direction for extensible combat systems and player mastery. Work closely with the Leadership Team to achieve experience goals. Help build compelling second-to-second gameplay experiences Collaboratively plan, design, and evaluate top notch abilities gameplay Work with audio, effects, and animation developers to make in-game sandbox affordances clear to players REQUIRED SKILLS Previous experience as a Combat Designer on a AAA or large-scale mobile game Experience designing, documenting, and building game feel systems with a focus on mechanics and philosophies that drive it Intuitive understanding of how second-to-second action games work and why people play them Excitement for collaboration with designers, artists, programmers, audio professionals, quality assurance and producers to achieve a common goal Ability to creatively align with the team and then take initiative locally and externally Social intelligence, great interpersonal skills, and empathy for creative teams Ability to handle ambiguity, including giving and handling feedback despite that ambiguity NICE-TO-HAVE SKILLS Experience in Animation; able to talk anticipation, follow through, character and timing Experience designing, documenting, and building weapon systems, damage systems, abilities, or any other sandbox system on any scale Portfolio demonstrating the drive to make great feeling action gameplay People management experience Discipline-leadership experience Experience successfully leading interdisciplinary teams through several game development cycles Experience hiring, training, mentoring, and managing peer and junior designers So you don't meet every requirement listed in this job description? Do you think your experience level is not where it needs to be? Studies show that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they believe they meet every single qualification. Bungie is focused on building a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace. If you're interested in this position but your past experience doesn't line up perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we want you to apply anyway. The right role for you may be right around the corner! Most Bungie full-time employees will adopt a digital first approach allowing remote work in Bungie approved locations (outside of positions identified as 100% onsite in Bellevue/Seattle, or individuals preferring a hybrid/flex environment). Prospective full-time employees located outside of CA, CO, DC, FL, GA, IL, MA, MD, MN, NC, NJ, NY, OR, TN, TX, UT, VA, WA, or WI will need to establish residency in one of the states we are compliant in within 45 days of a start date. Contractors will follow a digital first approach adhering to the location guidelines agreed upon by our third-party employer/vendor and Bungie. Bungie’s remote policy is subject to change at the company’s discretion.

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

Cold Iron is seeking a Combat Designer to join our world class team on our next AAA title for consoles and PC! This position is fully remote and open to applicants across the country. Are you passionate about innovating and working on large-scale game systems? Do you revel in creating combat experiences that are both challenging and gratifying? Here’s the most important one: Do you do it all for the game? Because you know that your talents are needed to make sure that even the best development teams get an awesome experience out the door? Awesome. Come join our creative, collaborative studio and get involved creating systems and combat with a tight, integrated team of game developers. Your Day to Day You can expect to be responsible and accountable for the following: Working with the project leads and other designers to develop gameplay systems that work within the overall vision of the product Brainstorming, documenting, and implementation of combat and other gameplay systems Working closely and effectively with others in cross-discipline teams during implementation and iteration Creating long-term RPG advancement gameplay systems Gathering playtest data, both quantitative and qualitative, and aid in coming up with solutions to make the gameplay and systems as fun as possible Qualitatively and quantitatively study and learn from combat systems in action, shooter, or MMORPG games Your Career Progression Do the best work of your career! No, really, that’s what we expect of you. Come aboard and work with industry veterans all working to improve their craft and become better game developers. Your portfolio of experience will grow, and the size of the audience you reach will expand exponentially. The small team atmosphere allows you to contribute more and have greater ownership over what you do day to day. Requirements Experience working on combat related systems in games, focusing on gameplay feel, class or role balance, and NPC design Experience working on large and complex gameplay systems including RPG economies, crafting systems, or loot driven systems with large number of assets Math and analytical skills with a proficiency in Excel Sense of level design, scale, and gameplay flow Enjoys playing and creating games Self-driven with strong communication skills Ability to tackle challenges and problem solve with a strong sense of ownership Ability to work closely with many other disciplines and be a team player Would Love to See 3+ years of industry experience in a systems or combat design role Experience with multiplayer games and/or shooters Experience with Unreal Engine Education No requirement Location This position is fully remote and open to applicants across the country. About our Location Cold Iron is a team of passionate game developers located in San Jose, California. We’re a diverse group of veterans with decades of experience developing and launching award-winning shooter, MMO, and action titles on PC and console. We launched Aliens: Fireteam Elite in August 2021 to critical acclaim and to a very devoted fan base. Exceptional employee benefits, Remote work; 18 days PTO first year in addition to 11 paid holidays plus company-wide shutdown between Christmas and New Year’s Day; Robust Medical, Dental, Vision insurance coverage for entire family; Company matched 401k vested immediately; Flex Spending Accounts, annual stipend to help cover work from home expenses, ultra-creative environment.

Lightforge Games is a new studio bringing the roleplaying back into RPGs. We're looking for people of all levels, backgrounds, voices, identities, and perspectives to join us on our journey. We strongly believe the key to making a better game, better company, and better industry begins with a diverse set of voices. We value transparency, empathy, and personal growth, and we believe that making games is both an art and a science. As a fully remote company, we're open to teammates living nearly anywhere. We practice nonlinear workdays, allowing everyone to determine how and when they work best. We also follow an open salary policy where all pay details are shared with everyone. This holds us accountable to fair pay. Lightforge Games is very much a work-in-progress, and you can help shape who we are. Come join us to build something special! Lightforge Games is looking for a Game Designer! We're looking for a Game Designer to help delight and engage our players. In this role, you'll conceptualize, pitch, implement, and balance game systems and features. You'll work with a team that values an open-minded, collaborative environment. We’re open to candidates of different experience levels. We’re looking for someone who is passionate about creating engaging and unique gameplay experiences and is excited to take on new challenges and to learn and grow along with us. Responsibilities Design fun and compelling classes, abilities, encounters, and other gameplay features. Collaborate and provide feedback on gameplay systems, art, and content development. Effectively communicate ideas, receive feedback, and iterate on designs. Organize and actively participate in playtests to both parse and provide gameplay feedback. Develop and maintain documentation. Embrace and uphold our Core Values. Listening to and empowering the stories of others, while contributing your own story to Lightforge’s development. Requirements Strong sense of what makes for fun game experiences A collaborative mindset that considers diverse perspectives Experience with playing roleplaying and creative games Desire to learn and grow. Solid math and problem solving skills Exceptional verbal and written communication skills Self-motivated and proactive, with ability to fully embrace a remote work culture Pluses Familiarity with scripting languages Experience with Unreal Engine 4/5 development Experience with playing tabletop games Prior work experience or education in other (non-design) disciplines, such as programming or production. If this sounds like a job you might be suited for, but maybe you think you're not quite ready, we’d love to hear from you anyway! You never know what's around the corner... Join us and we’ll do brilliant work together. *Required documents that allow a careful evaluation of your application are resume, cover letter and additional samples (Portfolio link)* Relocation & Remote Work Although we believe living close to our studio helps foster team spirit and stronger bonds between team members, we understand that people have different needs and expectations for their place of residence. You have a choice of three location options, allowing you to work with Crytek from anywhere you wish: Come to our modern headquarters in Frankfurt and receive an attractive relocation package and have access to all of our benefits. If you are already living in a European Union member state, we are able to offer you a permanent work contract and allow you to work remotely as an employee from there. If you are interested in full-time remote work in any other country outside of the European Union, we can offer you a freelance contract arrangement. Responsibilities Development of UX strategies and UX designs, both long and short terms Lead the UX Design team on a large franchise, including the management of priorities and greenlight process Create and develop a UX Research pipeline with our UX Researcher Conception of guidance, interaction design and information architecture in cooperation with our programmers and game designers. Take initiative and willing to expand own horizon. Mentor and help team members to grow and excel within their roles Work in a close relationship with the UI/UX Project Manager and the UI Art Lead Requirements 6+ years of experience as a video game UX designer. Evidence of being a leader or role model, within their trade, at a team level and with the necessary management skills to run a team on a day-to-day basis Experience with common wire framing and prototyping tools such as Figma, AdobeXD, Axure or Balsamiq. Strong visualization and presentation skills. Established interpersonal and organizational skills. Must work well in a team-oriented environment. Excellent English communication and writing skills. Be proactive and self-motivated, work without direct supervision. Pluses BFA in Design, Interaction Design, Computer Science or similar. Additional language experience (good knowledge of Flash / Action Script is a strong plus). Familiarity with Scaleform. Version-control systems (Perforce, SVN, CVS, VSS) familiarity. Shipped-title experience on both PC and Consoles What you can expect from us A refreshing yet highly professional atmosphere in a diverse team. Flexible work time. FUN. Free public transportation ticket, which lets you use public transport free of charge 24/7. Free onsite German lessons for our employees. Company language is English. Any additional language is a plus, but not a requirement. Extensive assistance with getting visa, work permits and communication with local authorities. Relocation support. A company apartment for your first few months and help in finding a private apartment. ...and much more!

During these uncertain times and rapidly changing environment surrounding COVID-19, all positions at Bungie are subject to onboarding and working virtually/remotely. Once the studio is fully reopened, most work is expected to be performed in-person at our main headquarters in Bellevue, Washington. RESPONSIBILITIES Build and maintain large-scale UI/UX features within our Systems Org and contribute directly to our design guidelines and style guides Gain proficiency in proprietary software tools and pipeline processes to implement visual designs (including visual elements like text, bitmaps, and animations) to a fully-functional and polished state Collaborate with engineering on toolbox, technical requirements, and data flows Collaborate closely with fellow designers to creatively solve design problems, taking into account UX principles and technical limitations Devise and champion best practices for implementation in the areas of structure, organization, reusability, and maintainability. Advocate best practices for UI content development and principles and communicate changes to stakeholders across a whole project Utilize graphics software applications to design and produce graphics for UI content Aid and support in final design and visual polish of various in-game elements, as needed REQUIRED SKILLS Experience in the field of technical implementation and deployment of large-scale games or software solutions Skills in implementing a fully functional and visually polished User Interface Practical understanding of UX methodology, UI mechanics, and Design theory Effective at communication and problem solving An understanding of graphics optimization and engine constraints Ability to take creative approach to solving challenging, complex problems Strong organization skills and the ability to follow established conventions Technical ability to pick up complex authoring tools effectively Enthusiasm for making industry leading game UI NICE-TO-HAVE SKILLS Scripting/programming experience Experience working in Agile and using a User-Centered Design process Previous working experience in games across multiple platforms Motion Graphics and Visual Effects In 2022, most Bungie employees and contractors will adopt a flexible schedule working from home (outside of positions identified as either 100% onsite or fully remote in CA, FL, IL, NC, OR, TX, and WA). Currently, only a select range of positions are available for remote work in CA, FL, IL, NC, OR, TX, and WA (please review location for details). Prospective employees located outside of CA, FL, IL, NC, OR, TX, and WA will need to establish residency in one of the states we are compliant in within 45 days of a start date. Bungie’s work from home, flexible work schedule, and remote policy is subject to change at the company’s discretion.

Systems Designer in Jagex

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

Company Overview: A leader in creating deep and engaging experiences on PC and mobile, Jagex was founded in 2001 and is today one of the UK’s biggest and most respected video game developers and publishers. Famed for its flagship MMOs RuneScape and Old School RuneScape, Jagex has welcomed more than 260million player accounts to its world and created a $1bn lifetime franchise revenue. Today the RuneScape franchise exists beyond running games in live operations; our titles are living games that connect and inspire millions of players, with content and experiences both inside and outside of inexhaustible game worlds. Both RuneScape and Old School RuneScape, on PC and mobile, offer ever-evolving, highly-active worlds and our community-focussed development ethos empowers players to have a real say in how each game is shaped. Jagex is expanding and extending its portfolio with fresh franchise titles, new IP and, in 2018 launched Jagex Partners, delivering third-party publishing and operational services exclusively for the living games of the future. Jagex employs more than 400 people at its Cambridge headquarters and is on the hunt for talented people to work across the business to help the company to achieve yet another year of record growth and player satisfaction. Project Background: Jagex has begun exciting new projects that leverage our legendary RuneScape IP in creative ways. We are expanding a project team with expertise in the latest technologies, focused around Unreal Engine 5, to create a highly-skilled, player-focused development group that you could join. A core team based in Cambridge, augmented by members distributed globally, form a friendly, talented bunch keen to invite new members. Apply your passion for creating unforgettable online games and drive technology development to help us fulfil our vision for a deep, community-driven, connected, multi-platform Open World Survival Craft experience, set in the RuneScape universe. Job Purpose: Jagex are seeking a talented System Designer to join our team in building an exciting new IP in Unreal Engine 5. Reporting to the Lead Designer, you will work alongside a cross disciplined team to plan, prototype and build game systems that impact all pillars of the game’s design. Design responsibilities include, but are not limited to, RPG-lite elements, technical writing, game flow and continual improvements and refinements to existing systems. Key Duties Include: Document game mechanics and features to serve as a knowledge base for all disciplines to understand the required design concepts for implementation. Coordinate with and work alongside programmers and artists to achieve the goals and specific needs of various game systems. Design and work in unreal to integrate a wide range of features and systems required for the game. Work with leads and scrum teams as well as directors to ensure all aspects of the game are hitting expected quality benchmarks. Essential Skills: Deep knowledge and understanding of RPG and survival-craft systems. Capable of writing design specifications and developing systems for multiplayer games. Knowledge of system constraints and game engine architectures to understand how to effectively work within them to deliver assets. Demonstrable organized approach to problem solving and time management. Clear analytical thinker with a proven ability to break gameplay design down into regular, reusable systems. Current on industry trends as it relates to modern systems design. 2+ years of game design experience in a System Design capacity. Passion for games and game development. Positive attitude, strong work ethic, and the ability to work in a highly collaborative team environment. Company Benefits: Flexible Working Bonus Scheme Private Health Care Gym Membership Generous Pension Contributions Life Insurance Free Cycle Repair Income Protection Dental Plan Free Fruit and Drinks Subsidised Canteen Feel like you fit this role, but don’t meet all the requirements? We strive for fresh perspectives, so as long as you can demonstrate how your attitude and other abilities might make up for any gaps we would welcome your application! Jagex are an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy or maternity, religion or belief.

Technical Designer in Bloober Team

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

If you’re searching for something more than just a workplace, if you want to be a co-creator rather than just another cog in the machine, if you want to go down in the history of the game industry working as a part of great productions – read this ad. Bloober Team S.A. is not only a leading horror producer, with strong financial ground beneath it, a clear strategy and perhaps most interestingly, a portfolio of pending productions. Most of all, it’s a place of business with a comfortable and open working atmosphere, and a great team working with passion soon to be found on the new generation of consoles. If you’re looking not only for a well-paid job, but also a great atmosphere and the opportunity to be remembered for your work – apply to this position: Technical Designer Within this role you will be responsible for: Creating instruments for other design, engineering and art departments to use; design, prototype, integrate, iterate and polish game mechanics, systems and development tools. You will ensure the communication and clear understanding of technical tasks by all teams involved in a project. You will prototype game features to prove designs to be valid and you'll create wholesome technical documentation to solidify the game design vision of the project. On a daily basis you will be in charge of technical workflow and pipelines, owning, adjusting and expanding them. At the final stages of the project you'll be the one to advance the quality and performance of the whole game, actively assist with delivering stable game builds while meeting target platform requirements and technical limitations. Job requirements Analytical and problem solving mindset; Willing to learn yourself and mentor your colleagues on possibilities of technologies and create new ones with your own hands; Good knowledge of visual scripting (Blueprints most preferable); In-depth knowledge of in-engine tools for UE family of game engines (profilers, debuggers, analyzers, reflectors); Solid understanding of programming patterns, conventions, code and project architecture; At least basic knowledge of C++ for UE4/UE5 (being able to read/debug preexisting code); Experience in indie/AA/AAA commercial project on any role; Proven record of skills and achievements in indie/AA/AAA commercial game projects (either your name in a game credits or personal published or finished projects or finalised mechanics online portfolio); English level not less then B2 It would also be nice if you have: Good knowledge of system design and user-oriented tools development (dev to dev); BSc/MSc in computer science, cybernetics or mathematics; Hands-on Unreal Engine 5 (new subsystems and pipelines); Profound Technical/Gameplay/System Design experience; Pre Production to Post-Release experience on at least one major project; Experience with game console optimisation and compliance to meet platform holder requirements (pref., current generation PS5, XboxSeriesS/X, Nintendo Switch); Mastery in any additional gamedev field or deep knowledge of several ones. What do we have to offer: Earnings fitting to your skills and experience, possibility of long-term cooperation on current and upcoming projects, work in a creative environment, in a committed team of game enthusiasts, work in a modern, comfortable office, or remotely. flexible working hours, days off, private healthcare, and working with new technologies.

Senior Game Designer in Tarboosh Games

Jobs available in Remote Job

Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps. With 6 billion downloads and over 300 million monthly active users, Voodoo is the #2 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google. The company is one of the most impressive examples of hypergrowth in the ecosystem, having raised over $1B and backed by Goldman Sachs, Tencent, and GBL. Deciding to expand its portfolio of products further, Voodoo has more recently announced that it will invest $200M in blockchain gaming studios, to lead the transformation of mobile gaming. Voodoo is now a team of over 700 employees worldwide, we’re looking for talented individuals from across the globe to come and entertain the world with us. Team Voodoo's Gaming business unit is made up of hyper-casual, hybrid-casual, casual, mid-core and blockchain experts. Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games. You will be part of a great small team looking to create new experiences for our audience beyond the casual market joining one of our Live Casual Studio : Tarboosh Games. Although Tarboosh is situated between Dubai & Istanbul and we are looking for someone open to Full Remote within a reasonable time zone. We embrace a remote culture, working collaboratively while providing autonomy and flexibility to allow you to manage your success on the team. Ability to conceptualize original game mechanics and level settings and push them through to completion. Destiny Senior UI Engineer - Player Identity in Bungie

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

Do you appreciate smooth user interfaces? Do you cringe at unintuitive menus and unresponsive controls? Do you have an eye for detail and polished experiences? Would you like to work on awe-inspiring worlds that bring people together, sitting next to inspirational industry talent at a company that values work-life balance and is invested in creating an inclusive workplace for every employee? As a Senior UI Engineer at Bungie on the Player Identity team, you will be responsible for designing, developing, maintaining, and evolving user interface code systems for features that celebrate Destiny players' personality, history, collections, and friendships. You will be directly involved in enabling our creative teams to bring elegant UI designs to life, empowering them to craft incredible player experiences. Additionally, you’ll bring a passion for growing the skills and capabilities of engineering peers and more junior staff. RESPONSIBILITIES Build and maintain production-quality C++ code Work closely with members of the UI/UX disciplines to help bring their visions to life Collaborate with designers and engineers across diverse teams to create, maintain, and extend UI systems and features Leverage and extend our in-game user interface engine and related designer tools Directly manage 1-2 engineers, providing support, mentorship, constructive feedback, and career development guidance REQUIRED SKILLS Professional C/C++ coding experience Experience developing user interfaces and interface systems for console and/or PC games Enthusiasm for user experience and the way it interfaces with software Ability to communicate effectively with customers of different technical and non-technical backgrounds to build features and achieve goals NICE-TO-HAVE SKILLS Experience leading (managing, mentoring, or guiding) engineers through planning, developing, and shipping Prior console development experience Most Bungie full-time employees will adopt a digital first approach allowing remote work in Bungie approved locations (outside of positions identified as 100% onsite in Bellevue/Seattle, or individuals preferring a hybrid/flex environment). Prospective full-time employees located outside of CA, CO, DC, FL, GA, IL, MA, MD, MN, NC, NJ, NY, OR, TN, TX, UT, VA, WA, or WI will need to establish residency in one of the states we are compliant in within 45 days of a start date. Contractors will follow a digital first approach adhering to the location guidelines agreed upon by our third-party employer/vendor and Bungie. Bungie’s remote policy is subject to change at the company’s discretion.

Jobs available in Remote Job

Disruptive Games is a veteran development studio specializing in multiplayer and online experiences. We are an independently owned studio working on a AAA, fully-funded title with original IP! We’re expanding our fully-remote team with people who share our passion for collaborative, multiplayer gameplay. Disruptive Games is looking for a Director of Game Design to drive our design process, partnering with senior leadership to champion the game’s vision from ideation to ship. What You'll Do Collaborate with the Creative Director and senior leadership to execute on the defined vision for the design of the project Champion the projects vision and pillars across the company clearly and with inspiriting enthusiasm Demonstrate a passion for creating positive, collaborative, and fun multi-player experiences to delight players Oversee the design of game systems from ideation through completion, advising on timeline and resources Partner closely with Production to define feature scope and production milestones Build and develop a team of game designers, in partnership with Talent & People, through recruiting, hiring, and team mentorship Interface with with publishing and external resources to ensure a smooth and positive development process What You Bring: Experience providing strategic leadership to a team of Designers on large scale, AAA projects from early development through launch Strong understanding of the ins and outs of video game design Ability to communicate game ideas and mechanics in a clear, inspiring way Ability to push the rapid iteration of features and ideas, collaborating with the team in a way that empowers others Ability to foster alignment across the broader team through clear, focused documentation Deep understanding of the design resources required to execute on deliverables, with an eye for planning in collaboration with Production Strong desire to share your expertise through mentoring a growing design team Knowledge and understanding of game engines, preferably Unreal Engine Expert knowledge of gameplay in collaborative, multiplayer games Disruptive Games is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Product Designer in Fortis Games

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

WHO WE ARE At Fortis Games we aspire to make great games that bring people together while redefining how game companies work. We believe in building a sense of belonging through our games, their communities, and how we operate and treat each other. Through our game communities, we will create powerful connections and lasting memories. We will foster a culture of diversity, equity and belonging where together our diverse skills, experiences and background impact the games we make. We are an early but mighty organization with a leadership team of game industry veterans. There are many opportunities for you to have a big impact on the products we’ll be making as well as the overall direction of the company. If you’re passionate about tackling difficult problems with direct and thoughtful communication and team first mentality, we may be the right place for you. ABOUT THE ROLE You’ll be a key part of a prototyping team exploring new innovative design spaces working on next-generation games as a service. Share learnings with the broader product team and contribute to the overall development of our product strategy and portfolio of games. WHAT YOU’LL ACHIEVE You will play a critical role on a small prototyping team during exploration of new game concepts: Creating proposals that articulate how these features and systems uphold the game’s design pillars and drive the desired player behaviors Delivering clear, concise, and thorough specifications to cross functional teams responsible for implementing these systems Designing, balancing and tuning content based on the high level goals different systems in the game You will become an expert in the systems and features you work on and become a resource to team members in your areas of mastery. You will develop an independent design philosophy that upholds the key tenets of Fortis’ approach to products while adding your own unique approach to thinking about emerging patterns in service design. WHAT YOU’LL NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL An understanding of fundamental design principles, metagame systems, game economies, and player psychology that allows you to design from first principles. Great sense for game balance, progression, and pacing and an exceptional attention to detail. Enthusiasm for solving tough problems and strong critical thinking skills. Ability to synthesize feedback from team members and rapidly iterate on designs. A natural curiosity and eagerness to learn - we believe this is essential to our ability to stay ahead of the market and value this over years of experience. We expect all team members to be students of their craft and the game spaces they’re working in. You should be educated on the latest trends and have a strong perspective on how they relate to our current and future projects regardless of your title or role. #LI-Remote WHY JOIN US There are many reasons to join us, but here are a few: We strongly believe we are changing how games studios operate and at the core of what we do is making great games that create a connected community Culture of diversity and inclusion and support to all team members Work with some of the industry's coolest people who have designed and launched the best games in the world Fortis is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Principal Game Designer in Fortis Games

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

Remote - Americas WHO WE ARE At Fortis Games we aspire to make great games that bring people together while redefining how game companies work. We believe in building a sense of belonging through our games, their communities, and how we operate and treat each other. Through our game communities, we will create powerful connections and lasting memories. We will foster a culture of diversity, equity and belonging where together our diverse skills, experiences and background impact the games we make. We are an early but mighty organization with a leadership team of game industry veterans. There are many opportunities for you to have a big impact on the products we’ll be making as well as the overall direction of the company. If you’re passionate about tackling difficult problems with direct and thoughtful communication and team first mentality, we may be the right place for you. ABOUT THE ROLE (THE MISSION, WHY THIS ROLE EXISTS, THE THING YOU DO OVER AND OVER AGAIN) Drive the product vision for a new game concept from ideation and prototyping through production and launch. Help build, lead, and nurture the growth of a team of talented Product Managers and Game Designers. Share learnings with the broader product team and contribute to the overall development of our product strategy and portfolio of games. WHAT YOU’LL ACHIEVE (OUTCOMES VS WHAT PEOPLE WILL DO) You will identify an opportunity space and work with product leadership to build a game concept that clearly articulates how we can win in this space. You will lead the prototyping efforts to prove out the concept and find its best expression by: Carrying the product vision and defining the game design pillars that guide the team’s major decisions Driving discussions and maintaining alignment on the team as you navigate through complex and ambiguous design spaces Ultimately architecting a set of systems that meet your prototyping goals and give us strong conviction in the commercial viability of the game You will have helped build and mentor a highly effective and engaged product team who push themselves and one another to their fullest potential. You will become an expert in the opportunity spaces, genres, and game mechanics you explore during prototyping and share your learnings with the broader product team to advance our collective knowledge. You will develop an independent design philosophy that upholds the key tenets of Fortis’ approach to products while adding your own unique approach to thinking about emerging patterns in service design. WHAT YOU’LL NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL (COMPETENCIES) A holistic view of game systems and the downstream effects of all design decisions throughout both the product and player lifecycle. A firm understanding of fundamental design principles, metagame systems, game economies, and player psychology that allows you to design from first principles. Ability to communicate your creative vision in a way that inspires and motivates teams. Ability to articulate the nuances of abstract concepts and how they apply to complex, interrelated systems. Ability to synthesize feedback from team members, user playtests, and other validation efforts into product insights and rapidly iterate on designs. A razor-sharp focus on what matters and the discipline to ruthlessly prioritize against it. Extensive knowledge of games as a service and live operations – you know what good looks like and can build efficient design processes, workflows, and tooling to enable it. Enthusiasm for directing, mentoring, and otherwise elevating the people around you to do their best work. A natural curiosity and eagerness to learn - we believe this is essential to our ability to stay ahead of the market and value this over years of experience. We expect our leaders to continue being students of their craft and the game spaces they’re working in. You should be educated on the latest trends and have a strong perspective on how they relate to our current and future projects. WHY JOIN US There are many reasons to join us, but here are a few: We strongly believe we are changing how games studios operate and at the core of what we do is making great games that create a connected community Culture of diversity and inclusion and support to all team members Work with some of the industry's coolest people who have designed and launched the best games in the world Fortis is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Senior Game Designer in Maxis Studios

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

Locations: This is a fully remote position, available across most European locations. Welcome to Maxis, home to tinkerers, craftspeople, & storytellers. Our drive is to inspire everyone to make a better world through creative play. As the developer of The Sims, we create games and experiences for millions of people around the world and are always looking for new ways to inspire our players. Maxis is a place where you can do what you love and help others grow while doing it; a place where your unique voice can be heard and seen. We put creativity and inclusivity at the core of our work and don’t settle for seeing the world only as it is, but strive to build a world as it could be. Read on to see how you can join our team and dream big. As a Senior Game Designer on The Sims 4, you'll work with a team of enthusiastic industry craftspeople from all walks of life. You will use your passion and knowledge to design player-first experiences that surprise, delight, and invite millions of Simmers around the world to Play with Life. You will report into our European Senior Development Director. Responsibilities: Design and own features from concept through implementation to completion. Establish player experience goals for designs, implement and tune features to meet those goals. Mentor more junior members of the team and provide feedback to other Designers. Improve designs based on play test feedback, game metrics, team input and community feedback. Think creatively using the tools and time available to build unique and fun experiences for players. Adopt and become proficient in new or proprietary development tools to implement and debug your work. Think about the future when implementing content, resulting in smartly scripted scalable systems and good design patterns and practices. Collaborate with all team disciplines, including artists, animators, modelers, engineers, quality assurance, and producers to get support from the team and guide a project from initial design to final production. Advocate for the design vision and get the team excited to work on it. Balance your design vision with input from your peers to find practical solutions that achieve the intended player experience. Become an expert on the game and our community, drawing from our large, varied player base and our past games to make and defend intelligent design choices going forward. Help establish best practices for the team and improve process and efficiency. Requirements: Shipped a AAA HD title. Excellent creative skills with experience creating detailed design documentation and maintaining it throughout a project life cycle. Design and implementation experience with game features that focus on open-ended player creativity. Effective at working both autonomously and in groups of different profiles. Experience with games in The Sims PC franchise and other simulation games. Other desirable skills: Led and mentored a small team of Designers. Comfortable with Visio, JIRA, online collaboration suites such as Confluence. More About Maxis: Many team members have a tenure of over a decade. Here are some top reasons folks join our team and stay: Work life balance. We work diligently to ensure we make incredible products while prioritizing our team member’s wellbeing. We uphold a people first mentality. Commitment to diversity. We take immense pride in the diversity of our team members. We know unique perspectives and experiences are critical to our success as a team in order to produce the leading simulation game in the world. Creative autonomy. We firmly believe good ideas come from anywhere. Joining the team means contributing to the whole production process, from concept through final in game experience. Purpose. We provide meaningful content that impacts our player’s in game and real world experiences, motivating us to push the boundaries of what’s possible. Community. We thrive at Maxis because of our incredibly supportive and creative colleagues and players that bring fun and positivity into doing what we love. About EA We exist to inspire the world to play. Through innovative technology and immersive storytelling, we deliver new ways of experiencing worlds of interactive entertainment for our millions of players worldwide. Our strength lies in the diversity of our people, combining creativity, innovation and passion. We fully champion inclusive culture, and provide opportunities for growing, learning, and leading that allows for the most impactful and rewarding work of our teams’ careers. We put our people first, and we make sure they’re taken care of both in and out of the office. As we reflect on our learnings and successes from remote work, we aim to provide dynamic, collaborative and flexible work environments for our teams. Our employees connect through our Employee Resource Groups, which are actively involved in driving business decisions every step of the way. But our support doesn’t end at the workplace—we also encourage a balanced lifestyle with paid time off and new parent leave, free video games, fitness reimbursement and more. Our goal is to provide a safe, respectful and inspiring workplace for all of our employees. Through our diversity, equity, inclusion and social responsibility programs, we’re doing the work to give everyone the space to be their full selves while giving back to our community. We’re looking for problem-solvers, game-changers, innovators, dreamers, doers—people that are ready to move the needle and build on our success. As our industry accelerates, we aren’t just keeping up—we’re staying ahead of the game. Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Senior UI Technical Artist in Ubisoft

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

Ubisoft’s 20,000 team members, working across more than 30 countries around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players’ lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their commitment and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin’s Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting edge technologies and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown. JOB DESCRIPTION We are looking for an experienced Senior UI Technical Artist to join our team as the link between art and code! You'll work with industry-leading tools, like our proprietary game engine, and collaborate with a team of UI/UX Designers, Artists, Designers, and Programmers, to create advanced UI content for our games. What you'll do: Implement static and animated user interfaces utilizing our node-based, visual scripting language, that are easy to understand, easy to navigate, and convey information for effective end user experience. Provide in game UI assets to support team-wide project communication vision, and marketing needs. Build logical UI Flows and produce the final engine assets. Execute UI design in engine with a keen eye for detail at all levels – keeping in mind the overall art treatment, screen-to-screen- UI placement, and data structures, while applying and maintaining consistency throughout the entire project interface. Communicate and collaborate with all disciplines necessary to deliver features on time, in line with the art direction, and with the players best interest in mind. Ensure our UI is optimal with continued iteration and development. Identify priorities and gaps in current designs, data structures, and contribute/iterate on creative/technical solutions. QUALIFICATIONS 5+ years of game development experience as a Technical UI Artist in games or equivalent. Experience with node-based scripting languages or coding languages (C#, Python, Java, etc.). A leadership mindset with a proven ability to work with a team first mentality. A strong eye for quality and are always seeking to improve. Desire to solve problems and ability to think both technically and artistically, considering accessibility and optimization in your work. Exceptional Interpersonal skills – able to interact with team members of different disciplines and personality types. Strong understanding of engine technologies, optimization, and data structures. Extensive knowledge of UI in games across multiple genres on all platforms. A positive attitude with the ability to give and receive constructive feedback. Ability to find and debug issues within content. It is a bonus if you have: A desire to grow into a leadership role. Proven experience developing UI for a AAA production from conception through to release. Understanding of various design tools (e.g. Figma, Adobe Suite & 3D software). Knowledge in Shading in nodes (HLSL/GLSL). Portfolio showing a wide range of work. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION Heavily subsidized paid medical and dental insurance for employees and dependents. Paid life and short- and long-term disability insurance. 401(k) plan with match. New hires start with 3 weeks of vacation annually, increasing to a cap of 5 weeks based on years of service along with 3 additional weeks of wellness time. 10 paid holidays (and we’re closed the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day). 12 weeks paid maternity leave and 6 weeks paid paternity leave. Employee Assistance Program. Body-Mind-Soul monthly reimbursement program for eligible activities. Strong, incentivized, employee referral program. Flexible work schedule. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

JOB DESCRIPTION We are looking for a Senior UI Artist to join our multidisciplinary and international team, where active communication and collaboration is crucial, and where people are eager to achieve the best player experience possible together. As a Senior UI Artist, you will help drive the development of the UI, setting up the UI pipeline, and documentation standards while guiding intermediate/junior UI Artist(s) in following those guidelines. What you'll do Concept and Design and create static and animated UI for in-game screens, features, and content, utilizing Adobe Suite, Figma, or 3D software that are easy to understand, easy to navigate, and convey information for a quality end user experience. Provide AAA artwork to support team-wide project communication, vision, and marketing needs. Build logical UI flows and produce the final interface work. Execute UI design with a keen eye for detail at all levels – keeping in mind the overall art treatment and screen-to-screen UI placement, applying and maintaining consistency throughout the entire project interface. Communicate and collaborate with all members of the team, helping to establish and maintain team culture. Identify priorities and gaps in current designs and contribute/iterate on creative solutions. Maintain style guide assets to ensure consistency across the department. Provide mentorship and knowledge-share with other UI artists. Coordinate with the QA department to identify and call out visual inconsistencies.
