Gameplay Security Engineer - XDefiant in Ubisoft

Requires Skils: OOPS,Data Structures

Jobs available in Remote Job

Keeping out the cheaters and making the game environment fair for everyone is a constant challenge and a rewarding struggle. We all know how important it is to give people the chance to show off their skills without having to contend with script kiddies running aimbots. Think you have what it takes to make the next generation of games a place people want to play? Join XDefiant and show us your game security skills and help us lock out the losers who need cheats to even be on the leader board. We are looking for a highly talented, motivated, and experienced person to work with us on XDefiant, a new multiplatform online multiplayer action game based in our San Francisco studio. XDefiant is a free-to-play, fast-paced arena shooter that combines intense combat with personalized loadouts and specialized factions, as teams battle for domination. You’ll be working to make the game client and servers are as secure as possible, so we can ensure that our users get the best, fairest game experience possible. Working to make sure the game server data is secure and validated, blocking game exploits, and helping create the best possible play environment. You will work with a small, collaboration-oriented team where you will have the opportunity to contribute in meaningful ways. ­­WHAT YOU'LL DO Analyze the game ecosystem for exploits Ensure that server logic and server-client interactions are secure and validated Collaborate with the networking team to harden and optimize network traffic Maintain and extend documentation on gameplay security best practices Self-manage programming task schedule updates and coordinate with production team Ensure that your code meets the team's coding standards to deliver high quality and maintainable code QUALIFICATIONS WHAT YOU'LL BRING Solid C/C++ development skills Several shipped titles as Gameplay or Game Security Engineer Experience in developing and implementing key gameplay systems Autonomous, problem-solving, and open-minded attitude Debugging and analytical skills ADDITIONAL INFORMATION WHAT YOU'LL GET Medical, dental, and vision coverage Employer HSA contribution to fully cover your deductible (with enrollment in a HSA eligible medical plan) 401k match Paid vacation, holiday and wellness time Fitness, physical challenge, and eSports competition reimbursements Ginger emotional support app for you and your adult dependents with up to 10 sessions per year of video-based therapy and psychiatry services Membership to One Medical Rocket Lawyer online legal service membership Paid parental leave Paid time off to volunteer Pawternity – paid time off to bond with a newly adopted pet Sabbatical leave available after 5 years of employment Access to all of the latest Ubisoft games for PC Generous discount on new Ubisoft games All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guideline Ubisoft is composed of over 20,000 talented people located in 55+ development studios and offices across the globe. With more than 80% of our teams dedicated to creation, Ubisoft is the biggest in-house creative force in the industry. MORE ABOUT US Ubisoft is composed of over 20,000 talented people located in 55+ development studios and offices across the globe. With more than 80% of our teams dedicated to creation, Ubisoft is the biggest in-house creative force in the industry. Ubisoft’s worldwide network of video game development studios and business offices work hand-in-hand each day to deliver rich and innovative gaming experiences that reflect the creativity and diversity of their teams. This cross-studio collaboration model means every team member has the opportunity to participate in challenging projects based on iconic brands including Assassin's Creed®, Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six Siege®, Tom Clancy's The Division®, For Honor®, Rabbids®, Rayman®, Watch Dogs®, Far Cry®, The Crew®, Just Dance® and more. Ubisoft is a global leader in the video games and entertainment software industry. We are committed to enriching player’s lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. We create worlds where people can express themselves, explore and discover new possibilities. Are you looking to work with enthusiastic experts who are tackling game-changing challenges in entertainment and beyond? At Ubisoft, we offer an open environment where bright ideas are given a chance to shine, and everyone is eager to share knowledge. Skills and competencies show up in different forms and can be based on different experiences, that's why we strongly encourage you to apply even though you may not have all the requirements listed above. At Ubisoft, you can come as you are. We embrace diversity in all its forms. We’re committed to fostering a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences. Ubisoft is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that reflects the diversity of our player community. We are an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability status. Take entertainment to the next level. Join us and create the unknown. We do not accept any unsolicited resumes submitted by staffing or placement agencies or recruiters.

Jobs available in Remote Job

We are looking for a highly talented, motivated, and experienced person to work with us on XDefiant, a new multiplatform online multiplayer action game based in our San Francisco studio. XDefiant is a free-to-play, fast-paced arena shooter that combines intense combat with personalized loadouts and specialized factions, as teams of battle for domination. As a Senior Gameplay Engineer, you’ll focus on designing and building the game systems that are the foundation of our game. You will also be optimizing, expanding, and adding core features to our engine technology in areas such as AI, navigation, online play, and audio. As a dependable member of a cohesive online game team, you will participate in the design, coding, testing, integration, and debugging of the game’s features and content with creators from multiple disciplines. You’ll also be part of the diverse Ubisoft San Francisco team. We embrace a variety of work situations based on what’s best for the team, and we welcome people working in our SF office, remotely from other locations, or some combination of the two. We put a priority on supporting our team members and what makes them happiest and most productive. Jobs available in Remote Job

When you’re an Online Engineer at Ubi San Francisco, you have direct influence over the quality of XDefiant’s online experience. You are entrusted with developing the game’s online features, optimizing online performance, and developing custom services deployed to the cloud. You are part of a team developing the infrastructure, preparing the game for launch, and working with the support team once it’s live. During the game’s development, you commit yourself to answering the most fundamental questions: Do the servers scale to support hundreds of thousands of concurrent users? Will it be easy for the player to connect? Are the matchmaking systems giving players the best games possible? Is the whole experience as seamless as it can be? As a dependable member of a cohesive online team, you will participate in the design, coding, integration, and debugging of the game’s networked and online features.  You care about providing our players with the seamless online playground they deserve. Rendering Engineer – XDefiant in Ubisoft

Requires Skils: OOPS,Data Structures

Jobs available in Remote Job

We are looking for a highly talented, motivated, and experienced person to work with us on XDefiant, a new multiplatform online multiplayer action game based in our San Francisco studio. XDefiant is a free-to-play, fast-paced arena shooter that combines intense combat with personalized loadouts and specialized factions, as teams battle for domination. You’ll be working to design, create, and extend the rendering systems which bring our games to life. Based on the Snowdrop engine, XDefiant brings cutting-edge visuals to the latest platforms, and your contributions will enable the game content and our target platforms to shine. You will work on a small, collaboration-oriented team where you will have the opportunity to contribute in meaningful ways. You’ll be part of the diverse Ubisoft San Francisco team. We embrace a variety of work situations based on what’s best for the team, and we welcome people working in our SF office, remotely from other locations, or some combination of the two. We put a priority on supporting our team members and what makes them happiest and most productive. WHAT YOU'LL DO Extend and improve the existing rendering systems Improve rendering system compatibility Optimize rendering code and systems Collaborate with the Lead Core Engineer on technical design and feature roll out Work with game teams and other engineers to identify systems in need of maintenance, optimization, or refactoring Coordinate with other developers to ensure smooth roll out of new features Review the work of other engineers and provide mentorship Create and maintain technical design documents QUALIFICATIONS WHAT YOU'LL BRING C/C++ experience with understanding of multi-threaded programming techniques Solid graphics knowledge using Direct3D or OpenGL Experience writing and optimizing shaders using HLSL or GLSL Experience building games as an engineer for PlayStation, Xbox, or PC Ability to be self-directed, focused, and detail-oriented Understanding of low-level optimizations and core subsystems, memory management, cross-platform development Experience on the new generation of consoles (PS5, Xbox Series X) ADDITIONAL INFORMATION WHAT YOU'LL GET Medical, dental, and vision coverage Employer HSA contribution to fully cover your deductible (with enrollment in a Ubisoft games All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guideline MORE ABOUT US Ubisoft is composed of over 20,000 talented people located in 55+ development studios and offices across the globe. With more than 80% of our teams dedicated to creation, Ubisoft is the biggest in-house creative force in the industry. Ubisoft’s worldwide network of video game development studios and business offices work hand-in-hand each day to deliver rich and innovative gaming experiences that reflect the creativity and diversity of their teams. This cross-studio collaboration model means every team member has the opportunity to participate in challenging projects based on iconic brands including Assassin's Creed®, Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six Siege®, Tom Clancy's The Division®, For Honor®, Rabbids®, Rayman®, Watch Dogs®, Far Cry®, The Crew®, Just Dance® and more. Ubisoft is a global leader in the video games and entertainment software industry. We are committed to enriching player’s lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. We create worlds where people can express themselves, explore and discover new possibilities. Are you looking to work with enthusiastic experts who are tackling game-changing challenges in entertainment and beyond? At Ubisoft, we offer an open environment where bright ideas are given a chance to shine, and everyone is eager to share knowledge. Skills and competencies show up in different forms and can be based on different experiences, that's why we strongly encourage you to apply even though you may not have all the requirements listed above. At Ubisoft, you can come as you are. We embrace diversity in all its forms. We’re committed to fostering a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences. Ubisoft is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that reflects the diversity of our player community. We are an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability status. Take entertainment to the next level. Join us and create the unknown. We do not accept any unsolicited resumes submitted by staffing or placement agencies or recruiters.

Senior Core Engineer – XDefiant in Ubisoft

Requires Skils: OOPS,Data Structures

Jobs available in Remote Job

We are looking for a highly talented, motivated, and experienced person to work with us on XDefiant, a new multiplatform online multiplayer action game based in our San Francisco studio. XDefiant is a free-to-play, fast-paced arena shooter that combines intense combat with personalized loadouts and specialized factions, as teams of battle for domination. As a Senior Core Engineer, you’ll be working deep in the Snowdrop engine, working to design, create, and extend the underlying general and platform-specific systems which bring our games to life. You’ll be adding functionality and features, improving performance, and expanding the Snowdrop engine’s capabilities. Your contributions will empower the content developers and our target platforms to shine. You will work on a small collaboration-oriented team where you will have the opportunity to contribute in meaningful ways. You’ll also be part of the diverse Ubisoft San Francisco team. We embrace a variety of work situations based on what’s best for the team, and we welcome people working in our SF office, remotely from other locations, or some combination of the two. We put a priority on supporting our team members and what makes them happiest and most productive. WHAT YOU'LL DO Design Snowdrop engine improvements and extensions Implement system-level and gameplay-supporting systems Optimize game code and systems Collaborate with Lead Core Engineer on technical design and feature roll out Work with content teams and other engineers to identify systems in need of maintenance, optimization, or refactoring Coordinate with other developers to ensure smooth roll out of new features Review the work of other engineers and provide mentorship Create and maintain technical design documents Mentor more junior engineers QUALIFICATIONS WHAT YOU'LL BRING C/C++ experience with understanding of multi-threaded programming techniques Understanding of low-level optimizations and core subsystems, memory management, cross-platform development Experience building games as an engineer for PlayStation, Xbox, or PC Ability to be self-directed, focused, and detail-oriented Experience with technical requirement certification (Sony, Microsoft, etc.) Experience on the new generation of consoles (PS5, Xbox Series X) Understanding of streaming file systems Experience in networked gameplay High level graphics knowledge using Direct3D or OpenGL ADDITIONAL holiday and wellness time Fitness, physical challenge, and eSports competition reimbursements Ginger emotional support app for you and your adult dependents with up to 10 sessions per year of video-based therapy and psychiatry services Membership to One Medical Rocket Lawyer online legal service membership Paid parental leave Paid time off to volunteer Pawternity – paid time off to bond Gameplay Network Engineer – XDefiant in Ubisoft

Requires Skils: OOPS,Data Structures

Jobs available in Remote Job

We are looking for a highly talented, motivated, and experienced person to work with us on XDefiant, a new multiplatform online multiplayer action game based in our San Francisco studio. XDefiant is a free-to-play, fast-paced arena shooter that combines intense combat with personalized loadouts and specialized factions, as teams battle for domination. As a Gameplay Network Engineer, you’ll be entrusted with developing the game’s higher-level network features, ensuring the game simulation’s fairness, reducing latency, and optimizing network performance. You are an essential part of a team that holds the player’s connected experience at the core of its mission. You’re focused on making the game as responsive as possible in multiplayer matches and as fair as possible. You will work on a small collaboration-oriented team where you will have the opportunity to contribute in meaningful ways. You’ll also be part of the diverse Ubisoft San Francisco team. We embrace a variety of work situations based on what’s best for the team, and we welcome people working in our SF office, remotely from other locations, or some combination of the two. We put a priority on supporting our team members and what makes them happiest and most productive. WHAT YOU'LL DO Collaborate with other engineers to improve the game’s network replication Optimize networking systems to improve latency Work to level the playing field and maximize game fairness Educate content creators and gameplay engineers on how to maximize network reliability and replication Develop networking code to interact with backend systems for new gameplay features and data collection Maintain and extend documentation on network-oriented features and systems Debug and optimize existing gameplay networking  QUALIFICATIONS WHAT YOU'LL BRING C/C++ experience with understanding of multi-threaded programming techniques Experience building games as a network-oriented gameplay engineer for PlayStation, Xbox, or PC Understanding of computer and console game networking systems and technologies (e.g. peer-to-peer and client/server models, latency compensation, etc.) Experience with off-the-shelf anti-cheat products, such as Easy Anti-Cheat or Battleye Senior Infrastructure Engineer in Lumos Labs

Requires Skils: OOPS,Data Structures

Jobs available in Remote Job

Lumos Labs is the industry leader in brain training. Since the launch of Lumosity in 2007, more than 100 million users have trained their cognitive skills by playing over 7 billion training games. We believe in helping people keep their brains challenged through playful, meaningful experiences grounded in science. From neuroscience to art, we combine diverse disciplines to create a brain training program that is both engaging and accessible — making cognitive research available to everyone. We draw upon scientific research, user-friendly design, and engagement with our user base to continuously improve our product. Through the Human Cognition Project, we collaborate with over 100 leading researchers and clinicians from institutions around the world. We’re committed to building upon our brand to become world leaders in digital health and medicine. WE'RE LOOKING FOR We are looking for a Senior Infrastructure Engineer to join our Core Services team who will oversee code releases and assist with technical architecture, combining an understanding of security, engineering, and coding. Help improve the development team's productivity by creating and implementing new tools and analyzing data to improve existing ones. You are a curious engineer that constantly thinks about improvements in observability, monitoring, and scaling aspects of the infrastructure. We have applications running on Kubernetes, ECS, and Serverless. We’re constantly looking to build out more tools and processes to support our user-facing, data engineering, and data science teams. YOU WILL Develop and maintain all aspects of our operational infrastructure including codifying everything via CDK (Javascript/Typescript). Create next-gen infrastructure supporting external and internal applications. Improve Observability and Monitoring to preemptively help scale our systems. Build tools to reduce occurrences of errors and improve customer experience. Employ preventive measures to maintain high availability of services. YOU HAVE 4-6 years experience in site operations. Strong software engineering, database, system administration, and infrastructure management skills. Managed operations and infrastructure for a large-scale website. Good knowledge of writing code in Python, Typescript, or Javascript. Familiarity with the following technologies: AWS, Infrastructure as Code, Container Orchestration, Serverless, Continuous Delivery/Deployment, and Version Control. Database management in MySQL, PostgreSQL, DynamoDB, and overall Linux knowledge. Enthusiasm to work in small teams helping development teams be more self-efficient and self-serviced. Bonus Qualifications Experience building infrastructure using AWS CDK. Proficient with writing code in Typescript. Worked in a regulated industry and experienced securing infrastructure per HIPAA or HITECH guidelines. WE OFFER Lumos Labs offers a wide range of competitive benefits for all of our full-time employees. The excitement and fun of an early-stage startup paired with the maturity and stability of a later-stage business with substantial revenue and company infrastructure. A remote-first culture, building a team that spans the Eastern-to-Pacific U.S. time zones. Competitive compensation packages, including salary and benefits on-par with later-stage companies, and equity options on-par with earlier-stage ones. Flexible time off throughout the year to rest, reset, recharge, and have an end-of-year holiday break. Generous company-sponsored medical, dental, and vision plans (options for individual, spouse, and/or domestic partner, and family coverage). Continuous learning budget for conferences, professional and skill development – think Udemy Courses, Coursera and books. Monthly fitness, wellness, internet, co-working, and cell phone reimbursements. Lumos Labs values diversity and recognizes that employees from a broad range of perspectives improves both the practice of science and the brain training experience for everyone. We are committed to inclusion, diversifying tech, and advocating for diversity in our employees, their experiences, and the people we serve. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Engineering Manager, Partners, Accelerate Solutions in Unity

Requires Skils: OOPS,Data Structures

Jobs available in Remote Job

The opportunity We are Unity's Accelerate Solutions, an innovative team building custom software for a wide range of clients are looking for an Engineering Manager to join our team! Our professional services team works across multiple platforms incorporating groundbreaking technologies like XR, robotics, machine learning and IoT. We work on a diverse range of business verticals including games, automotive, retail, manufacturing and entertainment. In this role, you'll help us reach more customers in using our outstanding network of 3rd party developers. Our teams work directly with clients: from the concept and proposal phase, to planning and build, and ultimately to the delivery. A customer-focused attitude combined together with experience in software development and project management, are musts! We're committed to maintaining a diverse team, and we welcome and encourage applicants with diverse experiences and backgrounds. What you'll be doing Lead all technical aspects of Unity's engagements, delivered through partners Work with our partners to build and develop world-class proposals for customers Vet and onboard new partner studios, vendors, and contractors for future collaborations, contracts and projects What we're looking for Experience working with 3rd parties or contractors to build outstanding, industry-leading products Strong ability to balance multiple projects simultaneously Great interpersonal and leadership skills with internal and external partners Strong understanding of the software development lifecycle Delivery of real-time 3D solutions using Unity or competing engines You might also have Experience with AR/VR, mobile apps or games Experience in a pre-sales, solutions engineering, or field engineering role Life at Unity Unity (NYSE: U) is the world’s leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity is the foundation upon which the world’s most powerful digital content is created. Specifically, Unity’s platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices. In the fourth quarter of 2021, Unity had, on average, 3.9 billion monthly active end users who consumed content created or operated with its solutions. The applications developed by these creators were downloaded, on average, five billion times per month in 2021. For more information, please visit www.unity.com. Unity is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment and celebrate our employees across age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. Our differences are strengths that enable us to support the growing and evolving needs of our customers, partners, and collaborators. If there are preparations or accommodations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please fill out this form to let us know. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

Jobs available in Remote Job

Giant Squid is looking for a highly-skilled Senior Programmer to make core gameplay systems, engine features, and developer tools for our new exciting game project. We are looking for an experienced developer who really understands video games and is great at making them– a heavy hitter who can take on any kind of task and do what it takes to get it done right. Beyond being a virtuoso coder and great communicator, our ideal candidate is aligned with our goal of creating video game experiences that are elegant and efficient, yet evocative, beautiful and meaningful. As a Senior Programmer, we will ask you to design, implement, maintain, and debug many features for our current UE5 game project. These will include gameplay systems, editor tools, and more. You will often work directly with technical artists and animators as well as the rest of our coder team to implement game features that require cross disciplinary collaboration. Giant Squid is a small but seasoned team of award-winning game developers. The innovative and beautiful game experiences that we make spring from a team culture that is friendly, open, and inclusive. We are looking for a team player who fits right into close-knit small team development and shares our excitement for learning, wearing multiple hats, and stepping outside of regular workflows to make things happen. This is a remote position, and we are a fully remote team. We operate mainly in the PST time zone and prefer that your location is in a time zone relatively close to ours. Responsibilities Design, implement, maintain, and debug large core game systems Extend engine functionality in an efficient and sustainable way Design and implement developer tools for art, level design and programming, incorporating team workflows Optimize code and systems to bring game performance up to a shippable level of quality Requirements Wide breadth of game programming knowledge and experience (critical gameplay systems, world-building tools, shader programming, engine systems, etc...) Deep understanding of mathematics for game systems (calculus, linear algebra, trigonometry, etc.) Mastery of programming in C++ and working knowledge of many programming languages A willingness to collaborate closely with artists Knowledge of game design principles At least one title shipped in a senior programmer role or equivalent experience Bonus Experience with Unreal Engine

Jobs available in Remote Job

As a Porting Programmer at PixelAnt Games your primary responsibility will be to work on porting games to major consoles (Xbox Series S|X, Sony PS5, Nintendo Switch), whilst developing new tools, working on optimisation, game certification, and more. You'll be responsible for delivering efficient and reliable code, planning the development process as well as designing, building and maintaining platform specific game features. As a Porting Programmer you will: Write and be accountable for high quality source code. Work with designers to implement gameplay and user interface elements to the designers' specifications. Liaise with Quality Assurance to fix bugs. Ensure the game is compliant with manufacturer's guidelines for all the relevant platforms. Must have skills: Proficiency in C/C++, with proven commercial experience Practical experience with 3D programming and mathematics Working experience in game production Excellent communication skills Have worked on at least one released game and/or experience with at least one current generation engine (UE4/UE5, CryEngine, Source, Unity etc.) Experience of source control systems Useful to have: 2-5 years’ experience in the games industry. Contributed to shipped titles on console games. C#, JavaScript or Python programming experience. Graphics systems (3D graphics, animation, camera control, lighting, materials and shaders) knowhow. Experience of working to manufacturers' guidelines for the relevant platforms. Knowledge of the requirements placed on gameplay code by a multiplayer networked game. Networking experience (TCP/IP, UDP, both client-server and peer-to-peer). Knowledge of console certification process. Memory management experience. Ability to co-ordinate work for a small team of programmers. Produce milestone and platform submission builds. What We Offer: Possibility to work on one of 40+ titles (AA+ and AAA) that Sumo group is developing Developing games in a crunch-free environment with very experienced colleagues in an open and respectful culture Competitive Salary Flexible forms of employment Fully transparent Annual Bonus Plan for everyone 50% tax relief for creative work Employee Referral Bonus Lux Med Platinum healthcare family package (highest available & fully covered) Office working/partly remote/fully remote Flexible working hours Clear Career Paths 5 paid Learning Days a year for self-development Access to 4,000 Udemy Courses and GDC Vault English group classes and/or 121 meetings with the teacher Team-driven initiatives (PAG Plays, team-building events, charity engagement) Development initiatives (Life Drawing, Game Jams) Mental health support activities (Yoga Classes, Well-being webinars) The best working tools of your choosing- a powerful workstation or a top gaming laptop Relocation package Home -office perks (ergonomic gaming chairs, adjustable desk) ...and much more Can you spare us another 30 seconds? Great, let's talk about ourselves quickly. We're ambitious game enthusiasts who are well prepared to both have fun and work hard. We aim high, but we do not lose ourselves in the pursuit of success and further achievements. We love to learn! And over the years in the industry, we have learned that the best games are created by qualified, rested, treated with respect game developers. Importantly, our work culture has been built on the basis of specific, true (and respected by us) values. The most important of these is "We never lie", so you can be sure that we have not overdone this announcement. We play by our own rules and we make games that we would like to play ourselves. We combine the game development world with best software delivery practices to make it more predictable and reliable. All this helps us to bring fun back to game development! Will you help us? Where do we stand on diversity? We hope to bring together a diverse team of people with various backgrounds and experiences, who will bring broader ideas, new perspectives, and different solutions to our table. Whoever you are, feel welcome and encouraged to apply.

Senior Graphics Engineer in PlayStation

Requires Skils: OOPS,Data Structures

Jobs available in Remote Job

Why PlayStation? PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more. PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team. The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation. The Sr. Graphics Engineer position is responsible for building out exciting rendering systems and features to bring our team’s vision to life. This position will be responsible for: Collaborating with designers, artists, and programmers, to design, implement and iterate on rendering systems. Extending existing rendering systems to provide new or improved functionality to meet the needs of the content teams. Optimizing high and low-level rendering code for console platforms. Researching into new real-time rendering techniques and features. What craft expertise you’ll have: Technology Knowledge Required: Strong C++ programming ability. Required: Knowledge of HLSL/PSSL. Desired: DirectX experience. Desired: C# experience. Tool Knowledge Required: Visual Studio with strong experience debugging and profiling code. Desired: Experience with CPU and GPU profiling tools; Razor, RenderDoc, etc. Desired: Experience working with PS4 or PS5 hardware. Desired: Perforce, Jira, Confluence, and Jenkins Craft Experience Required: Solid understanding of real-time rendering techniques. Desired: Hands-on experience implementing rendering systems for AAA games with experience in at least one of the following; lighting, shadows, GI, particles, water, fog, post effects, or pipeline optimizations. Other Criteria: Experience Degree: B.S. in computer science or equivalent experience. Years of Experience: 7+ years of rendering programming preferred. Desired: Strong preference for a candidate that has shipped at least 2 AAA console game. Additionally, you should possess A proven ability to manage time, self-organize, and meet deadlines. Strong communication skills. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills. Strong organizational skills with an attention to detail. A growth mindset. A desire to eliminate unnecessary inheritance, templates, and operator overloading. Equal Opportunity Statement: Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category. We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond. PlayStation is a Fair Chance employer and qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for employment.

Senior Game Engineer in PlayStation

Requires Skils: OOPS,Data Structures

Jobs available in Remote Job

Why PlayStation? PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more. PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team. The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation. The Senior Game Engineer position is responsible for building out exciting game systems and features to bring our team’s vision to life. This position will be responsible for: Collaborating with designers, artists, and programmers, to design, implement and iterate on game systems (combat, AI, camera, inventory, etc.) Extending existing game systems to provide new or improved functionality to match updated designs. Building and maintaining tools for development. What craft expertise you’ll have: Technology Knowledge Required: Strong C++ programming ability. Desired: C# experience. Desired: Knowledge of Python, Powershell, and batch files. Tool Knowledge Required: Visual Studio with strong experience debugging and profiling code. Desired: Experience working with PS4 or PS5 hardware. Desired: Perforce, Jira, Confluence, and Jenkins Craft Experience Required: Solid understanding of asynchronous programming techniques and pitfalls. Desired: Hands-on experience implementing systems for AAA games with experience in at least one of the following; AI, camera systems, animation, physics, networking, memory, or threading architectures. Other Criteria: Experience Degree: B.S. in computer science or equivalent experience. Years of Experience: 3+ years of game programming preferred. Desired: Strong preference for a candidate that has shipped at least 1 AAA console game. Additionally, you should possess A proven ability to manage time, self-organize, and meet deadlines. Strong communication skills. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills. Strong organizational skills with an attention to detail. A growth mindset. The knowledge that “writing” the multithreaded code is the easy part. Equal Opportunity Statement: Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category. We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond. PlayStation is a Fair Chance employer and qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for employment.

Lead Game Analyst in Jagex

Requires Skils: OOPS,Data Structures

Jobs available in Remote Job

A leader in creating deep and engaging experiences on PC and mobile, Jagex was founded in 2001 and is today one of the UK’s biggest and most respected video game developers and publishers. Famed for its flagship MMOs RuneScape and Old School RuneScape, Jagex has welcomed more than 260million player accounts to its world and created a $1bn lifetime franchise revenue. Today the RuneScape franchise exists beyond running games in live operations; our titles are living games that connect and inspire millions of players, with content and experiences both inside and outside of inexhaustible game worlds. Both RuneScape and Old School RuneScape, on PC and mobile, offer ever-evolving, highly-active worlds and our community-focussed development ethos empowers players to have a real say in how each game is shaped. Jagex is expanding and extending its portfolio with fresh franchise titles, new IP and, in 2018 launched Jagex Partners, delivering third-party publishing and operational services exclusively for the living games of the future. Jagex employs more than 400 people at its Cambridge headquarters and is on the hunt for talented people to work across the business to help the company to achieve yet another year of record growth and player satisfaction. Job Purpose: Analytics, Data Science and Engineering (ADSE) is the heart of player, product, and business insights on our games. The is one of the most critical roles we have as it acts as both a part of the game development team and as a center of growth for our Studio in unlocking insights about our players and our business. The person in this role is most successful when they can merge technical, game design & analytical skill to provide insights and actionable results. The LeadGame Analyst will deliver insights learnings and guidance to game and business development staff and have a significant impact on the direction of our games and studio. Key Duties Include: Lead a small team of analysts to deliver insights that guide decisions on product and feature road-maps Drive deep, impactful learnings by working across data, game design and research to deliver a story driven direction based in data Responsible for designing and maintaining telemetry events for current and future content updates Create automated reports and dashboards to share insights across the studio Grow relationships across the studio to promote a data-driven partnership Present analysis conclusions to business stakeholders in a clear and practical way Partner with data engineering to manage data requirements such as schema requirements and data format to support high-quality deliverables Conduct effective analysis while adhering version control, documentation, and reproduction Play the game and know it from the inside out to deliver insight most effectively Essential Requirements: Proven commercial experience applying statistical analysis to consumer, user, or player behaviours Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline such as Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or equivalent experience Advanced skill in SQL and a statistics language (e.g. Python or R) Leadership skills and a solid work ethic Fluency in statistics and datasets Experience with Microsoft Excel Experience with quantitative techniques including regression, classification, and clustering Experience with dashboarding software (e.g. Power BI, Tableau, Dundas) Familiarity with modern data architectures (AWS, Snowflake, OLAP) Superior attention to detail, natural curiosity, and ability to problem-solve creatively Previous experience in the games industry Desirable: Previous experience leading analysts while also delivering high quality insights Familiarity with statistical IDEs like Jupyter Notebook or PyCharm Company Benefits: Flexible Working Bonus Scheme Private Health Care Gym Membership Generous Pension Contributions Life Insurance Free Cycle Repair Income Protection Dental Plan Free Fruit and Drinks Subsidised Canteen Feel like you fit this role, but don’t meet all the requirements? We strive for fresh perspectives, so as long as you can demonstrate how your attitude and other abilities might make up for any gaps we would welcome your application! Preferred requirements as we grow Experience in native iOS and/or Android development. Experience building observable applications and measurable experiences (analytics, error reporting, distributed tracing). Experience with WebSockets. Gross salary: EUR 3300-5500 Salary ranges may vary. We’re seeking candidates with varied experience levels; from individual contributors to functional leaders in this space. We’re an international team and our business language of choice is English. Good English level is required, proficiency is preferred. A modern and innovative company with a fresh attitude to ‘’how it’s done’’. Additional annual leave, no questions asked approach. Remote and flexible work programs for our global workforce. AcadArena is the home of campus gaming across the Philippines and Southeast Asia. We’re building a better future for student gamers by creating a place for them to play, connect, and earn. Though our team started in 2019 as a group of volunteers, we've grown into a venture-backed 30+ team that creates communities, platforms, and experiences that have brought hundreds of thousands of students into gaming and the metaverse. Our vision is to create a place where students around the world can achieve their dreams — a university without borders. About The Team Software Engineers at AcadArena work on our Product team, building out the machinery that powers our community as a whole — including our global student platform for games and scholarships, our new suite of metaverse applications, and more. As a member of our Product Team, you’ll be working with a diverse, global team of engineers, designers, researchers, and product managers to build and shape the tools we need to serve our global network of students and leaders. As a Full-Stack Engineer, you’ll be flexibly supporting engineering projects across all of our teams, from verification processes to scholarship experiences to peer-to-peer gaming applications. Your Responsibilities Develop, test, deploy, maintain, and improve software across our suite of products Organize file structure in a logical, reusable, and scalable manner Work with Product and UX team to scope and design new products and features Your Qualifications Proficient Full-Stack Developer. 2+ years of industry experience. Has knowledge and working proficiency with: Microservices architecture DRY principles Serverless Architecture CI/CD pipelines Agile Development Effective Team Player. Has a proven track record in shipping projects from scratch while working with a team. Goal Oriented. Laser-focused on directives and tasks. Able to contribute to sprint planning and estimations. Values-Driven & Youth Focused. You strongly believe in youth empowerment and have a good grasp of their needs and struggles. Strong Communicator. Proficient writing, communication and presentation skills in both English and ideally, a SEA language. Your Pluses Strong understanding of gaming and esports Familiar with Web3 and Metaverse concepts, like Play-to-Earn games and Crypto Wallets Familiar with regional culture and trends in SEA, Brazil, or South Korea Familiar with Discord API + Bot Development. Proficiency in any of the ff. languages: Bisaya Hiligaynon Mandarin Vietnamese Bahasa Indonesia AcadArena is a Southeast Asian campus gaming start-up building the place where students play, connect and earn through gaming and the metaverse. We're backed by an all-star cast of investors including Iterative, 1KX, Hashed, Kevin Lin (Twitch), Kun Gao (Crunchyroll) and Holly Liu (Kabam).

Senior QA Analyst in Jagex

Requires Skils: OOPS,Data Structures

Jobs available in Remote Job

A leader in creating deep and engaging experiences on PC and mobile, Jagex was founded in 2001 and is today one of the UK’s biggest and most respected video game developers and publishers. Famed for its flagship MMOs RuneScape and Old School RuneScape, Jagex has welcomed more than 260million player accounts to its world and created a $1bn lifetime franchise revenue. Today the RuneScape franchise exists beyond running games in live operations; our titles are living games that connect and inspire millions of players, with content and experiences both inside and outside of inexhaustible game worlds. Both RuneScape and Old School RuneScape, on PC and mobile, offer ever-evolving, highly-active worlds and our community-focussed development ethos empowers players to have a real say in how each game is shaped. Jagex is expanding and extending its portfolio with fresh franchise titles, new IP and, in 2018 launched Jagex Partners, delivering third-party publishing and operational services exclusively for the living games of the future. Jagex employs more than 400 people at its Cambridge headquarters and is on the hunt for talented people to work across the business to help the company to achieve yet another year of record growth and player satisfaction. Job Overview: You are responsible for overseeing a wide range of tests to ensure the software meets our end-user requirements, which includes setting test scope and objectives, monitoring test coverage and evaluating the overall quality of targeted test items. This position serves as the product team expert in acceptance testing and undertakes medium to large sized projects requiring some QA testing management and oversight. The role sits within a development team and follows agile methodology. Updating the team on your activities during stand-ups and contributing to planning sessions are key requirements. Key Duties Include: Deliver technical, quantitative, and qualitative feedback on assigned features to the development team, be the voice of quality for the product. Execute pre-integration build verification and reporting processes, along with content testing strategies using development tools. Use telemetry to augment test requirements and plans. Craft, research or utilize existing tools to improve and measure QA efficiency, make the team better over time. Brings together and updates key project and test knowledge through wikis, documents etc. Test case creation from design documentation or feature expertise. Support coordinating and disseminating daily testing tasks to the offsite team and provide updates on testing progress. Become the Subject Matter Expert for the area being tested. Be the central contact person for multiple teams. Review the bug database, consider severity vs priority and push for the right issues to be fixed before release. Work closely with other QA Analysts to identify efficiency opportunities and suggest ways for them to improve. Member of the QA best practice group that creates standards and policies for the wider team. Is responsible for the onboarding and initial training of new QA members. Essential Requirements: Develop and build strong working relationships with development teams and execute a development QA support strategy during development. Dedicated, flexible, and able to adapt the QA process to the critical needs of multiple teams. Understands concepts of defect prevention and defect containment. Able to collect and transcribe defect data which can be used to generate risk reports. Active listener with both peers and partners can drive conversations and supports team participation. Can analyse personal and team process for innovation opportunities and raises potential improvements. Understanding of different communication channels and when to use appropriately. Ability to create training programs to spread test excellence across all Jagex test teams. Advanced understanding of the development process. Strong working experience and collaboration with external and internal teams. Capable of translating complex requirements in an easy to understand manner for other Analysts. Desirable Requirements: Medium knowledge of data analysis tools such as SQL and Power BI. Knowledge of products and technologies on the mobile market. JIRA JQL experience. Ability to create and reuse advanced lookups. You have previous test experience on MMO’s, sandbox or ARPGs. Company Benefits: Flexible Working Bonus Scheme Private Health Care Gym Membership Monthly Energy Allowance Generous Pension Contributions Life Insurance Free Cycle Repair Income Protection Dental Plan Free Fruit and Drinks Subsidised Canteen Feel like you fit this role, but don’t meet all the requirements? We strive for fresh perspectives, so as long as you can demonstrate how your attitude and other abilities might make up for any gaps we would welcome your application! We want to hear from you! Your Day to Day You can expect to be responsible and accountable for the following: Write game, engine, and tools code using C/C++ Help design, schedule, and implement features that meet the requirements art, design, and animation teams Communicate effectively with your peers and colleagues Regularly debug, profile, optimize, and maintain code Provide technical assistance by responding to inquiries regarding errors, problems, or questions with programs Your Career Progression Do the best work of your career! No, really, that’s what we expect of you. Come aboard and work with industry veterans all working to improve their craft and become better game developers. The small team atmosphere allows you to contribute more and have greater ownership over what you do day today. Requirements Love of games. A minimum of 5 years of industry experience Ability and drive to contribute towards and advance all aspects of the game Work independently and efficiently under deadlines Excellent programming, debugging, and optimization skills Would Love to See Experience writing games (either on your own or professionally) Experience with Unreal Engine Experience with other programming languages (e.g. Go, Python, Javascript) Education Bachelor’s degree in computer science, mathematics, physics, or related degree Or equivalent industry experience Location This position is fully remote and open to applicants across the country. About our Location Cold Iron is a team of passionate game developers located in San Jose, California. We’re a diverse group of veterans with decades of experience developing and launching award-winning shooter, MMO, and action titles on PC and console. We launched Aliens: Fireteam Elite in August 2021 to critical acclaim and to a very devoted fan base. Exceptional employee benefits, Remote work; 18 days PTO first year in addition to 11 paid holidays plus company-wide shutdown between Christmas and New Year’s Day; Robust Medical, Dental, Vision insurance coverage for entire family; Company matched 401k vested immediately; Flex Spending Accounts, annual stipend to help cover work from home expenses, ultra-creative environment.

Senior/Regular Network Multiplayer Programmer in PixelAnt Games

Requires Skils: OOPS,Data Structures

Jobs available in Remote Job

As a Network Multiplayer Programmer at PixelAnt Games your primary responsibility is to design and implement low level network systems and implement network game play, perhaps even on occasion enable network game play to be developed. The role requires a strong communicator with a high level understanding towards game technology production. You must be adaptable with the flexibility to juggle multiple projects and streams of work that have common technologies. As a Senior/Regular Network Multiplayer Programmer You Will Develop technical design specifications, implement and test plans Test, debug and take a lead on revising new or legacy engine network systems Play a role in the development of network systems appropriate to a given game Implement and support other network features as required by a given game's target platform or platforms Complete profiling, performance-analysis, performance tuning Research state of the art techniques and contribute innovative and original ideas towards all aspects of game networking Work with Technology Programmers, Development Directors, QA Testers and game project production staff throughout various points of the game production lifecycle What We Need You To Have Experience in C++ Understanding of the client-server and P2P architectures Be able to demonstrate the ability to communicate effectively within a large group/multiple project environment Think critically, and apply analytical skills in resolving complex issues Have personal standards as demonstrated in quality and pride of work Create complex systems from start to finish Quickly master proprietary tools and development processes Take direction and absorb feedback Meet deadlines designated for team projects Show professionalism and the ability to function well within a team Be self motivated Very good English (at least b2) Good to have: Experience with online services solutions (e.g., PlayFab, OpenMatch, Agones) Experience with Unreal Engine Basic knowledge of Docker Basic knowledge of Linux What We Offer Competitive Salary Flexible forms of employment Bonus plan Flexible working hours Fully remote/ Office /Mixed working models 5 Learning Days a Year Access to 4,000 Udemy Courses and GDC Vault Game & Book Libraries Career Development ...and much more Can you spare us another 30 seconds? Great, let's talk about ourselves quickly. We're ambitious game enthusiasts who are well prepared to both have fun and work hard. We aim high, but we do not lose ourselves in the pursuit of success and further achievements. We love to learn! And over the years in the industry, we have learned that the best games are created by qualified, rested, treated with respect game developers. Importantly, our work culture has been built on the basis of specific, true (and respected by us) values. The most important of these is "We never lie", so you can be sure that we have not overdone this announcement. We play by our own rules and we make games that we would like to play ourselves. We combine the game development world with best software delivery practices to make it more predictable and reliable. All this helps us to bring fun back to game development! Will you help us? Where do we stand on diversity? We hope to bring together a diverse team of people with various backgrounds and experiences, who will bring broader ideas, new perspectives, and different solutions to our table. Whoever you are, feel welcome and encouraged to apply.

Engine Programmer, Graphics in Insomniac Games

Requires Skils: OOPS,Data Structures

Jobs available in Remote Job

Why PlayStation? PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more. PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team. The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation. Do you have experience in game development and a particular interest in graphics and rendering? Insomniac Games is looking for an Engine Programmer to join its Core Technology department and focus on the development of its AAA game engine as a member of its rendering team. Candidates may be considered at higher seniority levels. This job is primarily individual contribution, with support, peer mentoring, and planning responsibilities as appropriate. You'll be developing ownership over an area of Insomniac's renderer, creating forward-looking and cutting-edge features to support the needs of the production teams building games such as Marvel's Spider-Man and Ratchet & Clank. The Core Technology department at Insomniac includes programmers and technical artists who work outside of any direct project schedules and deliverables, offering some independence and self-management to individuals on the team. They maintain close communication with the production teams, ensuring that the engine team has a direct relationship with the people using their tools and tech to build games. Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Design and develop game engine technology based on direction or feedback from team leads Design and implement efficient low-level systems to support higher-level pipelines Design and implement tools that facilitate content creators in developing game assets Maintain and update existing systems for increased functionality and performance Maintain familiarity with the capabilities and limitations of specific game platform hardware Work independently to complete assigned projects with limited supervision Document technical implementation details Work with production teams to analyze and address development challenges Educate production teams on technology and engine functionality Respond to bug reports, feature requests, and questions related to engine technology Maintain current knowledge of technological developments in the game industry Other duties may be assigned Qualifications: Knowledge of the game engine landscape and modern engine feature sets Experience with game engine programming or a related field Experience with modern rendering pipelines and the techniques therein Strong C++ and HLSL programming abilities Strong verbal and written communication Equal Opportunity Statement: Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category. We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond. PlayStation is a Fair Chance employer and qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for employment.

You'll be developing ownership over an area of Insomniac's engine and tools suite, creating forward-looking and cutting-edge features to support the needs of the production teams building games such as Marvel's Spider-Man and Ratchet & Clank. They maintain close communication with the production teams, ensuring that the engine team has a direct relationship with the people using their tools and tech to build games. Associate Engineering Manager - Playables Ads in Wildlife Studios

Requires Skils: OOPS,Data Structures

Jobs available in Remote Job

This position is based in Brazil, on a remote-first working model: you choose which city to live and work remotely if you prefer, but the São Paulo office is available if you wish to work presentially. The Associate Engineering Manager for Playables (gamefied ads) will be responsible for mentoring a team of developers, providing technical and career guidance, as well as coordinating the team through the development of new tools and extensions to our proprietary game engine. The ideal candidate is a strong Sr. Engineer, preferably one who is a Tech Lead, who wishes to pursue the management career path. Preference will be given to candidates with experience with game development. We know that the work we do has a high impact on our company's success and culture. The right person for this position is curious by nature, and comfortable in a “take the initiative” environment, loves solving problems, and can thrive in a fast and growing business. What you'll do Provide both technical and career guidance to the developers; Responsible for ensuring the team has the right structure, and hire new members; Foster team technical development, bring new challenges as developers grow; Manage a backlog of new tools and improvements to our current game engine; Ensure the team dedicates time to R&D initiatives; Be the team interface with leadership areas such as Management, Business and Product; Translate into leadership language the team technical issues; Work closely with Artists, Product Marketing Specialists and Data Analysts; What you'll need Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or similar course, or equivalent working experience; 2+ years of experience as a Tech Lead Engineer or Software Architect; Experience leading a team of 3+ developers is desired; Solid understanding of computer science concepts (data structures, networking, concurrency, memory management, algorithm analysis, computer graphics, etc.); Experience in HTML 5 and JavaScript is desired; Experience developing games or similar real-time interactive applications is a plus; Experience in Unity, WebGL, and Shading languages (GLSL / HLSL) is a plus; Excellent verbal and written skills for communicating with artists, engineers, and leadership; Intermediate English for reading and writing technical documents; More about you You are technically strong, but also passionate about people development; Team player, you love to help and see other engineers succeeding; You empower your team members to be the best version of themselves – you aim for their success instead of your own. You love listening to and helping others; About Wildlife Wildlife is one of the leading mobile game developers and publishers in the world. We have released more than 60 titles, reaching billions of people around the globe. Today, we have offices in Brazil, Argentina, Ireland, and the United States. Here, we build games that will excite, intrigue, and engage our players for years to come! Equal Opportunity Wildlife is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, colour, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law. We're committed to providing accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance, please let us know at recruitment@wildlifestudios.com.

Director of Data Engineering in PeopleFun

Requires Skils: OOPS,Data Structures

Jobs available in Remote Job

PeopleFun™ is the award-winning creator of mobile games for players across the globe. We are part of the AppLovin™ studios family, a publicly traded company, with world-class projects, resources, and infrastructure. PeopleFun™ is a Dallas-based game studio founded and maintained by game industry veterans, where game developers thrive on collaboration, creativity, teamwork and fun. Our games are played by over 25 million players each month, and we have a number of exciting mid-core and casual games in development. Our mission is twofold: excellence in creativity and data-driven product innovation, and to be a best-in-class workplace providing unique opportunities to learn and exercise curiosity. Candidates who reside or will reside in the following locations are eligible for this role: California, Nevada, Oregon, Texas, Colorado, Washington State, Ohio, North Carolina, Florida, Pennsylvania, Washington DC, Michigan, New York, Mississippi, Georgia, Maryland, Iowa or Toronto. PeopleFun is seeking a Director of Data Engineering to lead the building of our data infrastructure and pipelines and manage the data engineering team. This person will collaborate with data analysts and product managers to understand the needs of the team and design a flexible data infrastructure to meet current and potential future needs. This person will lead data engineers that will build a robust multi-sourced data pipeline into a central warehouse that supports scalability for multiple live games with continuously evolving data requirements over the lifecycle of each game. This person will also be responsible for leading development of ETL routines that provide data validation and maintain aggregated tables. Responsibilities Lead the data engineering discipline Create and execute on a roadmap for the data engineering department to fulfill the data needs of the studio Design, develop, and maintain a flexible, robust, scalable data infrastructure Work closely with the product managers and data analysts to implement and improve data models that are used by business intelligence tools Design, build, and maintain efficient and reliable data pipelines across several platforms/environments Use your past experience to identify gaps and issues in the existing data pipeline Assess the cost of the data infrastructure and implement and maintain a cost efficient solution that meets the needs of the studio Work with external data providers/sources to integrate the data into the studio's internal data warehouse Implement new requests from Data Analysts, Data Scientists, and Product Managers to fulfill their data needs Prioritize requests from multiple stakeholders and manage expectations on deliverable scope and schedule Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree (graduate degree preferred) in Computer Science, Data Analytics, Data Science, or other related fields with focus on quantitative analysis or engineering 5+ years' experience in the data engineering field Experience in data warehouse systems such as Snowflake, BigQuery, Vertica, Redshift BigQuery experience is strongly preferred Extensive experience in SQL, Python, and other scripting languages used for data engineering Extensive experience in developing and maintaining ETL processes that are robust, scalable, flexible Extensive experience in validating and debugging data to ensure high quality data for the rest of the team to use Experience working with external data providers/sources via API, raw data drops, and other protocols Experience working with both client-side data and server-side data sources Experience working with data visualization tools such as Tableau Excellent attention to detail and strong desire to iterate and improve on processes Strong critical thinking and communications skills Self-motivated team player that brings excitement and enthusiasm to work each day Familiarity with the mobile games and video games industry is a plus Benefits Competitive compensation package Performance bonuses 401K with 3% employer matching Family friendly culture Flex PTO policy Medical/Dental/Vision insurance On-Site Gym and free Yoga classes $1,500 annual budget for career development & education $1,000 annual game device and IAP budget Free drinks & snacks, catered lunch on Fridays Happy hours, social events and more PeopleFun is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, protected veteran status, medical condition or disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Vehicle Physics Coder (C++) in Cardboard Sword

Requires Skils: OOPS,Data Structures

Jobs available in Remote Job

Responsibilities This is either a permanent position (UK) or contract position (worldwide), with your current main role being as vehicle coder for our 3D driving game: Transmission. With feedback from our Design Director and alongside our Lead Designer, you will need to make driving our cars feel perfect. This is not just about pure simulation, but also about understanding user experience and how to tune that model to create satisfying vehicle handling. You will be coding ‘everyday’ style road cars, in particular those from the 1980s. This includes car types such as standard 5-doors, estates and 4x4s, and larger vehicles like vans and lorries. Maybe even a 3-wheeler if you’re brave enough! Essential Fully remote C++ (proficient) 3D Maths and Physics Programming experience Debugging and Optimisation experience Preferred A good knowledge, enthusiasm and understanding of cars Unreal Engine 4 experience Blueprints experience Other programming language experience Console development experience Simulation and/or VR experience Happy to work with large code bases Starting Salary Full-Time: £30,000 – £48,000 (depending on experience) Contractor: Fee to be discussed Note: If you are applying for more than one Coder position, or if you would like to be flexible in your coding role, please submit only one application but mention in your cover letter or email which roles you are interested in.

Overview Splitgate is a free to play, fast-paced sci-fi multiplayer shooter that combines the strategic elements of portals with the explosive gameplay of a first person shooter. We quickly became a top trending game on PlayStation, XBOX, and Steam. In our first 6 days, we passed 1M downloads, and hit 2M within the first two weeks. We’re now at 15M+ downloads and growing. After receiving $100M Series A funding with a valuation of $1.5B, we are actively looking to grow our team with the best talent out there to continue the journey of making Splitgate a game that we and the millions of players in our gaming community are proud of. What We're Looking For A passionate engineer: You love to take on difficult, seemingly impossible technical problems and dig in to find creative ways to solve them A hard worker: You love to put in the extra effort, not because you are told, but because you enjoy your work and know the impact of finishing the tasks on hand A passionate gamer: You are a gamer who grew up playing games and can recognize what separates exceptional games from the average ones. You understand the mindset of gamers which enables you to create and implement features that will further benefit the game Required Skills Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related technical discipline 4+ years of experience with React, Javascript, CSS, and HTML User-focused, passionate, scrappy, solutions-focused, and innovative Strong eye for UI/UX & design of web interfaces Strong experience building and releasing high-traffic, scalable web applications Have built at least one scalable web application from scratch Knowledge of front-end languages and libraries (e.g. HTML/ CSS, JavaScript, Typescript) Also familiar with JS bundlers (Webpack/ES Build) Develop and manage modern data stores Write scalable APIs where necessary Debug and troubleshoot software efficiently Desired Skills Game development or industry-adjacent experience Experience working at small startups Familiar with online communities in the games space Experienced with web analytics tools Fluent with modern, headless CMS systems

Senior Network Developer in Bright Star Studio

Requires Skils: OOPS,Data Structures

Jobs available in Remote Job

Want to be onboard a rocketship and help build a new and groundbreaking MMORPG called Ember Sword? Senior Network Developer As a Senior Network Developer on the Bright Star Studios engineering Team, you'll be part of the core infrastructure team. You will work on implementing and optimizing network solutions for Ember Sword and its surrounding services. We are expanding with rocket speed, while being on our quest to make the next big MMORPG. Generally, building something from scratch should excite you rather than terrify you. Don't worry, you won't be doing this alone; throughout the last year our team grew by 125% and we have various backgrounds from companies such as Riot Games, Blizzard, Apple, Unity, Lucas Art, and so on. We have plenty of ideas and we are looking for more talented people to help us fulfill them. Responsibilities: Implementing and maintaining RPC system, maintaining message packing, optimizing network stack Analyzing, designing and configuring network infrastructure and application components Work closely with DevOps to closely monitor applications in live environment and improve their stability and performance. Create internal debug tools to inspect network messages and give insight into the network stack Work with game developers to create features and tools based on their requests About Bright Star Studios We are crazy ambitious. That’s one of the reasons why Ember Sword is created on our own custom game engine. The game should be playable via a browser and it is a matter of seconds from you entering our site until you are ingame. If you want to play in another region, you don’t need to start from scratch. You’ll simply have all your gear, levels, and items with you - This means you can always play with your friends, regardless of what server you both started on. No more annoying scenarios where you have to make new characters or pay to move to another server. All your skins are owned by the players, not the gaming companies. All cosmetics are dropped in-game as free NFT’s, allowing the player to truly own it, and enables them to legally trade assets outside the game. Cosmetics have zero in-game advantages and you can not pay to win. It’s free to play and it’s a game by gamers, to gamers. We are able to proudly state that, as our team consists of former professional Counter-Strike and World of Warcraft players. Everyone is invited: Because together we are better. It's our policy to provide equal employment opportunities for all applicants and members of Bright Star Studios. We know that fresh and varied perspectives will make us better at what we do, so however you identify and whatever background you bring with you, we're excited to hear from you. Don't be discouraged if you feel you don't meet every one of the requirements for a role, there's always room for growth at Bright Star Studios. You can work remote or join us in one of our offices located in Denmark, Netherlands, Serbia or Romania. We can even assist with relocation if you please. Listen to our podcast to know more about us, we recommend "Working at Bright Star Studios" and "Meet The Team", to understand more about our culture If you spot a role to make you want to jump out of bed in the morning, we are waiting to hear from you! Requirements The MUSTs: Expertise C++ 5+ years experience with network stacks Solid understanding of TCP/IP and UDP packets Experience with profiling, input validation / sanitization, fuzzing of network packets The GOOD TO HAVEs: Knowledge of the uWebSockets library . Knowledge of WebTransport Genuine love for MMOs and/or RPGs Experience with data driven programming principles (Data driven development) Benefits We offer remote options and flexible working hours. We offer balance between work and personal life and are encouraged with open paid time off. All employees getting onboard 2022 will get a token package, and therefore have an incentive to make the best MMORPG. Besides that, we have the usual: Free coffee and tea. Social gatherings. Board game nights. Free office snacks and soft drinks. Friday bars. Health insurance.

Senior Engine Developer in Bright Star Studio

Requires Skils: OOPS,Data Structures

Jobs available in Remote Job

Want to be onboard a rocketship and help build a new and groundbreaking MMORPG called Ember Sword? Senior Engine Developer - Engine team As a Senior Engine Developer on the Bright Star Studios Engine team, you'll be part of the core group of developers that build our custom ECS-based game engine written in C++. The game is compiled with emscripten to webassembly and runs directly in your browser where it loads in just 5 seconds. Therefore we care greatly about the quality and performance of our code and don't shy away from refactoring if needed. You'll be building core engine features such as rendering systems like particle systems, integrating audio solutions, implementing optimizations, entirely new services for various game features and creating general infrastructure for game developers. If you are looking to have an impact on building the engine for our first game, Ember Sword, then join us and pioneer solutions that will help us scale to the next level. We are expanding with rocket speed, while being on our quest to make the next big MMORPG. Generally, building something from scratch should excite you rather than terrify you.
