Who We Are Founded in 2005, 2K Games is a global video game company, publishing titles developed by some of the most influential game development studios in the world. Our studios responsible for developing 2K’s portfolio of world-class games across multiple platforms, include Visual Concepts, Firaxis, Hangar 13, CatDaddy, Cloud Chamber, and HB Studios. Our portfolio of titles is expanding due to our global strategic plan, building and acquiring exciting studios whose content continues to inspire all of us! 2K publishes titles in today’s most popular gaming genres, including sports, shooters, action, role-playing, strategy, casual, and family entertainment. Our team of engineers, marketers, artists, writers, data scientists, producers, thinkers and doers, are the professional publishing stewards of our growing library of critically-acclaimed franchises such as NBA 2K, Battleborn, BioShock, Borderlands, The Darkness, Mafia, Sid Meier’s Civilization, WWE 2K, and XCOM. At 2K, we pride ourselves on creating an inclusive work environment, which means encouraging our teams to Come as You Are and do your best work! We are dedicated to diversity and inclusion, and want our community of candidates to reflect this commitment. We encourage all qualified applicants to explore our global positions. 2K is headquartered in Novato, California and is a wholly owned label of Take-Two Interactive Software, Inc. (NASDAQ: TTWO). What We Need: We’re looking for an experienced Producer to join our Mobile Games team! This position is the glue that holds the development and publishing teams together, driving the day-to-day work that keeps our games fresh, player-focused, and engaging! What You Will Do:​ Reporting to the 2K Mobile Executive Producer, you will plan and oversee projects and management of the publisher pipeline. You will work with dev partners and will steer our efforts in successfully building, operating and servicing our mobile games. Key responsibilities: Partner with devs to define milestones and sprint deliverables, then drive the successful delivery of these objectives. Ensure game production, content updates, and Live Ops plans are on track. Own weekly production reporting and ensure stakeholders are aligned on product roadmaps and creative changes. Project-manage the tasks of the publishing team – Product Managers, UA/Mktg, BD, Live Ops, BI/Reporting. Lead weekly stand ups and ensure everyone has visibility on each other’s work and are working towards common goals. Handle coordination with 2K’s QA, Localization, Customer Service, and Legal Clearance teams. Define production processes and workflows with dev partners. Optimize the way we build service-based mobile games to maximize time and resources against the highest priorities. Who We Think Will Be A Great Fit: 2-5+ years of experience as Producer for successful mobile games across all stages of development (concept to launch to live service). Launched at least 1 Top-Grossing title. Passion for Free-to-Play and service-based mobile games. Has intimate knowledge of gameplay mechanics, monetization systems, and other aspects of these games’ core designs. Self-starter with proven leadership and influencing skills. Proficient communication skills (written and oral). Proven ability to work with creative and technical partners across sites and time zones. Adept at MS Word, Excel, Powerpoint, and Google equivalents. Highly organized and an effective multi-tasker. Strong time and project management skills. Can focus on multiple projects while meeting changing deadlines and priorities. Ability to identify and analyze risks while leading mitigation support. Experience building or working on wireframes, GDDs, TDDs, and product specifications. Experience with project management and communication tools such as Asana, JIRA and Slack. Bachelor's degree. Knowledge and love for the 2K IP franchises (Borderlands, BioShock, NBA2K, WWE2K, XCOM, Civilization) preferred. Fluency in Mandarin Chinese is preferred. Location: Remote (supporting West Coast hours) As an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to ensuring that qualified individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform their essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us if you need reasonable accommodation. Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

The opportunity Unity’s new Emerging Technology division looks forward to welcoming you aboard as a Producer. We’re partnering with global leaders in game development to deliver “lighthouse” games that prove and improve Unity’s fitness for purpose across all major game genres! You’re an inspirational team member who helps guide our project teams through the delivery of technology and tools for game development while working directly with one of our world-class customers to build tomorrow’s top games. You nurture success through communication, organization, process, and passion! Partnering with Emerging Technology senior leadership, you help to align our development teams, project managers, internal Unity groups, and our customer’s leadership team. What you’ll be doing Help manage a cross-functional team assisting in carrying out a strategic customer project Be responsible for all of Unity’s efforts to ensure the successful delivery of the customer’s project at outstanding levels of quality Help to improve processes, assists in schedules, and action plans that guide the project & customer teams towards success Assist in weaving the complex, multi-faceted process of game development into a coherent narrative to inspire your team and advise executive leaders Advise and assist organizational leaders with formulating product strategy, capturing customer intelligence, and understanding the needs of your team. What we’re looking for Experience as in production or project management Able to write clear, concise documents and give verbal presentations in English Can build reports illustrating P/L, team utilization, project timeline, and risks The ability to understand the diverse roles and production stages involved in the creation and delivery of video games, and how they impact schedules, requirements, and problem-solving strategies. You might also have Been a programmer, technical artist, designer, or artist on a game Worked on a “AAA” or similarly high-production-quality title for PC/console Given talks or seminars in a public venue or conference Life at Unity Unity (NYSE: U) is the world’s leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity is the foundation upon which the world’s most powerful digital content is created. Specifically, Unity’s platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices. In the fourth quarter of 2021, Unity had, on average, 3.9 billion monthly active end users who consumed content created or operated with its solutions. The applications developed by these creators were downloaded, on average, five billion times per month in 2021. For more information, please visit www.unity.com. Unity is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment and celebrate our employees across age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. Our differences are strengths that enable us to support the growing and evolving needs of our customers, partners, and collaborators. If there are preparations or accommodations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

A Senior Game Producer acts as the “North Star” for one of our development teams, plotting the course of development and fostering the collaboration needed to turn “Wouldn’t it be cool if…” ideas into reality. You will leverage your project management expertise to establish the overall schedule, roadmap and development processes for your team in a way that aligns with the game vision, maintains team health and happiness, and achieves project goals. You’ll tackle new development challenges and develop the processes, rituals and pipelines we need to ship an amazing game. Responsibilities: Be a partner to initiative leads. Collaborate on building the workflows that unlock the team’s ability to bring their creative vision to reality. Define dates and deadlines for the team and communicate them in an effective manner to drive the completion of goals. Communicate frequently with project leadership on status, risks, and opportunities. Champion the team and its members. Foster a culture of open collaboration and trust. Mentor other producers with guidance on leadership and project management Collaborate with leadership to shape the project management processes, tools and standards for the team. We are excited to create the role of Desktop Gaming Product Manager, to make Ubuntu the best Linux desktop for gaming. We work with partners in the silicon world to ensure the latest graphics drivers and tweaks are built-in for optimal frame rates and latency, as well as with partners in the gaming industry to ensure that mechanisms such as anti-cheat capabilities are available to ensure fairness and product availability. If you have a passion for technology and business, experience in open source software engineering, the Linux desktop, developer tooling, and of course gaming, then you will love being part of our team. Role summary This role leads the product and go-to-market for gaming on Ubuntu Desktop. You will define product strategy as well as drive engagement and adoption. The role requires an analytical storyteller with a strong sense of message and a deep understanding of Linux graphics, gaming, and desktop technologies and communities. We prefer university-graduated professionals with software engineering and software engineering management experience who want to become business executives and entrepreneurs. This is an exceptional opportunity for a competitive technology leader to: lead desktop graphics choices in Ubuntu drive partnerships in the graphics silicon, desktop, and gaming spheres tell the story of Ubuntu for gamers lead engineering design and development What you will be doing Be part of a rapidly growing team of multi-talented individuals with a strong focus on building great products Work with Canonical’s desktop engineering teams to ensure great integration across Canonical’s product portfolio Analyse market trends, define product goals, themes and features, maintain the product backlog, and solicit input from stakeholders Shape the message for gaming on Ubuntu Create effective Marketing content to engage and entice sophisticated technical and consumer enthusiast audiences Be accountable for the product roadmap, go-to-market execution, sales collateral, case studies, training, blog posts and community outreach What you bring to the team Hands-on experience in Linux and gaming tech stacks A curious and analytical mindset A technical or science background At least 3 years of software engineering experience Experience in open source project and community leadership Business and commercial interests Proven leadership and presentation skills Personal interests aligned with the field Awareness of Ubuntu and Canonical’s competition and opportunities Track record of data-driven decision-making Proven ability to write about technology and the tech landscape About Canonical Canonical is a growing, international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu -- the world’s #1 cloud operating system. Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu. Canonical is a unique tech company - global, remote-first, open source, with 700 professionals across 50 countries - we want to be the world’s best, not biggest, global software company. With almost every team remote by default, Canonical sets the pace on the 21st-century digital workplace. What Canonical offers: Work from home Learning and development allowances Competitive Salary Annual compensation review Recognition rewards Generous annual leave Paid maternity, paternity and sick leave Priority Pass for travel Exposure to international business and technology We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

Committed to cultivating a fun and fulfilling environment where everyone can show up as their authentic selves. Senior Product Manager in Gram Games

Jobs available in Remote Job

Gram Games is the studio behind some of the most popular mobile titles in the world, like 1010!, Merge Magic! and Merge Dragons!. We work in small self-managing teams, enabling you to have an incredible amount of ownership, autonomy, and impact. In Gram, everyone is expected to have a razor-sharp focus on what creates tangible impact: impact on their team, impact on their work environment, and impact on the overall company strategy. We are on the lookout for a talented Senior Product Manager who thinks they could thrive in that environment. As a senior member of the product team, you will be instrumental in keeping the ball rolling for your team. The ideal candidate has acute analytical skills and an in-depth understanding of free-to-play games. In this role, you will be responsible for helping to navigate a full free-to-play business model, and for discussing, advocating for, and helping determine which strategic elements are needed for the titles to be an ongoing success. Gram is a data-driven company. In this role, you will work closely with the data team on investigations, analyses, and the game economy. But this role has a key human element, as well; you need to be able to help drive and motivate team members across all disciplines and to curate a positive and productive team culture. Ultimately, the ideal candidate is a multi-talented, flexible problem-solver who’s not afraid to roll up their sleeves and get their hands dirty. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Working collaboratively with a range of disciplines to drive results and outcomes Working with data to help validate/invalidate hypotheses about the game economy Assessing the impact of potential improvements or changes on the game Effectively communicating with different stakeholders & teams & offices Above all, flexibility and adaptability are key Requirements Minimum of 3 years of experience in product management in consumer, mobile, or game development Ability to create wire-frames, product specifications and white papers Experience managing live mobile applications and/or games with multivariate testing is preferred Exceptional data analysis skills Strong project management skills and ability to present work to executive staff Strong passion for games, creating fun, compelling and addictive user experiences Outstanding written/oral, organizational, analytical skills, and attention to detail Ability to provide clear direction, set measurable goals and give insight on industry trends Previous start-up, social networking and/or consulting experience is a strong plus Advanced Excel and SQL proficiency preferred BA/BS degree, MBA preferred Benefits Competitive salary, bonus plan, Zynga RSU’s (Restricted Stock Units), ESPP (Employee Stock Purchase Plan) RRSP Company Match Contribution Extended Health coverage, dental, disability, critical illness, EAP, and life insurance Virtual mental health and neurodiversity support programs Goodlife fitness annual membership Open vacation policy Family planning support program Generous paid maternity/parental leave Subsidized Back-up child care Zynga happy hours and frequent employee events Casual dress every single day Culture of diversity and inclusion including employee resource groups Work with cool people and impact millions of daily players

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

Unity Accelerate Solutions is a specialized group that creates custom software experiences for customers around the globe. Innovation and understanding are at the core of what we do. Join the team to play a critical role in helping our clients build innovative solutions and solve daring problems in various industries: Automotive and Transportation, Games, Aerospace, General Manufacturing, AEC, Energy, etc.! You will work with several different teams to run activities across different client projects, to continuously improve and adapt our development processes to enhance delivery. Working closely with our sales teams, you will facilitate communication with the client and ensure that visions are aligned across different fields, from design to engineering. If you're client-focused and excited by the prospect of orchestrating sophisticated product and service pipelines with teams spanning the continent, this is the job for you! This role will involve periodic travel to client and Unity offices; may include some cross-continental travel. What you’ll be doing Manage the scope and capacity of the team throughout the project life cycle, ensure quality of deliverables whilst maintaining profitability of the project Continually drive day-to-day production across different internal development and external partner teams, scheduling sprints, balancing priorities, and supervising progress Partner with the project leadership team to manage the entire development, release and support processes of your projects Facilitate communication within the project team and among key partners. Build positive relationships with client teams, Unity's internal teams and external partners Generate and present weekly project status reports for key partners with ongoing risk management What we’re looking for You are a Project Manager with extensive experience working in Industry or Games on sophisticated projects a strong influencer with great communication skills, able to work with diverse groups and align teams around common goals You are customer focused, bring a professional attitude with stellar interpersonal skills, and are able to resolve conflicts with empathy Adaptability to embrace and navigate change is absolutely essential in our fast-paced environment You might also have Working knowledge of JIRA, PSA tools, or other similar software Experience using Unity in a professional environment Some knowledge of coding or authoring 3D artwork Life at Unity Unity (NYSE: U) is the world’s leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity is the foundation upon which the world’s most powerful digital content is created. Specifically, Unity’s platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices. In the fourth quarter of 2021, Unity had, on average, 3.9 billion monthly active end users who consumed content created or operated with its solutions. The applications developed by these creators were downloaded, on average, five billion times per month in 2021. Unity is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment and celebrate our employees across age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. Our differences are strengths that enable us to support the growing and evolving needs of our customers, partners, and collaborators. If there are preparations or accommodations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

At Wizards of the Coast, we connect people around the world through play and imagination. From our genre defining games like Magic: The Gathering® and Dungeons & Dragons® to our growing multiverse, we continue to innovate and build new ways to foster friendship and connection. That’s where you come in! As the Executive Producer for D&D Digital, you'll empower a diverse live game team to continuously deliver content, features, and player delight to drive the digital future of D&D. This role is responsible for all aspects of D&D Digital including business, production, and leadership elements. The ideal candidate has extensive live game leadership experience, a data-informed development approach, and the vision to build new business opportunities. What You'll Do: Lead the team through circumstance, using production expertise, collaborative problem solving, and effective prioritization to exceed expectations. Deliver on business requirements while ensuring the team, and thus the product, are creatively inspired, growing the power of the D&D brand. Work closely with the tabletop team to realize the vision of a unified D&D team. Partner with other teams across Wizards and Hasbro to discover and deliver impactful opportunities. Operate a multi-platform live service game experience through effective delegation, resilient processes, and continuous iteration. Ensure the growth and learning of the team for both business effectiveness and professional development. What You'll Bring: Multiple shipped and operated live service experiences at a senior leadership level, ideally across multiple platforms. Lifestyle game development from concept to completion with core audiences. Business and production management at $100M+ project scale. Corporate communication and evangelism both externally and internally. Expertise in building, managing, and refining 100+ member game teams. Infectious passion for crafting outstanding entertainment experiences that succeed from player love. Curiosity to drive continuous product and team iteration to achieve and maintain top status in the genre. Proficiency in video game production and business fundamentals across all subject areas. Servant leadership attitude that empower leadership across the team while still holding everyone accountable to business results. We are an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer The above is intended to describe the general content of and the requirements for satisfactory performance in this position. It is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of the duties, responsibilities, or requirements of the position. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. As a Principal Producer within Core Tech, you will be instrumental in playing a key role in our success. You will help drive priority and vision of key technical programs, powering all of Hytale’s various gameplay experiences and groundbreaking creator tools. You will work closely with teams of engineers while you collaborate across tech teams and leaders to help bring Hytale to life. Who you are: Experienced technical leader with exceptional prioritization skills and experience Exceptional ability to decipher technical needs from stakeholder feature expectations and requirements You have deep technical knowledge in highly creative projects A strong leader with integrity that consistently pushes for high standards to achieve goals whilst supporting your team Passionate about driving and delivering scalable and efficient core technical solutions Experienced as an Agile Product Owner for highly technical products Can think like a customer, understanding needs and requirements, ensuring that technical solutions are focused on enhancing the customer experience Able to communicate the intent behind plans and decisions As an excellent communicator, you are authentic and transparent in helping players and team members understand the decisions we make as developers Some of your role: Act as a Product Owner for the Core Tech team, scoping, prioritizing and defining delivery standards. You will own the vision and deliveries for the Core Tech team. Working with stakeholders to create, update and refine complex technical roadmaps Build and lead highly technical, geographically diverse teams Collaborate frequently with leads of product teams, identifying and selectively investing in opportunities where Core Tech can enable those teams to best serve the Hytale audience. Act as the main contact for Hytale’s core technology team, as it relates to the scope and design of our technical architecture, and future state. Essential Traits: 8+ years of experience leading highly complex technology teams, in a creative environment Experience with Agile development as a Product Owner Ability to work across all areas of the product, understanding feature and delivery implications with all major technical decisions Bonus Traits: Experience shipping titles across multiple platforms (PC, console, mobile) Experience with voxel, sandbox, or open world games A personal passion for open world, builder, or survival games We can offer: A chance to work on a new game project with an extremely motivated team Opportunities to learn and grow personally and professionally A stable and secure work environment The ability to work remotely We’re looking for applicants who are self-driven, put players first, and that have a history of making cool stuff. In return, we can offer an environment that values and supports individual creativity and passion and believes in fostering new talent. Every week, the Playrix marketing team brings millions of new players to our games. That's a lot! We never rest on our laurels and are constantly looking for ways to step up our game. Can you help us do that? Playrix is looking for an enthusiastic marketing producer who will improve our strategy for attracting users and lead projects at the department level for the User Acquisition team. We have a talented team of professionals, a powerful automation and analytics system, and partnerships with the leading players in the market. Tasks developing a user acquisition strategy; studying the algorithms of advertising channels, forming hypotheses, conducting research; analysis of the results of advertising campaigns, the implementation of KPIs; interacting with the creative team and our partners; leading the user acquisition team. Requirements at least 5 years of experience in performance marketing; work experience in a large company; experience managing a user acquisition team; an understanding of how Google Ads, Facebook Ads, and other advertising platforms work; a completed physics, mathematics, or technical education; English at the Upper-Intermediate level or above. Preferred experience in game development; experience with analytical systems (BI, Tableau); experience working in analytics. Our Perks Flexibility Work from wherever you like: your home, one of our offices, or choose a hybrid format. No one will micromanage you or count your hours. Healthcare We reimburse online sessions with a psychologist and offer you and your children healthcare, including dental insurance and treatment for COVID-19. We can organize vaccination for those who request it. Fitness We support leading a healthy lifestyle and offer reimbursement for gym memberships, fitness app subscriptions, or participation in marathons. Work-life balance We offer a generous amount of paid vacation days and sick leave. In special circumstances, additional days off can be requested. Comfortable workplace We have everything you need to work comfortably wherever you are. Our offices have recreation areas and provide hot meals, while employees working remotely can request any necessary equipment. Professional development and education We reimburse participation in relevant conferences and courses, and regularly conduct internal bootcamps and internships. For personal development, we provide access to thousands of books in our online library and discounted English language courses. Entertainment and merch Every year we hold hundreds of events around the world, including contests, sports challenges, parties, hackathons, and offline events for individual teams. Points for participating in these activities can be exchanged for collectible merch and branded equipment in our internal Playrix Shop. Social responsibility projects We continue to launch charity projects and support our employees' ideas in grant competitions. Work Format Remote

Producer in Level Ex, Inc.

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

Level Ex is a fast-growing game studio that creates video games for doctors. Our games feature thrilling medical cases built with the highest standards of game design and deliberate game mechanics. They also employ state-of-the-art graphics and physics technology, supported by the latest generation tech, allowing us to craft breathtaking virtual anatomy: custom-built GPU-based fluids, tissues, and soft-body systems that look and react like the real deal. We attract top artists, engineers, designers, and others from prominent gaming franchises, like Mortal Kombat, League of Legends, Call of Duty, Walking Dead, and Star Wars. Our caliber of talent keeps us in the forefront of the industry: GDC ranked our game design talk #2 of 194 for sponsored sessions in 2019, and we earned 2nd place at SIGGRAPH Real-Time Live! 2019, sharing the stage with Epic, Unity, Digital Domain, and others. Meet some of our incredible team here, and learn why you’ll enjoy our company and culture - Video: Why Join Level Ex? We are seeking a Producer to lead our growing client-facing team of developers. Our ideal candidate is a proven leader with a record of bringing products to global success and who is eager to join us to elevate medical games at a genre-defining level. Working cross-company, the Producer will coordinate feature and content deliveries on current and future projects. What You’ll Do Lead individual products - work use cases with the client, lead how the team converts goals to results, and drive internal resources in delivering clearly prioritized work. Partner with Leadership to review project progress and balance inbound change requests. Coordinate with business development and product management to quickly deliver pre-production documentation for customer proposals. Drive teams of engineers, designers, artists, medical researchers, and others through full development cycles. Collaborate with marketing, business development, operations, client solutions, QA, and other departments. Mitigate risks and work solutions, keeping the team appraised of changes through clear communication. Develop long term project plans & work to maintain ‘on track’ and ‘on budget’ status. Lead sprints, evaluate burn downs, ensure traction on sprint over sprint project objectives. Own tracking tools and reports (JIRA/Confluence) and be open to using the right tools at the right time. What You’ll Bring Minimum of 4+ years experience in game production or consumer software project management. Ideally, you are credited as a Producer on multiple-first mobile games/applications. Flexibility in handling ambiguity, excellent at guiding global expectations, and firm in adherence to scope and timelines. Lengthy experience running Agile development practices (including Kanban). A ‘problem solver’ demeanor - adaptable plans, efficient evangelization with internal and external partners. Appreciation for data - analytics driven and know where to measure and how to apply relevant data metrics. Care about being excellent at your craft, helping others to succeed, and lead by example to set the standard on what it means to be an industry defining leader. Able to efficiently work remotely, collaborating and sharing virtually with team members across the U.S. Bonus Points For An authority at the Atlassian suite, able to optimize and upgrade the group on JIRA and Confluence in your sleep. Significant experience working with clients as a game developer or within an agency environment. Skill at leading efforts through difficult communication situations with executives, partners, and the team at large. College Degree or equivalent production experience. Experience with outsourcing and remote development. Medical Profession-based application development. How We Make You Happy Multiple health insurance plans with 100% company-paid premiums. 401(k) with generous company-paid match. 4 weeks of PTO, 2 weeks of company holidays. 100% remote for all U.S. employees or ability to work out of our awesome downtown Chicago office if you desire. Dental, vision and optional pet insurance. Pre-tax flex spending for healthcare. Monthly snack allowance sent to your home. Remote after-hours team events, like board games tabletop simulator, Jackbox Games, etc. DEI events, game jams, virtual happy hours. Unlimited cold brew and gourmet coffee, kombucha, Bevi sparkling water, and craft beer in the office. Interested? Please send us your resume along with an optional cover letter detailing why you’re an excellent fit using the links below. We look forward to hearing from you and exploring the possibilities. Diversity Statement Level Ex is the collective sum of all our individual experiences, backgrounds, and influences and we pride ourselves in growing and learning together. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to building an inclusive and diverse environment where everyone’s individuality is respected, and everyone has an Identity. Our commitment to inclusion across race, gender, age, religion, identity, and experience drives us forward every day. No Agency or Recruiter submissions will be accepted. Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required.

Executive Producer in House of How

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

We believe that a universe without fun would be a pretty dull place to exist… and that games are the best medium in the world to provide that fun. We love games which is why we make games. We make games to be a part of providing that outlet for escape, competition, exploration, social connection and so much more to a global audience of 3B+ players and growing. We believe in authentic leadership, real conversations, making decisions, learning from mistakes but always continuing to move forward. We don’t want big company politics. We just want to do our best work with good people and have fun doing what we love. We believe that our team performs best when everyone shows up as their authentic full self and we strive to empower everyone in the studio to be a game-maker. We encourage everyone to have an entrepreneurial mindset and we foster continuous learning and innovation. In a time of so much industry consolidation, House of How is proud to be fully independent. We are based out of Bothell, Washington with remote game-makers all over the USA. We have a satellite studio in Boden, Sweden and are also now expanding our remote workforce in British Columbia, Canada. Starting out as colleagues at Microsoft Games, our leads worked with each other for years before setting out on a new adventure together. From humble beginnings, we grew slowly and carefully to ensure we could control our own destiny. We are now at ~50 people and growing rapidly as our industry reputation is bringing more and more projects to the studio. Come join our team and be part of the amazing growth story of House of How Games and help us to entertain the planet! Responsibilities Build and mentor a team to lead all aspects of game production. Work with both dev and art counterparts to build products, processes, features, and assets. Responsible for timely, quality delivery of game features and content. Own final quality and driving of a major product, or multiple small products simultaneously. Create, prioritize and manage project backlog, roadmap, production schedules and other high level planning. Communicate and strategize with publisher and external development contacts to facilitate our development efforts, reporting issues to executive management when as they arise, with the help of company leadership. Define and ensure proper management of complex internal team, external team and cross-team projects. Define, review and continually improve team development processes. Run scrums and production meetings to ensure effective communication of goals, tasks, progress, and blockers. Ensure the development team is working towards clear deadlines, and support a foster of solid estimates, responsibility, and quality. Requirements Track record of delivering high-quality games as an Executive Producer or comparable product leader. Ability to identify and recommend improvements to the development process. Outstanding people skills and EQ. Demonstrable organizational, problem solving and time management skills. Demonstrable ability to develop complex project roadmaps and staffing plans. Must possess excellent spoken and written communication skills and be able to work with varied staff members and personalities. Strong presentation and leadership skills and the ability to mentor more junior producers. Experience in budgeting processes at studio, project, and outsourcing levels. Must be punctual, proactive, and have a strong work ethic. Experience in source control systems such as Git or SVN. Expert in ADO, Trello, Jira, or other task tracking systems. Written and Spoken English Fluency. Bonus Qualifications Experience in Unreal, Unity, or other engines. A passionate interest in games to drive our products to the next level. Animation, Audio, etc. If you have any related side skills, please tell us!

Executive Producer in 2K

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

Who We Are Founded in 2005, 2K Games is a global video game company, publishing titles developed by some of the most influential game development studios in the world. Our studios responsible for developing 2K’s portfolio of world-class games across multiple platforms, include Firaxis, Hangar 13, CatDaddy, Cloud Chamber, 31st Union, Visual Concepts and HB Studios. Our portfolio of titles is expanding due to our global strategic plan, building, and acquiring exciting studios whose content continues to inspire all of us! 2K publishes titles in today’s most popular gaming genres, including sports, shooters, action, role-playing, strategy, casual, and family entertainment. Our team of engineers, marketers, artists, writers, data scientists, producers, thinkers, and doers, are the professional publishing stewards of our growing library of critically acclaimed franchises such as NBA 2K, BioShock, Borderlands, Tiny Tina’s Wonderlands, Mafia, Sid Meier’s Civilization, WWE 2K, and XCOM. At 2K, we pride ourselves on creating an inclusive work environment, which means encouraging our teams to Come as You Are and do your best work! We are dedicated to diversity and inclusion and want our community of candidates to reflect this commitment. We encourage all qualified applicants to explore our global positions. 2K is headquartered in Novato, California and is a wholly owned label of Take-Two Interactive Software, Inc. (NASDAQ: TTWO). What We Need We’re looking for an Executive Producer to work with 2K’s internal and external studios in developing and publishing a slate of exciting new AAA titles in the shooter, action, role-playing and/or strategy genres. Executive Producers within 2K’s Product & Live Service team are responsible for leading several titles from inception through to post-launch operations. We need someone who is self-motivated, is highly organized, possess strong leadership and team-building skills, and most importantly who understands what makes a great game. An Executive Producer is a leader-of-leaders who unifies internal and external groups towards a specific set of goals, tracks and leads progress, removes roadblocks and ultimately is responsible and accountable for shipping high-quality products that our players love. What You Will Do Partner with extraordinary development teams in both internal and external studios to help them realize their creative vision and support them in all aspects required to achieve the highest quality products Lead multiple projects simultaneously at different stages of development from concept to completion and act as the product’s champion both with the studio and the larger 2K publishing organization Oversee, lead and collaborate closely with internal and external studio partners to meet production schedules and maintain a coherent creative vision throughout the entire development life cycle Ensure each title has a clear investment thesis and is built to meet or exceed their success criteria and publisher goals Establish development priorities and landmarks on a per-project basis Lead strategic planning for product budgets and milestone schedules and lead forecasts of the budget, anticipating, identifying, and resolving overruns Ensure Sr. Producers identify, track and mitigate key development and publishing risks on their titles. Present updates throughout the entire product life cycle to the executive management layer at the label, regarding project strategy, status, budget, quality Coach and manage studios through each milestone gate while ensuring adherence to schedules, budget, scope and quality expectations at each phase of development. Partner with 2K Live Services to ensure titles are set up for success regarding games-as-a-service (GaaS) - including a post-launch strategy that is data-driven to support key performance indicators Collaborate with publishing stakeholders in Marketing, Commercial Growth and Live Services to define key publisher-led initiatives and drive alignment with the studio Hire, manage and mentor producers at all levels, and support their growth and career development to ensure they have clear goals and expectations. Lead and act to prevent potential conflicts between internal and external expectations for projects Assist with coordinating game release process with internal groups including Marketing, Live Services, QA, Core Technology and Customer Service Assist with portfolio planning and identifying key products to acquire or license to support the company business goals What Will Make You a Great Fit Expert-level understanding of the game development process (ideally from hands-on experience leading development teams) Ability to foresee and mitigate key development risks including those related scope, budget, staffing and product quality. Experience with the publishing process, particularly for AAA PC/console titles. Knowledge of live operations and games-as-a-service (GaaS) Excellent communication skills (verbal and written), time and project management skills Experience building and being a great partner with vendors and other external resources Experience with conflict resolution, with particular regard to mitigating, and resolving development, publishing and product quality risks Understanding of various production processes and methodologies Displays resourcefulness, enthusiasm, and self-motivation Adept at building relationships throughout the organization Ability to lead to and deliver on hard product deadlines with rapid development cycles while being the guardian over product quality in all phases of game development from concept to completion Ability to inspire and motivate those that work for them and those they work with The ability to multi-task, prioritize and execute with autonomy Bonus Points Experience with AAA console / PC products preferred Knowledge of and experience with shooters, RPGs and/or action games is a plus Travel, both domestic and international, may be required As an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to ensuring that qualified individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform their essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us if you need reasonable accommodation. Please note that 2K Games and its studios never uses instant messaging apps or personal email accounts to contact prospective employees or conduct interviews and when emailing, only use 2K.com accounts.

We strive to create an environment where we can do our best work regardless of what we look like, who we love, or how we identify. With support operations in New Orleans, Louisiana, the studio also works to identify, mentor, train, and hire individuals from underserved and overlooked communities and backgrounds. As a Senior Producer, you'll work closely with the Production Director and leads to create & maintain a scaffolding of process to support our incredible development team as they collaborate, stay aligned, and reliably meet our commitments. Because strong collaboration makes the best games, you'll also work closely with all development disciplines to help shape and guide the game holistically through all stages of development. Core Responsibilities & Objectives Working closely with the Production team and other leads to create and refine processes and project planning that allow the development team to produce ambitious work within constraints. Facilitate scoping, planning, goal-setting, and dependency & task tracking for a large cross-functional product area. Use a mix of waterfall and agile tools for ensuring short- and long-term goals are met, problems are surfaced, and solutions are developed in partnership with everyone who has a stake in the outcome. Support communication & knowledge sharing across a fully distributed team with a consistent cadence and lightweight tools. Core Traits (Skills, Knowledge, Experience) Strong understanding of game development cycle from pre-production to release & live operations Solid experience with short- and long-term planning, and with agile methods for task and workflow management. Jobs available in Remote Job

Deep Silver Volition has been creating wildly original and successful video games for over 25 years, including the fan-favorite Saints Row series. Our studio has prospered by making fun, innovative games no one else can make, while focusing on work-life balance and fostering a culture of collaboration, continuous growth, and learning. This is a remote-friendly role. We’re a hybrid work environment, headquartered in Champaign, IL but with employees working permanently remotely across the U.S. We're seeking a Senior Producer for an upcoming, unannounced title. As a Senior Producer, you’ll establish scalable process improvements that achieve our goals while sustaining a healthy and empowering team environment. You'll balance creative pursuits with scheduling needs, pushing for quality and innovation while managing project scope and budget. To succeed in this role, you should be inventive, inspiring, and well organized, with a broad set of hard and soft creative production skills, and enthusiasm for building and leading diverse and inclusive teams. What you’ll do as a Senior Producer: Lead and nurture a diverse group of creative production professionals across several areas of focus (IP development, art outsourcing, product innovation, branding, and packaging) to be leaders in their craft and grow in their careers. Drive product quality, regularly reviewing the game and providing constructive, thoughtful feedback to the team. Inform and guide the team with a detailed understanding of risks, dependencies, and resource constraints. Identify potential areas of risk, create/execute mitigation plans before issues happen, and keep the team running at a high level of productivity. Facilitate communication across the project team; clearly communicate tasks and responsibilities to staff. Act as primary problem solver, resolving conflicts before they impact production and productivity. Partner with Project Managers to deliver and refine the project roadmap. Participate in Scrum team ceremonies, including daily standups, sprint planning, backlog grooming and retros. Track bugs and triage regularly with your team, assessing, assigning, and prioritizing according to sprint and project needs. Develop and share game industry best practices for product management, team communication, LiveOps, road mapping and business strategies. Define, implement, and evolve team processes that foster collaboration, open feedback, and individual initiative. Be a champion for a healthy team culture that rejects crunch while supporting each other to carry out ambitious goals. Craft clear, detailed, and proactive communication to your immediate group and our studio leadership team. What we’re looking for: 8+ years' experience in game development production. Full project life cycle experience as an internal game producer, with at least 3 shipped AAA game titles. 4+ years' experience as a trusted and inspiring manager and motivator, with high EQ and low ego. Comprehensive understanding of agile methodologies, project management tools, and game development life cycle. Empathetic collaboration style, with an ability to articulate the "why" instead of just the "how" and "what" to ensure developers apply insights for future features. Persuasive and effective communication skills, with proven experience in diplomatically and effectively negotiating efficient solutions across cross-functional teams. A resourceful and adaptive entrepreneurial spirit, with a bias for action. Strong intellectual curiosity, willing to embrace experimentation and invite open participation in creative problem-solving. A servant leader mindset, with a passion for enabling creative people to do their best work. Some of our benefits: Subsidized medical/dental/vision insurance Company-paid life, short-term, & long-term disability insurance Generous paid time off (including parental leave and an annual company shutdown between Christmas & New Year's) 401k with company contribution Annual learning & development budget + access to LinkedIn Learning Paid subscriptions to Headspace, Doordash, Sworkit, and other wellness apps At Deep Silver Volition we believe in fostering an open, collaborative, and diverse environment, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We will consider all qualified applicants without attention to race, color, national origin, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, genetic information, disability, age, veteran status, or military status.

Technical Program Manager in Twitch

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

About Us Twitch is the world’s biggest live streaming service, with global communities built around gaming, entertainment, music, sports, cooking, and more. It’s where millions of people come together to chat, interact, and make their own entertainment. We’re about community, inside and out. You’ll find coworkers who are eager to team up, collaborate, and smash (or elegantly solve) problems together. We’re on a quest to empower live communities, so if this sounds good to you, see what we’re up to on LinkedIn and Twitter, get interviewing tips on Instagram, and discover projects we’re solving on our Blog. About the Role Are you passionate about making the internet safer, more inclusive, and more enjoyable for people around the world? Do you want to grow your career turning that passion into action? As a Technical Program Manager on the Twitch Community Health team, you'll define and deliver programs that keep millions of Twitch users safe. Our growing team navigates a dynamic problem space to defend Twitch creators and viewers from harm. Community Health builds tech that: enables reporting and enforcement of harmful content, allows communities to self-moderate, and supports our Law Enforcement Response team. We invest in prevention of harm via machine learning as technology evolves. As a Technical Program Manager, you will support long-term strategy and tactical to deliver strategic programs, and report to the TPM manager for Community Health. You'll align roadmaps to program goals, and guide cross-functional teams to optimal solutions that keep users safe. You can work in San Francisco, Irvine, CA or Seattle, WA. We are remote flexible. You Will: Manage the program for how we enable communities to self-moderate via Channel Moderator tools. • Employ your domain knowledge and creativity to resolve emergent safety issues in the community. • Provide recommendations to product teams across Twitch on how to integrate with the safety tooling within your program. • Define and roll out best practices across the Community Health org, and be a productivity process expert You Have: Been a Technical Program Manager for 2 or more years. Deployed user-facing technologies at high quality bar, with demonstrated track record of meeting user needs and resolving business tradeoffs. Knowledge of engineering architecture and ability to identify dependencies and technical risks. Experience managing stakeholders, and cross-organizational dependencies. Comfort working on occasion with potentially sensitive or disturbing content. Bonus Points Domain experience in Trust & Safety. Perks Medical, Dental, Vision & Disability Insurance 401(k) Maternity & Parental Leave Flexible PTO Amazon Employee Discount Monthly Contribution & Discounts for Wellness Related Activities & Programs (e.g., gym memberships, off-site massages, etc.) We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Twitch. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. The base pay range for this position in Colorado, Connecticut, Washington and New Jersey is $134,550 - $164,450 yr and in New York City is $148,050 – $180,950 yr. Pay is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. A sign-on payment and restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered. Applicants should apply via Twitch's internal or external careers site. Workers in New York City who perform in-person work or interact with the public in the course of business must show proof they have been fully vaccinated against COVID or request and receive approval for a reasonable accommodation, including medical or religious accommodation. Product Manager - Hypercasual Mobile Games in Kwalee

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

A Little Bit about Kwalee…. Kwalee is one of the world’s leading multiplatform game developers and publishers, with well over 900 million downloads worldwide for mobile hits such as Draw It, Teacher Simulator, Let’s Be Cops 3D, Airport Security and Makeover Studio 3D. We also have a growing PC and Console team of incredible pedigree that is on the hunt for great new titles to join TENS!, Eternal Hope, Die by the Blade and Scathe. What’s In It For You? Profit sharing scheme - we win, you win Quarterly Team Building days Pitch and make your own games on Creative Wednesdays! Flexible working hours - we trust you to choose how and when you work best All the equipment that you need to be properly set up Are You Up To The Challenge? We work with hundreds of developers all over the world, helping them to transform their dreams into reality with hit games. The central technology used to do this is our Publishing Portal. As a Product Manager you will take full ownership of our Publishing Portal project. You will define the vision we are working towards and manage the roadmap and team that will deliver it. Your Team Mates The Mobile Publishing team works with external game developers to bring their titles to success by leveraging the internal expertise of Kwalee. We source and onboard developers and provide a suite of tools through our publishing portal to support them at every step of the journey. Our team comprises of Business Development who source new games, Partnerships who nurture our long term relationships, Production who ensure games are of the highest quality, and Technology who build the technology that supports our partners. What Does The Job Actually Involve? Ensure the successful delivery of our Publishing Portal roadmap. Analyse gaps in our technology stack and propose new technology projects that help us to meet our corporate goals. Define a product vision, go to market plan and a roadmap strategy from inception through the full product lifecycle to deliver against the company KPIs. Liaise with internal and external stakeholders to help build the backlog of product features. Manage the development team working on the Portal. Your Hard Skills Experience of leading concurrent and overlapping technology projects from inception to launch People management skills with a focus on bringing out the best in a team Knowledge of agile and SCRUM product owner methodologies and tools Ability to understand the big picture and the inter-relationships of all positions and activities in the system, including the impact of changes in one area on another area Can manage a complex backlog of features and launch roadmap Great people skills with the ability to communicate plans with internal and external stakeholders A bonus if you’ve worked in the gaming industry or a related technology field Your Soft Skills Kwalee has grown fast in recent years but we’re very much a family of colleagues. We welcome people of all ages, races, colours, beliefs, sexual orientations, genders and circumstances, and all we ask is that you collaborate, work hard, ask questions and have fun with your team and colleagues. We don’t like egos or arrogance and we love playing games and celebrating success together. If that sounds like you, then please apply. A Little More About Kwalee Founded in 2011 by David Darling CBE, a key architect of the UK games industry who previously co-founded and led Codemasters, our team also includes legends such as Andrew Graham (creator of Micro Machines series) and Jason Falcus (programmer of classics including NBA Jam) alongside a growing and diverse team of global gaming experts. Everyone contributes creatively to Kwalee’s success, with all employees eligible to pitch their own game ideas on Creative Wednesdays, and we’re proud to have built our success on this inclusive principle. We have an amazing team of experts collaborating daily between our studios in Leamington Spa, Lisbon, Bangalore and Beijing, or on a remote basis from Turkey, Brazil, Cyprus, the Philippines and many more places around the world. We’ve recently acquired our first external studio, TicTales, which is based in France. We have a truly global team making games for a global audience, and it’s paying off: - Kwalee has been voted the Best Large Studio and Best Leadership Team at the TIGA Awards (Independent Game Developers’ Association) and our games have been downloaded in every country on earth - including Antarctica!

Senior Product Manager in Fortis Games

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

Remote - Americas WHO WE ARE At Fortis Games we aspire to make great games that bring people together while redefining how game companies work. We believe in building a sense of belonging through our games, their communities, and how we operate and treat each other. Through our game communities, we will create powerful connections and lasting memories. We will foster a culture of diversity, equity and belonging where together our diverse skills, experiences and background impact the games we make. We are an early but mighty organization with a leadership team of game industry veterans. There are many opportunities for you to have a big impact on the products we’ll be making as well as the overall direction of the company. If you’re passionate about tackling difficult problems with direct and thoughtful communication and team first mentality, we may be the right place for you. About the role Work with product leadership to design major systems and features for new game concepts. Help direct and mentor other members of the product team. Share learnings with the broader product team and contribute to the overall development of our product strategy and portfolio of games. What you’ll achieve You will design core systems in our new games that are critical to their success by Creating proposals that articulate how these features and systems uphold the game’s design pillars and drive the desired player behaviors. Delivering clear, concise, and thorough specifications to cross functional teams responsible for implementing these systems. Providing team members with direction on how content should be created, tuned, and live operated within these systems. You will become an expert in the opportunity spaces, genres, and game mechanics you explore during prototyping and share your learnings with the broader product team to advance our collective knowledge. You will develop an independent design philosophy that upholds the key tenets of Fortis’ approach to products while adding your own unique approach to thinking about emerging patterns in service design.​ What you’ll need to be successful A holistic view of game systems and the downstream effects of all design decisions throughout both the product and player lifecycle. A firm understanding of fundamental design principles, metagame systems, game economies, and player psychology that allows you to design from first principles. Ability to articulate the nuances of abstract concepts and how they apply to complex, interrelated systems. Ability to synthesize feedback from team members, user playtests, and other validation efforts into product insights and rapidly iterate on designs. Extensive knowledge of games as a service and live operations – you know what good looks like and can build efficient design processes, workflows, and tooling to enable it. Enthusiasm for directing, mentoring, and otherwise elevating the people around you to do their best work. A natural curiosity and eagerness to learn - we believe this is essential to our ability to stay ahead of the market and value this over years of experience.​ ​We expect our leaders to continue being students of their craft and the game spaces they’re working in. You should be educated on the latest trends and have a strong perspective on how they relate to our current and future projects. WHY JOIN US There are many reasons to join us, but here are a few: We strongly believe we are changing how games studios operate and at the core of what we do is making great games that create a connected community Culture of diversity and inclusion and support to all team members Work with some of the industry's coolest people who have designed and launched the best games in the world Fortis is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Our employees connect through our Employee Resource Groups, which are actively involved in driving business decisions every step of the way. But our support doesn’t end at the workplace—we also encourage a balanced lifestyle with paid time off and new parent leave, free video games, fitness reimbursement and more. Our goal is to provide a safe, respectful and inspiring workplace for all of our employees. Through our diversity, equity, inclusion and social responsibility programs, we’re doing the work to give everyone the space to be their full selves while giving back to our community. We’re looking for problem-solvers, game-changers, innovators, dreamers, doers—people that are ready to move the needle and build on our success. As our industry accelerates, we aren’t just keeping up—we’re staying ahead of the game. Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. Senior Producer in Stoic

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

Are you looking for an opportunity to work on a brand-new title with a team of highly respected game developers? Are you a reliable, thoughtful collaborator who enjoys working with a highly creative and talented team and directing it to smooth and predictable outcomes? Our team at Stoic, 4-time BAFTA nominated independent video game company, is seeking a Sr. Producer. You will help us take the project from Production through launch. As a Sr. Producer your responsibility is to own and drive a part of the game and lead a cross-discipline development team through launch into a long-term live service. You are responsible for keeping the team focused and productive. This is a key role that involves a high level of interaction with team members, outsourcing partners, project, and studio leadership. The successful candidate will be passionate about helping our team achieve their creative vision. What You Will Do: Lead with enthusiasm, humility, empathy, honesty, and respect. Shape and drive production for a portion of our game and its live service. Work with directors and leads to establish clear goals, creative vision, and “what good looks like” for your team. Accurately forecast our trajectory, identify risks, and actively work with the team to address. Establish, drive, and communicate the long-term roadmap and schedule for the area of responsibility. Create highly efficient pipelines for areas of responsibility. Communicate with stakeholders to understand problems, solutions, and plans and bring pertinent information into planning discussions. Set quality targets and drive processes to ensure those targets are being met. Use data and analytics to inform decision making and ensure that decisions are made in a timely fashion and evaluated for efficacy. Need to Have: A minimum of 5 years of experience in a Production role in AAA games. 5+ years of experience developing and executing game project plans. 5+ years of experience leading, motivating and driving teams to success. Strong understanding of agile development values and practices. Strong logic and communication skills. Negotiation, change management, and conflict resolution skills. Ability to successfully partner within the studio. Sound decision-making based on data analysis, market knowledge, and personal judgement. Assertive and motivated team player with a bias for action. High degree of initiative, takes opportunities to make improvements. Ownership mentality: accountable, invested in outcomes. Humility and Integrity. Stoic has transitioned to a fully remote, forever remote workforce. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Are you looking for an opportunity to work on a brand-new title with a team of highly respected game developers? Are you a reliable, thoughtful collaborator who enjoys working with a highly creative and talented team and directing it to smooth and predictable outcomes? Our team at Stoic, a 4-time BAFTA nominated independent video game company, is seeking a Producer for development of our next project. You will help us take the project from Production through launch. As a Producer your responsibility is to own and drive a part of the game and lead a cross-discipline development team through launch into a long-term live service. You are responsible for keeping the team focused and productive. This is a key role that involves a high level of interaction with team members, outsourcing partners, project, and studio leadership. What You Will Do: Lead with enthusiasm, humility, empathy, honesty, and respect. Shape and drive production for a portion of our game and its live service. Work with directors and leads to establish clear goals, creative vision, and “what good looks like” for your team. Accurately forecast our trajectory, identify risks, and actively work with the team to address. Establish, drive, and communicate the long-term roadmap for the area of responsibility. Create highly efficient pipelines for areas of responsibility. Communicate with stakeholders to understand problems, solutions, and plans and bring pertinent information into planning discussions. Set quality targets and drive processes to ensure those targets are being met. Use data and analytics to inform decision making and ensure that decisions are made in a timely fashion and evaluated for efficacy. Need To Have: The successful candidate will be passionate about helping our team achieve their creative vision. 4+ years of experience in a Production role in games or software development. 4+ years of experience developing and executing project plans. 4+ years of experience leading, motivating and driving teams to success. Strong understanding of agile development values and practices. Strong logic and communication skills. Negotiation, change management, and conflict resolution skills. Ability to successfully partner within the studio. Sound decision-making based on data analysis, market knowledge, and personal judgment. Assertive and motivated team player with a bias for action. High degree of initiative, takes opportunities to make improvements. Ownership mentality: accountable, invested in outcomes. Humility and integrity. Stoic has transitioned to a fully remote, forever remote workforce. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

A passion for gaming and an up-to-date knowledge of gaming trends. This is the same world-class team known for its contributions to the Last of Us franchise! Using our existing expertise and premier talent, we will guarantee a high visual quality bar for the game and a compelling experience for our players. Our team is seeking a dedicated, focused, and self-motivated producer with a broad proven experience and a track record of building processes to help the team achieve its highest potential. As the ideal candidate, you will be proficient in all aspects of AAA game production and management. You are an organized and attentive leader; strategic, and thoughtful in all interactions with both internal and external partners. Most importantly, your experience will guide the team’s cultural growth and abilities. Responsibilities: Define and maintain project plans, schedules, and roadmaps considering dependencies across multiple development teams. Ensure the team is on track with their deliverables, and seek opportunities for project optimization. Lead in the creation, estimation, and tracking of major milestones, gates, features, tasks, and bugs. Communicate concisely, frequently, and effectively with the production team and discipline leads on project status, risks, and opportunities to ensure they are properly informed. Suggest corrective or mitigating actions. Can speak designer, artist, and engineer. Able to translate between these teams where needed to ensure alignment on goals. Help make informed decisions in conjunction with team leads on work methods, development pipeline, priorities, and available people. Apply project tracking tools to maintain a constant awareness of game content status and improve our creative processes. Work with the tools team to advance the development of our production-related software and optimization of production workflows. Improve the processes used by the production team to ensure our own effectiveness and workload balance. Set and moderate studio meetings, determine and delegate action items, keep the discussion on track, and set follow-up meetings. Remain current on industry trends, including new game genres, new game development methodologies, and emergent technology. Requirements: Minimum 5+ years of solid experience in a game development environment Minimum 2 years as Senior or Lead Producer on a 20 plus person internal team Two or more published AAA titles, at least one of which must have been as a Senior Producer during the entire development cycle. Experience working with teams through all aspects of the product life cycle, including prototyping, pre-production, production, beta, and release. Experience with JIRA (preferred)/DevTrack and Confluence workflows Nice to haves: Familiar with visualization / collaboration apps like Miro Experience working on projects with and sharing / shepherding co-dev partner production teams. This could also be expressed as “You are a highly collaborative individual and can help facilitate relationships across the team.” Can discuss best project management practices for projects of varying scope and size. Can develop robust pipeline-based workflows in JIRA that maintain clear lines of accountability throughout a given issue’s lifecycle. Players love our games’ focus on racial, gender, sexual, and identity diversity while holding us accountable when they expect more. Your role will be to develop a growth strategy, build a growth-driven roadmap, and iterate on strategy/roadmap continuously based on analytics and user feedback Define key in-product acquisition loops, including but not limited to referral loops, content loops, reward loops and partnership loops for user acquisition, and optimize every stage of these loops to maximize impact Draft business rationale, functional requirements and user stories of desired features with detailed measurable KPIs and collaborate with the production team to convert them into rolling quarterly growth roadmap Lead execution of growth roadmap and present post-mortem analysis to cross functional teams after each main feature rollout Continuously iterate on plans and motivate cross-functional teams to continuously improve upon targeted KPIs, e.g. user growth, conversion rates and retention rates Provide and present quarterly analysis of user acquisition best practices of competitive products or similar platforms to grow organizational knowledge in this area Potential people management opportunity as the platform scales and the team grows REQUIREMENTS 4-8 years in product management or equivalent field delivering KPI-driven roadmap Prior experience innovating high-impact growth features for freemium products Structured and data driven approach in problem solving and critical thinking Excellent oral and written communication skills at all levels Entrepreneurial spirit- a self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment, deals with ambiguity, and motivates cross-functional teams even without authority BA / BS or equivalent industry experience, Masters/MBA preferred BONUS REQUIREMENTS Product management skills in live ops and data analysis Hands-on experience in A/B testing tools such as Optimizely, CleverTap/LeanPalm etc Experience in (and love for) narrative or interactive fiction games Experience in (and love for) casual and/or female-focused mobile games BENEFITS & PERKS Competitive salary High level of autonomy and freedom Rich & flexible health, disability, and employee assistance offerings to meet the needs of a diverse workforce trivia parties, and other team-building activities throughout the year! What you’ll do as a Producer at Deep Silver Volition: Lead and collaborate closely with feature teams to drive product quality and timeliness, while ensuring alignment of creative vision and pillars throughout the entire process. Model proactive team communication, ensuring prompt dissemination of information and updates. Partner with project management to ensure reliable team performance and deliverables, supporting creativity and building cohesive teams. Ensures high quality by continuously playing the game, reviewing competitive products, evaluating design/technical/art documents and other creative materials, and creating quality tracking documents. Schedule and coordinate meetings and ensure completion of action items. Collaborate with Marketing and PR to support their efforts to promote the game while advocating for the development teams. A servant leader mindset, with a passion for enabling creative people to do their best work. Working knowledge of Jira, MS Office, Confluence and testing applications. Understanding of software development project management methodologies such as AGILE/Scrum. Strong time management skills with a proven ability to focus on priorities, risk assessment, problem solving, handle multiple tasks and meet deadlines. Proven ability to lead, connect with, and motivate all game development disciplines. Some of our benefits: Subsidized medical/dental/vision insurance Company-paid life, short-term, & long-term disability insurance Generous paid time off (including parental leave and an annual company shutdown between Christmas & New Year's) 401k with company contribution Annual learning & development budget + access to LinkedIn Learning Paid subscriptions to Headspace, Doordash, Sworkit, and other wellness apps At Deep Silver Volition we believe in fostering an open, collaborative, and diverse environment, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Today the RuneScape franchise exists beyond running games in live operations; our titles are living games that connect and inspire millions of players, with content and experiences both inside and outside of inexhaustible game worlds. Both RuneScape and Old School RuneScape, on PC and mobile, offer ever-evolving, highly-active worlds and our community-focussed development ethos empowers players to have a real say in how each game is shaped.
