Junior Project Manager (f/m/d) in PlaytestCloud

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

About PlaytestCloud PlaytestCloud and our products power the player-centric development of modern mobile games. Over 60% of the studios listed in the Top 100 grossing games charts on the App Store have tested their games with PlaytestCloud, so we have a lot of experience under our belt. Our aim is to make it 100% by the end of 2022! We’re the premier user testing provider for mobile games - we help game studios worldwide make the best games they possibly can. Our online platform enables testing iOS and Android games with real players around the world and provides in-game video recordings, surveys, and reports which game studios use to craft amazing player experiences. We’re bootstrapped and profitable, with 300+ paying game studios and 1,000,000+ playtesters. At PlaytestCloud, everybody contributes directly to helping our clients make the best games possible. Tasks We are looking for an experienced Project Manager (f/m/d) to help us expertly manage remote playtesting for game studios around the world. Our chosen candidate will: Take ownership of the successful planning, execution and delivery of remote mobile playtests, including scoping, quoting, technical setup and evaluation of the results Communicate effectively with our clients via email and Zoom to provide project-specific support for their playtesting needs Set up complicated playtests, schedule interviews and facilitate communication between clients and external Games User Researchers, all while meeting tight deadlines and managing multiple projects simultaneously Master and use in-house and external software programs to facilitate playtesting and client communication, including Asana, Jira, Slack, and Heroku Document and regularly update information for playtests and processes related to playtesting Suggest improvements that will make our processes and tools more efficient Requirements You have (near) native spoken and written English skills. German is not required for the role. Any additional languages will be a plus. You have 3+ years of experience managing projects, ideally in gaming, user research, research operations or in SaaS businesses You’re able to respond quickly to the needs of our clients and have communicated closely with customers in previous roles You have strong organizational skills, with excellent and proven time management abilities and can manage multiple projects with short deadlines You can quickly learn new complex software. In-house we use our own (custom-built) tools and are looking for someone who has professional familiarity with other complex software or programming languages (e.g. Google Data Studio, Logic Pro X, Unity, Tableau. SQL specifically is a plus) You’re familiar with video games, whether it was “back in the day” or more recently, and are eager to learn more You're open to working a later shift (11:00 - 20:00 Berlin time) All candidates, who may not have the above-listed years of experience, but can demonstrate the necessary skills, may apply and will be considered. With your application, please send us a cover letter on why you are a great fit for PlaytestCloud. What's in it for you Expand your knowledge of mobile game development and Games User Research Work directly with the top mobile gaming studios in the world Take responsibility for a core part of the business from day one Experience a high level of autonomy in your work Be part of a tight-knit, motivated and supportive Project Management team Contribute to a highly successful SaaS research operations team Benefits Here comes the fun part! If you love a less-formal work environment, flexible work hours and location, a competitive compensation package and benefits - and most of all, being the authentic you - we want to meet you. Here are some of our perks & benefits: Hybrid work model: Employees can flexibly switch between different workplaces - and even work 100% remotely. This includes temporarily working from different countries, You're also welcome to work from our centrally located office in Berlin-Charlottenburg German lessons on all levels (A1-C2) Budget to set up your home office environment 27 vacation days + additional time off on December 24th and 31st A stack of the latest technologies and working gadgets English is our company language Pet-friendly office Strong culture: We have a feedback-driven company culture that is open to trying new paths, where the best idea wins DO YOU NEED TO MEET EACH HIRING CRITERIA ​​A common question you might be asking is: “Do I need to meet all the requirements to apply?” Our answer is, studies by several different sources have shown that, on average, men will apply for a job if they meet 60% of the application requirements. By contrast, women/non-binary people will seek to match a much higher percentage of the requirements before applying. We encourage everyone to apply and give us a chance to evaluate your skills and experience. We are all learning on the job, and although the listing above has been carefully compiled, we are also open-minded and interested to hear about the value you can bring to the role, and to PlaytestCloud. EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER At PlaytestCloud, we welcome diversity and believe everyone should have a fair chance at setting a high score. We are committed to providing an inclusive environment for everybody who works here or with us, regardless of race, color, national origin, age, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion (or lack thereof), political affiliation, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, or any other protected characteristics. At Omeda Studios, we believe that community feedback is integral to the development of games that players will not want to put down. Having recently closed a $20m Series A funding round, we've populated the studio with an exciting mix of industry veterans and community talent and we want you to be a part of shaping and executing our vision and the challenges that await us. And here's where you come in! We need an experienced Publishing Producer like you to help us successfully develop and release new and exciting cross-play content. In This Role You Will Take an active role in the day-to-day development of Predecessor by being responsible for features or parts of the team Work closely with other Producers and the Leadership team to drive the build and distribution of various types of releases Help to create, manage and coordinate release schedules for upcoming cross-play content that champion first-party submissions (SONY, Microsoft) Provide advice and guidance for age ratings, first-party policies, certification requirements, and best practices Perform administrative services for access to first-party development documentation, tools, and access Keep a good relationship with our first-party partners by being their go-to person for all questions What We're Looking For At least 3 years experience in a Production role where you have shipped at least one game within a development studio Experience managing the release of games content across Sony and Microsoft Demonstrated ability to juggle feedback, priorities, and deadlines in a fast-paced environment Driven and proactive nature mixed with a can-do attitude Excellent written and verbal english communication skills Experienced with Jira / Confluence Nice to Have Experience working on a cross-play games (PC + Consoles) Experience working on a live-ops title with regular updates and patches A genuine passion for video games (MOBAs are a plus) Salary band for this role is £45k-£60k depending on experience. Benefits Global, remote team 33 days holiday inclusive of bank holidays EMI Stock Options Healthcare More to come!

Senior Associate Producer in Crytek

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

We are looking for a dynamic, experienced SeniorAssociate Producer to support the Hunt: Showdown development team. As a Senior Associate Producer you are expected to be in charge of multiple teams and/or pipelines, to be confident in taking full ownership and making critical decisions whenever needed and applicable, to own and implement roadmap planning, prioritization and time allocation, and ensure development and final product is both outstanding and on time. You must have excellent project and people management skills, need to be an expert in applying the right development methodologies and team dynamics to maximize productivity, in utilizing project management tools to create transparency, and have a good background knowledge of game production pipelines and the games industry. *Required documents that allow a careful evaluation of your application are resume and cover letter* Relocation & Remote Work Although we believe living close to our studio helps foster team spirit and stronger bonds between team members, we understand that people have different needs and expectations for their place of residence. You have a choice of three location options, allowing you to work with Crytek from anywhere you wish: Come to our modern headquarters in Frankfurt and receive an attractive relocation package and have access to all of our benefits. If you are already living in a European Union member state, we are able to offer you a permanent work contract and allow you to work remotely as an employee from there. If you are interested in full-time, remote work in any other country outside of the European Union, we can offer you a freelance contract arrangement. Responsibilities See the big picture and disseminate all relevant information to / from your teams. Receive high-level direction, and provide mid- to low-level direction to your teams. Own and implement road-map planning for your teams in relation to overall production road-map and priorities. Prioritize tasks and backlogs in relation to short-, mid- and long-term production goals. Oversee, coordinate, track and manage activities cross-functionally to ensure that production goals are completed on time. Facilitate communication and discussion between team members to ensure team buy-in, informed decision-making, and development efficiency. Create project schedules and track how development is mapping against this, and highlight possible risks and provide alternatives whenever necessary. Proactively identify production bottlenecks, dependencies and risks, and take appropriate steps and/or provide possible mitigation plans to resolve them. Confidence in taking full ownership of a product and making big decisions. Implement and improve processes to ensure delivery on time and quality and to drive team quality, efficiency and effectiveness. Promote effective and sustainable team dynamics. Assist in the hiring process. Mentor other managers on the team. Requirements 5+ years of experience as a Project Manager within the video game industry. At least shipped two titles on PC and/or Console from beginning to end. Strong knowledge of game development methodologies. Strong social competence to play in the team and with the team. Has managed one or multiple teams successfully. Able to work under pressure and to handle multiple tasks at the same time by having the priorities straight all the time. Good knowledge of MS Office and Atlassian products (Jira, Confluence etc.). Team player and self-driven. Passion and knowledge of games. Willing to learn, but also to mentor. Good organizational and problem-solving abilities. Good negotiation, conflict resolution and decision-making skills Good communication skills with strong affinity for transparency. Pluses Engineering background. Experience in using CRYENGINE or any other game engine. What you can expect from us A refreshing yet highly professional atmosphere in a diverse team. Flexible work time. FUN. Free public transportation ticket, which lets you use public transport free of charge 24/7. Free onsite German lessons for our employees. Company language is English. Any additional language is a plus, but not a requirement. Extensive assistance with getting visa, work permits and communication with local authorities. Relocation support. A company apartment for your first few months and help in finding a private apartment. ...and much more!

Producer in Sketchbook Games

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

Sketchbook Games are a small independent studio based in Suffolk / Essex in the UK, who mostly work remotely. We have released our debut game, the multi- award winning Lost Words: Beyond the Page on Steam, Playstation 4, Xbox One and Switch. The game features a story written by renowned games writer Rhianna Pratchett and an orchestral soundtrack by BAFTA nominated composer David Housden. We are now using the Unreal Engine to develop a new project– a first person narrative based walking sim with light puzzles based on the theme of mental health and anxiety. ‍ Culture: We believe diverse teams make better games so we are keen to attract all kinds of candidates, particularly those from underrepresented groups in the games industry. We aim to continue to build an inclusive environment and are committed to continually listening, reflecting and improving our practices and culture. We are a small, friendly team. We’re using Codecks for task planning and have weekly team voice calls on Discord. ‍ Location requirements: We have a fully remote team, and we all work during the times that suit us best. We do try and synchronise rough core hours for team communication but some team members choose to work half days and others to only work certain days each week so we do our best to make sure everyone is accommodated. We will also be having monthly, but optional, team meets in London. ‍ In a nutshell: Fully remote Small team Inclusive games Flexible hours Freelance contract Contract: Freelance, part-time and remote: we are flexible on the hours based on your availability and the project needs - a day or half day a week to start with, with the potential to scale up could work well. Timeline: We are looking for the right team addition, therefore this role will be open until we have a really good match. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis so please apply fast to avoid disappointment! Recruitment process: The first stage is submitting your CV and answering the job questions, if you are successful you will be invited for a video interview. Reporting: You will report directly to the CEO/ Creative Director. Structure: We’re a small team with a very flat structure and are open to discussing how people’s roles can evolve to accommodate what they want to work on. Salary: While we don't have salary ranges, we are happy to be as flexible as possible for the right candidate, if we can't reach your salary expectation we will be happy to adapt the hours to make a more appealing offer. We can offer an hourly/daily rate or a project fee if preferable. Person: As a small team, good verbal & written communication are a must, we expect you to be friendly and capable of expressing your opinion calmly, having other people in mind. You will good at giving and receiving feedback. You will need to want to make games that have something to say and can make a positive difference to players You will need to be able to work with all disciplines. Understand, spot, track and communicate problems Be good at identifying, suggesting and actioning potential solutions Coordinate and assist with areas such as marketing, focus testing and more Manage our backlog to ensure tasks are prioritised and team goals are clear Help the team plan time estimates and keep the team and project on track Be flexible, self-motivated and open minded Foster an environment of ongoing improvement Be autonomous, and support the team’s own autonomy with their tasks and hours Excellent communication skills Able to interact with the team on Discord and answer their questions Qualifications: Experience working on at least one released game Bonus: Experience shipping a game on multiple platforms Soft skills: Excellent communication skills, cross-disciplinary understanding, feedback-oriented, collaboration, teamwork, positivity, leadership Hard skills: Excellent written skills, knowledge of a production tool such as Jira, Asana, CoDecks, Notion or Basecamp. To apply, please send us your CV and your answers to these two questions: In bullet points, please demonstrate how you would approach the Production role and assess the workload, team needs and next steps, bearing in mind this is a new project with no tracking or planning done yet. What are the most important systems, tools, methodologies or anything else you would need or like to set up in order to work efficiently and independently on a very collaborative, remote project?

Technical Supervisor in PlayStation

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

Why PlayStation? PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more. PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team. The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation. Technical Supervisor Remote, Canada PlayStation Studios Visual Arts on our San Diego campus provides world-class content, development and services to PlayStation Studios. Our team is always at the cutting edge of technology and partners with the industry’s best minds and companies. You will work with our multi-award winning team while working with AAA Worldwide Studios like Naughty Dog, Santa Monica Studio, San Diego Studio, Guerrilla Games, and more! We are looking for a Technical Supervisor to join our development team where you will be responsible for the planning, set up, and maintenance of our technical pipeline on all projects including environment management, workflow tools, and automation. You will lead a team of technical artists to ensure all project needs are met, write tools for our artists for a variety of software packages, troubleshoot technical issues that arise, and ensure the quality of our final product. Our Technical Art Department works with both our art and engineering teams to help provide communication cohesion between the groups. This position requires experience and understanding of visual effects pipelines, extensive experience with Autodesk Maya software, and strong python programming skills. Responsibilities: Working with clients and internal teams to set up project technical pipelines, primarily for Maya art and animation, and game engine integration. Setting up and maintaining project specific environments and automation. Learning and supporting varying client working environments, assets, and tools. Writing, maintaining, and customizing internal tools for production team. Building and maintaining technical documentation. Desired Experience: BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Graphic Art, or a related field, or equivalent experience. 5+ years in a branch of visual effects (film, game dev, tv, etc) with previous experience leading or supervising a team. Excellent knowledge of Maya with general knowledge of Maya rigging Strong Python programming skills and experience with PyQt/Pyside. Experiencing developing or maintaining project pipeline tools and system environments. Excellent troubleshooting skills and the ability to creatively solve problems. Knowledge of or experience with game engines such as Unreal, Unity, or proprietary engines. Nice to Have: Motionbuilder experience. Experience with other programming languages, especially C++. Experience with perforce and/or git. Experience with project management and tracking software (such as Shotgun). Equal Opportunity Statement: Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category. We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond. PlayStation is a Fair Chance employer and qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for employment.

Narrative/Creative Producer in Firaxis Games

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

Who We Are: MAKE LIFE EPIC Founded in 1996, Firaxis Games is a world-renowned game development studio with an unwavering mission to “build games that stand the test of time”. The name Firaxis, a fusion of “fiery” and “axis,” communicates the company’s dynamic development process that results in the creation of ground breaking titles with unparalleled gameplay delivered to gamers around the world. Under the creative direction of industry legend Sid Meier, Firaxis has released dozens of hit games on multiple platforms and is recognized as an industry leader in game development. Core values: GAMEPLAY FIRST Let gameplay drive decision making BE ACCOUNTABLE Deliver great work for the studio, the team & yourself PEOPLE FOCUSED Maintain an environment where people are happy EMBRACE ENTHUSIASM Find opportunities to contribute and collaborate WORK SMART Put effort where it pays off the most Firaxis Games prides itself on maintaining a quality of life inside and outside the studio – when our team members are happy and healthy, creativity can flourish. We offer boot camp fitness and yoga classes at the office, a free gym with shower, regularly catered lunches and breakfasts, biweekly Friday Happy Hours, company events and parties, and a “FunZone” complete with billiards, foosball, video games, and tabletop gaming space. We are also a philanthropic studio and offer employees the chance to volunteer with local charities and nonprofits throughout the year. Fulltime employees can also take advantage of Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage, 401K retirement savings, a wellbeing initiative with the opportunity to earn cash rewards, an Employee Assistance Program, and paid time off and paid holidays. We are looking for an experienced Creative producer to work alongside our Game design team to help foster and empower the creation and development of world class strategy games. In support of the creative team and product leadership, this experienced producer will combine creative, business and technical needs into a unified set of strategic goals for the project. You’ll collaborate, communicate and support our design talent and work across discipline to own schedules, understand dependencies and communicate status, risks and opportunities. You’ll work with the team to ensure the highest quality execution against key deliverables while looking to improve processes and outcomes when and where needed. What You Will Do: Own the team schedule - partner with leads to establish a long-term roadmap and appropriate pipelines and delivery schedules. Communicate across project providing transparency on design goals, status and changes ensuring dependencies are known and accounted and risks are understood and mitigation plans are put in place. Provide the tools and the process to empower our creative teams to deliver new features and gameplay experiences to delight our fans. Work closely with internal and external teams to manage budgets ensuring your team has the resources needed to accomplish their goals. Who Will be a Great Fit: 5+ years of experience working in the game industry specifically AAA production and creative/design production Experiencing managing large teams Proven track record of working in a fast paced, creative environment. Experience with current gaming trends in RPG and narrative driven games As an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to ensuring that qualified individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform their essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us if you need reasonable accommodation. Please note that 2K Games and its studios never uses instant messaging apps or personal email accounts to contact prospective employees or conduct interviews and when emailing, only use 2K.com accounts.

The name Firaxis, a fusion of “fiery” and “axis,” communicates the company’s dynamic development process that results in the creation of ground breaking titles with unparalleled gameplay delivered to gamers around the world. Under the creative direction of industry legend Sid Meier, Firaxis has released dozens of hit games on multiple platforms and is recognized as an industry leader in game development. Core values: GAMEPLAY FIRST Let gameplay drive decision making BE ACCOUNTABLE Deliver great work for the studio, the team & yourself PEOPLE FOCUSED Maintain an environment where people are happy EMBRACE ENTHUSIASM Find opportunities to contribute and collaborate WORK SMART Put effort where it pays off the most Firaxis Games prides itself on maintaining a quality of life inside and outside the studio – when our team members are happy and healthy, creativity can flourish. We offer boot camp fitness and yoga classes at the office, a free gym with shower, regularly catered lunches and breakfasts, biweekly Friday Happy Hours, company events and parties, and a “FunZone” complete with billiards, foosball, video games, and tabletop gaming space. We are also a philanthropic studio and offer employees the chance to volunteer with local charities and nonprofits throughout the year. Fulltime employees can also take advantage of Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage, 401K retirement savings, a wellbeing initiative with the opportunity to earn cash rewards, an Employee Assistance Program, and paid time off and paid holidays. We need an experienced Producer to help drive the creation of an exciting new project. We are looking for someone with the proven ability to turn long-term plans into day-to-day realities, the insight to own the production of major aspects of the game/team, to work directly with project leaders and individual contributors, to drive continual improvement, and of course a master of organization & communication. Depending on the skills and experience you bring, this role could be either a Senior or Lead position for the team. The ideal candidate will be able to come to our Sparks, MD or Cary, NC office to work full or flex time with the team. Based on experience and specific role we may offer flexibility for full time remote. What You Will Do: Assist Product leadership team in execution of the vision for our games. Ensure that game features and functionality support the creative and business goals. Manage across discipline to ensure team goals and production values are met while keeping projects on schedule and within budget. Proactively identify and communicate changes in scope, priority or direction while understanding and articulating the impact on schedule and quality to the Executive Producer and Leads. Establish, maintain, and enhance relationships with internal and external resources including collaboration with 2KPD, Quality Assurance and Creative Services. Mentor, assist and help direct Producers or Associate Producers on team Who Will be a Great Fit: You are someone who can lead teams and deliver on hard product deadlines, while being a guardian of team culture and product quality in all phases of game development from concept to completion. Experience in game production where you have lead teams through all stages of game development for AAA titles (prototype through release). Excellent communication skills, written and verbal. Ability to handle conflict, and proactively mitigate and resolve risks. Deep understanding of various production processes and methodologies. Passion and enthusiasm to help build a healthy project team. Experience managing relationships with vendors and external partners. Service-oriented mindset that is adept at building relationships throughout the organization. Executive Producer in Jagex

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

A leader in creating deep and engaging experiences on PC and mobile, Jagex was founded in 2001 and is today one of the UK’s biggest and most respected video game developers and publishers. Famed for its flagship MMOs RuneScape and Old School RuneScape, Jagex has welcomed more than 260million player accounts to its world and created a $1bn lifetime franchise revenue. Today the RuneScape franchise exists beyond running games in live operations; our titles are living games that connect and inspire millions of players, with content and experiences both inside and outside of inexhaustible game worlds. Both RuneScape and Old School RuneScape, on PC and mobile, offer ever-evolving, highly-active worlds and our community-focussed development ethos empowers players to have a real say in how each game is shaped. Jagex is expanding and extending its portfolio with fresh franchise titles, new IP and, in 2018 launched Jagex Partners, delivering third-party publishing and operational services exclusively for the living games of the future. Jagex employs more than 400 people at its Cambridge headquarters and is on the hunt for talented people to work across the business to help the company to achieve yet another year of record growth and player satisfaction. Job Purpose: As Executive Producer you will be responsible for opportunities and offshoots for new games which extend the RuneScape franchise. You have a strong balanced mix of business, technical and game production leadership experience. Working with both senior leadership and executive team members you will identify, incubate and launch new titles which are adjacent and complimentary to our core first party titles, RuneScape and Old School. You will refine the vision of the studio for the franchise opportunities through research, business planning, production and partnerships. A creative, commercial and strategic thinker, an entrepreneur with a great sense of what it takes to make truly compelling and successful live games. You will define effective strategies for new game franchise extensions, working with Jagex teams to translate those objectives into achievable operational goals and business plans. Key Duties Include: Assess opportunities for franchise development, create business justification breakdown of opportunities into clear, understandable formats for presentation at studio, executive and board level. Analysis of new title initiatives based on internal and external tech architecture, new or established processes, content, capabilities and market opportunity. Be comfortable with ambiguity and fluidity, comfortable interpreting requirements from a range of sources and translating those into actionable plans with specific business outcomes and operational objectives. Work with other internal Jagex teams to support in auditing capabilities of potential external studio development partners, assess the requirements and risks of projects based on such due diligence. Act as the connecting anchor point between internal business units and external partner studios. Ensure that milestones are delivered on-time, on-budget and complete as per the approved development plan, and that the mile-stone submissions maintain alignment with the established franchise plan. Responsible for helping studio deliver against the RuneScape franchise vision, this includes identifying key risks or gaps and developing plans to mitigate them. Essential Skills: Extensive experience with internal and external development, shipping global games (PC/console) through entire product development lifecycle (Concept/Launch/LiveOps). Proven ability to break strategies down into a plan for execution. Team player, highly organized, self-motivated, detail oriented, with the ability to follow through on action plans and ideas. Excellent leadership and communication skills, diplomacy, balanced decisiveness, clarity in judgment and establishing of priorities. Demonstrate sound decision-making based on data analysis, market knowledge and personal judgment. Extensive and direct experience managing cross-disciplinary game teams, showing a wide range of leadership, motivation and management skills. Thorough understanding of all game production models, managing complex product-level P&Ls, meeting and exceeding revenue target goals. Company Benefits: Flexible Working Bonus Scheme Private Health Care Gym Membership Monthly Energy Allowance Generous Pension Contributions Life Insurance Free Cycle Repair Income Protection Dental Plan Free Fruit and Drinks Subsidised Canteen Feel like you fit this role, but don’t meet all the requirements? We strive for fresh perspectives, so as long as you can demonstrate how your attitude and other abilities might make up for any gaps we would welcome your application! Jagex are an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy or maternity, religion or belief.

Producer in Cold Iron Studios

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

Cold Iron is seeking an experienced Producer to join our world class team on our next AAA title for consoles and PC! This position is fully remote in the United States and open to applicants across the country. Can you not help but care if the team is on target, working on the most important tasks to hit their overall goal? Do you arrange schedules to solve for interdependencies like a wizard and attack work roadblocks like a berserker? Is it a point of personal pride that you know the current status and roadmap of the project like it was tattooed on you? Here’s the most important one: Do you do it all for the game? Because you know that your talents are needed to make sure that even the best development teams get an awesome experience out the door? Awesome. Come join our creative, collaborative studio where you’ll own the product management responsibilities for a tight, integrated team of game developers. Your Day to Day You can expect to be responsible and accountable for the following: Assist in building the product plan while contributing to overseeing development efforts, keeping product development on schedule, within budget and hitting the game’s vision Work with team members to ensure timelines are realistic and deliverables are scoped to allow for confident delivery of the highest possible quality within the time allotted. Track and prioritize development tasks to make sure we hit team goals on time. Be the liaison between the studio and third party development partners, including platform owners, publishers, outsourcing partners. Be one with the status of the project. Communicate this effectively to the team, executives and publishing partners. Support leads and founders in holding product vision – be a product knowledge base for inside and outside of the company. Run meetings and playtests. Drive agendas and achieve defined goals. Communicate the resulting information, decisions and tasks to the team. Lead day to day playtesting and manage QA operations Handle the localization of pipeline Your Career Progression Do the best work of your career! No, really, that’s what we expect of you. Come aboard and work with industry veterans all working to improve their craft and become better game developers. Your portfolio of experience will grow, and the size of the audience you reach will expand exponentially. The small team atmosphere allows you to contribute more and have greater ownership over what you do day to day. Requirements Love of games. A minimum of 5 years of industry experience in an internal production role. Must have worked on at least two shipped games throughout the entire product cycle. Excellent documentation and communication skills with strong attention to detail. Extensive knowledge of how games are made. Ability to multitask, prioritize, and follow-through to completion. Great interpersonal and facilitation abilities. A deep desire to make game development better for all those involved. Proficiency in Excel, Word, Outlook. Would Love to See Previous hands-on development experience Experience in bringing a product through console certification and release cycle. Experience in multiplayer, console, RPG and/or shooter games a plus. Proficiency in JIRA, Confluence, Trello, Slack, Project. Experience with outsourcing management Education No requirement. Location This position is fully remote and open to applicants across the country. About our Location Cold Iron is a team of passionate game developers located in San Jose, California. We’re a diverse group of veterans with decades of experience developing and launching award-winning shooter, MMO, and action titles on PC and console. We launched Aliens: Fireteam Elite in August 2021 to critical acclaim and to a very devoted fan base. Exceptional employee benefits, Remote work; 18 days PTO first year in addition to 11 paid holidays plus company-wide shutdown between Christmas and New Year’s Day; Robust Medical, Dental, Vision insurance coverage for entire family; Company matched 401k vested immediately; Flex Spending Accounts, annual stipend to help cover work from home expenses, ultra-creative environment.

Jobs available in Remote Job

PeopleFun™ is the award-winning creator of mobile games for players across the globe. We are part of the AppLovin™ studios family, a publicly traded company, with world-class projects, resources, and infrastructure. PeopleFun™ is a Dallas-based game studio founded and maintained by game industry veterans, where game developers thrive on collaboration, creativity, teamwork and fun. Our games are played by over 25 million players each month, and we have a number of exciting mid-core and casual games in development. Our mission is twofold: excellence in creativity and data-driven product innovation, and to be a best-in-class workplace providing unique opportunities to learn and exercise curiosity. Candidates who reside or will reside in the following locations are eligible for this role: California, Nevada, Oregon, Texas, Colorado, Washington State, Ohio, North Carolina, Florida, Pennsylvania, Washington DC, Michigan, New York, Mississippi, Georgia, Maryland, Iowa or Toronto. PeopleFun is seeking a Lead Product Manager to drive audience growth, monetization, retention, and engagement across our entire game portfolio. You should have experience playing and developing mobile games. Working in close collaboration with the Production and Design teams, you will play a key role in strategy, analytics, and live operations. You will own game features and the relevant KPIs, provide reporting, and offer insights into the future direction for each game in our portfolio. Responsibilities: Lead product management on a new game or existing live games Plan and execute product roadmap to achieve business goals Collaborate with studio stakeholders to define, design, and manage key features that further user acquisition, engagement, retention, and monetization Design and balance game economies to drive amazing player experiences, player retention, and monetization Perform game analytics and proactively seek opportunities to improve player experience and core financial performance Routinely track game KPIs and report findings to the team Analyze competing games and provide relevant competitive references, including performance reports, tear-downs, diagrams, videos, screenshots, etc Leverage liveops tools, analytics, AB testing, local/push notifications, and other tools to optimize player experience and drive business objectives Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree (graduate degree preferred) in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Finance or related field 3+ years' experience in a game product management role Passion for creating innovative, fun, and compelling games Understanding and experience with a wide range of business models and monetization mechanics, including, but not limited to, free-to-play and subscriptions business models Ability to perform research and analytics at industry, genre, and game level to inform product Strong business & creative capabilities You can confidently draw a line from detailed player behavior all the way to financial outcomesStrong experience in quantitative analysis, including the ability to model game parameters using Excel, SQL, and business intelligence tools such as Tableau Experience designing and tuning a free-to-play economy by making structured, hypothesis-driven product improvements Experience with A/B and multivariate testing Ability to multitask, efficiently manage time and priorities and work with minimal management Excellent attention to detail and strong desire to iterate and improve on processes. Strong critical thinking and communications skills Receptive to constructive feedback Love for casual mobile games Self-motivated team player that brings excitement and enthusiasm to work each day. Benefits Competitive compensation package Performance bonuses 401K with 3% employer matching Family friendly culture Flex PTO policy Medical/Dental/Vision insurance On-Site Gym and free Yoga classes $1,500 annual budget for career development & education $1,000 annual game device and IAP budget Free drinks & snacks, catered lunch on Fridays Happy hours, social events and more PeopleFun is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, protected veteran status, medical condition or disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Apply Now

Product Manager in Fanatee

Requires Skils: OOPS

Jobs available in Remote Job

We are looking for a talented and experienced person who can help manage and direct the performance of Fanatee’s games. In this role, you will interact and work across multi-disciplinary teams: game design, art, engineering, user acquisition, and community, as well as focus on opportunities and providing direction to grow and improve our games. You’ll translate ideas into strategy and features, and follow game development from start to finish. To succeed in this role, you should be an analytical and creative leader and a reliable problem-solver. Responsibilities As a Product Manager, you will be primarily responsible for identifying business and product needs. You have strong leadership skills and solid track record of building and developing highly effective multidisciplinary teams. Manage the life-cycle of our games. Ability to formulate product strategy and present clear measurable objectives. Provide valuable input into business cases based on data analysis and demonstrate how that analysis impacts key product metrics. Proactively design, pilot and implement process improvements If you value high-quality work, innovation and are passionate about working with others to generate great results, this position is perfect for you :) Requirements 5 years experience in product and project management or game development. Strong leadership experience and good team player. Previous similar experience in a startup, consulting or tech company. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Have the ability to draw data-driven business insights. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Analytical skills and attention to detail. Want to develop your career in a game company. Experience working on global company or global products is a plus. Fluency in English. Bachelor’s or Master's degree in Business Administration, Economy, Engineering or Computer Science. Did you like the job description? Feel free to apply even if you don't have all the requirements, we are looking for passionate people willing to learn and grow (: What we offer Competitive remuneration Flexible benefits Health and Dental Insurance Life insurance Profit Sharing Career development support Casual environment as well as the dress code A space for resting moments, full of snacks, fruits, and drinks. About Fanatee Fanatee is a mobile gaming startup founded in 2013. Since then, our goal has been to enable people to play our games anytime, anywhere. We believe that quality is the key to success. Our creative processes are well planned and carefully detailed, and our talent lies in turning great ideas into great businesses: our games hit over 130M downloads worldwide. We believe that a diverse work environment contributes to an increasingly responsible society that values differences. Our dream allows us to do what we love the most: work with talented, passionate people and give them the opportunity to achieve goals as big as they can dream of. If you want to share this ride with us and join a lightweight, fun and focused environment that breathes innovation and game culture, apply now!
